There is a limited amount of songs, alot of which are behind pay walls. OSTV was great, but now I'm slowly becoming more and more bored. It's fine if it's behind paywalls, but add custom songs. Like, make a system where people can submit songs, and you guys verify it. Besides this, it's a good game. Still very fun, but I'm slowly getting bored, and would love to hear my favorite songs, without having to use mods, which I haven't done yet.

I gotta say, the new update is great. I love the slur you guys added to the blocks, great job. And I can't believe The Living Tombstone is finally in beatsaber! I am so happy. Also please one day add a CG5 music pack, I would buy it in a heartbeat.

This is an awesome game, so much fun, and you really work up a sweat! 

HOWEVER after installing it I found it would instantly freeze as soon as it started and never recover. I saw other reviews complaining of the same thing. Restart/reinstall no good. But then on Reddit I found a suggestion to try without Bluetooth headphones (wired is fine) and it instantly started working. 

I don’t know if that’s a Beat Saber bug or an Oculus bug but they should work together to fix it.

1. Play beat saber without the wrist straps
2. Throw your controllers out the window
3. Buy new controllers and continue playing
4. Beat immortal on hard and think your insane at the game
5. Play online and get clapped
6. Cry yourself to sleep and try again tomorrow
7. Beat spin eternally on expert plus
8. Beat ghost on expert plus
9. Clap everyone and become bored of the game
10. Get mods and get into a match with Tichi
11. Get clapped on your bootycheaks by Tichi 
12. Rage and break your oculus

And that is how to play beat saber correctly
review_title: 12 Easy steps on how to play beat saber

one_reviews_text: I have previously game this game 5 stars because it was my ultimate favorite game to play. Now I have given it one star because I can’t play it at all. Ever since it updated, the game freezes right at the start of the song. I have uninstalled it multiple times and reached out out to get it fixed only to still be unable to play. Can this get fixed soon please

Now beatsaber or whoever has the power to add this, the lady gaga pack and billie eilish pack were ok but they don't fit the game. What I think we need is a completely separate pack for The Living Tombstone. Now this would hit hard. Especially for people like me who originally bought thus vr headset for 2 games. Beatsaber and fnaf vr.

Please make this happen!

This game is so good!! But you need to have more variety of songs. I love the songs on there but I want to be able to play my favorite songs without adding a mod to my oculus. I also want to be able to customize my sabers maybe add that? The game is really fun though. I play it everyday ✨

i hate having to downgrade my beatsaber or having to have a wired connection to play custom songs. i cannot seamlessly play an ost v song and then a custom one on standalone whatsoever and it's a real big pain. if you're working on a custom song feature then please let us know and if you aren't working on it then just let us know.

It would be great if a simple and intuitive editor was developed in the game itself to freely place blocks and create your own movement. Even something like this: you start a song and create a dance (well, you invent a dance) and during this, with the controllers in hand, when you pull the trigger a block (cube) is automatically placed in position with the cutting direction, then you try it and you can make changes, here is a dream editor that would bring huge value to the game

This is a fantastic game but unfortunately the latest update has made mine freeze a lot and I'm really not sure how I feel about the new notes that have been added 🤔 I like them but I really hope they're not going to be in every single song that's done from now on? Still on the plus side I'm going to go back to the modded version anyway and that is fantastic so many custom songs, sabers, and mods that make the game even better! Honestly tho whether you decide to play it vanilla or modded it is worth the money best rhythm game IMHO.
review_title: Not Sure about the latest update 🤔

one_reviews_text: Why can't this game get fixed. I have been waiting for over two months now to play this game again and yet the same issues I've had keep happening, I start my game up and am ready to play, I click on a song, and slash my first block and the game breaks. I've tried to reload over and over again but nothing works. I wait one or two weeks and try again still no fix, how is that even possible. Not everyone might be having the same issue but many people are. I've paid $30 for this game and expected so much more for a game with a player base this large, but I feel as if my issue means nothing to the people running this game. I would love to see this game fixed and see sort of apology from the devs to the people this bug has plagued. But for now I am going to uninstall beat saber as it is a waste of  my time and space on my oculus.
review_title: Why is this game Still broken?

one_reviews_text: I always wanted to play beat Saber but all the vr headsets were ridiculous expensive. One day I found Quest 2 and it was so cheap that I bought it and I was hyped to play beat Saber. This is the next level of gaming experience. Has amazing songs and everything! Updates just keeps getting better and better. I just can't forget the amazing times when I played beat Saber for the first time. If you are planning to get vr headset, please get beat Saber right away. It is so worth it! I wish there could be more and more updates to keep the excitement!
review_title: The best vr game you can ever own.

one_reviews_text: I have had beat saber and got Bmbf. It was really fun until the file corrupted.😐 I have probably spent 30+ hours trying to get them back but every strategy won’t work. I need beat saber to build in mods to their game so I can have fun. I have never been more disappointed at a game for not simply having custom songs. If you guys make mods built in it would make my experience much better. I gave it 1 star so they would notice this. If you guys make built in mods I will definitely raise my review to an easy 5 stars but until that happens I will never enjoy this game like I did before.
review_title: Amazing Game if mods was built in. 😐

This game is amazing, and I’ve had it for around a month. I still play it like I just got it, although I did take a break from my VR altogether for a few days. Beat saber is one of my favorite games, and it gets better when you use side quest to download your own songs to it. That feature is amazing. I love the challenge of getting better and better, and the better you get the more fun the game becomes. If you’re going to spend money on any VR game it should definitely be this one.

Great game honestly. After a while it does start to get a little boring but that's just me. The only kind of problem I'm really having Is that sometimes it takes a little time to connect to an online server. I know that my wifi is not the problem because I have excellent connection and strong wifi. This has also been going on for a while. It would also be really cool if a custom song option was added. Sometimes the songs get boring playing the over and over again. Other then that, this game is so amazing!

It’s a really fun game with limited song options, a concern is that every time I use Bluetooth with my oculus the levels freeze completely I can do anything but listen to the music. I don’t have a problem with Bluetooth on any other game, when I’m in the menu there’s no problem but as soon as I try and play a level the game freezes before I get to hit a single target. Please fix this for some songs need to be heard on headphone in order to enjoy the 3D feel that the speakers can’t give

I tried to follow the pamphlet and the kit but they just wouldn't grow no matter how many times I watered them. Even though they haven't grown yet the color on the packaging is absolutely horrid! There's no way to describe this monstrosity! It is the grossest thing I have ever seen and tasted, if you can't think of anything gross let me tell you about an example. Have you ever tried sugar-free SUGAR BABIES. NO JOKE THEY'RE IN ACTUAL THING! It's like eating a wax manakin then going into labor except the end result is you but less alive than you should be! As I have said there is no AAA battery in the dollar store that can fix this sinful being of the Apples companiesiz. After I found out what this scam actually  was I left my home and decided that it would be better to live in a McDonald's freezer room instead of live my life with this abomination in my abode of eternal darkness. But overal beat saber is really fun, I would recommend.

I’ve been playing this game for a year and have devoted my life it it. I wake up, play beta saber. I use the bathroom, while playing beat-saber. I go outside, by changing my virtual environment and playing beat-saber. My doctor says I’m underweight and lacking vitamin d and to get off my oculus. I just ignore him and play beat-saber.

You already know this game is great.  Yeah it's annoying that they release more music packs for money, and you can't easily create free music packs, but you can just play base packs.  I hate freemium games, but I do find myself buying the new packs when they come out, because it feels worth it since I play so much.

Everyone always says their main concern is that there’s no custom songs, although there is custom songs through mods, people don’t have permission to make them from the owners of those songs, which is why it’s hard to just let people make their songs in the actual game. For doing what they can, the game is great, the only real issue is the fact that we don’t get enough songs for $12.

review_title: Removed invite friend from quick play?

one_reviews_text:
I know I can't convince anybody on the Oculus app, it's extensively part of the internet and people can be quite stubborn. I promise that whenever anybody brings up this game to me, I'll make it clear exactly why it embodies the worst trends of both the music and game industries. This is an insidious piece of software down to its conceptual core.

If you're interested in my reasoning, well, look at who owns the rights to the game (Meta), custom songs, and DLC. Meta's stance is VERY hostile to custom songs, especially on their platforms (mainly Quest). How do I know they're against custom songs? They make it very difficult to use any and the three times I have, my Quest needed to be factory reset after less than a week. Custom songs ensure that smaller artists and other media in general can be part of the experience of this game; by Meta practically banning custom songs and requiring expensive & semi-glamorous contracts for paid DLC, it's denying art, culture, and community fun that they could be platforming. Meta's excuse is that custom songs would be too much of a DMCA issue but that's a moot point: YouTube, Facebook, Instagram, and really any platform where art can be shared among users will have DMCA issues but Meta as a company already has systems to deal with this type of thing on their other platforms. If you don't LOVE only the mainstream artists that pay Meta's toll, you'll hate this game. If you appreciate artistic freedom, you'll probably be frustrated with what this game offers. If you care about integrity and community, this game might enrage you. If you like flailing your arms alone to generic EDM (or paying top $ to flail your arms alone to a handful of celebrities) then I've found the perfect waste of your time, money, and energy.

The fact that Pavlov Shack has a lower rating than this is a travesty. I assume a lot of those reviews must be salt anticipating an update, people who didnt play long enough to realize the different game modes and what you can do on different maps, and people who never played more recent updates. I wouldn't say this for the Steam version or any of the versions a few years ago before Meta basically took charge of this game. This Quest version as of 2022 though? The worst iteration I've played yet.

I have been playing Beat Saber for a couple months now, and it is the most comfortable game I have. It is entertaining with its multiplayer and has plenty of updates still coming. Also, It's a great workout, I burn like 1000 calories with every play session. The only down side is that playing the same songs over and over can get slightly boring and repetitive.

Okay, starting off with the basic things. This game is super fun and addicting. It’s also a bit of a workout because you have either lean to the left or right, or squat/duck down. Like seriously, it’s a exercise game, just with lightsabers. 

I’ve seen so many people play this and, I thought it seemed pretty fun. Although, I can’t seem to figure out how their able to show their bodies…? (If you don’t know what I’m talking about, I mean the videos that show the peoples bodies and how they move to hit the best squares.) 

But, besides that, this game is super fun to play when you’re bored! I enjoy the music that they use, along with the way you can change a few things to your own liking! If I hate to rate this game more than 5 stars, this game would get 20 stars from me.

SONG PACK REQUESTS: 1) Nicki Minaj. Now, look. I know there are kids playing this game and such but, Nicki’s songs would fit! Just add both clean and not clean versions so there’s no argument. 2) Rihanna. Okay-okay. Don’t get me wrong on this but, Rihanna’s music has a few good and bad songs. But her bass in her music hits HARD. For example the song “Pour it Up”. Like Nicki Minaj’s songs, add clean and not clean versions. 3) Beyoncè. I’ve always loved the Queen B’s songs since I was 8 yrs old, and her music is exceptional. But, maybe just add a few since she talks about uh… “inappropriate” topics sometimes.
 
That’s all I have to say about this game. Thanks for taking the time to read this. Have a wonderful day/night/noon/evening! :)

(Also yes, I know it has a warning at the beginning of the game but, I’m gonna say it anyways. If you have photosensitive epilepsy, it would be best to stay away from this game and check out a different one. This game has quite a few flashing lights, along with some bright ones. So, don’t play this game if you have photosensitive epilepsy. 😉)
review_title: One of my favorite games to play!

one_reviews_text: It’s a super fun workout, but it has a really sharp learning curve. It took me almost 2 months to even try an Expert+ song, and another few weeks to beat it. I’m not asking for it to be changed, but just so new players know, it takes a while to learn how to do expert+ songs.

I loooove beat saber! I have been playing this game for a solid month. I often use it as a warm up before I got play other games. It’s fun and mentally stimulating. I am a speech therapist that works with people who have brain injuries. I often encourage people to play games like lumosity (not VR) to train their brain. This game fits the bill to physically give you a workout as well as mentally. Sure, you can T-Rex it and not get a workout in… if that suits you. I prefer to give it all I have and deliver powerful slices to the cubes as they fly towards me. I close my rings (apple watch) daily with the help of Beat Saber. (I also love Supernatural VR game for this same reason). If you like to be challenged mentally and physically- you will enjoy this game. Get it! Try the demo. You just might get hooked.

I have put many hours in to this game and I myself have found that I No longer need food just beat saber I no longer need water just beat saber wen I need to pee I do it in beat saber I no longer need to live I am beat saber all I need is BEAT SABER. Over the past few years I’ve lost 89 pounds and extremely skinny and I recently went to the doctor and they said to take vitamin D pills and go outside they also said to turn of my oculus but I just play more and more beat saber …——————————————————————————————All jokes aside this is a great game would Recommend to anyone. My grandma can even play this game

69420/10 would buy ten more times

My wife loves beat saber but recently had surgery on her wrist. She still wants to play but you can only play a few songs with one hand….aaaaand it has to be on expert level. This is crazy to me. While my wife’s condition is temporary, there are others in the world who 
permanently have only one hand. Why can’t all levels be open on all songs to one handed players. Seems pretty unfair. Therefor I am rating this one star until it’s fixed.

This is definitely a must have game for any music lover. It’s my go to game and never gets old for me. However I would love to see more songs with different play modes; like 90 & 360 views in more difficulty levels. Most songs available with this mode are only playable in one difficulty. I love the different music genres and beats and can’t wait to see what other songs will become available in the future! An Avenged Sevenfold pack would be a dream come true! 😉

Initially I was frustrated that official BS doesn’t have custom songs, but to be honest that concert disappeared after sometime. I really like quality of official packs like Lady Gaga,Linking Park and Electronic Mixtape is absolutely impressive one! It would be really great to see more official packs with pop and rock hits of 80th, 90th and up forward.

I love playing beat saber it’s one of my daily games however thanks to this new update I can no longer play anything it freezes after ONE block and it’s very frustrating and upsetting especially when I’ve payed for a few of the add ons it just feels like a waste of money now please hurry and get this fix because after reading some of the reviews I’m not the only person having this problem

I love this game, play it daily for cardio and it works great for that and the levels are really cool but...... For someone who plays daily the songs definitely get old, I'm on expert+ on some and that helps with the repetitiveness but even that is starting to not help. Definitely get more songs! I and I'm sure alot of us beg you!! 🙏🙏🙏🙏🫶

Pick this game up now! It’s great and will get you playing for hours. The global leaderboard system is great and the ability to play with others is awesome! 

However, many music packs are locked behind paywalls and honestly it feels like such a waste of money when people can just mod the game if they really want. 

My proposal is that you make the vibrant bustling modding community a part of the normal beatsaber community. Instead of paying for music packs, I’d spend money on buying things like custom sabers and cool effects (for example a fire trail coming out my sabers). This game has so much potential with customisation… Make all songs free and have people import custom songs, however make users pay for added cosmetics. Not saying steal from other games but you could make more money with let’s say a “beat pass” or some sort of item shop instead of making people buy songs they could get for free in the modded variant of the game.

Okay so I've played this game abt 13 times but now I have my own headset so I just wanna say this is a great game max ive played in one go was around 15 hours it was my first time and yeah fun game cool lights and that's all I gotta say a m o u g u s

Beat Saber is one of if not my favorite vr game. It is great and it has a lot but I want the to add two things or three I guess. I don’t know if the developers are reading this or not but if they are please consider these ideas. 1. Different sabers. Now the default sabers are great but what if we could get different ones, like have you seen the ones you can get with mods, they look great now how we obtain them is in two. 2. A store. Now with the store we could buy different items like sabers from idea 1 and avatar items for online. We can get money to buy things by buying it with IRL money or depending on the difficulty, mods, and score we could get more or less money. 3. A specific song pack. I really want a Metallica song pack or just some sort of heavy metal song pack that has at least one or two Metallica songs. Thank you for reading my review and if a developer is reading please consider these ideas. Thanks
review_title: 10/10 but I want them to add something

one_reviews_text: This game is absolutely amazing. I could play for hours and never get bored. Only one drawback however, you can't play custom levels or make custom levels. You can on HTCV Vive though. But those headsets are around $1,000. So please make it so you can make and play custom levels. Other than that, it is an amazing game and worth the $30.00 10/10 would recommend.

Honestly the game is incredible, the one issue is the song catalog isn’t very wide so at some point you have to mod it and you need to install the old version etc. If the modding community was more accessible to everyone the game could be flawless, but this is not a very big issue and overall the game is incredibly fun to play for hours every day.

This game is a must buy for quest. Originally I bought it not particularly interested but tried it. It was okay for me at first but I wasn't good. Waited a few months then gave it another shot and I did not regret it. Im not sure what threw me off at first but I love this game. The new electronic music pack is absolutely fire. Good choice of music with the exception of not having crazy frog in it but thats okay, hopefully for electronic music pack 2 we get that plus the other classics everyone loves. Absolute blast. Favorite is ghost n stuff by deadmau5 easily. Keep up the great work!

I love the game so fun yo play and i have purchased a few of the music packs, one thing i would like to see is for them to add more songs into some of the smaller music packs such as panic at the disco pack as its only got 4 songs and there are some great contenders for the game.

I absolutely love beat saber and it’s one of the main games that I play on my headset. I’ve started experiencing issues with the game and am super disappointed about it! Now when I load up the game everything will be running fine, I pick a song and as soon as the blocks start coming towards me the game crashes and freezes. The music will still be playing but everything else frozen. I’ve tried uninstalling and reinstalling and the same thing keeps happening. All my other games run on my oculus fine so I don’t understand what could be happening. Please help! I’ve bought many music packs and don’t want to lose everything I’ve paid for!

review_title: Best VR has to offer, but short lifespan

one_reviews_text:
I love this game. It’s amazing and SO FUN. I wish I could give it five stars, but there are some things that I have started to notice and it’s been starting to get more and more annoying over time. It’s great to play on the easy modes, but over time as you start to progress and try to do the expert or expert plus stages it gets significantly more annoying and harder to play. Not because it’s hard but because there are some issues like: controllers spazzing out in the game and completely flying off the map, controllers entirely not registering in the game, the game not registering the sabers randomly throughout the song and disappearing, causing you to miss notes that you know you wouldn’t have missed, and some songs have notes that are way too high for you to even reach. You have to actually stretch, and that’s hard because I’m already short as it is. I know it’s the game specifically having these issues because playing on others games I NEVER have controller issues. And every other game registers my controllers just fine. But as soon as I play this game and move around a lot the game glitches out. ALSO, the game has a hard time registering the controllers especially when you cross your hands/arms for some notes, and takes a while to go back to normal causing you to miss even more notes. My room is nicely lit, not too bright and I have enough space to move around. I know it’s not my surroundings that causes these issues. And even the other games work fine with my surroundings and the lighting. FIX THESE ISSUES.  I know I’m not the only one out there who has to deal with this. I really want to enjoy the game without my controllers disappearing and ruining my perfect streaks. 

Other than that I enjoy most of the packs and the songs.

I’ve been playing beat saber, to put it lightly, way too much.

And I’ve been playing since pretty much day one. So I can make opinions with confidence.

The game is amazing, unlike any other beat game out there. Pistol whip, and other beat games are still good, but let’s be serious, beat saber’s the best.

So, what makes it so great?

The songs is what gets everyone. They are great. You have 100’s of free songs too choose from, and once you feel done with that, you have the DLC’s!

There are literally hundreds of songs.

And once you finish that, you can always just install mods and play some ranked!

Now, as a former holder of top 8k in the world in beat saber, I must say, it’s a good game, and there is something for everyone difficulty.

Yes, It’s not a game for everyone, but even my friend with epilepsy plays the game for 30 minutes a day. 

And if he was willing to do that, it means it’s a good game.

Trust me, the money you put in to buy it, will not be wasted.

SOL-O-METER
( My ranking system )

Graphics : 7/10
Gameplay : easy 10/10
Community : very active 8.5/10
Songs : 10/10 ( they have panic at the disco )
Mapping : 7/10 (camellia songs are 10/10)
Voice Chat : 0/10 ( no voice chat but it’s fine)

ITS A GOOD GAME. MUST BUY.

Update- figured out how to get it to let me play. If your game is freezing and you are using Bluetooth headphones that is your problem. Something about the update messed that up. I disconnected my Bluetooth headphones and it worked perfectly. It’s annoying not being able to use my headphones, but I’m happy to be playing again and hopefully they’ll fix the issue sooner rather than later.


I’ve had my quest 2 headset for about a month now and I have loved playing Beat Saber. It was the first game I bought, but since the update they did last week I have not been able to play it at all. Every time I try playing I’ll get the first couple of notes and then the whole thing just freezes up. The music keeps playlist my but that’s it. I’ve tried restarting the e headset. I’ve uninstalled and reinstalled the game. I did a factory reset. Nothing works!! All of my other games work just fine so I don’t see how it could be the headset itself. It’s really frustrating paying for a game and paying for some of the song packs and not even being able to play. If you’d asked me a week and a half ago I would have had nothing but good things to say, but after not being able to play for over a week I don’t even want to rate it.

The best virtual reality rhythm game i ever played. Also it totally gives you a workout. If you play a couple expert+ songs after your arms will be jelly. But in a good way. THis game will never get old so you  should always be able to enjoy it! this game is the best Vr game in my opinion And  i totally recommend it! thank you creators!

Love it 🥰🥰🥰🤩🤩🤩

Been playing this game since release, own pretty much every music pack. But seriously, what were the devastating thinking with the new bendy note cuts..they have just ruined the game for me and I doubt I will be buying any more packs until they are removed or at least an option to not have them. They don't feel good to cut and add nothing to the game..just ruin the flow of the songs..the other line to notes don't really add anything either but at least they don't detract from the experience. What a shame coz this was my go to game

Plus it's a blast to put newbies in it and watch them have fun. My only suggestion is there is a heart button for songs you like, I would find it more useful if there was a thumb down 👎 button for songs you really don't like, then there would be a visual cue so you don't accidentally select them and then have to keep backing out, sometimes that makes the game freeze.

I will hit the first or second block in a song and it will freeze, and keep playing the music while I can’t do anything. I have reinstalled it multiple times and factory reset my headset. Do not by this game if you are on meta quest 1 since it does not work.

one_reviews_text: I love this game everything is good about It I have no complaints I just hope they add more tracks like the new electronica mix oh my God this album SLAPS my guy reminds me of childhood with sandstorm from darude that alone made me by that pack just make more like it 10 stars
review_title: Need more like the new electronica mix

one_reviews_text: After u play the SAME songs 20 times it gets pretty boring. Priced way too high because of this issue. I don’t understand why they are SOOOOO slow with updates.  I would gladly pay $2 - $5 per songs for old songs that I love or have already paid for on my music collection. I don’t want ANY NEW songs. Just give me ones I already know. I don’t need the new Timberland songs.  I’d rather pay for some of his old ones. Hell, go back to the 80’s, 90’s, or early 2000’s songs if u have too. Or one hit wonders. I’m sure they would like a $1 or $3 per download. There was already many levels made with hundreds of songs and it was killed by greed. And they were all free.  Why not take some of those levels, offer to share payment with the performing artists and let the downloads begin. The people who made the levels didn’t ask for any money, so u don’t need to pay them for they work. Just touch up the levels to Oculus standards. Waiting months and months for new music packs of songs I never heard and don’t like are ridiculous.  Give me music I already know and then this would be a great 5 star game.  Until then wait until it goes down to $5 or $10.  Not worth any thing more for playing the same unknown music. 11-17-20 update. The lack of diversity in the music is regrettable. Not sure if they know that black people play this game too.
review_title: Great at first, repetitive & boring late

one_reviews_text: Controls that come with the Meta Quest 2, turn this game, that was easily a five-star experience into a one-star very quickly. The controller offset is such that you have to continually mess with the settings so that you can get it to where you think it's okay, but then when you try and play the game, the sticks are way off in another direction. There needs to be something done about this. It's an awful awful experience.

I have loved playing this game I thoroughly enjoy it. But as you get better, specifically expert level... You start running into songs where the hand sets can't keep up and you get phantom misses. I first noticed this playing the Song "Rollin'" I've submitted videos showing My saver going through boxes and not hitting them... Doesn't matter, they don't care. Then some of my favorite EDM songs of all time drop and some of the songs you have to move so fast the Quest system can't keep up. I've put everything back to factory full charge with official Meta headset battery expansion and brand new Energizer battery in the hand controllers. Nope phantom misses galore... So just know you can only get so far before you are Better than the system allows and that's not even close to the top of the game. Every time I play now I'm just disappointed and frustrated... No more purchases from me.

So I got my Oculus a couple days ago and this is the first game I got because I’ve heard a lot of good reviews on it and it is amazing the songs are good the graphics are good the songs are good and I like how you can play with other people and I like the music packs to the nacho expensive they’re not too cheap and they have a quite good amount of sounds in there. I would love to see if they added a Olivia Rodrigo pack and a weekend but this game is really good recommended it. 


PLEASE DO!!

I would say this has to be one of the first games you should play in vr especially if you're not use to it. All the free songs are really well made and the paid songs are even better. I will admit it can get repetitive every now and then but I would recommend side quest overall 10/10

Super fun, and its for all skill levels. No serious motion sickness, and pretty fun at a high level. If you get too good, get the game on steam, and you can play some custom levels through modding. Would recomend.

Beat Saber is a fairly simple rhythm game where you cut the blocks to the beat of the song while also dodging walls and mines. It’s very easy to learn but hard to master. The levels are all very well synced up to the music, but the song packs are a little overpriced, you can just mod the game to get custom songs. But all that aside I could probably play this game for hours at a time and not get bored, (if my arms wouldn’t feel like jello after an hour or two) there is so much replayability with the modifiers and difficulties. The decorations are very well done, the stage, lights and shaders all make the game have this futuristic feel to it. 
Not to mention there is an online mode and even a campaign. This game is awesome and I would recommend it to practically anyone.
review_title: Use lightsabers to cut floating blocks

one_reviews_text: Love this game it's fun for about an hour but it gets old quick. I'm so sick of not being able to add custom songs or even I'll settle for letting us buy single songs from a store or something. It's been years and years and everyone has one single problem with this game it's extremely small library of songs. GIVE US CUSTOM SONGS ALREADY THIS IS A JOKE LISTEN TO UR CUSTOMERS
Beat saber is very exhilarating and fun to play all the time, it has many options, but when you try to mod it it’s really hard, if there is anyway to mod it easily, that would be great.
The experience is very awesome, and please make the OST 5 free except for some songs, maybe just one OST 5, or The song called "Play" Free Please!! We will be very happy if you did!! :D

But, I got this game to help get me active, and I'd LOVE to see some classic rock (Bon Jovi, Styx, Journey, Foreigner, Phil Collins-In the Air Tonight) or maybe a movie song playlist (Eye of the Tiger, Highway to the Danger Zone, Footloose), or even some really good hip hop or (don't laugh) disco. review_title: Such a good game, my only issue is..

one_reviews_text:
As someone who proudly owns all dlc (10 dlc packs currently.) I would like to request you allow for users to download all dlc songs / songs in a pack with one click.

Secondly, let online players choose a dlc pack to create a multiplayer lobby. So instead of all or built in we can narrow our search for the exact dlc we want to play with random people with.

 Thirdly add a dlc only menu to remove OST trolls.  I don't like that I own every song and select all songs in multiplayer to be stuck playing OST 4 and 5 songs. Force people with no dlc to play in the non dlc lobby. Something needs to be done about match making. 
There needs to be a slipknot beat saber dlc!

So I bought BeatSaber awhile back and I was so happy I played a few songs but A few days after it gets so boring like you start to realize that it was a waste of money then another few days it's fun and repeat but this game just ends up not being fun at all anymore it costs you money for a song which I think is worse than Spotify 
( that's my opinion though) but you can't mod it really at all on the Oculus Quest 1&2 so that makes it more only on PC and I don't have a good enough computer to mod it so the game is basically trash and the only people that want or play beatsaber is either 9 or 10 year olds that complain to their moms if they don't get a 20 dollar hat in gorrila tag. So when you stop playing the game you will realize that's it's not that's intense it's more of a starter game but $30 FOR A STARTER GAME that's more intense than the game itself $15 would be more reasonable than $30 but that's how it is.
review_title: Fun then boring, then Repeat, then stop

one_reviews_text:
I’ve wanted to have Beat Saber for a really long time, and now that I have it, it’s great! Although, it’s really expensive to thoroughly enjoy this game. You’re limited to a certain amount of songs and you have to buy a songs and packs if you want more. The prices for these packs are… okay- They could be better. But it’s worth it:) At least, it’s worth it for maybe… a month? You could get easily bored if you don’t try to keep the game fresh in your mind. 

But, there’s a lot of good things about this game! You can go online and play songs with other people. I just wish there was either a voice chat or a type chat. Both would be nice. Also, whenever you really get into a song and enjoy it, it’s a great feeling. It’s fun! 

Thanks for making an awesome game:)
review_title: There’s Pros And Cons, But It’s Cool:)

one_reviews_text: So I love beat saber and I use it for working out, but other than the one song "fit beat", most of the work is in the arms, not the legs. My solution is to jog and hop in place while playing. I play at expert level for fun and use hard level for working out. For pure work outs beat saber's main competition is supernatural which has cool graphics but is not as fun. If beat saber was smart they would come out with a 10 song music pack with easier arm stuff (less cross overs etc) and harder legs (more barriers with faster transitions side to side and up and down) This would totally capture the pure work out market! Just a suggestion.
My main thing is I think you should be able to make custom maps without mods as it would really make the game much more exiting although overall great game.

I find it annoying that you have to mod the game to get custom songs. A built in map creator would work considering Moon Rider does it (Basically free, watered down Beat Saber.) When you consider this, it would be easy to do.

i have many suggestions for songs and packs but i dont know where to place them, so i will put 1 song and 1 pack here, the song is Monkey Monday by MTSG, and the pack is Undertale, even though Monkey Monday wouldn't fit the type of the games songs well, it would be nice to have it, and yes Undertale, it would fit well, but i would expect the pack to take a long time because, undertale has many songs included in the game, but im sure the songs you would add are boss themes like Bonetrousle or something, i hope you add this sometime

I was having a lot of fun before this issue occurred but now I am left with a defective game that can’t process anything past the in-game menu system.

I did the work to get mods running, but I understand that many people won’t do that, anyway, great game, mabye even my favourite (top 340 for people on beatleader, and top 8000 in the world)

Ok, the game is amazing (coming from a guy with a few thousand hours of play) but we need a level editor. This would be so much fun for your community to engage in fan made levels. You could even add a daily challenge and a weekly challenge to set high scores. You should also add a challenge based system in your free play/campaign/online mode where you incorporate a point based system to purchase in game goods and even custom sabers and whatnot. That reminds me, you should also add like a saber creation mode to customize sabers to give yourself a unique playing experience for all players to enjoy. I will continue to play this game for a long time.

review_title: Lots of fun, but you can't share DLCs

one_reviews_text: The songs are limited. Don’t get me wrong the game is awsome. But You should be able to have a more abroad choice of songs. Black eyed peas should be on here for sure, y’all need to add that as a pack!!! Over all love love the game.

(Keep in mind this is for the add ons not the game it’s self) I bought the greenday add on and regretted it immediately. It looks like you let a kid do all the mapping. The only reason this gets any stars at all is because the songs themselves are good. I thought since the standard game was so good that the add ons would be too. I was wrong. I’ve had the months now and can beat expert+ on most songs. But when I tried this it was like I said, a child was mapping the songs. You have to use all of your arm strength for each note. They are put next to each other and expect you to be able to go from one side to another in milliseconds. I would rather play the hardest song on expert+ than play one of these.
Update: Love this game it’s a favorite! Three of my family members bought the oculus 2 because of this game! The creators did a great job and I see some great new stuff! Thanks!

My kids and I play this game continuously lol my 9 year old son and 8 year old daughter are already kicking my butt doing the “Expert plus” mode!! Don’t even get me started on how good my 13 year old is!!! I’m just like “Nope, my brain doesn’t work that fast…. Yet!” Lol we have quite a few games on there and out of all of them this is by far the one we play the most. This was also our first game we bought on the Oculus too and we are definitely NOT disappointed!! The options between just playing and then heading online to complete - just keeps ya wanting to play more and more getting better and better. It’s a “MUST HAVE” type of game when it comes to VR.

Bear Saber is one of my favorite games to play, but there is one main issue I have that I’m pretty sure a lot of players have. The notes are way too low, and just a day ago it was fine, I tried adjusting the boundary and height, yet nothing worked. I won’t be able to play beat saber as I once was able to, due to this weird glitch. I hope you guys consider fixing this.
review_title: Great game, but a major issue…

one_reviews_text: The game is pretty fun. The accuracy is pretty tough if your a taller person. Even with changing the settings. But this is only on invincible blocks. Some reason can never get it to work right.  Now main thing I don’t like about this game one bit and is pretty much a joke imo. You can buy extra packs but it will only be for your individual name. Nobody else on your console account can play them. That is honesty the most annoying thing ever.  Only way they can play is to rebuy them again or go under my name. This needs to be solved.

I love playing with my daughters. I play everyday. My daughters and I play at least 5 times a week. We have so much fun and we love how it challenges us to be better. I have all the music packs. You need to add more songs/artists like some old school funk or Bruno Mars or 21 pilots. Metallica would be great too.

I had seen the hype, the videos, and a bunch of other games when I first got my quest. I finally downloaded the demo and was instantly hooked. I couldn't believe How long I waited to get it. Now I play this game so much it may as well get its own console! Expert plus levels were a funny joke to watch when I got started but now it's all I play. 

My only critique is I wish there were more songs available for the price of the game compared to other similar music/rythm games like Just Dance or Guitar Hero or even Tap Tap Revolution. Even if only available as add-ons I shouldn't have to mod the game to get more than a few popular songs or packs.

Overall I love this game. However, there are many things in the steam mods that I wish were in the actual game. For example, custom sabers and an FOV Slider. For the custom sabers I think there should be a currency system that you can use to buy new sabers. You could either; buy the currency or beat songs to obtain some. I think that the range for how expensive the sabers are should be anywhere from 250-2500 credits. I also think that the amount of currency you get from the songs should vary how well you do (The lowest would be 5 while the highest 10 or 15). Other than these things, the game is very fun and would recommend.
review_title: Amazing game but I have some suggestions

It’s absolutely horrible and completely ruins any sort of motivation ive had to play it.

This game is one of the first VR games I've ever played, and it is amazing! First, the songs are great! The soundtrack is really catchy. Plus, you can buy extra soundtracks from your favorite bands! Second, the mapping of the blocks feels natural and fluent, especially with the new block types. The blocks match with the music and they follow up each other in a natural way. Third, the game is original. It is a music/rhythm game where you slice blocks with sabers. This game is a must have, whether you are new to VR, or a VR veteran. If you have $30, spend it on this game!
review_title: This Game Will Go Down as a VR Classic!

one_reviews_text:
This is just what I expected, nothing more nothing less, mods make it really fun because you can play songs by known artists for free, it if they did include those types of games without mods it would make this infinity better, but 30$ is a good price for this. You'll break a sweat and end up dancing to the music

To start, I just want to say this game is amazing. It feels great to play, and it is a great way to burn some calories. With some effort, you improve your reaction times and get better at the game. one_reviews_text: I tried to download the update on my oculus.  It has been frozen for 3 days, will not complete download and will not allow me to play anything else while it is in the process of downloading.  I do not have the option to cancel the update, it just continues to display “this may take a few minutes to update”!

I have been playing Beat Saber for about 6 months now and I have been absolutely loving it. I'd always struggled to get into exercise as it's really dull going to a gym to get your workout or buying home equipment that eventually gathers dust. Beat Saber is the one consistent form of exercise that I have stuck with and it's showing! 

So what keeps me coming back! Well the game play is really fun and really gets you moving around. It's like fruit ninja on LSD with bangin choons that sucks you in and turns you into a flailing psychopath which is a great show for the neighbours when you forget to close the curtains. 👀

Most of the song packs are great and has a nice variation of genres from indie bands like Imagine dragons, Pop Punk like Green day and Fall out Boy then lots of more dancey and electro stuff which is awesome if you are feeling that sort of vibe. 

If you want to have fun and work out at the same time this is the game for you! 

-------------Feedback For Devs---------------
- Would be awesome to have a playlist feature so I can add songs from different song packs together. I know there is the heart feature but if I am feeling a more Rocky genre sort of day would be nice to jump straight into my playlist for it. 

- Would be nice to have the ribbon and arc notes as an optional feature as some of the Fall Out Boy songs recently released are great songs but don't feel the best to play with the ribbons. 
Just to add these new note types can be hella fun to play just would be nice to disable on occassion if you have Beat Sabered too hard and your arms are too rekt to keep consistantly held in the air. 

- Would be nice to have access to custom songs without being hooked up to a PC. 

- Occassionally I have noticed that notes will seem to miss whenever I play online but never seems to happen in singleplayer. Could be due to net speed but haven't noticed any issues on other games. Have tried cleaning the cameras, adjusting the lighting in the room, making sure controllers are fully charged etc but doesn't seem to help.
review_title: Burning Calories One Block at a time! 🔥

I love playing beat saber. I have it on the ps4, but was stuck to one room so I got a oculus quest 2 just for beat saber now I can not play it. I slash the first note and the game freezes. The music plays on but, screen is frozen. I Uninstalled it and reinstalled same problem. I reset my quest 2 no luck. I have only had this headset 2 weeks or so and it's a 256g so it's got lots of room a patch needs to be released soon. Otherwise I'll only be using this unit for movies.

Update Some how I got this fixed on my own. I  played a song through in zen mode then I played the same song without hitting the note blocks for a game over then I restarted the song and it played just fine. I was on stationary mode at first, but I tried this method  with the room boundaries on and it worked just fine. Yes it's a little hassle to run the song to get game over first then get to play it for real but at least I get to play. Will update if steps become unnecessary.

Final update for right now the game is running just fine no crashes as of yet, no extra steps needed to play any songs so far.

Now I love this game and I really enjoy it, but when I play for a while the songs start to get really boring because you've heard it like 1000 times. 

I feel like there should be a built in mod with the game so we could get other songs and also custom sabers. The game would be much more enjoyable and we get to play more songs! 

I feel like the people without a PC can't enjoy playing the game because you can't get mods without one. So please add the option of getting custom songs and custom sabers as everyone wants them.

This used to be *THE* game on Oculus. But for whatever reason, this game has become unplayable.  It no longer tracks my 'sabers', and the only way I can play the songs is if I put them on no fail mode, which makes the game no fun.  NOT ONLY THAT, I can't play in multiplayer because of the failure to track my sabers.  This is the only game in which I play that has this issue.  

**NOTE** To the developers: I also recommend that you rework the tracking for short players, ie, people shorter than 5 foot.  I cannot play the Expert+ games without jumping.  The notes are too spread apart for me to reach them.  I also ****HIGHLY**** recommend you add a continuous play mode like Synth Rider.
I absolutely love this game it is the first game I got on my quest 2 and I can’t stop playing

I have zero complaints about the gameplay. Our three children (17, 13, & 11) LOVE the game. Even I, at 52 years old, enjoy it and have managed to fight through some "expert" level songs.

My warning is about the available-for-purchase in game music packs. They DO NOT share to all accounts on the device. For example, if your three kids all want the BTS music pack on their accounts, you will be forced to buy it three times. This is, simply put, a greedy money grab.

Consider yourselves warned!

Every time I start a song now, no matter what song it freezes. It freezes faster on hard than it does on easy, but I can't get through the first 20 seconds of a song either way. I uninstalled and reinstalled, I checked software updates for the oculus, I've done everything it said online and I can't find anything else about this or a way to directly contact the devs. Before this it was an amazing game. I'll fix the review if you fix the game.

one_reviews_text: I love this game and have been playing it for years (since the imagine dragons pack came out) and I have bought the Imagine Dragons, Fall Out Boy and Green Day packs. They are the best ones in my opinion (rock and indie music fan). But one problem is the Multiplayer, in the multiplayer people without packs can play in the “all” packs mode so I am constantly placed with people who constantly want to play the same song. If there was a way to fix the matchmaking that would be cool.

So the game itself is absolutely amazing, 100% recommend.  But I bought the fob pack, being that I get excited when the release actually good music packs, and ngl i was not disappointed. The music quality for like 2 songs were low, but I was blow away about how fun it was, and the amazing background. So I went to a hella mega concert and fob played there, and there were these weird screen things, and lots fire, and too see that beat saber used the videos that were actually from the concerts (except for 1) in the background was amazing. And I do hope that the next thing you release will be my chemical romance. That would be awesome.

Right now, I believe that Beat Games’ approach is to gain a bigger amount of players through the music packs. When the Fall Out Boy music pack came out, I bought it because they’re one of my favorite music artists. That’s their approach.

You get people to buy the music packs through the popularity of the artists, and so Beat Games gets revenue, you get an amazing experience of songs in new ways you couldn’t even imagine.

Listening to the song is one thing, but actually feeling the song is another. It’s an amazing concept that is executed very well. This is exactly what Beat Saber needs. 

TLDR: The Music packs gain more players and are fun, I really enjoy this game.
This game definitely  needs more songs (free and paid packs). Playing the same songs over and over can get repetitive. That said, it's a good time and I'll probably keep playing.
I use this game to hit my calorie count, and I’ve actually gotten good at it! The music is great!

I like this game because of its many songs and packs buy this game(if u wanna) and experience amazing

100% 5 stars if this gets added

review_title: My all time favorite game to play!! :)

one_reviews_text:
Love it, love love it!

Not sure if it’s a hardware issue or a game issue seems more and more my sabre misses so many blocks but I’m not!!! It makes it very frustrating especially when there’s a tight game… The one star will stay until the game does the one 
thing it is supposed to do… Hit the blocks… be even better when they can get on a real platform like Apple vr.

I mean, don’t get me wrong, it’s not the only game I play and like, but it’s the one I play every day for at least an hour, it makes for a wonderful workout !
You need to stretch before playing though, as the shoulders, arms and wrists will be highly solicited.
For me, Beat Saber is like entering a new realm of reality in which I can vibe to a rythm and sweat like crazy !
You need at least a meter sqare to play I would say, but you won’t be able to play some game modes without at least a 1.5m square, like 360 mode, where the level goes all around you and you often end up backwards from where you began.
To wrap it up, I’d say Beat Saber is definitely THE experience everyone should get on Quest, as it’s probably the game that has one of the best replayability, because every level has a lot of difficulties and game modes, and the developers are always adding new content (OST 4 is awesome, Ludicrous+ in expert+ is just a thrill).
I’ve been playing Beat Saber daily for 2 months and a half now !

Update: it’s been over a year, I don’t play it as often anymore but still my favorite VR game, with and without mods. Plus OST 5 is out of this world, it’s wonderful to have got all these creators which were already known in beat saber through mods !
review_title: My quest 2 is a Beat Saber machine

one_reviews_text: Fun but when it comes to the music packs it’s meh, the songs you need to buy aren’t the greatest songs but there not bad.

Hugely addictive game that I keep coming back to. That said, the most recent "developments" to the game leave a lot to be desired. Not a big fan of chain notes but I can live with them. The bigger issue is the completely pointless arc notes. They have no scoring value, are distracting, vibrate unnecessarily (which can't be turned off in settings unless you turn off all vibration), and are frankly patronising. Have hardly bothered playing the new music pack as it's full of this rubbish.
Good game, but add more songs. Custom songs or something like that will be great idea.

beat saber was a mid game before the new ost 5 update came out (my opinion) but NOW with the amazing songs (my opinion again) I LOVE IT almost all the songs for me in this new album are not only fun to play but also sound good too, and the best part is that they are all FREE!!! thank you beat saber, thank you

one_reviews_text: I am someone who works from home and sits at a desk all day so I get little to no activity. Everyday I try to challenge myself to something new whether it be adding a new modifier, beating a friends score, or going up in difficulty. I love it and I spend at least an hour on it daily.
After I hit a box the visuals freeze. It's completely unplayable. Also the music's bitrate sounds as low as 96 kbs which sounds really bad.

Other than that, its great.

I love this game, it’s great for some light exercise and being someone who likes music as I am (choir and theater kid lol) it checks all the right boxes, except one… I wish there was a tad more variety in the stuff you don’t have to buy, it’s just a little frustrating to buy a game, then have to buy half of the things I want to actually do in the game. I also just as a personal thing this isn’t a bash on the game but I really wish there was more metal music. I love the Green Day (punk) Linkin Park (emo/rap) and Panic! At The Disco (alt/pop-punk) packs, but I would love to see some heavy metal stuff just cause I’ve seen videos where people mod it in and it looks fun but I don’t wanna mod my oculus and chance damaging the software, plus I understand devs are just tryna make money to eat so I try to be understanding with costs. Maybe a Disturbed pack if you can get an agreement with them? That or maybe Korn, Five Finger Death Punch, etc. I’d be happy with whatever I just feel it would be hella satisfying to lash out at those blocks while listening to someone shred.

one_reviews_text: Content diversity is inversely proportional to game popularity. If You are no fun of pop, you maybe find few tracks to play at get bored after few weeks. At least they have 2 rock dlcs. Track difficulty is completely inconsistent, therefore You can end up at point where you won't have any of them to train with and won't "level up" until You are a fan of muscle memory training or playing with decreased speed. Fans puts love only to expert+ tracks. Lower difficulty levels are scarse and poorly designed until they are - again - pop or kpop (had feeling sites are flooded with it). Many people refers to this game as fitness app, which is true only on start, because with progression it rewards speed therefore movement optimisation and muscle memory over reaction time, so it ends up that on expert+ You use only your wrists (otherwise you would need hydraulic muscles like insects) with 140 bpm after 20 min of game.

As someone who loves music driven games going back to DDR at the arcade,  then Rockband, Guitar Hero, etc... finally playing Beat Saber on the Oculus Quest2, it's been by far one of my favorite games. I know there are "work arounds" to play music not available directly through the game... i would ask(beg) the developer team to put out a "90's" pack. i would gladly pay to see tracks from 'The Offspring', 'RHCP', 'No Doubt',  'Hole', 'Foo Fighters', 'Pearl Jam' etc...  at least more rock genre added.  I'm sure there are more in my demographic that would agree. 
Thank You!

Beat Saber is the best game to play if you ever need to be active. The visuals are stunning and the gameplay is silky smooth. Definitely addicting. When you play with friends in a room it’s even more fun as you’d think. Always being competitive to see who gets 1st. I’m definitely recommending this to who hasn’t got this game yet. As you become better, nothing seems easy as there is always a difficulty that fits your skill level. 10/10 if they added more free songs more often. 9.5/10 Great job devs!

If you love music like me and feeling really cool this game is for you. The one downside is you are only able to play limited songs. If you don't have a pc. 

Over all this game is a solid four and a half stars for me. The only things I would add is being able to create your own songs and let people without a pc download extra songs.

Once you get the hang of it, you'll love it. You'll want to play every day. You'll burn lots of calories, work up a sweat, and lose weight. No need for a gym  when you've got cardio, squats, and boxing all rolled into one FUN game. If you're competitive, you'll love it even more, always trying to improve your score. The built-in music is great, the graphics are cool, the add-on options are fun, it's amazing.

Notes for the developers:
1. Make it possible for me to see my own top scores in each level, not just those of the people scoring hundreds of thousands points more than me (how do they do that?!).
2. When I try to compete with others, my height adjusts to a small child and I cannot increase it. I also cannot squat forever, so I can't play in that mode until you fix this.
3. The objects that make you move are often too wide to properly move within my boundaries. Any way to adjust this?

Never liked to sweat until I got good at this game. I would play all day if I had time. I think it stimulates my ADHD brain in ways no other exercise has. I feel like it also counts as meditation when you are in the zone. 

For anyone who has issues with their headset staying in place or denting their forehead while playing: put your hair in a ponytail. It makes it so you can loosen the straps to where it doesn’t dent, and it feels much more secure. And if you add a modern sweatband you won’t get sweat in your eyes or irritation.

While I never thought I would give this game a 1 star review, as this game was the sole thing that made my buy an Oculus, however this new update is making me do so. Adding these arcs and chains is NOT NEEDED. Stop trying to change this game into something it is not. We do not need that. If we wanted that we'd buy Synthriders. I bought this game for blocks and slicing, and music. Not for arcs that dictate where I move my sabers. Make this optional or stop. If this gets added to all new songs, you're killing this game. I'll stick to modded instead if that is the case. Stop trying to "improve"
 things just for the sake of saying you are doing something, because you are not improving it. Don't try and fix something that isn't broken. Period.

When I first started playing this game I started with the demo then after getting the hang of it with the same song that comes on the demo I decided to buy the full game. 

Let me tell ya! Started with campaign mode then after playing for about 10 mins solo I jumped into multiplayer with random experienced players and they pushed me further to level up my skills, stamina and fitness with songs as ghost, ludacris and what the cat! 

The very next day I woke up with sore shoulders. A week later I came to realize when I saw myself in the mirror shirtless that my upper body was more toned, I felt more agile, stronger, more energy, just felt good in general. Did I mentioned I felt also like a samurai? 😁👌🏼
This game is really fun and fun to learn.

I know I am very late to make a review on this but there are no words on how to describe how good this game is. The levels are very challenging and that's what I love about this game. It's just so much fun! Although I wish they had the songs from Imagine Dragons: Love,Dream, and Stuck. If they were to add these songs the game would be so much more fun and I would instantly buy them as soon as I could. But other than that, this game is 1,000,000/10 and is a must Buy!!!!!!!!!!

This is the gold standard for VR rythm games. Great selection of music and plenty of liscenced DLC albums. 

There is room for improvements here, like the occasional blocks that have an unexpected slice direction based on where the game has had you move your arms on previous blocks. Those are always a bit of a shock that's throw me out of just enjoying grooving along with the music. I'm also not a fan of the saber colors changing with albums. Since I tend to go between albums I find myself floundering while my brain adjusts, only to be done and ready to move on to another song from another album and starting all over. Luckily you can set static colors in settings, but seems like a bad design choice all the same. 

With that said, for being a few years old the devs did a fantastic job and have continued to support the game. I own this for both PCVR and here for the Quest 2, and and graphical difference is negligent to my eyes. It's definitely worth picking up if you enjoy rythm games.

If you’re looking for an awesome rhythm workout game, this is definitely for you. There are over 300 songs and and almost half are free-  and ones that aren’t, are special and come with new VR environments and saber colors. New song packs come out at least every two months and are by famous music artists such as Lady Gaga, Imagine Dragons etc. I seriously suggest you buy this game

review_title: Why this game is the BEST

one_reviews_text:
I’m not a RPG or FPS type of gaming person so Beat Saber was the first game I purchased and it definitely was not money wasted. I took my time leveling up and playing the songs so it wouldn’t get old and boring. At first, my shoulders would start burning after 20 minutes of playing normal levels. Today, I can play an hour straight on hard levels and my shoulders are just fine, so I can only imagine that I’ve developed those muscles a bit. I’ve also lost a few pounds and have seen my heart rate as high as the 140’s when playing harder and faster levels. 

The game is what you make it. You can keep it simple and play all the songs on normal, or you can challenge yourself and play in 90° or 360° (pretty cool), or you can do one saber, no arrows, etc. I love playing multi-player with my sister and also in servers with strangers. You can also buy additional albums to play (Billie Eilish is my favorite so far) or download SideQuest and mod your game for all sorts of custom songs. My husband loves it too so we take turns playing. Four months later we are still playing it daily.

Would recommend to all that Love music and Vr 🤣

Would Love for Music by the band Ghost to be added ❤️
Ever
So good mods run really good but you should add a downgrade option to but still really good and fun 🎮

one_reviews_text: I have a brand new Oculus Quest 2, and only had the app 2 days.  Suddenly the music is gone, but the game is still working.  That sucks.

This game is amazing. It's perfect if you need a fun and rewarding cardio work out or just a reason to get up off the couch. Play is addicting, especially if you end up score chasing a lot. Believe me when I say you're capable of making it further in this game than you thought if you're willing to take the plunge.

Some quality of life changes though.

On the leaderboard it would be nice to see what modifiers people ran to get that score. It would clear up some confusion on what combos are necessary/possible to get to those top scores. It may clear up confusion for people new to the game that look at those top scores and think they're unachievable.

You guys already have the small icons for ghost note, disappearing arrows, etc in a multi-player lobby and I feel like they could fit in well sitting next to someone's score.

It's also annoying trying to keep up with what songs you've run with modifiers and this would clear up that issue.

It would also be nice to have a "randomize song" option in multi-player. I've been in lobbies where no one knows what to play, and having the option for everyone to agree to randomize would help clear up that issue and keep gameplay moving.

It’s pretty good, but if you are expecting something with a lot of songs, don’t, most of the updates bring like 4 songs, if you need more songs I think you can find them at beat-saver, but the base content feels a bit sparse at time, I wish they had something where people could choose songs from Spotify and use them for new maps, but it might be hard to get the rights to, I get it

What I think we will need for a ost to buy is something like a Bruno Mars or a Living tombstone pack think about it they are big creators and you have already done a collaboration with them in ost 5 and if not that add some more songs to the extras pack I hope you take my opinion into consideration.

First off, if you are a kid, you'll love this game. If you are an adult, you'll love this game. Fact: At 6-8 months old, a typical infant can make "Vwwww" sounds while pretending to swing a lightsaber. If you have a Vive/Rift/Quest, obviously purchasing this game is mandatory.
As mentioned, watch where you're swinging those controllers. You may want to consider using a mat on the floor to keep track of where you are. Wrist straps are heavily recommended. And fellow dads, please stretch first. 
For Quest 2 owners, custom level support requires a sideloader. As an owner of both a Rift and Quest 2, I'm disappointed to find out that I have to buy this TWICE if I want to play on both my Rift and Quest 2, despite the fact they both use the same account. This is ridiculous.

So I’ll keep this review short and simple…

Base Beat Saber is a fine game. With around 35+ base songs and around 60 buyable songs the game is a very fun time sink. I can’t even begin to describe how many hours I’ve sunk into songs like Ghost and Spin Eternally on here! But a lot of the songs on here you won’t like too. I can’t say everybody will like the challenge of Ghost, the groove of LVL Insane, and so on.

This is where moding comes into play

Moding Beat Saber turns the game into a whole ‘nother being entirely. With being able to mod the cubes, walls, world around you, sabers, and add custom songs to the game it makes it entirely worth it. Ghost on Expert and Expert+ is nothing compared to songs like Reality Check and plenty of the remixed Deltarune songs by Camellia. Plus it’s not “Illegal” like the warning will give you upon opening the game. I highly recommend that, if you have a PC or Android Phone, you learn how to downgrade your game and install BMBF, as well as putting your Oculus headset into developer mode.

Without mods: 4/5 stars
With mods: 5/5 stars
review_title: Learn how to mod the game

1. The fact that people STILL don't understand that Beat Saber X _____ just means that's it's a crossover between the artist and Beat Saber. No it is not false advertising because you can't figure that out or even use Google. I mean did you think the McDonald's X BTS meal came with the band? This is a commen thing used today and if you've never seen it you must be living under a rock or in rural Alabama. So if you're complaining the game didn't come with Billie's songs, you should learn to read/do some research/grow up.

2. People asking for Metallica. As a Rock Band Veteran since Rock Band 1, some of you have no idea how much licensing cost for Metallica tracks. It's very expensive. Why do you think movies, trailers, etc. Use cover versions? The entire Green Day pack cost less to license than like 2 of their songs. So this more than likely will never happen.

3. If you've read this far you're probably wondering if the game is worth the hype 🤔, and yes, yes it is. It's got some great packs that I recommend buying on sale, or modding the game at your own leisure. But it will make you sweat like hell and it gets the heart racing.
review_title: Writing a review to address stupidity 😀

one_reviews_text: This game is so fun I will play it all day

After not playing the game for a while, when I start the game after the latest update, the song starts and after a few seconds the song plays but the screen freezes. Re-installing does not solve the problem and keeps crashing.

The only flaw is that there is still a pretty limited pool/variety of music. I bought all the packs that have music I like (which is about half of them), but still feels like I am playing the same songs over and over. Another issue that kind of pops up with the new packs is that they "feel" better, so the older packs starting to feel kind of meh/boring. For me it is really noticable with the Greenday pack. Man I loved that one when I got it and when I play it now it just feels like uninspired hitting blocks. Might be just me though.

I looked a bit into custom songs, but that was a lot of hassle and the choreography on custom songs is really hit and miss while the "native" songs all have great choreography (newer packs are better than the older ones).
I have a quick question what game engine did you use to make this?

As a previous player of Beat Saber, on the PSVR, the Quest version is strides better. The fact that it comes with automatic height adjusted, just by holding the menu button, is a step up. One major thing that drastically changes this game from the version I played previously is the online multiplayer. Being able to go head to head against 4 other players adds so much more replay potential. Personally, the fun of the songs comes from the selection of music by popular artist. One flaw, with Beat Saver on Quest, is that at times swiping a block will not be registered and it would either force you to miss a block or count it as a wrong directional swipe. It is sometimes annoying especially when you are putting effort into the swings and attempting long score streaks. It’s minor and only appears ever now and then. I other than that it’s a solid game to own and a must recommend.
review_title: Best Rhythm Game on Quest w/ 1 Flaw

The Game is a pretty good… well… game. It’s really fun to play and the songs are really good and they slap. But the multiplayer. I found the this glitch by running in the trees and then I ascended randomly. Then, I was teleported to the rec center, where I played golden trophy. I beat it and then I was the Gorilla tag computer with my friend. And then I walked out of the wall in FNAF security breach. Then I was on fortnite and I just killed a guy when I was playing mini golf. Then I answered a riddle about Mario’s Pokémon. After that. I was teleported back to the beat saber home menu. So yeah. Weird glitch. 

But yeah good game 5 stars.

I usually LOVE rhythm games and don't normally get frustrated by them, but this is an exception. After the new wore off, I found myself not only getting frustrated, but actually coming out stressed when I was perfectly fine before.

I try so hard to love this game the way I love other rhythm games, but after even 5 minutes I'm stressed, frustrated, and want to do something else.

Games like this don't even normally stress me at all, but this one is made in such a way that it does. And if I'm being honest, if I knew about this before I bought it, I probably wouldn't have.
review_title: Should come with more health warning

one_reviews_text:
Ive been playing this game almost non stop since I got my quest 2, and I don’t really have any complaints, I do have a few suggestions though. 

1 - Saber customization: after a while the basic round saber starts to get boring, and I wish I had more option than just the color to work with, sabers could be awarded for getting certain achievements too. 
I also know many people who complain that the original saber is too wide, and they want to be able to have a thinner blade.

2 - Player Made Beatmaps: I know this is not likely to happen, but I believe people should be able to make their own beatmaps, if not with any song then at least with the built in songs or songs they own. This is one of the only things that I like more about pc vr, but even there the community can only make beatmaps through the use of mods.

In conclusion this game is great, the song library that is already available is amazing and the game runs smoothly. The above statements are not meant to be complaints but suggestions, and either way I will be playing this game until I can beat every level on expert+

Fun game, but we were very dissapointed in the song inclusion, price of song packs and especially the inability to share song packs amongst all accounts on same Occulus. For the price of the game, there should be more content.

I actually like the game but not a huge fan of a good portion of the music. I share the device with three other people in my family and the base app shares just fine to their accounts. 

The problem is that if you try to purchase add-on music packs they are not shared with other users (not readily advertised BEFORE purchase). Apparently the expectation is that you can pay the ~$40 for the game once. But each user has to pay their own ~$15 per add on. That seems both petty and ridiculous. 

I am not against developers making money on their work. But this would be like having each person sitting on the couch purchase a copy of a DVD they are watching together on the tv.
Brilliant game, am no spring chicken, but play it almost daily. Get the benefit of a lot of fun, with some fitness thrown in. Win, win!

This game is incredibly excellent when you start modding it. Maybe modding is not for everyone, but just try to  add some custom song, that's easy even for beginners. With custom songs you will unlock a completely different game !! Playing on your song is sooo different and satisfying than playng with a music that just feel meeh for you.

If you want to renew with beat saber or give it his GOTY... Add your song, that all I can say, it's a game changer 👌

Dev: if you can add this feature and add custom song like Synth Riders, your game will be to good just for 5 stars

I resisted this for a long time because I was worried the music was going to be cringey mainstream pop from the TV ads I’d seen. The music is actually really good, and most of the cringey stuff like Lady Gaga is actually DLC. The free music that comes with the game is chunky, impactful EDM. Actually really good. 

And the gameplay is just downright excellent. If you ever liked Guitar Hero or Dance Dance Revolution, do yourself a favor and get this right now.
