... they legalize custom songs and mods! Without those, the game deserves 4/5 stars, but gets old quickly. 

Playing BeatSaber on PC - where mods are "allowed" - you realize how much custom content there is and its quality blasts the default (and paid) content out of the water.

So, this has to be legalized - other playforms and games manage to do this, too.

It’s definitely what you would expect. It’s that game where you slice boxes in a certain direction to the beat of dubstep music. While that is the definition of the game, beat saber excels past that. The amount of fun I’ve had with this game is beyond what I was expecting. The gameplay loop is so repetitive but yet it’s fun. Seeing my high score go up as I flail my arms about faster and faster is something else. It truly is one of the best experiences I’ve had in vr. There is some negatives though. 

The base soundtracks included are good but limited. This isn’t really the fault of the game. It’s more of a fault on the developers. With music packs costing 12-14 dollars each you could get two packs and it would be as much as the game itself.  I can only recommend the game if you are a leaderboard hunter. Otherwise play something like moon riders since it is free and has better songs. 

But those are just my gripes otherwise it’s a great game and as time goes on beatsaber will probably be the first really mainstream vr game.
review_title: This game is totally worth it but…

one_reviews_text: Okay before you buy this heat me out. Comparing it to other VR versions of this game outside of the occultist quest, it’s only average. There is no modded music or mods for this version. They need to add that because otherwise it gets boring pretty fast and music packs are expensive.

This game is fun but the limited music packs are boring. I’ve no problem paying for more music but there just isn’t any more to buy. It desperately needs music additions. It needs Disturbed, AC/DC,  Slayer, Queen, ABBA, Bad Bunny, Beyoncé…it needs variety.

The vanilla game is good, but the when modded the game is excellent. It is not that hard to mod all you need is a computer (anything works as long as you can plug the VR in). On the computer you will need to download side quest and bmbf and that is all you will need to download. Drag and drop the bmbf into side quest and you are basically done. The process can be confusing at first but in general it is pretty straightforward and makes the game 100x better. I 100% recommend getting this game if you are willing to do that process. I had the game for over 2 years and I always will come back to it no matter what.
review_title: Such a good game when modded

one_reviews_text: Although this is an extremely fun and engaging game, they fail to tell you that you CANNOT use this game (the additional songs) on your family account. If you buy the game, it can be seen on your family account so that another Oculus user on your account can see and play with you. HOWEVER, what makes the game fun is the songs your ACTUALLY familiar with . If you put shade those songs they will ONLY show up in your Oculus and not the other Oculus that is on your family account. This is very deceiving and honestly… a ripoff. Shame on the developers.

one_reviews_text: This game is really good and we all have enjoyed it a lot, and I think this is a must have for anyone starting with Oculus. We liked it so much that we have purchased music packs. Unfortunately, MUSIC PACKS purchased by the admin of the device ARE NOT SHARED with family users, which a bit ruins the experience. In order to play the game with the packs, other members are asked to buy it, but have to own the game first. I think this should be solved asap. I will not be buying any other packs because it cannot be played by other family members.

You WILL get kicked out of the round if you didn't buy the song other players voted for. If the devs really cared about the customers who bought the base game, they would make it so that you can still play the beat map, but without music playing. The problem would be instantly solved: no licensing issues and no pissed off players leaving lobbies in droves.

AVOID until the developer fixes this issue!

review_title: Awesome, but more music genres please

one_reviews_text: Just based off the pure replay value, enjoyment I get out of this game, and honestly the work out I get all combined into one I honestly can’t say I enjoy any other game more than this one. They have banger songs for DLC too so you don’t have to mod the game or anything but of course people love to do it lol. I honestly think that the base game with all the options it gives you, is unbeatable. It literally is like guitar hero on crack for some reason. I remember as a kid being so addicted to guitar hero and growing up and finally having something like this but in VR is awesome. I honestly also think it’s way more fun for some reason. Maybe it’s the immersive experience that makes the whole difference but I truly think this game is well worth it.

The choices that come with the game are pretty lacking. Please add more “free”(read: I paid for it when I bought the game) music, it’s the only thing taking away from the experience.

One of my favorites I would definitely recommend it to people.

This is pretty much my go to daily.  A great warm up to my daily exercise program.  Sometimes an hour of this is the only exercise I get.  But, there is a lack of music.  I use the same music over and over because of the lack of music I can get into.  Im pretty versatile with music, but I’m pushing 60 years old and would like to see something more that I actually enjoy.  Some tribal drums, even some music from some of the Disney movies like Mulan, Brave, etc.  all ages love Disney… maybe adding in a Disney package?  I’d be the first to buy!  But, seriously, there needs to be some more music packages that fit an older generation.  Kids aren’t the only ones that use this. I give it a four star only because of the lack of music that I enjoy listening to.

When I have free time, I put a weird device on my head and cut cubes with light sabers while listening to music.  The best game.  I rate 7 red pandas out of 3 (dont judge how I rate.  Red pandas are worth more than stars).

This game is the 2nd game I bought on Oculus and MAN is it just an absolute joy to play. Im a fan of rhythm games and have always wanted to play this, and when i did it just blew me away. The gameplay is smooth and straightforward (no insanely complicated mechanics), very inviting for new players (having very simple songs to get you started), and having a ton of customizability, even without mods (saber color, background, in-game avatar, height, and much more)! Highly recommend for new and veteran vr users, this one is absolutely worth checking out :)

  (Motion sickness is also not an issue due to lack of movement)
While I’m playing beat saber if feels really nice even though I have not bought a music pack the built in songs are really good.

It's a great game, with music from the actual artists, unlike some other types of games similar to it.  However, there aren't enough of them and music packs aren't released fast enough of them.  I never purchased the Lady GaGa pack so fast in my life, because I was bored with the limited music.  This issue causes me to leave the game because I'm just bored.  
Another issue is their height adjustment.  It's never the same game twice, where the beat blocks are at different heights almost every time.  They do have the auto height that you can use but it's severely limited.  The example below, and there's no in-between, if you're 5 ft 9 in like myself, you're out of luck.  I'm sure they can make it where you can input your actual height.  Please work on this. 
1.7 meters = 5ft 7in
1.8 meters = 5ft 11in

This game isn’t worth 30 bucks without mods. The selection of free songs is decent, but the song packs are overpriced. Mods allow this game infinite replay ability with thousands of free songs. This game is thankfully easy to mod.

I'm giving 4 stars instead of 5 because when you see the 'Beat Saber X Billie Eilish' picture one may assume this comes with the purchase which isn't the case. There's also a pack with a 'Beat Saber X Imagine Dragons' image that does include the imagine dragons pack so that only adds to the 'confusion' ... I don't care for Billie Eilish so not a big deal but still...

The game itself is great, plenty challenging, fun and a good workout as a bonus. 
The only downside I can find is that the songs that come with the base game are more or less all in the same genre with only a few songs I really like so add-ons will be required in the near future.

The game is really good but I have some suggestions
More free to play songs
Dexarson music pack
Maybe less money?
Better tracking
If these get added then I’m all in

On May 29 2019 it was teased custom levels for the quest version of the game. They also said they would “fix” it so Oculus user could stream to Facebook. I’d much rather have the former but the fact that both of these things were talked about and not given an update and seemingly left to rot hoping that no one would bring it up. No response to even suggesting a reason as to why custom songs well after two years later. It’s disappointing when everyone is left in the dark potential forever.

one_reviews_text: Best game

First off I will admit I did not think I was going to enjoy this game but a buddy convinced me to buy it and boy was I wrong.
After the first day I couldn't wait to get home and get back into beat saber. I have even taken my headset to work with me to be able to play at lunch.
I do have one request that is holding me back from giving 5 star rating. I have played multi player with buddies online and have fun playing and I would say competing but I suck compared to them so it is much more just for the fun and hanging out. That said it would be awesome if we could share songs purchased by eachother. I know this could be a license issue or a "if you want to play then buy it". However I do think that if we could share say my Imagine Dragons pack or my buddy's Linkin Park pack it would lead us to buy the other packs as he will be better on his packs I'll be better on mine just due to practice time so to be able to try to be better after playing in multi palyer it would probably push us to buy the next pack.
But buy more aside, it would be great to be able to share packs purchased when playing multi player cause just being a spectator sucks and just puts us onto playing songs we both have and can play.
Make it that we can share our songs and you get the 5th star from me!
This game is amazing. My new favorite game now

So I had my oculus for like a month now and  this was the first game I got and my gosh it is so good like some good songs but still I think it is amazing and if you are thinking well I want a game that is cheaper then you are wrong this is amazing but one thing instead of the music packs should not be money it should just be in the game but other than that amazing graphics as well and it is like yours Jedi but with your lightsaber you are making music so that’s all you all should get this game

This is a phenomenal game. The visual effects are amazing, the songs are all incredible, and besides that it’s just so fun to play. Whenever I’m grinding to beat a difficult song and I quit for a while, it just keeps me coming back to it with more drive to beat the level. I have always loved rhythm games, and since I got my oculus quest 2 this is the only game that I have paid for. I am so exited every time I get on to play it and I highly recommend this game to anyone new to vr because it also won’t make you motion sick since you are standing still. This is a game that anyone can be good at with enough time and commitment. It also gives you a good workout, the first week I played my arms would burn so much. 11/10, get this game.
review_title: I just keep on coming back

So I bought all but 1 music pack and whenever I go online multiplayer I end up mostly playing default songs because other players either don't have the song or don't wanna play a song because they think nobody else has it. 

To fix this either have a menu option for players with dlc or a much nicer option, let other ppl play your song if it wins the vote

Would really like to see new songs by Dua Lipa, Katy Perry, Melanie Martinez, Taylor Swift, BlackPink, Justin Bieber, Odesza, and more recent songs from Maroon 5!

The game is a lot of fun and an excellent workout, just a shame they don’t officially allow custom songs, only if you mod the game which is a hassle and not ideal!

So this is a standalone experience only for the quest internal hardware this does not allow for air play or to play while connected to a PC,which is a huge bummer. I don't know why while logged into the same account and essentially in the exact same store my purchase does not carry over on this game and it does on others. That fact that a game is essentially locked to one or the other should be explicitly spelled out when you go to purchase a game.

Rant over as far as the game itself it is still a tone of fun and a must have as an on the go version to show off to friends and family, sad that it is a bit stripped down both in graphics and features. The visuals are fine clear and run smoothly but are missing some of the cooler visual flair from the PC version and you can't change your sabers as you can in the PC version. overall still a good game and worth a purchase but just the one.
I really love this game, and I beat it within a week of getting it. The best thing is, it is incredibly replayable
I love the game but why can't the music be free just please make them free 😁 love your game🏅🏆

I'll start of by saying that, for any new Quest users reading this, this game is a must-have.
The different maps and levels are super immersive and really makes you feel like a Jedi, the concept and the idea behind it are incredible, just awesome.

With that said, the execution is not even close to flawless. This game has a really major issue with it randomly missing notes, and I was quite  unhappy to find out i'm not the only one experiencing this issue.
And no, it's not that i'm missing notes (because i've checked footage and i've clearly hit the notes), it's the game blatantly ignoring/missing my hits.

The main reason I didn't reduce my rating to something bellow 4 stars is that this issue only happens from time to time and there are fixes (such as changing tracking frequencies from Auto to 60Hz/50Hz and restarting the console), but it's still a very irritating issue nonetheless.

Regardless of that, I do still advise to anyone considering this game (and anyone who isn't) to actually buy it. You'll have lots of fun (and psst, be sure to mod 😉)
review_title: Really immersive with one MAJOR issue..

one_reviews_text:
Dropped to one star because selling it as “Beat Saber x Billie Eilish” means you are buying her song pack, not “buying the opportunity to pay $12.99 more if you want her song pack”.  That’s deceptive advertising and it’s worth losing four stars.  I don’t even know or care about her work, but I do care about honest dealing, and this isn’t it.  Be better, “Meta”.

The game itself is otherwise amazing, watching videos doesn’t capture how immersed you feel when you’re actually wearing the headset.  Rapid learning curve from awkward, stiff swipes to full on grooving and dance fighting.  Excellent cardio workout when you’re trapped inside for yet another pandemic winter.

one_reviews_text:
This game is the reason I got an Oculus Quest 2, and it doesn't disappoint. Great music, easy to learn, difficult to master, always addictive! It's hard for me to start this and not play for an hour straight. 

And exercise! Good aerobic. I like to get into it and move my whole body to the music. After about 20 minutes I always break a sweat.

Also, in a world of subscriptions, I really appreciate the  music packs are one-time purchase. Like the artist? Great! Buy it, it's yours. Don't? Great, skip it. Plus they're then downloaded so it still works online or off! 

A little hard to make this full fun at parties. Better if the audio from casting (to TV) was more in sync so the experience could truly be easily shared. But that's an Oculus issue, and still everyone wants to have a turn anyway!

If I could ask only one thing, it's bring more music packs more often. There's enough now to keep me busy, and love that I can just throw on the headset and play. Plus I genuinely love this game so much, buying feels like a nice way to say thanks for the continued awesomeness.

I think Beat Saber is great for light aerobic exercise, as well as hand eye coordination training and quick thinking. 

What I dislike is the difficulty settings wildly vary. Some songs on the difficult mode feel like normal. And many songs have a huge increase in difficulty from normal to difficult. There's no in between. It's either slightly too easy or really really tough.

Lastly, in regards to these issues, it would be good if I could save a difficulty level preference for each song. Because, I forget which songs were too easy or too hard, and in which mode.

I just a couple weeks ago got an Oculus Quest 2 for Christmas. I almost immediately bought beatsaber upon setting it up and I’ve been addicted to the game ever since!

I ended up near Expert level in those 2 weeks of play! 

I plan to practice more to reach more insane heights with the game and carry on to be one of the best players in the game. Not to mention, it’s an amazing workout, too. :)

It would be nice to be able to app share.  Also, having a playlist of some of some of the upbeat Christian music (Skillet, Toby Mac, Seven Day Slumber), some country songs, a playlist (or two or more :-)) from some of the 80's bands would be incredible!!

After purchasing Beat Saber and several song packs, I tried setting it up so my wife could also play (i.e. using the same headset).  That is when I discovered unlike every other game I'd purchased, Beat Saber had decided to disable the "Multi-User accounts and App Sharing" feature.  That means you have to purchase the app and song packs multiple times if you intend to share a headset between family members.  Definitely a greedy move on their part.  I might be more understanding if this was stated clearly pre-purchase within the store, but it wasn't, thus the reason for my low rating.  Looks like others brought this to their attention 7+ months ago, yet in the multiple updates since, the feature remains disabling.  Seems clear they want the extra $$$.  Not from me; won't be buying extra copies, or any more song packs from them;  either for myself or my wife.  Too bad because it was fun to play, until this discovery soured me on it.
review_title: Does NOT allow for Multi-User accounts

I would give it a 5 star if it was a little easy to get different sabers.  Also another I idea is to have a level system and at the first 10 levels you get some free things like sabers or boxes to try and get a random saber or have a battle pass type feature.  Other than that it is over all a great game it keeps me intertwined for hours on end.

The expansion packs are few and expensive for the number of songs they contain.

The campaign was quite fun and challenging, but I hated all levels which require making mistakes on purpose. Why would anyone want this  mode is beyond my understanding.

Some additional ideas for improvement:
* song progress and time indicator would be very useful
* possibility to restart few seconds before the last failure in practice mode would help as now I have to guess / remember where I dialed
* 50% speed minimum is still too fast for me when I tried practicing an expert plus song. It would help to be able to go slower than that.

The Demo was great for our son who has autism and he absolutely loved it and! and so we purchased the game for him. 

It would be great to have a setting where you can overide the game part of if you don't hit the cubes 'correctly' you can just keep playing (like the demo). He only gets to hit 2 or 3 till the game finishes and he gets frustrated and looses interest. 

It is an excellent game for people with autism as it teaches them so many hand/eye coordination and working with crossing over the mid line body movements (which people with autism struggle with and is very important to work on). Just be great to have a on/off setting while they are learning and mastering the app.

Great game. Really fun and lots to keep you occupied. I feel like the transition between difficulties is brilliant and neither too drastic or too little.

I do, however, strongly feel that there needs to be more variety of songs added (popular/well known songs) as well as a bit of classic rock (fleetwood/toto/the eagles) etc..
It can get stale quick otherwise 

I am aware that you can "break the game" and mod, but I would much prefer to pay for the fair use of songs I enjoy

This is definitely a stable game to have for any vr users! Its hard to put into words the about of content you can get from this game whether its the campaign mode, regular songs in solo mode, dlc songs, custom songs, online play with friends/strangers, playing enough to go up a level in skill (I'm trying to reach expert+ tbh), or getting full combos SS rank on all your favorite songs. There's endless fun with this game and it doesn't get boring after a while just because it offers so much and its such a great rhythm game. Potentially one of the greatest vr games created (imo)! My only gripe is its sometimes hard for users to set up custom songs through your pc (but it worked fine for me and there's plenty of guides and even a discord server if you need help setting it up).

After spending 3-4 weeks in the VR space I can say Beat Saber is one of my best experiences so far. 

Enjoyable, addictive, single & multiplayer, great mobility, accuracy and very comfortable. This game will make you sweat! 😂 

Hope to see co-op or team vs team modes in the future. 

Great work Devs! 👍

Vanilla
Pros:    Has a decent enough library of songs, different modes for each song, and has music packs        that come out yearly with about 4-10 songs each.

Cons:   Needs thinner saber's, library gets boring easily because of lack of songs and or genres, and in need of a marathon mode.

Modded
Pros:   Custom everything!  better lighting,  free unlimited library,  and is easy to set up.

Cons:  Can be laggy due to certain mods like Akiatweeks or Chromia,  hard to get custom saber's, and certain saber's can break the game.


After everything is give vanilla a 4/5 and modded a 4.8/5



Also If you need custom saber's I'd recommend you go to the Quasmetics discord for some great saber's.

one_reviews_text: I picked up an oculus some days ago. I’ve always like rhythm games such as Guitar Hero, Rock Band, you name it. I’ve seen a bunch of videos on beat saber and i was interested. So I downloaded the demo, and fell in love with its fast paced action. So I bought the game. Just to let you know how much i’m enjoying it, I’ve already spent 10 hours on it. One thing to look out for, is that it MAKES YOU SWEATY. With it being fast paced, and you have to move a lot, you start to pour sweat. After every song i have to take off my oculus and wipe down the sweat. And you don’t want the sweat to stick, (especially if you don’t have a silicone cover). But apart from that, it’s an amazing game. The developers worked hard and it’s a must have game if you’re looking to pick up an oculus. Beat Saber with Oculus combines well like Mario Kart for Switch.
review_title: Must Have If You Like Rhythm Games

It says “ x Billy Eilish Music Pack” in the thumbnail, but actually it’s not included, you need to pay extra for the pack. 
It only includes 30ish songs, most of not all of them are just song that are unheard of. This game has an AAA game price tag but only delivers so little, I think it would be unfair for other AAA games if I say this game is worth the money. 
You can get lots of custom songs (popular songs, and for free) in Synth Rider, and Synth rider has a much prettier interface too. In here, customs songs are just not supported, and frowned upon. It feels like a rip off to buy all these music packs that can cost you >$100 easily. 
The only reason I would keep this game is that is is so “popular “ , that your friend is likely to have it if you wanna to do some online multiplayer party.
review_title: Billy Eilish music pack cost extra

In terms of quality the game is great, flows smooth and you will have fun.

However, after paying 30EUR for the base game you will receive what feels like a demo version of 35~ songs and when they get old (which happens pretty fast), enjoy paying 10+EUR for minor expansion packs of a few songs each. 

Basically if you want to have a bit of variety in your play prepare to spend a 100EUR more.

With custom music support, this game could be gigantic. Instead, it makes you feel scammed.

So this is the must have game for the quest. No denying it's excellence as a game. Easy through to impossible, so many mods to challenge yourself more. But, it loses one star for its money hungry cash grab. While it comes with plenty of content, if you want to add music packs they cost 10 to near twenty dollars and the real kicker..... When you app share, you can not use the add in packs and you can not buy them if you are using on the second account. We have 2 quests and wanted to play multiplayer. So instead of buying twice, we set up both with the same account, then added a second account on one of them and app shared. Nothing we tried allowed the second account to access the extra music packs so ended up having to buy the whole game  for both.

Beat Saber is a rhythm game that i just enjoy, its addicting too. I'm slowing getting better too! Basically too win you have to hit the blocks in the  right direction(tip: swing at a 90 degree angle) and not miss to many to beat a level. The game is simple but if you want to mod there's many people that teach you ways. Youtubers such as Lstoast, Naysy, and Waqman. The youtubers will give you a advanced version of beat saber and allow you to play all songs, but beatgames can't do this on there own due to copyright. 

Enjoy your Beat Saber, and also look for me on leaderboards im FYRE_AceBat!

I have Beat Saber on my Quest 2 and on my PC (Vive with Index controllers). This game runs horribly on the Quest 2. I'm randomly missing notes that I would definitely not have missed on my Vive, the audio somehow always feels out of sync with the notes despite tinkering with the audio delay settings, and the overall experience just feels like it's lacking in performance and optimization. I get that PC's are stronger and able to process things more quickly, but I recently bought Synth Riders and that game does not have the issues I've listed above. Synth Riders also has better music than Beat Saber. I would say there are only 2 or 3 songs on Beat Saber's OST's that sound somewhat decent. I love Beat Saber, but it is a s### show on the Quest. I will be sticking to Beat Saber on the PC and Synth Riders on the Quest.

one_reviews_text: This game is fun. You put it on expert it’s get even more fun and challenging. The music is very nice. I recommend this to new people or even if you don’t have it you should get!

Beat Saber is a fantastic game. It’s what sparked mainstream interest in VR back in 2018. Back when few people like me had a headset since 2016/2017. The game is very simple, slashing cubes with light sabers, but my god is it perfect. Each swing feels satisfying, haptics in the controller making it feel REAL. Sparks flying out of the sliced cube, laser lights all around you like a Pink Floyd concert, while you are slashing to the rhythm feeling like Anakin “disposing” of the younglings, DOPAMINE HEAVEN. 

The game is a workout too, (mostly on hard to expert+.) I always have sweat dripping down my facial interface to the point where I have to wipe it off. (Which is why I picked up a silicone cover lmao.) 

The game is easy to pick up, but hard to master. I’ve been playing for a long time now, it only took 4 months to get the hang of expert plus, and I still suck at “Ghost”. If the built-in songs aren’t enough for you, there’s always DLC. (I recommend Green Day and Linkin Park because the mapping works really well.) For the Beat Saber team though, I’d recommend making more rock music packs. It works so well in a rhythm game! Pink Floyd/Aerosmith/Metallica would really make Beat Saber feel like a different game. Techno and pop gets old really quick. And frankly, I grew up with 70’s/80’s/90’s rock, and the bombastic chords, vocals, and guitar riffs would make this game a million times better.

Another thing we need is custom mapping on Quest. PC already has it, and if it were on Quest, sales would probably be through the roof. You CAN use mapping on Quest, but it is far from official, and is a long process. Mapping your own songs would add so much replayability! 

In conclusion, buy Beat Saber, it’s a must have, we really need Quest mapping and hard rock music packs PLEASE, thanks for reading. 👋

When I played this game I had so much fun dodging and it was a excellent work out but you had to buy more music witch upset me because I had already spent 30 dollars on it but the free music was great and it was quite easy to play with friends overall it is a amazing adventure and would highly recommend it to all my friends

Beat saber gives the user a fast paced yet highly customizable way to experience music like never before. The slashes match beats well so you feel like the gameplay truly sinks with the music in your ears. DLC songs are well tailored so fans of lady Gaga, Billie Eilish imagine dragons and more can experience what I would consider their best songs.

Only complaint I have is the interface is a little overwhelming when you first start, with little tutorial. Additionally you should be able to add to your device’s leaderboard while in solo. 

Regardless this is easily a worthwhile purchase for musicians and gamers alike.

I never would have believed it. Me..53yrs old..playing VR!! WHATT?? 6 months in & 15 lbs down! I play this game for about 3 hrs a night, at least 4 nights a week. I'd play 24/7 if I could! Not only have I lost weight..but I've also improved muscle tone due to having to "crouch" under those $@!$% walls! I can also proudly say that I'm on Expert+ for most songs!! Never thought THAT would happen! Best of all.. I've earned 'respect' from my 29 yr old son whom I've yelled at for YEARS to stop playing video games lol one night he came over & I had it casted to the TV..all I heard was "Ma?! Holyy %$#! You're actually killin it!!" Then I'll hear him telling his friends that I'd kick their butt on Beat Saber! LOL  

My only cons:
I wish they'd come out with new music more often. Now that I'm playing on E+, I master a new music pack pretty much within the first few days. I'm gonna keep trying to install the modded version, (but it never works). 

When playing multiplayer, you both have to play at the same level... which totally sucks when you dont have any friends who are even passed hard. It's not fun if it's way too easy. If we could play the same song at our own level, it would be better. 

Other than that, if you love music & dancing, this is such a great outlet! I pair this up with Audio Trip and BoxingXR and get a work out that kicks my old but!! ☆☆☆☆☆☆☆☆☆☆☆☆☆☆☆☆☆

I am new to beatsaber and love it. However I can't give it 5 stars because although the app sharing is great (me and my daughter can share the game on one device), this does not work on any purchased songs. The purchased songs reside on the admin account and any other accounts even though on the same device have to re-buy them. 
If you have 3 accounts on 1 oculus headset that means you may have to buy a song or album 3 times. This seems costly and excessive. This is also probably why a lot of people are modding. I am happy to buy songs legitimately but not 3 times for one headset. There also needs to be more song choices to buy. I do like that you can buy singles though so you're not stuck with songs on an album you don't like.
Buyers should also be aware that if you want to compete against someone with your favourite purchased song, they need to purchase it too, this is frustrating but fair enough.
The music it comes with is annoying and grating. If you buy additional packs the game becomes fun.
After spending $30 on a game only to realize you have to buy the music, too, I’m incredibly pissed off. I can’t afford this.

This is one of my favorite apps; I play it almost everyday since 2019 on my Quest 1 and since 2020 on my Quest 2 also. I switch devices when device battery is low. I thought it was controller issues but, it happens with this app only. I play tennis, table tennis, bowling, shooting and fitness games and more. No issues on any of them.

I also tried to fix the problem with factory reset and repairing controllers. Didn't work.

By the way, very good app. Congratulations, excellent job.

12/24/2021

one_reviews_text:
If you haven't already tried Beatsaber, you must do yourself a favor and buy it. Oculus has an easy refund policy, though I don't suspect you'll use it!

Beatsaber is an amazing and immersive experience that also gets you active and moving. My only gripe is that a lot of good songs are locked behind dlc, however they're always on sale. Beatsaber is worth the price of admission and it's good to know there are more songs to get down the line.

In terms of VR comfort, Beatsaber excels. Whether sitting or standing, I've never had a problem nor has anyone I've shown the game to. Plus, there are a variety of difficulty increases and decreases that can be toggled on or off. Although playing for a high score is some serious fun, my guilty pleasure is to turn off arrows (since I'm no pro!) and jump the difficulty to extreme with headphones. That to me is the ultimate immersive experience I've had in VR!
review_title: Beatsaber is a must play experience

one_reviews_text: Or this game first day I got my vr. Haven't stop playing it since. So good definitely recommend

First, I'm reviewing the base game, not the modded one. There is lot of pros in the comments, so about cons:
1) No custom songs!! (promised in 2019 and available only on PC version)
2) Expensive song packs (few songs for a price of some other full games). I am not surprised people are modding the hell out of this game.
3) Too much of annoying "electro" music, too few "normal" songs (unless you buy expensive song packs).
Beside the above, fun game.

A group of us at work all got Oculus Quest 2 devices. During our first time playing together we decided to go for Beat Saber after someone tried the demo. "Which one we going for?" with the response of "The Billie Eilish one". Everyone buys at the same time, jump in and find that Billie Eilish is an extra charge! Very naughty given how its promoted in the VR version of the store with massive cover image and NO hint that buying "Beat Saber x Billie Eilish" does not give you Billie Eilish. One of the group goes and buys the extra, we are all set to play again ... only to find EVERYONE HAS TO PAY otherwise you have to sit it out!!!! Very misleading and the worst first purchase on a platform ever. Made worse this was multiple peoples first experience of the platform. No don't want to buy anything from this developer out of principle.
review_title: NO Billie in Beat Saber x Billie Eilish

It's a good intro to VR. I just bought my quest a couple weeks ago and glad I played this first since other games still. Make me nauseated but this is just good old fun. Would be great if they included more kpop songs, like TWICE. There are mods but they're mostly all expert and as a newbie in the game I can really only play til hard.

Game is good with fun gameplay and decent multiplay, but pricey with it.

Compared to other music rhythm games, this game seems not to have particularly effective algorithms for dealing accurately with less than ideal lighting and shiny surfaces - when playing, I often 'miss' notes that I hit accurately, so it is frustratingly random whether I can achieve a full combo or win in multiplay.

Beat Saber does not officially support mods, so I would not recommend buying it for what might be here today gone tomorrow at the first whiff of trouble for the devs.

If your money is tight, I suggest first looking into Audio Trip (which I think has the best dance workout and included music, and even has a built in track editor), Synth Riders (which also has multiplayer and a custom track community) and Pistol Whip. The first two are far more affordable and all are great, with their pluses and minuses. If you're into metal, try Ragnarock.

I play it daily for 30-40 min., I find it an amusing experience and good for a little fitness work. I grave It 4 stars out of 5 because I find interesting only about half the songs, and the packs are a little pricey. 
Recommend buy, tought.

If you're interested in this game, I would advise to reconsider. Maybe buy Synth Riders instead. They officially support custom songs. And the default songs that they have are better. It has a demo you can try.

Anyway, let's get started with my review.

This could have been a good game. But if you don't like the genre of music they give you, then there is only one option and that's modding the game to unlock all kinds of music. But here's the problem... They do everything in their power to make modding hard. I never got the mod to work on my device after many hours on several days of trying. And even if I got it to work, every game update breaks the whole mod until the mod gets fixed I have heard.

This game simply gets a huge amount of free advertisement from all the videos that show lots of different genres of music on the internet. While in reality, there is almost no song variation at all. I don't really like a single one of them, even though I am a huge music lover. All the devs need to do is branch out to more genres. I am sure lots of artists would love to have their song officially licensed in this game instead of only be playeble through mods. That way less people will mod the game anyway. The devs are just not trying to please anyone but their own taste in music.

one_reviews_text: 这游戏居家隔离健身必备！
I love this game

In spite of the ridiculously few song choices (music packs included, not to mention music popularity) this game alone makes it worth buying a VR headset!

Why "a VR headset" and not Oculus? Because in spite of introducing family sharing, you still have to purchase the game + music packs for every user - which can amount to A LOT depending on the headcount in your family.

Wanna have friends over regularly and compete over high scores? Tough luck! Not only do they need to log in with their Facebook credentials, they also need the game - purchased!

The only alternative is to let them play on your account which means ruining your personal records(scores, calories burnt, playtime and what not) not to mention this is against TOS for every respectable gaming platform. So if this is your way of getting people to purchase your game, try out your device and get into the Oculus ecosystem, not only are you bottlenecking yourself, you're making it a pretty underwhelming experience.

Unless of course you're targeting socially awkward individuals who have no family or friends and wouldn't wanna share anyway!

Some people stop at "Facebook" ...the rest throw the idea out the window at the mere thought of the expenses involved of introducing it to their family. Might as well buy a gaming computer but the hassle of switching steam accounts on it is another wall nobody wants or cares to take down.

Edit: 3 stars (up from 1) till music packs will be shared as well.

I would not recommend any VR game for fitness. It's just not the correct platform. Perhaps in a few years more sensors will be available to reflect full body tracking. 

That being said,  it is a fun game that can get your heart rate up. The levels start off easy and within a month you'll plateau and getting better requires real work. There are enough songs as well as a campaign option and multiplayer option and invite friends mode as well. 

One of my complaints is that I ran out of songs quickly. I pay $30  for the game and now they want me to add on music packs for $10-$15.  Not interested.  For as popular as this game is that is very expensive and the additional development is minimal. 

Most youtubers have jail broken their Quest2 and Sideloaded music packs free with the understanding that it voids the facebook license and disables the multiplayer option. 

I think adding a 20-30 song free music pack, or dropping the prices would get more people into this game.  After a few months I play it maybe 2x/week and get bored.

one_reviews_text:
The mechanics are simple, the game is simple, the gameplay is amazing, I will never get bored
I always get bored of a game after about a month playing it, no matter how good it is, but this game is an exception. I fell in love with this game, got good, and when I wanted more, I just modded (which was easy as cake (if you want to mod just download BMBF from side quest straight onto your quest (if you don't have or don't know about side quest, just look up "how to install Side Quest on YouTube, although the side quest app has its own in app download tutorial, so it's pretty simple))). The Modding community is amazing, and with one of the recent updates, we are soon to see the BeatTogether mod, noodle extensions mod, and mapping extensions mod all come to quest! (for context to potential buyers, these mods basically remake the whole game over again, but better, with more customisablity. The base game itself, mods aside, is pretty good. There are only a few (as in about 50) free songs with the game, but that number is steadily growing. You can buy music packs, but in all honesty, Modding is free, and waaaaay easier than you would think, so why not just mod? Beatsaber for the quest 2 is constantly getting closer and closer to PC beatsaber in terms of looks, modablity, etc, so don't be too fussed about looking for it on PC (though of you have a good PC why not just go for that) all in all, one of the best games to ever hit VR, and if you don't own this game, buy it, *especially* if you were into games like piano tiles or the like.

one_reviews_text:
I mean, what can anyone say about this game?  It's basically an institution for VR at this point.  Beat Saber is fun for everyone from casual to competitive, young to old.  The learning curve is fairly easy until you start getting into the transition from expert to plus, but dlc (and custom for many) can help bridge those gaps.

It can be relaxing.  It can be a workout.  It can be fun for a group of friends (streaming the POV, and getting to watch how silly we all look playing.)

The game is constantly updated for QoL (with more hits than misses), gets dlc at an increasingly steady pace and often gets free content.  

I've got quite a few of the more 'mainstream' VR rhythm games, all of them are great; but this is the game I'm always coming back to, looking to improve something, from accuracy, to technique or maybe just to FC a song I've been trying to work out.  

Hope this helps someone!

Simple game, yet very fun and very satisfying.
I would give it 5* if it wasn't for the outrageous money-milking rip-off.
You pay 30€ to buy the game and have a very limited number of (not great) songs.
Then each new pack of 8-10 songs costs 10-20€ each. Absolutely outrageous, for a game that is already pretty expensive for something so simplistic.

This puts beat saber to shame, compared to other big VR examples. E.g: walking dead S&S - 100 times more complicated game, and yet, when they release a DLC with 6-7 hours of new campaign and a brand new horde mode, the DLC is free for anyone who bought the game. In comparison beat saber asks for 15€ for every new songpack you'll play twice...

My advice: try the game it's fun, ask for reimbursement after 1h50min, and do not buy any songpack to not encourage this shameful marketing strategy.

How many times do people have to tell you that your game rocks but your music sucks? I’ve bought my last music pack from you until you start putting out music for “the rest of us”. You have to have the musical tastes of a 12 year old from Wyoming to listen to this noise. Not everyone likes the same kind of music. You devs need to deal with that reality and finally, at long last, do something about it. I would play this game every single day if there were more than five songs I could tolerate. But Beat Saber has become a torture for me because I’m bored. BORED, as in I can’t listen to this bubble gum crap not one more time. I want music that people like me can get into, not being 12, or from Wyoming. And I’m not giving you one more dime or one more star ⭐️ until you hire some diversity and start coding some Salsa, some Merengue, some Jamaican dancehall…something ELSE. 

And I don’t just want ethnic diversity in your music catalog. If you really want five stars from me, I need you to pretend for a moment that older people have more money than their kids and grandkids, and put out music for people who’d kill to be able to Beat Saber to some Van Halen, or Styx, or Led Zeppelin, Cheap Trick, Tom Petty, or dare I ask…QUEEN!!! Folks who would pay whatever you’re asking to Beat Saber to “We Will Rock You”. I’m not saying that you devs are racist or ageist. I’m saying your music catalog is. It’s fixable, but it requires that you ask for help in this area, and take the time to look for and hire devs who know this music and can properly code it. I guarantee you, they’re out there. Contract out the work if you have to. But do it, because if you don’t, eventually some other developer will. And then THEY will get all my money.

I highly recommend the pc version as you can download custom songs made by people’s love and care over a paycheck, with nearly every song having an adaptation on beatsaver.

review_title: Favorite Game So Far Next2Job Simulator

one_reviews_text:
I'm not usually a fan of over-hyped games, but this one is legendary. Yes, I know, EVERYONE knows about Beat Saber so you're probably thinking it's another crappy super-popular game but this one is worth every freaking penny and provides nearly endless amounts of fun. 

The concept is simple. You've got two light sabers. A song plays. Cubes fly at you. You slice them to the beat. Seems simple. 

Until you realize that your entire body is getting sore and sweat is pouring down your face and back and your alarm on your phone is going off because it's time to get in the shower and go to work. Yeah... not only do I play this game for fun, but it has accidentally also become my morning pre-work workout as I try to beat harder and harder levels and get higher and higher scores. 

You'll kinda accidentally become addicted to it. At first you're just having fun. Slowly but surely you get so drawn in you're finding yourself doing weird little dances that the song doesn't really require, or song exaggerated swings... just really getting into it. You'll find yourself pushing yourself to beat this difficulty setting... then... maybe making it a little harder to challenge yourself. 

I love it. My kids love it. We take turns playing and will cast our game play to the laptop so the others can watch and cheer us on. 

This is ridiculous. 

The graphics are amazing, there is a huge amount of songs that come with it plus a ton of albums you can buy... you just can't go wrong with this one. 

Every Quest 2 should IMMEDIATELY have Beat Saber on it.

Edit: finally tried multi-player and it has added an even more insane layer to my Beat Saber addiction. I want to write a big, long thing like I usually do about games... but words escape how much fun the online play can be. Again... if you do not own this game, YOU ARE MISSING OUT. GET IT IMMEDIATELY. THERE IS A REASON IT SELLS.

For me this would’ve been a 5/5 stars game, but because of the lack of good and free songs it only gets 3/5 stars.

This game is really fun and, in my opinion, one of, if not the best game on VR. Some things I have noticed when getting my friends into it is that:
1. People who have played other rhythm games or have watched people play BeatSaber on YouTube do far better than other people starting out, so if you find getting your first song done annoying, try watching it on YouTube, because it honestly seems to help.
2. I got the demo version first, which is a Normal difficulty of song (compared to most people that start on Easy) and that helped me to advance more quickly through the difficulties, so before getting it, I’d recommend playing getting that one free song first to help warm yourself up to it, because I could see it being frustrating to some people spending a lot of money on a game and not doing well at it at all.
3. If you need a very easy song to start with, either in the beginning of the game or while advancing to new difficulties, start with the song Beat Saber. Until Expert+, where it is the hardest song, I find it is the easiest song to get through.
4. If you’re looking for a challenge, try the Camellia pack and OST (Original Soundtrack) Vol 4.
5. The paid DLCs are almost always better mapped and better flowing than the OSTs, so if you have money to burn, definitely get those.
6. This probably sounds weird but I find that I do so much better when I just tune out on a map altogether. I just start thinking about something else and I just breeze right through the song. I didn’t realize this until I think Hard difficulty when the songs actually start to get a flow instead of just hitting blocks.
7. For me, FitBeat (Extras pack) and Burning Sands (OST Vol 3) are some of the best-mapped songs in the original maps.
8. I recommend playing with a wide stance in your legs so that you can lean out of the way of the lasers/walls/whatever people call them instead of stepping, which, when you have a smaller play space, quickly results in hitting something. Remember, only your head cannot go through the laser walls, because the headset doesn’t detect other parts of your body, besides your hands, which can go through but I prefer to avoid it because the vibration kills the controllers faster. My only suggestion would be to add a setting that disables vibration.
9. This took me forever to figure out, but proper form for Beat Saber that gives you the most points per hit is hit the block in the direction of the arrow and in the center of the block, and to use your wrists to deliver the hit, not your arms. The wrist flick motion is what gets you a higher point score, so use your wrists to deliver, and arms just get you to the hit.

One more thing: if you don’t like techno music, you probably won’t want this game, because most (if not all I’m not the best with music genres) of the songs are techno, but I’m pretty sure that can’t really change because you can’t really map other types of songs as well as techno. I just had to add this after seeing some negative reviews about how bad the music is.
After reading more negative reviews, I’m also adding, yes, some of the songs are not as fun, but that does not mean AT ALL that you should not buy it, because there are still plenty of good songs, even if you haven’t heard of them.

I recently got my Quest 2 about a year ago, and I got this game about a month later. I absolutely fell in love with it immediately. It’s even better when you have a PC. With a PC you can have custom songs, sabers, blocks, and walls. You can also install mods with a PC.

The only downside is the song selection. There are 4 song packs with an average of 5 songs each. You can’t really complain about that, but if you want songs from people you’ve actually heard of you either have to pay for a song pack or download custom songs.

Final opinion: I think that if you own a VR headset you need to try this game. It’s really fun and addictive.

one_reviews_text:
Beat Saber is a really good game. I tried it first thing when I got it as a surprise from my parents. Me and my mom play the game (almost) every night now. Like some other reviews, I wish there was an easier way to play custom songs. I have enough money for the link cable and I found a watch-worthy tutorial by Naysy on YouTube on how to get custom songs. I love playing this game all the time when I have time, and this is probably the only game I play on my Quest 2 besides Rec Room and (edit: barely, now.) VRchat.

Beat Saber is my #1 game to play on my Quest and I would recommend the game to people who are interested in VR rhythm games and my Roblox players who play Sound Space.

Overall rating: 5 stars.

(Would rate it 6 stars if there was an option for that.)

one_reviews_text: I kept putting off trying this, because it looked too simple/repetitive, and there's so many tiktok and YouTube vids of obnoxious people playing it to songs I can't stand. Now I wish it was my first purchase. This game is great. Very immersive and a decent selection of songs (wish there were more genre choices). With how popular Synthwave is, and standard Drum n Bass, I don't know why those aren't represented, but even the songs I wouldn't listen to outside of the game are a lot of fun to play along to. They seem to add new song packs (for purchase) fairly regularly, so it should keep things from getting stale; plus there are a bunch of different game modes and difficulty settings and you can play with others. Can be played sitting down too and if you are very confined, you can turn off leaning dodges, so you can keep your play area small.

Bought beat saber in 2019 on vive and enjoyed it but only occasionally played it. Played it daily since i bought my quest 2 at the beginning of 2021.

No wires and having everything contained within the quest 2 is amazing. Also nice is that beat saber doesn't require an internet connection. It's so easy to stick on your head and have a blast with any spare moment. 

Other games come and go but i keep coming back to beat saber. There's a great element of skill to this game. It's only cutting blocks but the music is enjoyable to listen to and the game keeps getting faster and more complicated as your skill progresses. It's easy to pick up but super difficult to master. 

At this point I can complete a load of expert plus and expert feels fairly easy. It was hard work for a while getting to a decent level, but now it's amazing. Far from being the end of the game, this is when it's started to get really good. Every expert plus track is such an amazing workout. I usually try and play a few expert plus songs when my energy is high, then i play expert until my arms don't work anymore. I've lost a load of weight, toned up, and it's such a great way of blowing those cobwebs away from your brain and waking you up. 

This was the first game i bought and it's been great value for money. Buy it just be prepared to put the work in to get to the good part.

When I first got my Q2 I browsed around for games to play and Beat Saber kept coming up. I thought nah, that looks boring, can’t be bothered with that.  It then occurred to me that a great way to get used to the system would be to download as many free games and demos as possible and try them out - even this one. OMG, I found myself counting down the minutes to the end of work, so that that I could strap on the Q2, load up the game, and slice, slide, dip and glide around the room, dodging what looks like ice blocks coming towards me at a rhythmic parade, where I’m standing in the middle of the road and no one’s stopping!

It helps that the demo track is good and great at catching your interest as it eases you into the game at a comfortable level, making it both fun and accessible. Once you’ve been hooked and purchased the full game, there are loads of customisable features which mean nothing is too hard or too easy.

There are a good few tracks that come already installed. However, I found that the genre is limited and I could only really start to feel in my element once I started to download add ons. This is a shame, as I’m not into rock so it limited my game play. It would be amazing if the standard types of music that come installed could be expanded to fit a wider audience, even if that wasn’t what it was designed for. House, jungle, grime, RnB etc would all lend themselves nicely to this game. Also the choice of add on genre is also quite limited, although better than nothing. 

Would and have recommended this game and we just love it! Exciting, frustrating, a great work out and most of all, so much fun!
It would be really cool if you could make it so we can change the scoring parameters, other than that amazing game.

While I find 1 star reviews of games pretty funny like DOOM Eternal, this has gone out of hand.

1. App sharing

It was Beat Games’ decision to make this game unsharable through the Oculus App and Quests. Just because a feature of Oculus wasn’t turned on for a rhythm game, just shows that you just like to criticize anything for the smallest things possible.

2. Modding and Custom Songs

There is a fundamental difference between the PC, Quest 1 and 2, and PS4 version of the game. On PC, it’ knowingly easy to edit the files of the games since they are in the Program Files folder and that it’s a Unity game, so it can be modded very easily. For Quest 1 and 2, the game is an APK file, which can only be ran on BlueStacks or another Android device, such as the Quests. Because of this, it was harder to crack the game open to mods and custom songs especially considering that the game was updated a few days before a BMBF update was released for 1.14.0. For PS4, modding doesn’t exist. This was for legal reasons, which is completely understandable on Beat Games’ part considering how much they make off this game alone.

3: Tracking and other errors

These are either problems with the Quest, Unity, or the game has a common bug that many people don’t make a review towards. In the tracking case, it depends on the situation. If you’re sure you hit a block but missed, chances are really high you just missed it. Also the new DLC pack exists, but I personally didn’t buy it. Not to say that the game is worse this way, just that it now appeals to a bigger audience that like different genres of music. But the bug it causes (and apparently in an update) where the game doesn’t start up, I can’t help you as I both don’t have the pack or a Quest 2. The best thing I can give is update your Quest 2 or get a refund.

TL:DR: Stop criticizing this game for all the small things. Games aren’t perfect, and though progress on fixes can be slow at times, fixes and updates roll around to give new things and fixed areas that are heavily criticized are gone. And if you want to just play Ov Sacrament And Sincest ranked or whatever weird tech maps exist, just get Oculus Link, buy Beat Saber on the application, and get ModAssistant.

Stop being stupid. It hurts all our brains.

one_reviews_text:
Im going to start with the bad and why someone might not like it.

The song list is still in its early stages, and some of the best songs you have to buy.

It is a rhythm game. So if thats not your thing, you might not be too interested.

Motion. While it has some good options and settings for accessability. At the end of yhe day, the game still revolves around bright colors, and things flying directly at you while you try and hit them.


Other then that, I've had nothing short of an absolute BLAST with this game.

While its song list doesnt feature too many popular hits, like say, just dance. The songs it does have are really good. Amd all fit the game incredibly well.

The tracking is amazing, and the depth perception is also fantastic.

Its not a dancing type of rhythm game, but it is still one that gets you to move your entire body, which I love personally. Im not big on dancing.

The visuals are really simple, but impressive. It drfinately looks and feels like a top notch AAA game.

My only real problemis the difficulty on some maps. There are some songs that feel too easy on one difficulty, but the next setting up you might lose within the first 10 notes. Specifically some expert to expert plus songs.

But other than that, nothing will ever get me to stop playing this game. Love it to bits!
review_title: I literally bought a headset for this...

Edit--seems to be worst on the new Billie Eilish pack.  Poor sound mix (?) with her vocal volume and music in general too quiet and cutting boosted--trailing sound still should be cut or made silenceable

I want to preface this by saying that I get motion Sickness and cannot easily enjoy most VR Experiences properly.
Beat saber allows me to explore all that it has to offer without getting nauseous, and that's a big plus for me!

It's active like Just Dance, and challenging like Guitar Hero, and I love it!  Every song has it's own feel and rhythm, with five levels of difficulty to Master.  It comes with six albums of music, and more available for purchase if you tire out on the OST.  Although, I'd strongly recommend pushing yourself to run that CAMELLIA song you're afraid of first!

With the addition of online multiplayer, you can meet other players in live competition!  Randomly find others through Quick Play, or challenge your friends in coded rooms!

I tend to be very critical of simple arcade games that try to oversell with cliche story taglines. The simplicity of cutting colored boxes with lightsabers to music, is something I find pleasure in.  And while I search for better VR story games to play, (that won't make me nauseous,) I know I can always fall back on Beat Saber.

And if it's not already overstated, I highly recommend this game.

. While it is worth buying without any of the new packs and playing there are way to many songs that are choreographed way to easy and or boring . My family was sooo waiting for The bts pack , especially the song dynamite only to find the choreography of the blocks to be a bit boring . My son was a bit bummed out by that . I rarely beat a  song on expert on the first try but I beat this one right away. Now the song dna on the other hand was crazy fun. 
  Another example is from monstercat pack . The song overkill is a major hit with my family , while the song we won’t be alone , was seriously easy and boring. I know others who own and play beat saber and they all say the same thing. Way to many songs choreographed either way to easy or just plain boring. 
  When you play through a song and finish . You want a feeling of , WOW , what a rush . If you do not , then adjust the choreography until you do. 
 One last issue . I have tried expert plus and rarely make it through any song at all. To make the song expert plus I see to much reliance on simply speeding up the block to super sonic speeds. Would be better to rely on more intricate placement instead of focusing on sheer speed to make the song expert plus.

 After all I do not like I still highly recommend everyone buy and play this. It is the only game ever that I rate only 3 stars but still highly recommend. When you play a song that is choreographed well it is crazy fun.
Check out online , player made songs. Especially the ones with seriously high ratings .

 Update .Great, another song back. ? Not great. Makers of beat saber seem to be obsessed with adding songs with filthy language more and more now. I buy the pack forgetting to inspect there song choice. My son tries out the new pack and asks why if beat saber is rated for (everyone) why they are adding songs with filthy language. I forgot to inspect the songs so now I just wasted money on there new song pack. The filthy words are blocked out , but only 90% giving you a clear indication of every word. Beat saber should not be rated E any more. And again songs are mostly uninspiring in the block placement. Most are boring and super easy on expert. Equivalent of hard level of quite a few of the much older songs. 
 Finally had enough as we are retiring beat saber..
 Do not even get me started on not letting us share the game in same house hold like so many others do. Seriously on the greedy side to expect in same household to buy beat saber and all the packs all over again. Especially with the direction of adding more and more filthy worded songs and uninspiring block placement. 
   Cannot recommend any more.

 Another pack. They are addicted with adding filthy worded songs for some absurd reason. My son was excited to see another song pack. But when we went over the song lyrics mostly all we see are yet again filthy words. Even him as a kid knows better, shook his head and said he could not support playing beat saber any more. A song the (devils den) for some unknown reason they just do not seem to care anymore to put out anything good!!!!

Y’all I played this game on the top of the Eiffel Tower and umm.. let grandpa tell ya a little story. So i was playing up there on beat saber and umm I kind of walked too far and fell off the Eiffel Tower. And then I landed on top of a taxi but the driver didn’t hear it so I ended up riding on the roof of a taxi all the way to Africa. And in Africa I let a cow and a goat play beat saber. They liked it. In fact they liked it so good that they layed down and never got back up. A-anyways so I ended up finding an endless mud puddle over there in Africa while doing the waka waka dance and yeah. I swam down and down and down and I ended up.. IN CHINA. I’m like how in the world does that even happen. So yeah I learned how to use chopsticks over there. And all the sudden I had to take a crap…. Like real bad… and so I walked in dollar general over there and did my business and what happens next? I fell in the dang toilet. And it kinda flushed and I floated down the pipes all the way to i don’t know. And I climbed out and ended up climbing out of another toilet and here I am back home!

one_reviews_text: So, I have always wanted a VR headset, and then one faithful day. I got it. And the only game I really wanted was this game. So, I bought it. And like, BRUH, this is the best game VR has to offer. Whenever you slice a beat with your saber, you can just, feel the beat. I know it’s cheesy but you really can. And it is just SO satisfying to play. They chose the just right perfect music, and it just feels so good to play. And if you think the DLC is over priced and have never bought any, well, its definitely worth it to buy ALL the DLC. And there is very few bugs. Like sometimes my saber just goes flying all over the place. But for me that’s it. If your looking forward to buying this game IT IS DEFINITELY WORTH IT! They could sell it for 50 bucks and would still be worth it. No matter what you think, just buy the goddamn game please. PLEASE!!!

This game is overall really good. It's a game that requires skill and not at the same time. You get to do all sorts of levels/songs as well as add on songs if you got the money (example being BTS and Imagine dragons). This game allows you to feel the music and makes almost dance. HOWEVER, the game can be very exhausting. My arms felt really sore after completeing some of the difficult songs on expert. The game will also usually make you sweat, A LOT. And when you fail a level, if you're like me, you will be filled with rage and yeet your controller across the room. Overall great game 8/10 or 4/5 stars. Pro tip: Take a break from the game whenever your arms hurt, it will help you (and your arms).

Beat saber has been a blast. I’ve had it for over a month and I’ve still been playing it only with the built in OST s and other extra songs. Not only that, but beat saber has a online mode where you can play with other people and choose a song and a difficulty and see who gets the highest score at the end. Beat saber also has a mode where you have to complete songs with a specific requirement. You can still enjoy the game a lot if you can’t get custom songs or music packs. (Custom songs refer to unofficial songs made by the beat saber community using mods)

Use a light sabre to slash blocks in time to music. It's a lot of fun and can be quite a workout. otherwise, this game is just immaculate. easy to get into, then becomes HORRENDOUSLY addictive.
when you master actually hitting the blocks and stop freezing up like a dumba$s when a song becomes too complicated, after you master all of the dirty little tricks pulled by the song mappers, you work to master the games scoring system (and ruin your wrists in the process)

I've been playing this across PSVR and Quest over the course of almost 2 years now and i still play it on a very regular basis. as even after all this time it remains fun and with the custom song community literally testing the limits of human movement and reaction time, all there is to do is get better at it.

I have been playing BS for years now. I started on the PSVR and I recently switched to oculus and off course this was the first game I installed. The tracking on the oculus is so much better and it took me a little getting used to because the PSVR was a bit more forgiving on the timing of your hits. But after a few long sessions I'm back on my expert/expert+ level and even beating songs I couldn't before.
If you get into VR this is a must have. It can get a bit expensive if you want some extra DLC but they're so worth the money. The devs put in some free songs and extra features once and awhile, like when I started playing a few years back there was no online feature and it only had 2 song packs.

I'm really serious buy this game you will not regret it.

So I was playing my daily round of multiplayer beat saber and I was doing spins and stuff because I thought I was soooooo cool. Little did I know, I was being a little bit too enthusiastic.... 

I was in the middle of a song and in first place when I did a spin that was a little too quick for my headset. Time slowed down as I watched my headset fly off my face like an anchor ready to plunge into water. Adrenaline rushed through my veins as I bolted to action! I wasn’t gonna let this one mistake break my headset. My hands reached out but sadly my controllers were in the way so I couldn’t get a grip on my headset. Both me and my headset crashed to the ground and I looked at my headset in panic. There it was, the foam pad that once covered my face was no longer connected to the headset due to the impact. But other than that, the headset looked fine! I could still hear the music of the beat saber song playing out of my headset, so that was a good sign. I quickly put the foam pad back onto my headset and put my headset on my face. A sigh of relief. My quest 2 was not broken.￼ 

In the end I lost that beat saber game but I am very relieved that my quest 2 did not break. 

This game is so good that I almost broke my headset because of it. I am very addicted to this game and if you’re looking for a first game to get on your new (or old) VR headset this is definitely the game to get. It is a blast!

P.S. 

To Beat Saber devs, 

It would be pretty cool if you added the option of voice chat in beat saber multiplayer.
review_title: My quest 2 flew off my face....

Admittedly, I love this game. This is an amazing game. However, the developers have CHOSEN to not enable family/app sharing for this product. What that means, is your family accounts on the SAME Oculus headset have to purchase this game separately, multiple times, for the same headset. This means a 3 person family pays $30x3=$90, 4 person family pays $30x4=$120.  Every other game on Oculus has app sharing enabled, except for Beat Saber. This is a clear money grab for an already popular and profitable product. This will remain a 1 star review until the developers update this software with app sharing for the whole family.

one_reviews_text: This game is an epic way that you can work out and enjoy music

This is coming from the perspective of someone who’s had this game for 2 years btw, I’ve just never actually had the patience to write out a review.

If you’ve watched any sort of tier list or list of recommendations for VR games the past 2 years, you would have heard of Beat Saber, it’s possibly the most popular game in the VR genre to date and it deserves it, it is a very simple game with a very simple premise. Your main goal is to slash the coloured blocks flying at you to the beat of a song with lightsabers, as you play for longer and longer you will get better and better while progressing through the difficulties: Easy, Normal, Hard, Expert, Expert+. It sounds very simple, but is such a blast to play, especially with the recently implemented Online mode, I can destroy my friends playing $100 Bills on Expert+ and it’s so unbelievably addictive and fun!

If your looking for a VR rhythm game, then Beat Saber is the way to go, no doubt in my mind.
I would like to mention also the base game includes 36 free tracks for you to enjoy, but there is also paid DLC you can buy for affordable prices, some DLC packs include songs from: BTS, Green Day, Imagine Dragons and Panic at the Disco etc.

Modding: You may have seen YouTubers playing custom songs on Beat Saber before, sadly it is a very difficult and janky process to modding your game on Oculus Quest, if your looking for mods do not buy from the official Oculus Store and instead buy the Steam Version, it is a lot easier to mod with that version.
If you are looking to mod your game on Quest, I would highly advise you to proceed with caution, you will be installing a 3RD Party copy of Beat Saber onto your Quest, and 3RD Party Software, the chances of anything bad happening to your Quest is VERY unlikely, but please still Mod at your own risk.

Thank You for reading my review! I hope it helps! 😊

one_reviews_text:
This game is great fun to play with a lot of replayability.  I always find myself coming back to it even after I've got distracted with other games for a while.  I also feel that it has enough physicality to serve as a bit of exercise while I'm playing too.  The difficulty ranges really well from easy enough to be picked up and played by anyone, to insanely challenging even for a Jedi master.  
I'm really disappointed though that 6 months after multi-account was launched on Quest 2, that this still isn't supported.  I have three children (and a wife) who like to play on my headset and although there is a "party" mode which allows us to set local high-scores against each other, it would be much better if they could log into the headset on their own Facebook account and log scores on the global high-score charts as well as try out the "story mode" which I have to ban them from so it doesn't spoil my fun.  It seems that the only motivation for not supporting this feature is money, I can't see any other reason why they can't enable this.  I can't afford to buy the game four times over (I've purchased it twice now, as one of my sons has his own headset too), and I don't see why I should have to.  No other platform would expect you to purchase a game multiple times so it can be enjoyed by family members who share a device.  I'd give this game five stars without hesitation if it supported multi-account.

It can be no surprise to anyone who's read or watched anything about the Quest that Beat Saber is an awesome game. Virtually worth the price of the headset on its own, those moments when you achieve what psychologists call "flow" are sublimely satisfying. It's hugely replayable, addictive and exhausting in equal measure.
So why only 3 stars? Purely because, unlike every other game I've purchased, it can't be shared with another account on the same headset.
This means (a) that my daughter and I don't have separate high score records, can't pursue separate campaigns, etc (-1 star). It also means that my Move stats are tainted by her activity (-1 star).
Other than this, it's simply perfect. Everyone should buy it. But they shouldn't have to buy it again for their kids.

官方Ex+难度太难了，很多关卡不能通过，一度令我闹心吧啦，并对官方谱产生负面评价，但现在看法有所改变。
-
官方谱之所以难，主要是因为方块排布模式丰富多样（导致大脑和手不能及时反应过来）。现在看来，这不但不是缺点，反而是它的优点，是谱面质量的体现。
-
面对困难，重要的是找到克服困难的途径。
目前发现自己的短板一方面是的左手反应不够灵活迅速，所以着重通过单手模式训练左手熟练度；
另一方面是对不同谱面排布的打法不熟悉，通过打开No fail修改器或Practice模式不断针对单曲进行重复练习，进而掌握不同谱面的打法。
-
虽然自己很菜，但也要在菜的路上不断提升，相信努力一定会有成长。
-
总之，游戏功能非常完善，质量也很高，为开发者点赞！

I am a huge fan of rhythm games, so when I bought a VR, I had to pick this one up. 

After a few weeks of playing, I can say that this game is very fun. 

The graphics are great, the original music is great, and the game feels satisfying to play.

Although it's a very fun game, there are some issues that somewhat bother me.

Starting off, the lack of a way to manually modify the scroll speed of each song is a big issue in my eyes. Since the majority of the other rhythm games that I have played (DDR, Sound Voltex, beatmania IIDX) have all had ways to modify song scroll speeds, I expected this one to also have it. It was a big letdown when I found out it didn't. This is a big issue because many charts that I would normally be able to play have too fast of a scroll speed for me to be able to read it. I know that after a while of playing a rhythm game you are able to progressively read faster and faster scroll speeds, but the speed some of these songs are at such high speeds that it's very uncomfortable to try to play them. This isn't as much of an issue, but some charts that I want to play become boring due to having too slow of a scroll speed.

Another issue that I have with this game is chart quality. This one may be a bit more nit-picky than the previous issue, but, in my opinion, some charts in this game (mainly some of the earlier, harder charts) are extremely uncomfortable to try to play. I doubt that anything can be done with the charts since it's best to preserve the original charts, but it would be nice to see a remaster of them eventually, especially since the developers have obviously improved drastically at charting. (I LOVE the volume 4 charts)

The three final issues I have with the game are very nit-picky, but I'm going to put them here anyway. First, it would be nice to see a number difficulty rating system. I know that notes per second is what is typically used, but it isn't always accurate. Second, the lack of custom charts make the 30 dollar price tag of this game very questionable, in my opinion. Still an enjoyable game, but I don't think it should cost 30 bucks with paid DLC and no custom song support. Finally, physical rhythm games where you use parts of your body extensively (example: DanceDanceRevolution) shouldn't have 5 minute long songs. Songs over the 3 minute mark, if challenging enough, can be very painful for players to try to complete, and people don't want to be sitting around playing the same song for a long time. Rhythm games like DDR solve this issue by cutting down parts of songs and only leaving the highlights of them. It would be nice to see something like this happen with beat saber, also. This doesn't mean other games don't have long songs, but there shouldn't be this many. Another way to implement continuous, fresh gameplay is to add a course mode system where players can choose a few songs (or select from pre-made lists) and play them without any breaks in-between.

I hope this review helps. I apologize for any confusing parts of it, I just typed this entire thing on my phone.
review_title: Great concept, but could be better
