I have to admit: Beat Saber was not one of the games that made me initially jump into VR. I've seen videos of big youtubers (notably variety creators and not exclusively Beat Saber players) playing it when it first came out and thought it looked neat, but it never fully grabbed my attention. A friend suggested I should get the game anyway when I bought a Quest. It seemed like one of the essential games to get when getting into VR for the first time, so I went with it.

I don't remember how or when it happened, but I fell in love with Beat Saber. I brought my Quest to family gatherings so that everyone I knew can love Beat Saber just as much as I did. I wanted to get better at the game, and by my first month of playing I was already starting to get the hang of Expert+.

When the Multiplayer update rolled out alongside the Quest 2, that's when I knew that I was hooked. Not only did you get to compare scores with people all over the world, you can also play with them in real time. I have met so many amazing people through Beat Saber; from jumping into a public lobby and pantomiming at the other players, to somehow adding each other as friends and talking over Party Chat during gameplay. There's something magical about that. I'll never forget all the hilarious and heartwarming things I've seen other people do between matches.

If you're looking for an incredible rhythm game that has an incredible community, look no further.

We're playing Beat Saber.
review_title: This game will change your life

After having my Oculus Quest 2 for some months now this is the one game I keep coming back to. Beat Saber is easy to learn but hard to master. Each time you nail a song it feels like an actual accomplishment. Then you can push yourself even further by adjusting the difficulty, game mode, or perks for that song. Also, if you put some effort into your movements this game is actually a pretty decent workout as well — and if you do play enthusiastically, the game rewards you by giving higher scores too! Most songs are very well choreographed and if you're a little rhythmic you'll easily get the hang of them. The only downside to this game, in my opinion, is the rather small selection of songs you can initially choose from or buy. I'm willing to pay for more songs from some of my favorite artists, but unfortunately there are not many on offer (yet?). Maybe some Glass Animals, Justice, Muse, or Metronomy please? Their songs would be awesome to slice our sabers through! :)

Beat saber is all the hype you’ve heard. It can be fast pace fun that works up a sweat to pretty outstanding tracks. There is also the paid dlc music packs that can add some of your favorite songs repertoire.

With different environments and color customization ￼you can give it a fresh feel whenever things start to feel a bit repetitive. 

It offers multiplayer customization so your in game avatar has a unique look.

Different challenges also add replay value. 

But where this game shines most is as a party game. Nothing beats having friends come over a stream the headset to a television so your friends can cheer you on not just watch you flail about like some out of shape cyber samurai. 

The game has released several free tracks so it’s not all about having to pay for music. All in all the one thing that is stopping me from giving this game a 5 sat rating  is:

I recently bought a quest2, my wife created a profile on my original quest and I shared the library yet this game doesn’t appear available to her especially if I am on it. We actually tried to play together one night and wound up having to play something else because we couldn’t get it on both. This could be a technical issue and I truly hope it is. It would be frustrating to find out I have to pay out for another copy including extra music. As soon as this is addressed I’d have no problem bumping that 4 to a 5 but until then it feels like starting from scratch.

this is a really great game, it’s fun and a workout but it’s not like what you see on YouTube. The only way to play custom songs is if you wanna download a mod onto your console from a pc. The only problem with doing that is you would be breaking oculus’ rules and you could be punished and you would be resetting all your data in beat saber itself.  If you don’t mind not having songs you know and you just wanna play this is for you. But if you want custom songs I wouldn’t buy.

By far the best VR game out there. If you have a VR headset and don't have this game, you are doing something wrong. You have two sabers that have different colors. There are a lot of squares that come your way and you need to break them in the direction of the arrow on the cube. The cubes come at you at the beat of the music, and it makes you feel like a god when you beat a harder difficulty. If you look in the background of each level, you can see stunning visual effects. And as you dont need to move, you dont get motion sick! (you need to slightly tilt to dodge walls but it feels natural.) By far the best VR game out there.
This is a good game. However, the fact that I can't share the game with the rest of my family ON THE SAME DEVICE is simply outrageous. I'd return the game if I hadn't noticed the fact too late.

If you just got a VR then you HAVE to get this game. It is a little pricey but it is worth it. You don’t even need to buy the add-on music packs cuz there is like 50+ songs with different difficulties.

My biggest issue with this game.

I use Quest as a cardio machine which also provides some fun along the way. Beat Saber is an obvious go to game for cardio and fun. The biggest issue is the scoring system.

I know I would appear as a noob or complainer when I say the leaderboards are lacking in variety. Right now, the only way to get top ten is to play the game entirely in invisible blocks, along with fast speed, which isn't very fun to me. If I wanted to do any other mods or even just normal gameplay of the song, I have no chance of getting a top score. This is a flawed score keeping system which Pistol Whip has seen through and will change by giving every modifier combination it's own leaderboards. I don't know if this game can do something similar but it will certainly help the replay value of the game. It's just not fun to play every song with invisible blocks and sped up music.
review_title: One of the best but some issues.

one_reviews_text:
I've tried the similar VR rhythm games, of which there are plenty, but this is the one I keep coming back to, none have quite nailed the feel and energy as Beat Saber. It's a great game to give VR beginners to as it is comfortable and intuitive to play. It can be a great work out, even more so than some of the dedicated fitness apps. On Expert+ you will be constantly moving and you will be sweating!

However, as a flagship title, sadly it isn't a great ambassador for the platform. No cross-buy, so if you want to play on PC you'll have to pay separately for that version. Also, you can't share-play which is a poor showing from the Facebook owned devs, so households with multiple headsets can't share the game across accounts. Also, each update seems to bring more issues, in particular the tracking has gone downhill from the earlier days. The graphics have improved however.

The included songs aren't my kind of thing but they are still fun to play. It's a shame the default playlists don't have more variety genre-wise, without having to buy the pricey DLC of course. Speaking of the DLC, as a Green Day fan, the songs in that pack are quite disappointing. I can't imagine many fans clamoring to play tracks from 'Father of All MFs' over some tracks from 'Dookie'.

I love the game. I fully support it. But there is just one issue I have. Multilayer do not have an option to pick out only-bought soundtrack option. 

Music Packs options on Quick Play are lacking, you only choose from Build-In or All. It kills it for people who have bought the tracks. The tracks we pick usually don't get picked, because built-in tracks get the final pick. And if we do get picked, sometimes those people don't even have that song in the first place. So people end up leaving. 

I feel like everyone will be happier if we have the third option. Unless the people who don't have the tracks can still join in the multilayer, and not sit on the sidelines. At least that might stop them from constantly picking Crystallized track.

one_reviews_text:
This game managed to get me off the couch and make me move in the comfort of my home. I am not a gym person, nor am I into dancing games. 

I love that I can bring some martial art skills into this game, that turns it into a my personal dojo. 

I drop into horse stance, and chop with my arm. For an enhanced workout, I move with my entire body, and swing with full force. Sometimes I add weights to my wrist and ankles, too. 

After a few weeks, I found my core muscles. Then my posture improved and I started to develop some arm muscles. My reflexes are better than eve! My gut functions improved from the regular exercise (I'm coeliac with IBS). 

I'm a 52 yr old female, so I'm pretty happy with these results!

Multiplayer is a missed opportunity for varied skill lobbies. (Between friends and families). 

It’s only “enjoyable” to play in a lobby where the players are of equal skill. 

An expert player doesn’t enjoy playing on normal or easy, and a NEW player won’t keep up with higher game modes and as such will be left spectating for every single game.

PLEASE: 
1. Allow a “jump back in” button. 
(So what, you lost points anyway you can’t possibly win). 
Let that person continue to play along and improve/get better. Spectating is so boring.

2. Allow a social game mode/ handicap button so I can crank away on expert and my little cousin can join and play along with me on easy.  We could go all night, socializing, exercising and enjoying each and every song to our individual skill levels - both improving day by day but still having the pressure of failing a song at our respective skill levels…

NOT one person I have met (I had this on rift for years). Enjoys spectating… And NOT ONE person I know enjoys playing outside of their skill level for more then a few games. 

And, no… having a “no fail” game is not fun if you’re an “easy” skill person trying to flail your arms about in an Expert game. No fail is akin to playing a death match FPS where you can’t die, consequences are important but respawn exists in online games so you can lose points but have another crack AND KEEP PLAYING NOT SPECTATING!!!!!!!!! Ahh!

Again, unless the lobby is of the exact same skill level. Multiplayer is a short term game. 

Absolutely missed social aspect of an otherwise must have game. 

(I now own 3 copies that’s to quest and rift and steam store). So I’m being harsh but above is an undeniable reality of online play. 

In short; Please make a game mode that caters to varied skill level lobbies. And at a minimum a respawn button.

One of my sons and I are having a friendly competition on who can get to and pass each level on certain songs but it’s difficult since one of us may do better one day and then the other gets on and tries to beat that score without realizing it’s not their score! Give us separate profiles!!! I’m sure we’re not the only ones that would LOVE to have that feature. Thank you!

Beat Saber blew my mind at first, but I soon put it to the side because wanted to try out other rhythm games that seemed more complex. But now that I’ve come back to it again, it has blown my mind a second time. It really feels like you are engaging with the music percussively. By nature of using sabers, you’re slamming against the “notes” and it feels like actual drumming, vs something like Audica (another good game) where you shoot targets. The sensation is so incredibly satisfying. And 360 mode (when it’s available) is amazing. Takes a while to build up the motor skills to truly enjoy this game, but so worth it.

It's an amazing game, but the "App Sharing" feature is explicitly disabled in this game by the developers, forcing you to spend another 30 bucks for each one of your family members who wants to play in order to keep your game progress separated.

I completely regret buying this game in Oculus Quest instead of any other known PC store which allows this feature to be used without any problem, but I have been already playing about 3 hours when my wife realized that issue, so I cannot qualify for a refund.

Custom songs aren't supported even though other games on the Quest support them just fine.

The amount of free music you get is deceptive because the first two OSTs are not good. You'll find yourself skipping over them every time.

There's no cross-buy with the Rift version meaning you can't even play modded on a PC with Link, why not? This of course also applies to DLC.

If you want to mod the game on Quest, good luck. It's difficult and you'll likely have to give up updates and multiplayer on order to have it.

Audica (a similar game at the same price) has all these things and is also has more polish specifically for the Quest (like advanced haptics). Not to mention a much better selection of free music. For the money you'd probably have a better time with that game.

I’ll start off my review by saying that Beat Saber in itself is a great game. Super fun, good for exercise, great for showing friends. There are very few bugs, and both multiplayer and solo options are provided for a full experience. If you’re on the edge, I would go ahead and buy it! I don’t believe you’ll regret it and there’s always the refund option. Beat Saber is probably the most recognized VR game, and for good reason! I’m gonna say some negative stuff down below, but overall my opinion of Beat Saber is quite high.

That being said, a lot of the mapping is hot garbage. There are some fun packs- Camellia is challenging and interesting, Vol. 3 is bouncy and fun, and the Extras are pretty well done too. But there are other packs, especially the ones that you have to buy, that are just not worth it at all. The newly released mixtape pack has some good songs, but it’s all ruined by fairly lazy mapping with no interesting patterns whatsoever. The same goes for a few of the other packs, and as a result, very few of them are worth the purchase. 

This leads us to modding, which I would encourage everyone to try. It’s a free option that allows you to access a huge library of songs mapped by members of the community- much higher quality than the in-game packs, and free of charge to boot. So all in all, I encourage you to buy beat saber- its an amazingly simple concept that takes VR to its fullest potential. However, don’t be drawn into to the money sinkhole that is the extra packs- instead, try downloading some of the community created maps, and you’ll have a lot more fun. Hope to see you out there slicing it up!

So As A VR Enthusiast (I think that is how it is spelt) I feel like I have to do a review on all the games I buy. AND MAN this game is insane. So I started playing AFTER the 1.15 update. A month before 1.16 so I played during the 3rd year of the game being FULLY released. Ok now on to the actually review. So Let’s Get Some Ground Work If You Like Country Music Or Old Style Music This Game Isn’t For You. But If You Like Rap, Pop, k-pop,  and Electronic. Then this game IS for you. And if you like imagine dragons. So before the 1.15 update the game was already insane and I played it for hours on end trying to get better and better at the game. But the 1.16 update has its pros and cons let’s start with the pros: 2 NEW MAPS, a entirely new music pack, and we finally got a piece of PC VR graphics. Ok now the cons: The new graphics update drags on the performance and the battery life. And that’s it over all if you haven’t already bought the game then you should buy it, it is such a unique game and you should give it a try.

- WolfieTwinsyVR
review_title: Beat Saber Devs You Have Done It

one_reviews_text:
I am getting on in years and I never had any experience of gaming or virtual reality until l retired. When l first experienced this game l was awestruck. The sights and sounds, the animations of the blocks and sabres fascinated me so much that an hour had passed before l noticed the time fly. 

I have limited physical ability but the settings allowed me to compensate for that once l new how to use them and since they have added the social dynamic, l have had some quality time with my family thanks to this game which has been really important during our restricted times. 

I would recommend this game to everyone, young or old because it really is one if the best experiences out there. God bless the developers and everyone involved in making things like this possible 🙏 

If l had one wish, it would be that more music packs covering the different decades where available because it would only complement an already delightful experience and it would certainly be something that l would be prepared to pay for.

Wonderful, wonderful game!

Thank you ♥️

Beat Saber is somewhat fun, but relative to other games out there like Synth Riders and Pistol Whip (which are much better) I find myself somewhat disappointed. Firstly it never goes on sale and doesn't include that many songs, so it generally is overpriced. Second, the music is not that great and DLC packs contain music that is not interesting to me. Levels mostly feel the same. I mostly use these games for exercise, and I find I get much less of a workout with Beat Saber than I do with Synth Riders, which gives utilizes a much fuller range of motion. Harder difficulties are mostly hard because they require memorizing sequences, not because they work your body more. Finally it is difficult to use custom songs or other mods on the Quest version, whereas other games support custom songs out of the box. I'm not returning it because it's still some variety to mix into my workouts, but it could be so much better.

I love rhythm games and miss the likes of guitar hero etc, where the controllers enabled a more immersive feel to “playing” the songs. Fast forward one hundred years and I here I am slashing away at and dodging blocks in a way that feels so natural, it’s easy to forget where I really am. The gameplay feels flawless and seems well supported by the devs, with both updates and extra content which is sometimes free. I also love the leaderboards, which keep you coming back for more.

The only (minor)disappointment I have is that the environment, though impressive on first play, doesn’t really change throughout the game. Also, there aren’t many tunes that really capture my interest, though clearly a lot of people love the soundtrack. This certainly doesn’t detract me from playing though and this game really is a joy and the arcade nature of being able to play in short bursts is well suited to VR. 

I’d say this is a great starting place for anyone who just got into VR, or is looking for a rhythm game. It’s value for money and I imagine I’ll be playing this as long as I own the quest 2.

Amazing rhythm game, a must have if you ever loved Dance Dance Revolution. 

The biggest gripe that I and my fellow new-to-VR friends have is that the difficulty spike is rough at first. Easy to Normal is a relative jump but Normal to Hard is a very accurate way of putting it and then Expert is really quite difficult. 

Not in a way that is utterly impossible but it takes a long time to adjust to the intensity. They do offer modifications to help you though (IE: No Fail Mode, Slower Song Mode, etc). 

Very worth playing, if the thousands of 5 star votes aren't enough to sell you on it.

one_reviews_text: This game is really good to play if you are new to VR. It’s challenging in its own way and a great exercise for your arms. If you didn’t get this yet and your planning to, go ahead and buy this game, it’s worth it!
Beatsaber has brought me fun as a beginner and still now as an  experienced VR user. A great game for fun and to burn calories. A must have.
Absolutely love this game. Great workout for me physically and mentally. Great stress reliever. My only problem is I got charged twice for the interscope mix twice. Not sure how to get that straight.
Highly addictive the only downside is its hard to turn off

To be fair it does have a fair amount of songs. As a easy to pickup and play game, this appeals to a general audience of all ages... but the music doesn't. I remember playing guitar hero back in the day... that game had a really good variety of popular well known music. Given there are music packs you can buy to add a little variety. But there should be more songs in the base game that mix things up. Great game! But you get a star removed due to song selection!
review_title: Great game, need a better song selection

one_reviews_text: Beat Saber is by far the best game I’ve played on Quest 2. I absolutely love it. It’s a great play for a quick 5 min session or a longer time working through the campaign. Only downside once you finish the campaign there isn’t much to do except replay songs. I’m not sure why they don’t have an infinite campaign mode where the same songs have new random challenges or increase in difficulty. Other than that Beat Saber is the best game ever!!
review_title: Without doubt BS is the best VR game!

one_reviews_text: So from what i Know is that beat saber is one of the most iconic games for vr. And this game is amazing. But something i was looking forward to was custom songs. but without modding your VR headset you cant have custom songs. And i think that the devs should make an update where custom songs can be added. But overall great game.

As an oculus user theres no custom maps what about change that:

*a mini map of the level
*overhead song chooser where you can select songs from what you own and change the time when your editing
*moveable notes of red (1) blue (2) and bombs on. With no grid 
*make walls anywhere with the minimap 
*downloading page

Any way theres more you can add like tempo etc however thats my idea hope this helps

This would also help the copyright issues with the beat mapping community as it is against TOS

Amazing game love it and have the oculus quest (1) for it but since last update the app doesn’t open and asks me to download latest oculus version which I have so … hoping that devs repair the problem quickly and avoid any mistakes like this which is very frustrating.
Great game! I absolutely love playing it but the last 2 or 3 updates have broken my game and left me with no option but to reinstall and lose all my local high scores which is really frustrating.

I absolutely love this game! Especially being a musician whose brain constantly has music or beats running through it. My only complaint is the music selection is pretty lame. There's no decent classic (or current for that matter) rock or metal! I mean Linkin Park? Are you joking? Why don't you add something a little bit heavier? Mabye some black Sabbath or the Beatles? Judas Priest? Other than my issues with the extremely lame music selection this game is a lot of fun. 🤘🤘🤘

So wondering if I’m alone with this I’m not sure if it’s my oculus or the update that caused this issue . Other then that absolutely one of the funniest games Iv played really enjoy it . This was the first game I bought and is still my favorite. It will be worth your money.

one_reviews_text: I love the game I just think that use should add a setting on it where you can change your sabres to a cooler look but you don’t need to get a mod for it but if not I still love the game ❤️❤️
No longer even loads just boot back to the menu when loaded no graphics noyhing

Tue game itself is ok but it gets boring after a while also, the service is extremely bad. I requested a refund about a week ago, and it said “this can take up to 72 hours” but it “refunded” me after 5 days. Also, the game says “refund not approved” when I clearly added my card to the game.

Beat Saber is without question one of the best VR game of all time and is a blast and a half from start to finish, the premise is simple slice block to the beat of a song and get the highest score possible, this incredibly simple premise not only is enjoyable but it’s also a great starting point for people who are new to VR, Long story short Beat Saber is beyond good and you should totally buy it

Be warned! This purchase cannot be shared with other accounts on your headset. This has been disabled on purpose by creators/Facebook.  Great game if you are solo though. Remove the cash grab for 5 stars.

I love beat saber. I've been playing for years. But there's this bug that happens when there are too many notes on screen and I've only ever noticed it on the quest. 

When there are too many notes, sometimes it just stops registering your hits and the notes because immune to your swings. It can destroy your run on a level and 70% of the time I lose it's because of it. I would say it's a small bug that'll get fixed, but it's been here ever since my rift broke and I switched to the quest.

This game would have been rated an astonishing 5 star review only if they added custom songs for everyone to be able to use. The funnest game on VR so addicting takes practice but once you got the hang of it you feel like a rockstar  smashing those beats

I wanna love it more but at the same time the tracking is bad on my quest 2. I hit the blocks right every time and it doesn’t even say I hit them, instead it says “miss” but I know for a fact I hit them.

This is one of my favourite games to play on oculus quest 2. I’ve had this game for a couple of months now and I still play this game all the time. If you are wanting to buy this game go ahead it’s worth the money. This is my opinion.

litteraly worth every penny

Even if I look past the very monochrome soundscape, I find a few things, that unfortunately make me regret the purchase, a little bit.
Having to pay for additional (also not my cup of tea) songs, with this set, feels like a rip off.

Also there is no way for me to get low enough in some levels and look ahead.
I even tried setting player height to 2.5m, but this seems to have 0 effect.
I cannot believe that not more people run into this,
but it really puts a limit on my enthusiasm.
I mean, a deep squat should be enough, in my opinion.
Really wish I ran into this issue before my 2hour playtime.

Other then that, it is still pretty nice game.

For 4 stars, it would need to fix the height issue.

For 5 stars, the 4star point and FREE music pack to please people with a music taste a bit wider the 1°.

Well it all started when I was convinced to buy this game Ive grown to love

I’d never heard of the game and was hesitant but gave in to it and bought it...I beat my first level and immediately this game found my competitive and addicted side

So I began playing more and more until I found myself at the peak of my achievement where all songs were beaten...UNTIL OST 4 my boundaries were found when I played them, they are difficulty incarnate but in the end I beat them.

But what I’m trying to say is the game is brilliant and the songs are amazing, if your reading this you should buy the game at the expense of getting sore arms after like 10 songs 

P.S devs, I wanna say a huge thanks for making the game but...could we Maybe get voice chat in multiplayer? Or a purchase-able custom song finder for quest 2 players without a PC? 

Thanks! -v1rtual

This game has me hooked so bad that I can't wait to come home and play it. After a long day, it is a great game to come home to and play casually and just have fun. As I said in the title, this is probably the best game out there. Little pricy, but worth it none the less. If your considering buying it, do it. the free songs you get with the game are good, they are upbeat and different to what you’d expect. if you are planning to play this game loads, i’d advise you to buy the music packs otherwise you’re going to get bored of the same songs all the time. 

other than that i think that beat saber is a really good game and it’s also worth buying : )
I think it’s a fun game definitely exciting and keeps the family entertained I hope they can start adding more regular songs or find a way to add your own playlist

The actual game is really well done and super fun. My main issue is the lack of music to play. Everyone has their own taste of music I get it, but I was really disappointed in the selection here. There were only 6 songs I enjoyed enough to play more than a test run. There’s not much variety it’s either old bands or super crazy electronic music. You’ll get bored pretty quick unless you wanna try to get perfect scores or all difficulties. 
Until they have custom songs I’d give this one a pass. It’s a really good game it just needs more songs.
I love this game. But in multiplayer I want to change my skin do you know how to do that?
This game is THE VR GAME! If you are thinking about buying this game just buy it, it worth every penny!
I love this game, its practically the only one I play. However, I do wish they had more songs. I think A Day to Remember, Bring Me the Horizon, and JuiceWRLD would be litttt on this game

The game is awesome and I really enjoy it. The only thing I don’t like about it is that you spend $30 then you have to spend more on songs like Imagine Dragons (hints the 4 stars). Overall I think it’s a great game and you should get it!

There's terribly few songs and they are all the same sort of EDM. I find myself booting up the game and getting tired of it after three tracks. The lack of songs also makes for a really steep jump in difficulty between normal and hard. Other rhythm games rate songs from 1 to 12, but beatsaber only has about five difficulties. I can't find a good sweet spot between being bored out of my mind and failing tracks. There's a way to get custom tracks but it's a pain and it's very hard to find actually good custom tracks anyways.

one_reviews_text:
I'll start with this hot(?) take: what made this game what it is was its community and custom songs. The game is fun, but the base game is limited and the paid DLCs are inconsistent, some are good and others are really bad. 
Beat Games knows this because a long time ago they promised to implement a way to load custom songs on the quest.
But this was before the dark times. Before the aquisition.
So, every time you see a 5 star review with the words "custom songs", remember that they only exist through a mod, that breaks every update (so you must NOT update when it becomes available until the mod is fixed) and that anytime beat games (or it's owner) can close the door.
And think that someone on PC can play custom songs without moding...
Why？？？
review_title: The game won't open after the update

one_reviews_text: Great game that is unfortunately made by a greedy company trying to squeeze money from its customers by not allowing family app sharing.  They would have a bigger base and larger audience if they opened up this basic feature. Unforgivable policy decision demands a 1star rating.

Please add more sabers the old original sabers are getting boring and not a lot of people have PCs to get mods so I beg you to add more sabers and also add more free songs I get really bored of playing the same songs over and over other then that great game

Really fun, love that you can choose different complexity levels for every song. The colors and graphics are great, really feels like you're a freaking bada$$ on a platform killing colorful squares. The pictures in the app store don't do the game justice. 

Biggest issue I have is that I am basically limited to the three music packs I bought. I don't really enjoy much of the preloaded music. Of the music packs that became available with a recent update, I really only like three of them so I end up doing the same Panic, Imagine Dragons, and Green Day songs over and over. I like some electronic music similar to a few of the preloaded songs, but more dubstep than what is available. Would love some Skrillex or Bassnectar, more rock, or some 80's/90's. The other thing I don't like is how little your lower body moves.

Edit: I found some features I have apparently overlooked for the past month and a half. There is a very challenging 360 degree version, and a 90 degree version. Freaking blew my mind and scared me to death when I started the 360. lol It's pretty freaking kewl. However, I'm leaving it at 4 stars instead of 5 until they figure out how to do additional new songs or music packs more frequently. Totally willing to pay for them.
review_title: Great game, needs more mainstream music

one_reviews_text: I dont leave reviews but I have about 20 games and can share almost every game with my partner who has her own headset.  Beat sabre and the climb are the only 2 games I have that have disabled this function. I wont be buying it twice so sorry, as good as the game is. 1 star. Shame

So I’d heard about this game long before my oculus came in the mail, and after I’d saved up the somewhat pricey 30 dollars to get this game, I bought it. I’m not very good yet, but I can see lots of precious... irreplaceable time... gone to this game. This game is everything you would want in a vr experience. The graphics are next level, and the gameplay is phenomenal. Not only that, but the soundtrack is insane as well. I listened to it before I got the game, and thought it was decent. But when you experience the music the way beat saber let’s you experience it, it’s 100 times better. If you couldn’t tell by now, I highly recommend this game, and wouldn’t return it for double the money I payed. Unless I could buy it again... because then it’s a free 30 bucks... but you understand my point. Anyway, 10/10.

Coming back 2 months or so later. Im on expert plus levels and I’m still obsessed

Just a suggestion for beat saber devs it’d be pretty cool to put some NCS music in the game since most of the music is electronic I thought some of that would be super cool to play

When I got the Oculus, I didn't expect the added benefit of getting a workout. This game makes me work up a sweat! My legs were sore from the squats and I could feel the workout in my shoulders and arms the first few times I played. Ramping up the difficulty really gets you moving! Beyond any of that, it's just fun to play. Wielding light sabers is always a good time.

I cannot stop playing. This is way too much fun! In the first minutes it seemed like "hmm, this doesn't seem like a game for me" but like after an hour of playing I couldn't stop. It's also a perfect workout because I'm mostly inside because of COVID-19 nowadays and I love gaming.

Don't buy immediately if you are reading this and now wanny buy it. Try out the demo first and see if it is for you aswell.

Love the game but the lack of songs make for less play time. The fact I have to purchase additional songs doesn't sit well since I've already payed for the game. I understand that the music artists need to make money as well but let's be honest, who wants to jam Green Day on Beat Saber or Imagine Dragons? Pshhhhh.
I love this game so far. Currently my favorite song on here is Fitbeat because it it so challenging.
Beatsaber had brought me and my kids endless hours of fun. One thing I would like to have is to download custom songs to the game from a music app

Just add custom songs support already!! People are asking for it for YEARS. And I know there are ways to download a modded version but some people prefer to use the normal, legal app.

If you would add custom song support, you could moderate the songs people would be able to upload maps to. 
Incase there's a problem with licenses, you could prevent people from uploading maps to certain songs.

Please. Add custom songs support. You know that would REALLY increase sales for a while.
When the update for custom songs comes out, that would drive a LOT of attention to the game for a sudden. And more people would buy it.

Also you could make extra money by making it a DLC= "Custom songs support" DLC or something of the sort.

review_title: Easy to start, hard to master

one_reviews_text:
I can see why this app is so popular! It is super addictive. It was the only oculus app I'd purchased for atleast the first 3 months of having an quest 2. I can't even really explain why it's so addictive, it just is so much fun. I'd highly recommend playing with headphones for an more immersive experience.  I also love that you can customize the colors and play online with others. Campaign mode is also a good mode to have to get you more familiar with the different types of game play setups.

The only things I wish are that there were more DIVERSE songs in the library and songs with lyrics. But I understand that the lyrics can get complicated with licensing but hopefully they get it soon. But they can certainly include more diverse beats. Also I wish there was a way to create custom songs & maps in app and try others without having to basically bootleg a version of the app that can do it. But I highly recommend this app

one_reviews_text: This game is like a must have for every single vr user. Great workout, lots of fun, jam out to amazing music, and can be competitive. Beating high scores and moving up difficulties is so satisfying and makes you feel like a beast. Multiplayer is also pretty fun.

I loved this game and was looking forward to being able to share it with my wife using Facebook's new App Share facility.
However, this app cannot be shared.
I understand there might be technical or copyright restrictions in sharing the DLC, but I am surprised that the base game itself hasn't been Shared.
If they had shared it, Facebook would have had increased revenue from the sale of DLC on the secondary account.
This is a very disappointing development, particularly from a Facebook owned product.
And don't get me started about The Climb 2 which was released after the opt-out deadline and still doesn't allow app share.
Facebook is not doing itself any favours.
I absolutely love this game, the maps, the way it looks, but I would be nice if they made the add on maps free.

I've had my quest 1 for over a year now. This was one of my go-to games if I wanted to have a good workout and a good time. This was by far the most fun and competitive game I've been on. It's so easy and you kinda suprise yourself on how many cubes you cut per second. I've gone from 2 or 3 to 14. Fourteen! This is a must-buy for quest. And even to spicy things up a little. There is a modding community under BSMG and BMBF for beat saber! You can get custom songs, notes, bloqs, walls, sabers and so many more!

Using the Oculus quest 2 I had absolutely no issues playing an older version of this game. After about half an hour of playing I uninstalled the version I had on the Oculus quest 2 which was a older version of the same game.  I installed the updated OST4 version in 10 minutes and now the sabers are longer than they appear and there is lag on the Oculus quest 2, enough lag to rival a wireless stream virtual desktop from my PC desktop to the quest 2 .Which is the whole reason why I bought beat saber on the actual Oculus quest 2 is to defeat the lag. I said it on steam and I'll say it here please stop making bugs and start properly testing your game before it gets pushed out! At this point this is the fifth time on multiple platforms I had to adjust myself to your new version of the game please stop it! It seems like every other time I play this game it's changed so I have to retrain myself or the vanilla game is flat out broken. STOP!

I consistently experiencing tracking issues when I playing on expert or expert+ levels (Quest 2). I have a good light sources in the room, new batteries in controllers and latest software updates. But periodically I am SURE that I did correct hit - but it register a miss. I am frustrated and tired because of this.

So, because of this - just 3 stars.
This game is great!
Really, it's that simple. This is THE game that all VR owners should have. It is a good introduction into VR, a nice workout, and fun.

I love BeatSaber and use it for working out. The music is just ok and somewhat limited but the experience is still great. Unfortunately, they do not support cross-buy between the Rift and Quest stores and they also opted out of the new app sharing feature on the Quest 2. So, you have to rebuy the game for $30, and any add ons, for everyone in your household to use them under their own accounts, with their own stats etc... even on the same device. Since I owned BeatSaber on the Rift, before getting a Quest 2, I begrudgingly bought it again on Quest recently, with the expectation that when app sharing came, my wife could use it too. BeatSaber was even the app many news outlets have as an example when they reported on app sharing coming to Quest. But, they actively opted out of. My wife still can’t play it on my Quest except under my profile/Facebook account. I was not about to pay for everything a 3rd time. This is absurd. I will not be buying any other music packs, etc... until this anti-consumer behavior is addressed.
Why I need to buy all the games again for my oculus rift S , I bought them once on Oculus Quest 2 with same account...

Beat Saber is one of my Favorite games of all time. But it's missing alot of Components that I think alot of new players come for. And NO I do not mean custom songs! I'm talking abt the ability to customize how your Saber looks not just by Color but by changing the handle or changing how the trail follows. Or by adding the ability to do tricks without the risk of breaking something. What I mean by this is using a button to like spin your saber or being able to throw your saber like in vader immortal. I have been in VR for about 6 months now, and I have downloaded and played so many games, but to this day beat saber is still by far my favorite. This game is a must-have for anyone that has VR and either has memories in guitar hero or rock band. Even if you don’t have memories for those games, you’ll still have a great time slicing blocks in rapid secession. The game is still updating every few months, so new content is almost always on its way. There are only like two things I’d change. I know this is more of a quest problem, but while playing faster song especially, my sabers cut through blocks but they don’t cut and pass by my head. My play space have pretty good lighting, and this still happens regularly. The second thing is really a suggestion. Please add custom songs to the game! It would make it so much more enjoyable if you were able to flail your arms to through the fire and the flames and anything else. If Onward is able to do it with maps, you can do it for charts. Ok that’s it worth your time and money.

I first tried this game at Main Event, and I fell in love instantly. I almost impulse bought the Oculus that same day but decided to do my research before making a purchase like that. But when I tell you buying it for the SOUL PURPOSE to play this game, I’m telling you it’s worth it. I’ve played almost every day since I’ve got it. Any moment I have spare time, I’m playing beat saber. The only thing I would like to see changed, is to add more songs. I play so much, I’ve almost wore myself out with the music selection. I’m actually going to look into how to get different music on here, mainly because I saw a video of someone playing an Eminem song at one point, so who knows. Maybe I can download other music and just haven’t figured it out yet. But all in all, 10 out of 10 would recommend!!!!

It's really $30 plus whatever songs you want to play.

When I first got my quest I had no intentions of buying beat saber. I never understood the hype. I thought for $30 there were far better games out there, and that the price was not worth simply slashing some blocks to music that I would easily get bored of.

One night I thought I would just give it a try and most probably return it, however the game proved me wrong. I definitely underestimated how much fun the game is, especially when you play to your favorite custom songs.

Beat saber rapidly became my favorite and most played game by far, and it is definitely a game that I would recommend everyone try.  It also offers a great workout and is great for vr newcomers as it is unlikely to cause any motion sickness .

Definitely worth a 5 star rating

Beat saber is a very good workout game. If you play a lot of beat saber you will 100% lose weight. This game can save people’s lives by just playing it because you can lose weight. This game is also really fun to play and there is tons of levels too start off with and then when you start too play the game a lot and your bored just buy some of the dlc packs. I also didn’t say that there is a campaign mode. This is how you can get better at the game after the tutorial. That’s it there is my review I give this game a 5/5 stars because it is a fun game that can have you lose weight. I think everyone that has an oculus device should at least try beat saber one day while playing VR. And one last thing I recommend modding it when the new version of bmbf comes out so you can play custom song and mods.
review_title: Beat saber is a good game.

How about earning money by offering better music packs instead of annoying your customers?

I'm 50+ and love Beat Saber. It's a good diversion from stress, has decent music (absolutely love some of the add-ons but I don't really care for a few of the most popular included-probably age gap there), and it is excellent movement for the upper body. I've done almost all the expert levels and have been working on a few expert+ at no rush over several months. Though I may get that level eventually, do I really want to move that fast anyway? I'm not that competitive. I've noticed my reaction time has decreased and arm strength has increased. I play an average of 7-8 songs a session. You forget you're exercising- that's my kind of exercise.  
If in doubt, get it anyway. Don't expect to be an expert in a week. Just go though the levels at no rush so you don't pull anything and enjoy the journey.

I have only gotten this Oculus Quest 2 from about 3 months ago and this was my first game on it. I honestly think this is worth every single penny of it and after a few days of playing it, I was already addicted. My whole family enjoy it too! Also, the tracking is brilliant and doesn’t lag a lot. Sometimes, it lags a bit in multiplayer and doesn’t register that I hit the block/blocks and gets a little annoying, but it doesn’t really annoy me anymore as I play more solo that multiplayer. But, all the updates are worth waiting the time. Every single penny is worth it. And it’s overall the best rhythm VR game existing to me! I hope you found this helpful!

If you have the option to play this game on a different platform, do it.   Controller lag and random disappearance of sabers is super common at higher game speeds / difficulties.   If you don't ever plan on playing beyond normal difficulty then it's not as big of an issue.  

The game itself is a blast, it's like being a jedi on molly.   

learning curve similar to guitar hero.  You will 100% need to practice and develop muscle memory to move beyond each difficulty level.

So, I bought this game to see what all the hype is about.  “Why do people enjoy this game so much,” is the question I always asked.  But then, when I bought and played the game, I saw why.  The games graphics are incredible, some of the best VR graphics I’ve ever seen in my life, and on the Quest 2, forget about it, the graphics get even better on the new Oculus Quest, which I didn’t even know was possible.  And I also understand why some people bought this game for exercise.  At the highest difficulty, Expert+, it can get really fast paced.  And try combining their built in Camellia soundtrack (my favorite soundtrack) on Expert+, it can get incredibly fast, to the point where my muscle memory got 5x better just by playing ONE EXPERT+ song.  Some people say that they needed to enable developer mode and install a BMBF just to get the full experience of Beat Saber, and I cannot tell you how wrong they are.  A BMBF is not necessary to enjoy Beat Saber, the game is already amazing without it.  Overall, Beat Saber is a MUST BUY for anyone with a Quest, a Quest 2, or an Oculus Rift.

Let’s be real: there are plenty of good beat saber reviews. But the rate of music releases is best described as a trickle. In the past several months, all we’ve got is linkin park (awesome) and BTS (which is a Korean boy band that you kinda have to be into). I’m sure lots of ppl like BTS but plenty have no idea who they are. Does Monstercat even count as legit premium releases? All this time and Greenday, Imagine Dragons and Linkin Park are really the only 3 that most ppl can get behind and that’s not a lot of music. Please expand your DLC music library selection faster. 

Also, please add multiuser options and announce when you do - thanks.
review_title: Needs more music and multiuser update

one_reviews_text:
On the Oculus official blog:
"VR is a social experience, and that doesn’t just mean online multiplayer. We know Quest has become a shared device for many of you. We want to make it easier to share your Quest with the people you care about, whether with a partner, a roommate, family, or friends".
Beat Saber is owned by Facebook/Oculus. So why has it been decided that Beat Saber cannot be shared socially on the one headset? It's not a shared app on my headset at the time of writing.
That flies in the face of what has been said and acknowledged.
I can't find any reference as to why this is the case (copyright restrictions etc.) so I can only assume that it's greed.
And that angers me.

This was the main reason i got the quest and the quest 2. The game is amazing and gives a great workout. If you guys added every or the most popular songs from monstercat I'd buy everyone. Keep up the great work i love the multiplayer and hopefully custom sabers could come into effect soon.

It REALLY sucks that my granddaughter can beat, me, but because she has to play under her Mothers account and her mother kicks butt, her scores are no where to be seen. I'm sure if she could play under her OWN account that she would be proud to see her hi score, remembering she kick this ole mans butt...

I can understand one copy Per HEADSET, but not Per USER!!!

Hopefully they will fix the issue soon. It's already a HUGE money maker, no need to gouge us. She had 5 in the family. WE can't afford FIVE COPIES, and shouldn't have to. I'm the one that buys the two headsets, two programs, etc... Isn't that enough?

It would be nice if they let us know it WILL happen, so we don't remain ticked off and fuming every time we play and think of it.

They need to also allow the playing on our own music. We shouldn't have to be forced to pay for limited music packs or PAY TWICE FOR SONGS WE ALREADY OWN through iTunes, Amazon, or others. 

Maybe they need to become a music reseller or resell for others and get the profit that way. Prolly be even more profitable in the long run. 

Hey, if Real VR Fishing can allow playing our own music, Beat Saber should be able to allow it as well. We can see it's possible, as it's seen on many YouTube videos. So, there's already the ability to do it.

Hopefully they will let fairness replace the greed.

review_title: So good on PC and so bad on Qest 2

one_reviews_text:
I bought Beat Saber at end of January. I played it few times until 3rd march. Nothing special. It's just a rhythm game with good music.

To be honest, it wasn't that addictive for me but then I Turned On Oculus Move.

I used to play the game on Normal difficulty. I played for an hour and burned 450 calories. I was kind of impressed. I didn't have the silicon cover so my Face Cover was just wet for the next 10 hrs. I ordered the Silicon cover.

On 3rd March, I started playing the game on Normal and was able to complete one of the levels on Expert while playing the campaign. Same day. Burned 1000s of calories.

Since then I have burnt around 21,000 calories playing beat Saber. On average I play for around 1 hr and 30 mins everyday.

If there was no Oculus Move, I might not have gotten into Beat Saber like others. Now, it's a game about getting Full Combos on Expert for me. Learn the tricks to start with Expert+ (it's almost impossible).

Maybe the most addictive game on Quest. I'm someone who loves Half-Life Alyx, The Witcher 3, God of War, The Last of Us, Ghost of Tshushima, Spiderman, Horizon: Zero Dawn, A Plague Tale: Innocence etc. I wasn't expecting to get into Beat Saber but now I understand the hype.

I have all the song packs. It's not enough. Modding on Quest 2 feels risky even though it might not be. The recently released OST 4 has some of the best music but 4 songs only. How long can you listen to them? I love them but it's just 4. 

I'm really not sure how difficult is it to create maps for the songs but I do think that the developers should push out more songs like the modding community does.
review_title: Beat Saber and Oculus Move, Best Duo

one_reviews_text: best game evr ngl i rlly recommend it to u

Beat saber is a game where you slash the represented beats(which are cubes) and listen to songs at the same time. In beat saber people can have a great time burning off calories but once you’ve completed the songs that don’t have a pack it gets kinda 
boring. That’s why you have to buy the pack. Have a great time playing this amazing game!
Can’t use game since update

I'm on quest
On quest, Beat saber often loses track of the controllers (no problem with other games), it's a common issue, devs know it, but obviously don't care
Also, today, I tried playing the game and saw that there was an update
Of course, as always (and once again, only on THIS game), the update wouldn't install, so I had to uninstall and re install the game. No big deal, you gonna say..... nop, except for the fact that when you uninstall the game, it also deletes your campaign progress! I have to do it all over again! Who the hell codes an uninstall feature that deletes saves!
review_title: Not THAT bad, but so many problems....

one_reviews_text:
I got the oculus quest 2 in December early for Christmas. This is my first headset ever and been loving and playing it nonstop every day for around 2 months. 

The first game I got for it was beat Saber, by far the game with the most play time! I know I can’t compare but the graphics + frame rate￼￼ are great and run smoothly. 

The only time I have experienced drops was when i brought the quest 2 round my dads ( his internet is not great) ￼and tried casting, apparently the cast on my phone was smooth but my game was jumpy and the frame rate derailed off a cliff, it made me feel sick and gave me a headache. 


The neon visuals fit the sound track well for the vanilla and the optional paid for music packs and the game play is very satisfying to get right. Some of the songs can get very challenging but the more you play the better you get.

The multiplayer is fun to jump in to a quick play and cool to play with friends but I do have some gripes with it. Like sometimes I join a lobby with nobody in it, and the other players sometimes glitch out? I don’t know what it is, sometimes a player just starts going crazy  flailing their arms about at unbelievable speeds, then we start playing the song and the player is still going bonkers but still playing the song at the same time￼? It’s very confusing.

In my opinion Beat Saber is a great starting game and accessible to all ages with fun and literal endless gameplay. 

(Edit,I don’t think I sold my ideas that well so I rewrite this paragraph.)
￼￼￼￼
These are things that I think could work well in another future update, a tournament mode in online and add a way to level up also to look at your stats. (Online) Big ask but a built in chart maker where you can put your own creative twist on existing songs in game and upload your ￼￼￼levels to the online.
Very pog game. This is a good replacement to punching the wall, i can hit cubes instead :D
I have no words

It takes about 1 minute to figure out how to play. The challenge is endless. I had shoulder surgery about 5 weeks ago. This game is great therapy for the shoulder.  After playing songs at the normal level, i started the Campaign game. Now i am seriously addicted.  I wouldn't stop until i made it thru another level. I'm now playing at the expert level. Best game on VR!

As a Dj I would like to recommend to add tracks from the 90s era.Oldschool hardcore, techno,Drum n bass and trance.I m very sure that they will fit perfectly to the game.Also some dance 80s .Dance playing and having fun is the goal.I think this game is for all kind of ages, so yes the 16 years old like the tracks that you put in, but all people above 40 like me ,would appreciate some older stuff.

Beat Saber is a well established title for Oculus, so there's no need to say that it's a must own title (and in fact my very first purchase). 
The negative twist though is that it lacks the most basic functionality - Custom Songs. You can only play the limited originals, which gets boring after a while. I know that for PC there's a big community and tons of customs, but it requires a modded version of the game, which isnt something I'd like to do. Instead of going around you should just include the custom songs function (can be a paid DLC, I wouldn't mind spending extra 10-20 bucks to be able to explore player made content) to make your game fully enjoyable for years.
review_title: Must Have for Quest, but with a twist.

Ever since the 13-14.5 updates the game changed. The sabers would go straight through the notes. When I would miss one note at the beginning of the song I would go down to a B ranking. When I’m hitting the notes it would give me 80-100 points when I should really be getting 105-115. I would fail some songs because of the updates and my game reset my stats and progress because of the updates.

I have played this game more than any other game, with at least 100 hours. I strongly recommend it. Trying the demo will do more for you than reading reviews.

Keep in mind that installing mods/custom-songs on the Quest version violates Facebook's Terms of Service (ToS). They haven't banned anyone's accounts for it, but that could change in the future.

The Rift version (PC required) *supposedly* has better modding support and you're not violating the ToS with that version.

This was the first game I downloaded when I got the Quest 2. I played it at my friends and was hooked! I love the different songs and options available, like disappearing arrows and the ability to make the songs faster. I also like the options to purchase other playlists. I thinks it’s a great idea to have that availability. 

Would like to see more beat maps at the normal and hard levels for the 360* game play option. There’s only a select few songs at those levels, and the others are at expert(+) -- which is still only a handful of songs options anyway. 
Would also be fun to have some classic songs as a play list, specifically I’m thinking some Michael Jackson songs. I love the high energy of the electronic music, but would like to see some classic songs on a playlist in the future. 

This game is so much fun and I look forward to more updates :)

I have no words for how good this game is. I have played it throughout 2020 - 2021 and it’s great! This game gives you extra songs even when you start the game. There are songs like Crab Rave and FitBeat, ohhhhhh FitBeat. FitBeat is a track that I have definitely played the most. I’m horrible at playing it because I’ve only gotten to S playing it on hard. Beat Saber is a great game for the starter player on VR for the first time, it’s also great for people who have played VR a lot.

So I want to say at first that I love Beat Saber, easily my go-to game. However the devs or publishers(honestly I’m a bit thick in the skull and don’t really know the entire process of releasing a game)
seem pretty money hungry. No custom songs whatsoever, music packs are a little pricey on top of a 30-40$ price tag, and in multiplayer lobbies if everyone picks a song you don’t own you can’t play(you can’t even hear the song while spectating!!) Also there’s this bug that constantly happens every single time I play where my sabers will just pass through blocks multiple times per level. Edit: I have now bought the Imagine Dragons and the Green Day music packs. Honestly a little disappointing levels are super easy to the point of me almost getting a full combo on expert+ on every song first try. The devs also don’t seem to understand flow or rhythm, for instance on Breezer beats are just out of sync and it seems some parts of songs are in-sync and some aren’t. An improvement I think could add to the game and help others learn the songs is to have easy start super basic and then have normal and above add little things and make more and more of the notes be manual so you can basically still see the basic easy mode song underneath all the other notes. I don’t really know if anyone reading gets what I’m saying but what I mean is they don’t just change the song between difficulty’s. Edit: I bought the MonstercatxRocket League pack and it’s definitely one of the the best, if you get any song packs buy the Monstercat ones first. Also, the new OST4 is good it’s definitely the best out all the original sound tracks. BS is really fun game with good graphics and a great concept, but it isn’t amazing or awful just good. Would recommend but not as highly as other reviewers.

This game is freaking awesome. Not only is it fun, but it’s a great workout. It offers a ton of different difficulty options which is great for enhancing your hand I coordination. The music is great however I look forward to them getting more purchasable albums from￼ more artists. They do offer a lot of free music so it is definitely worth the $30.￼

It's one of those games that will probably remain relevant for years to come and be considered a classic. If you don't mind doing some phisical exercise, this is probably gonna be the game you'll always return to when you finish or get bored by other vr games. In this case it's probably a must buy! The replayability of this game can be endless. 5/5* for making aerobic fun for me. I'm afraid not to infringe some terms and conditions so I haven't tried to mod it on my oculus quest or to add custom songs. I hope for an official way to add the stuff that modders do on quest 2, those meme songs I've seen on YT looks really fun

P.S. if you play for the first time be careful with the expert/expert+ levels. They're more demanding then they might seem! Start with the campaign or easy/normal songs and work your way up. Expert+ songs+ no fail modifier on the first day it's a no-no, trust me! If you get sore muscles or wrists pain, take a break for few days and let the body recover, then get back on slashing blocks. It can be a healthy game only if you don't overdo it

So, I have a windows mixed reality vr headset for my pc that I just love, being wireless the quest 2 had me interested however with covid going on and losing my job because of it I couldn't get it till now. So I have played a lot of VR games and there are some I want to play but can not because it gives me mad motion sickness.  Single player games such as story's in VR don't offer long enough game play for the price personally so I avoid them. Stinks that the quest is so limited on games.

Beatsaber is still better on pc because of mods and players making tons more music available for this game, the limited music for this game with how long its been out stinks, it took them 2 to 3 years to start adding more but in dlc form.   Beat Saber is the only single game I keep coming back to even though I am absolutely sick of the music it has to offer, it's fun and offers more then an hour or 2 worth of gameplay.  It doesn't give any type of motion sickness at all bit the biggest downside is really the limited songs it has.

So far I liked them for the music but the mapping ehhh, I don't really like the mapping too much. It all happens way to quickly within like 1 min of the song and I get tired after a while. Like who doesn't get tired after playing one ExpertPlus song. Always take a break after playing for a good 3 mins. In conclusion, I like the new update and I think the mapping could be more improved if it wasn't too fast with some of the songs. Anyways I did play them with my friend after I told him another update was here and he liked ludicrous+ because of course it sounded electric or something.
review_title: Beat saber is the best Game!!

one_reviews_text: Nothing more to say about it. Gameplay is fantastic, great range of content with regular free updates which add new songs and fix minor bugs, and its propably the best experiencr for new VR-Users in any game. Only thing I can still ask for is more songs with a wider range of music genres and maybe mod support for the quest version.
review_title: A must have for VR users

one_reviews_text: They should add a custom thing where you can use your own sound and move the blocks around

Beat Saber itself is a good game. However, with all the money they make on this, it's pretty static and the song selection is abysmal. They updated the game to have multiplayer recently, and that was a great decision. But other than that, it's a little surprising how much they keep this the same.
When can we get a hip hop soundtracks?
Ok game feels overrated
Please add custom sabers in vanilla
You know already if you like to smack the block, just buy it already.

For one, you are only limited to the songs that you can buy, and not any that are created by others. review_title: Obvious best VR game is obvious

one_reviews_text:
I will try to resume the Pros and Cons of this Game:
Pro:
 Game play: Amazing, makes you move cutting blocks that come at you, with the rhythm of the song.
 Movement: The sabers work very well, you can define your height so the game will adapt to you, and it also forgives some cuts that are not very good, which is good, because your gonna near miss some.
Training: This game will make you sweat.
Difficulty: You enter into a music in practice mode and reduce the speed of the level to train, or start at a specific point in the music.

Cons:
Music: this game is not cheep, and it comes with a very limited number of songs, sure you will find music for your taste that will make you cut some cubes, that I can assure everyone, for me the problem is that only 7/8 music's motivate me to play this game.
Bundles: Very few are available, Be aware music's are censored with bip's and mutes, and for me that completely kill it (Green Day and Linkin Park for example) and tis not announced anywhere.
Some bundles that would make sense in this game, Avicii, David Guetta, Hardwell, Calvin Haris, so so many Sum 41, Blink 182, My Chemical Romance, Prodagy, Muse, OffSpring
Ok look They need to add custom sabers because barely anybody has a PC so please add custom custom sabers so we can express her self and make a season pass we hope this will come in the future
review_title: Plz add new sabers and new songs

one_reviews_text: Crooked Facebook wants you to buy this game multiple times for each account on your Oculus.  No thanks, I’ll be asking for a refund until this gets fixed.

review_title: The game is fun but colapses  in ex+

one_reviews_text: The game is good but it's to repetitive and we need to pay for other music so please we want custom song

This game never gets old and I’ve been playing it since last October. Once I finished the campaign you can endlessly change game modes on each song and play more and more challenging ways. 

I buy new VR games regularly but I always put beat saber in and play anyway. It’s just soo much FUN!! And I feel like I’m moving more and getting some exercise too!

If I were to request improvement it would be that I really want to make friends directly within the game. If you find a compatible player online, it would be nice to be able to select in game, send a friend request and, in addition, being able to party up from there would be awesome! 

And I’m a little surprised the sabers and avatars are not more customizable. That would be fun too! Think Rocket League bonuses but for sabers and outfits. Ya dig? (^_^)
review_title: By far my fave VR game

one_reviews_text: i personally think that beat saber is one of the best vr games of all time, especially those new to the vr community. however, for those who find hard levels too easy and expert too difficult, this can be helped by playing with modifiers, making the game more challenging. but otherwise, 9/10 would deffo recommend to a friend or this game again.

It is a great game to help you get used to vr faster more than most because of how simple it is it won’t make you as dizzy as fast and helps you get an idea of how to move around in and manage your space well especially if you don’t have much room like myself plus once you find your rhythm it becomes really fun at least I enjoy it
I've liked a lot the game, it's very fun, there are some people that can't stop playing it so far I've played some but there are some other games I like more.

Beatsaber is an awesome game and I'm pretty sure that the message is never give up
So I'm hear to tell you guys if you find a song that's hard you can do it and never give up

PS: thank you so much Beatsaber for creating this game it's been a massive part of my life.
Just A scam

I love the game and I’ve been playing it for a while now but I know a few artists to add to the game that would improve the game so much more, my first one has to be skrillex and the reason why is I feel like the song “bangarang” would make a perfect fit along with the other song “hero”, my next artist is Eminem for all of the rap lovers out there. I know collaborating with artists is challenging so I understand if you are not able to do it.

This is the first game I played on VR thanks to my son and he got the whole family in to it!    One thing I would love to see though:  in multiplayer/create server mode where you are inviting people, can you enable all the player options, especially “no fail?”  It pretty much wrecks the experience for a player that can’t play at a high level to just have the game end when they miss a brick... this isn’t just about competition but fun, too!  Many thanks for considering :)

got my oculus the exact same day the update for OST 4 came out. 5 days later, whenever i open Beat Saber the audio is just, corrupted, and whenever i try to play a level the game has a severe lag problem that makes the game unplayable. no other games of mine have given this problem, please help, for the love of god. other than this issue the game is great, i absolutely love the game and would give it 5 stars if i wasn’t having this problem.

one_reviews_text:
This game was awesome then something changed.
I’m not sure if it was an update or just problem with the game, but the first block comes towards you, then after that they disappear and you fail that level.

I have tried to report it, but have not been successful.
That’s all I gotta say.And if Beat Saber can, It would be amazing to have custom songs on the Quest!!!
The game is incredible as most people say, but one recommendation, don’t play without the wrist straps. (I learnt that the hard way)

There's no crossbuy. Why does anyone who buys a game on an Oculus platform have to buy the same game multiple times? Greed, that's why. Don't worry, I bought it on Steam so you got my money twice anyway.
Spend 400 on a quest just to have to delete everything I’ve done for a 30 dollar game. Support is also a joke.
review_title: Crashes my system and caused a reset

one_reviews_text:
Before I got it I thought it may have been just all and thought “nah it couldn’t possibly be thaaat good”, but after playing it for hours on end right away-it turns out it actually is that good, it’s fun, a good exercise that works as a real exercise but fun, and is very immersive.  The one thing that is a con is that you have to buy the add ons for the music you actually recognize if you aren’t familiar with the songs that they have free with the game, it’s pretty expensive, but overall a good game. And also me and my friend always talk about how we wish they had like a mode that you can add your own music in or create your own levels with your own music too.
Given that it is a bit of an expensive game though I suggest if you decide to get it or the add ons for it to do it while they are on sale, especially since they go on sale quite often.
review_title: All the hype you’ve heard is true.

one_reviews_text: I love playing beat saber! Its a great app and its exciting to see some of the new features they've introduced in the most recent update. However in this new update there is a lot of overlapping of the text in game (the scores and grades overlap on one side and in the other side the streak and time overlap). Other than that its a brilliant game - would love some more albums to be made available, and maybe some more tracks added to the panic at the disco album!
review_title: A couple of glitches but still amazing

one_reviews_text:
For anyone that is looking for a game that is fun, exciting, and something that can burn calories, get Beat Saber! Beat Saber was the first game I ever installed and I love it! I am a person that likes rhythms a lot and I find this game very rhythmic and I really enjoy it. Me and my whole family enjoy this game and I would recommend this game to someone who doesn’t get dizzy or nauseous easily. My family did not have a problem with being nauseous or being dizzy and that surprised me because one of my family members normally get motion sickness and can get dizzy pretty easily. 

I am very impressed Beat Saber. Keep up with the good work and the helpful updates!
I can't explain how fun this game is. It is so satisfying cutting through the notes at a high speed. There is a lot of customizability built-in and the game in general is really enjoyable.

I end the day with running a couple songs in BS. Tracking on the quest2 is great, although glitchy at times, especially if you wear a sweatshirt (weird). It would be better if there was a way to do user added songs and not lose scoring. 

I like the official songs because the variety is there. Not everything has to be seizure inducing 300bpm. Being able to hand the game off to my kid and let her have a go on easy and normal is great. 

This is a great first game, and would be great to be packaged with the system. 

Devs! Lets see more metal. Can we get a Fear Factory pack?

Update: something I didn't know about this, if you purchase an add-on pack, you better like it because Facebook will not refund bundles. Bought it Linkin Park pack, it's uninspired, slow songs trying to feel fast, and the environment inside the game is a concrete tunnel. Woo.

Okay I just wanted to thank you guy for fixing the height problem I mentioned below and even though I still can't use Bluetooth with the product I can still play without it so I just changed my one star review to a five star thank you for keeping your product up-to-date and improving and to the tech team you helped me out a lot.
Hello readers
The problem stated below have been resolved and so now I will highly recommend this product because I genuinely love the game and the problem was dealt with very quickly.

Previous review listed below:
Okay this is a game you can definitely play for exercise and for fun it's an amazing app.this game is definitely worth the money and time. But like everything has it's good things and it's bad things and recently you guys just did a huge update and messed with the height calibrations so now I'm too freaking tall and I can barely hit anything anymore and I'm at an expert level so if I can't hit anything something's wrong somewhere. Until this there was not a bad thing I could say about  this app other than the fact that you can't use Bluetooth without the maps glitching and I could deal with that because I could still play. So if you could fix those two problems I'd be happy to continue playing your app and continue to buy your products heck I even change this rating to a five star so please help a girl out

The only problem is that there isn't enough songs, intergrated custom songs is definitely needed for the people who might struggle at modding the game. Other than 10/10 game.

The game is fun, and the songs are challenging which is great. The only problem with it is that the controller tracking can be absolutely horrible sometimes, and when I swing to hit a block and know for a fact that I hit it dead on, it counts it as a miss. Please fix this issue

this is a good game but if it had a daft punk playlist it would be an amazing game
Good songs, good exercise, fun, wish they would add more songs and backgrounds. I do recoomend.

This game is fun, but it could definitely be more versatile with their music. The majority of their songs are pop songs, I would like to see some hiphop and R&B! If there was more diversity within the music this game would be top tier.
I bought linkin Park pack and it seems like now the boxes are lower to the ground making it hard to hit my notes.  How would u fix that ...

Until I attempted contacted with two of the addresses at Beat-games, I was enjoying the application, and it promotes elevated activity. You can get your blood flowing good with this app. contact@beat-games.com and privacy@beat-games.com  have not responded to my questions sent last month, so I'm definitely not spending any more money on Beat-games projects.

Stating shouldn’t even be an option devs can prohibit. It’s the same dang headset.

And... dlc with bleeped lyrics? That’s ridiculous.

I got my VR for Christmas and this is literally the only game I play & I haven’t got bored yet. I would really appreciate different genres of music, rnb, hip hop, 90s pop... also I would love more workout beat fit tracks, I think there is only one, that gave me a proper workout, I would like to do more of them challenging ones.

My family and I have so much fun with this game. The songs that come with it are catchy and fun to learn and the frequent sales they have on the music packs make this game all the more worth it. I’ve been playing it for a month and can finally play expert plus songs. The workout that the harder difficulty songs give you is a bonus.

I have been playing for a while now and the game is really fun but what I don’t get is why aren’t there more songs.I’ve seen people who have custom songs but you need a lot of tutorials.So what I’m saying is therefore there shouldn’t be the same songs but there is others songs but there money which I get.So I would really like more songs or maybe custom songs for everyone without going to a website because I don’t have a computer myself or I don’t know how to do that.Still this game is fun and exciting with all the things it has.

I love the game and all, but maybe in the future the game devs could add an option for custom songs.
I feel like more people would play this if there was an option for that. It would also be cool if they added it for people with no pc like me and still be able to do custom songs. This is just my thought have a nice day.
Would give five stars but there are add-ons

Loooooove this game but please release more free songs. Couldn't enjoy much more. Maybe make online content more interactive. Like lounges instead of waiting in the pre game lobby's. Maybe show off skills in front of others.
