But I love this game. It’s my favorite.
Really! Not 4 songs like in OST4 but 5-10 every month. Music packs like Monstercat - it's awesome and greatly ballanced. Love it. Anyway, it's a great game for workout.
I was having a lot of fun but then when I went on expert + my controller flew and I had to replace my controllers
I love the game! Top 10 in my opinion, but one problem is that I have to repay for this on my Oculus Rift, I think it's a waste of money that you have to pay either way...

This game is fun, but there is a weird haptic bug that makes one of my controllers haptics be less strong, and it’s never consistent with what controllers haptics will weaken, it could either be right or left, sometimes the haptics are barely weaker, but other times you can barely feel them, and the glitch only happens in beat saber and while I’m playing a song, in the beat saber menu it works fine all of the time, but when I play a song it might bug out, and the only way to fix it is by restarting the headset. So maybe the devs can look into that, but other than that great game!

It’s really fun I love I recommend this game I never get bored playing it I play it a lot and I want more songs imma get more when I get and I suggest to have it where you can look at old songs

Love this game! I don’t have time to go to the gym, so I use this game as my workout. You definitely sweat and get winded. Obviously, it’s primarily upper body. But, if you really get into it by bending down to catch notes you can expand to other muscle groups. Also, it’s just super fun! You can play a song 30 times and still get enjoyment from it. I would HIGHLY recommend!!!!

Be careful about purchasing music. I bought a package and hated the music. 6 minutes after purchase I tried to cancel and refund and it wouldn't let me. Said I played it longer then 2 hours. It was literally 6 minutes.

I'll admit that rhythm games aren't usually my thing, but experiencing it in VR really improves the experience. A real blast to play.

one_reviews_text:
I'll list the features you'd expect from any rythm game and that are missing from the most popular paid VR rythm game in 2021.

First, the minor problems. The campaign teaches you how to miss instead of introducing you to the accuracy system. This accuracy system is very cool in my opinion since it adds skill expression and needs to be actively worked on to improve. However the only feedback you have on it is a flying integer after every block you cut. You have to stop paying attention to the game bewteen each block, read a small moving number and substract it from 115 to know how well you cut that block. Usually games have a color system to give instant feedback, or at least have text that reads "Excellent" or "Good". No replay system.

Now the for the awful problems.

Let's start with the obvious. There are only 10 songs after you pay the game. The rest also has to be paid for. This is why I call this a community based game, as 99.9% of the maps are made by the community. This is similar in osu! and the community loves mapping so everyone is happy. Except that a good community game has mod support. This game doesn't. You have to download 10 unofficial apps and you have to be careful because all of your scores could get deleted next update. You rely on modders staying active to get basic features. Pathetic.

The difficulty levels. There are 5 of them : Easy, Normal, Hard, Expert, Expert+. Easy Normal and Hard get useless very soon. After a few weeks I can fc some expert+ maps. This is AWFUL. Usually you get a star system. I can remember when I beat a 4.5* map in osu! for the first time after 3 years of playing. The hype, the adrenaline. Now I can still feel that rush when I play in 5* difficulty and my best play is a 5.8* FC after 5 years. My goal is to one day FC a 6*. In Beat Saber, I FC'ed an expert+ map and now everything is called expert+. It's poor game design. A Camellia map is 10x harder than any base map in expert+.

The base concept is still very good.

I've been playing with the new update, great menus I have to say and it feels as if I'm doing better before I said the tracking was not perfect but I cam play way better now idk if you fixed it or if it was me being arrogant but I've put 5 stars because I really enjoy the game it's one of my favourites.

one_reviews_text: I love the game, but I'm kinda disappointed about the song library. Not a lot of songs come with the game and most of them are Dubstep EDM songs (plain noise if you're not into the genre). Beat saber is the first game that gives me the feeling that I didn't get what I paid for.

I'm SO DISAPPOINTED!!!!! this WAS a good game at first, then after afew days, the app stopped working.  I try and play a "solo" game and nothing happens.  going on for several days now, tried to find help and nothing.  going to be asking for a refund.

The recent update that added the experimental tiny notes and new modifiers broke hit detection for notes. you probably had this problem with the recent update to if your looking here. and this is not me being bad at the game so don't start with that. in the update i am referring to it apparently fixed note hitbox size as it was never the size of the actual object onscreen. from my observation i missed way more notes then i should be (singleplayer and online play) and i tested it with all the ost songs including the new ost 4 pack. not only did i miss notes when i hit them correctly to find my saber goes right through the note but also sometimes just as often the game will say a note was hit incorrectly as if i did a bad cut on a block even though it was sliced with the correct saber and direction. whatever they did messed up something in the game and the devs should either remove that feature from the update or fix the hit detection. as i said im not complaining in this review for being bad or anything like that but more to let people know about an ongoing bug in the game.
review_title: Hit detection needs to get fixed

I don’t think this is BS’s code but limitations on the kit e.g my fat belly blocking the tracking cameras detecting the controllers, BS use a bit of logic to guess the location in such conditions i suspect 

Oculus should create room sensor addons to alleviate this, I suspect the thinnines will be fine.

Regardless of anything buy the game 1st, it’s by far the coolest software I’ve played in my 43 years of life and I started on a Sinclair Spectrum so I’m original gamer.

So let's start with the fact it's really an awesome game and I love it, BUT...
The recent update didn't want to go through, although tried numerous times. After I believe 6-7th attempt I just thought it will be easier to uninstall and install it again. So I did. Imagine my surprise when the game greeted me displaying: "Looks like you're new to Beat Saber"... All the progress, achievements, avatars, everything just gone... Why wouldn't it remember my progress. It's not like I deleted my account, I still had music packs purchased, it's just everything else that's gone with the wind... And the reason I have decided to do the update at all is that otherwise it wouldn't allow me to play online... so there's that. And one minor thing - I liked the look and feel of the winners and scoreboard in an online quickplay from before the update. Now it's just so teeny-tiny and you don't even see your score (it's displayed only after everyone's in the lobby again)...

I love this game, I've spent many hours already playing it and foresee many more to go. I do wish it had more recognizable songs, there are a few song pack add-ons but aside from a few popular artists, they're techno and k-pop. That said, the songs included in the game have grown on me, so that's not such a big deal. The real issue is that this is one of only a handful of oculus games that isn't enabled for play across multiple profiles on the same headset. So my girlfriend has to play under my profile which means the campaign is already done, all my high scores are already present, so it's not as fun for her because she can't see her own progress. It's pretty disappointing, and frankly extortive for the developer to not enable multi-profile support for this game, and I don't recommend anyone spend money on this until that's resolved.
review_title: Great game with a huge caveat

This game is a great way to enjoy some low impact cardio. While others are angry that their aren’t here more levels and customization etc I am just happy to beat my last score. After 3 surgeries this is a good way to be active and work your way up to getting a high score. Any age can play. It would be nice to have different genres of music to play to but I am sure that finding fast paced songs on every genre is difficult.

There is no way to describe how well this game runs, how difficult the levels are when you are dealing with skill based difficulties. My personal favorite level is Ghost [Expert] by Camellia. The flow is super smooth and was really well made. This game is probably the best thing that ever happened to vr. Oh yeah, and the community isn't full of 9 year olds who got their hands on their older brother's headset. All-in-all, best game I've ever played.

TLDR : Very good game, good levels, good community

This game is definitely in my top 5 of oculus vr games. I think that this is definitely a game that people new to vr should get because it’s extremely comfortable, easy to learn and to have fun with, and doesn’t give you motion sickness. Over all this a great game and I think that it is worth the 30 bucks.

Get ready to sweat like crazy, wash your face with anti acne cream (maximum strength), and spend more money on washable head gear. Oh, and watch the pounds that drop too! It takes practice to get coordination, rhythm, and endurance to progress. When you do, it gets more fun and satisfying. Oh, did I mention you’ll excrete gallons of filthy sweat through your face? I mean DRIPPING. Oculus stock head gear is NOOOOT recommended unless you want to be a walking advertisement of a pizza franchise on your face for free. At some point, stock Oculus foam gear will get so gross that nobody will touch your Oculus because of the smell even after painstakingly strict cleaning routines. You’ll end up replacing your stock Oculus visor very quickly just so you can tolerate the filthy ness. Don’t forget that this is the hottest game on Oculus, don’t let me undersell you. Oculus, do a better job to keep in mind that some people regard hygiene just as much as entertainment and consumerism.

I played the demo and got a decent score. Tried again to get a better score and ended up worse than the first time.  Tried again and got even worse! Gave up.  Tried again a week later and did OK, so I decided to buy the full game.  Tried a few songs, different difficulty levels, tried some of the modifiers, etc. and just couldn’t get into it.  Decided to try the campaign mode — GAME CHANGER! This mode teaches you everything you need to know about playing this game by progressing you through various tasks and objectives, starting with the most basic moves and concepts through the more advanced levels. In a matter of a day I was rocking out in multiplayer mode and having a blast!  I would highly recommend this game. Only thing I dislike is the lack of songs, and having to buy new ones is kinda lame considering I used to play all the DDR games and they all came with TONS of songs built in, and they were songs you KNOW.  Unless you pay for a premium song pack, you won’t recognize any songs.  It would greatly increase the enjoyment factor if this game was based around popular music of this decade.
review_title: Took me a bit, but great game!

one_reviews_text: This game is so much fun and you will definitely want to move when playing. I am very animated while playing this game and it gives you a good full body workout if you do it right. I also get my heart rate up in the cardio range for long periods of times so it really just blows me away about how great I feel playing this game.

This game is definitely one of the first games to buy for me as an oculus owner. 

It’s got huge depth and variety of levels and somehow they all have a distinctive enough layout such that it’s hard to get bored.

And the increasing difficulty levels mean mastering it will only be done by the most committed. At Expert + level it’s almost impossible!

If you aren’t sure just get the free demo - you can see if you like it. And you will...!

I have only had my oculus for around a week and I absolutely love this game more than anything I have ever played.  In the last couple days however the game has been glitching left and right.  At first I was willing to accept maybe I just was not playing very well and needed to warm up.  However, after a few rounds I started noticing things like what should have been clear slices through the blocks was instead just the saber passing through the blocks as if they were ghost sabers unable to make contact.  More and more I also noticed my saber flapping around like wet pool noodles.  I even tried to hold my hand in many different positions in front of me just in case it was just the exterior cameras not picking up my controllers, even though I had not needed to do this any of the other times I had played.  I really hope this issues gets resolved, because now what used to be an amazing experience is now a frustrating and angering time.

one_reviews_text: Beat Saber is an incredibly fun and engaging game, particularly great to play with friends, an absolute must-have for VR. That said, there aren’t many songs available if you aren’t willing to pay extra for packs. Although due to different modes it’s still quite a bit of content to get through, especially if you’re aiming for perfection. Personally, I play Beat Saber just to wiggle my bones a little so I don’t mind replaying the same songs over and over again. It’s still fun. But I know for some people this can become boring after a while, so it’s something to consider before buying. Other than that, it’s 100% worth grabbing.

This is the single best VR game EVER. Seriously, I can only think of 1 or 2 games that are on the same level as Beat Saber. It’s so simple yet so fun. You slash boxes with light sabers in the arrows direction. That’s it. I’ve showed this to people that are almost 50 years old and even they liked it. This game is like Mariokart and Nintendo, or Halo and Xbox. It’s a must-have and is literally a system seller. Seriously, before you buy ANY other game that was on your list, get this first. It’s really worth it and it’s AUD$3 (about a dollar in USD) to get a new song that you may have heard on the radio before. 10/10, would play forever.

The only recommendation that I have for the developers is to add songs more frequently or add more songs per soundtrack so people don’t have to play the same songs over and over again. Yeah, the devs only added like 5 songs this update. The main question is should you buy Beat Saber? YES! It is totally worth $30. Oh, did I mention it is good exercise? It’s a workout.

one_reviews_text:

This is an unimaginative meld of fruit ninja, guitar hero and Star Wars, with a handful of the most generic EDM songs you can imagine. They need to get better music into it ASAP because right now it seems like a $46 demo.
Beat saber is a very fun game but it can get very boring if you play it for to long. But overall it is very cool, has lots of colors, and has lots of songs. I would buy this game if I were you!

This game is fantastic. Most played games on my Quest.

But it's not the same game I see everyone playing. You know, with all of those custom songs. Nope, if you get the Oculus Quest version, no custom songs without moding the bloody game. 

You may ask. "But the moding procedure is so simple, there are guide literally everywhere!"

Yes. That's true. There's also the risk of getting ban. 

You may then ask. "But no one has been banned!"

Yes. Not yet, they aren't. And if the ban hammer goes off, there would probably be an outcry. So it highly unlikely.

"So what's the problem?" You ask.

This practice is just shady. The developers (as well as Oculus) want don't want to get call out by the music industry by "not supporting" custom songs. But they still sort of allow it to happen by not fully blocking it since they benefit from the community by having them continue to creating new contents for the game and showing off the game with contents that don't actually exist.

They are double dipping.

Sometimes Ill catch myself randomly waving my hands across the screen- I mean eyesight in public..

To avoid this, maybe don't get to expert+.

My wife paid for me to have a VR experience back in March, and I fell in love with this game. I'm not a gamer, but I checked how much it would cost to get the gear for home and it was very expensive. Then along came the occulus quest 2, and I bought it with beat saber, best thing ever. The game is exactly the same, great graphics, very immersive and great fun. Different levels of playing from easy to expert+ which seems impossible to me, but I also discovered other fun modes too like 360 and 90 which has them coming at you from different angles. So much fun. You can put the game in different modes too such as party mode where you can challenge people at home sharing the headset, scores kept on a board, and campaign which is great to learn different modes and build up your skills. The music is great too. Great choice. Wouldn't mind some older songs from my era (80s such as Queen) some of those songs like Invisible Man, Breakthru would be fab. Can't recommend this game enough though. If you have a VR you must get this game.
You guys really need to add custom songs because i get bored playing the same songs over and over again.

I hope at the future I can talk with other players and the developers make a weekly ranking for on-line players, it would be very cool.

Lots of fun to play by yourself or just go wild with insane mods for the enjoyment of the people watching you. The additional music packs help keep things from getting too stale, as well as changing some of the play options and difficulty to keep you on your toes. It's also nice that this has a pretty even balance of work for both arms so you're not just using your dominant arm with occasional support from the other.

I’ve had beat saber for 3 years, and it’s amazing! But whenever you master all of the songs and expert plus is almost too easy, modding is very nice to have. There are some crazy hard songs, and you can play whatever song you want really. Here is a link to a tutorial for modding.

When it comes to pick-up-and-play, Beat Saber is a friend to both new and experienced VR players. From children to grandparents, anybody can jump into this game and have fun. The difficulty is so very buildable. Once you master Easy, you can move into the next difficulty, and within a brief amount of time and practice you’ll be slicing through Expert+ like it’s nothing. This is my go-to for introducing my friends to virtual reality and I’ve yet to meet somebody who left the game feeling less than giddy.

Nothing that really blew my mind to be honest... but it would have been nice to have had at least more game modes to go along with them.

This was one of the first games I bought when I first got my Quest. It’s a fantastic rhythm game and there’s a campaign mode that get progressively difficult which gives you more of a reason to play than just getting a high score. New songs are very rarely released though and this is where it falls down. There is a massive online community of custom songs but getting them onto your quest is complicated, not officially supported and a bit of a faff. I don’t understand why they can’t release more songs to purchase, more frequently, like they did with Singstar back in the day, surely it can’t be that hard to convince labels to partner up as a another source of revenue?
review_title: Must have but needs more songs

one_reviews_text: I like the game but the thing is there's not a huge variety of songs without the dlc and I don't really wanna spend a lot of money on dlc and everywhere I see custom beat saber songs so I think it would be cool if you could get custom songs for beat saber and sword designs like steam does with their games with mods.

This game is great and I love it ever since I bought it, the only problem, and often times I hear it from other people, is the actual music. Most games fall victim to this, there’s not much variety, and many games just do not have any hiphop, r&b,older 80s or 90s classics of any American genre music just to broaden the range of interest, I personally don’t know anyone who even likes bts or kpop in general. Hiphop is the biggest Genre today. The music in games is very important to think about. Keep up the great work.

My and my mom both play this game (she plays while I’m gone). Furthermore I just want to say how much I enjoy this I’ve not regretted the $30 at all. My mom loves the super fun exercise and I enjoy all the fun that is “B￼eat Saber”

it’s beat saber. arguably the most popular paid vr game in the world, and for a good reason. it’s fun, challenging, and satisfying. with mods the game is honestly endless, too.

review_title: Amazing way to spend extra time!

one_reviews_text: Beat Saber is one of 3 games I own on my Quest and it is by far my favorite video game I have ever played in my life. I’ve been playing for a year and change now and I haven’t gotten bored with the amount of songs they have. Even the difficulty levels ate perfect as it ranges from Easy to Expert +. It’s also an amazing way to get exercise, as some expert plus songs, like FitBeat and Light it Up, are fast paced and force you to move. Vr just isn’t vr without Beat Saber, and I will always tell anyone who just got a vr to get it.
review_title: You won’t regret getting this game

one_reviews_text: If you are skeptical about buying this then I really do hope you choose to buy it, it is such a fun game, along with the multiplayer just amps it up.  I haven’t gotten bored at all of this game, I hope you enjoy it too!

This game is perfect for someone like me whose job has entailed sitting in front of a computer all day for years, slowly watching my shape morph into the proverbial potato.  From the moment I tried it I was hooked. I psychologically can't leave a session until I have executed it perfectly on my chosen level of difficulty and with full body engagement.   An hour later and dripping with sweat,  this is the most I have moved my body in a year and I am feeling no pain, only addiction and energy.  This is how I now start each day and it's better than coffee. The only problem is not wanting to stop. I did buy the Panic at the Disco, Green Day and Imagine Dragon add-ons because I am a person of a certain age and just can't with BTS and most of the other included music choices.  I will hope to see more music genre and the ability to use a custom playlist.

So this game can be a great workout and has helped ease my severe anxiety by giving me something to disconnect with. However, the song choice is sucky and limited. You pay over $30 for the game and then have to buy the songs. A rip off! But if you watch a few YouTube videos, you can mod this baby to make it worth your while for free! With that being said, paying all this cash for a game you have to "fix" yourself is silly. Other than that, this is my new favorite game to ignore my family with!
review_title: It's fun but expensive for all the work

Cons - not enough song choice. Would love to see more music packs available in future updates.

I have had the quest for a year and played this for a year. This has by far been the best game. Even after mastering many different songs, it always gives you the feeling to strive further. I would recommend this to musicians and non alike, and will say that it can be fun for everyone, from family parties to friend hangouts and competitions with friends. 20/10!!!

This io one of the best games on quest it's fun for all the family and recently they have added online mode so you can play with random people or if you and your friends want to vibe to music while slashing blocks

This game caught my attention once I got my Oculus Quest, I bought the game and went to hard mode instantly... as usual, the game was good at first and tried many different types, they all were amazing after playing for an hour and a half (or so it felt like) 

this game can be a VERY fun game and also very addicting if your the type, I think anyone should try this game at least once, I play many games and this is definitely an amazing one! 
And since it keeps your heart racing and gives me a habit of trying until I have the score I am satisfied with. You can get really tired physically and can get boring if you play the same song over and over again, so try doing different ones, 

I do recommend trying online since it can be really competitive and fun since it’s not about what you want so you can try different songs each time, instead you vote and get r eady, playing with friends and people are the most fun I’ve had with the game, so if you can please try the game, I hope and bet you will have fun

This was the 1st game I bought with a couple of music packs. It is basically the beginning to all the future games you will play. You learn squatting, hitting objects in certain direction. The best is when you are playing to one of your favorite songs its like a whole new level of enjoyment. My favorite Thunder Imagine Dragons. Highly recommend for young and old
idk what to say it’s amazing

one_reviews_text: No vr game collection is complete without this game. It is incredibly fun and addicting, and it gives you lots of real exercise as well. As good as the base game is though, what really makes it amazing is the modding community and custom maps. This is where beat saber becomes infinitely replayable with a staggeringly high skill ceiling. I definitely recommend looking up how to install mods because it is 1000% worth it. Do yourself a favor and don’t miss out on this game.
This game is very fun. But if you don't like hard game do not get it

Great game, very fun and energizing. You start out and all you gotta do is feel the rhythm. It needs a little bit more spice to it, ya know? Something that will bring back the game for the quest platform.something that will. Bring the community to creativity. Like custom songs and sabers, I know the quests can handle it and it’s very boring how we have to buy songs that are 20 bucks a playlist in order to master it and get bored again. Maybe you can bring custom songs to quest so we don’t have to hookup a pic and download all this stuff in order to play songs that we like. There is a limit to fun  and creativity when you have to buy overpriced songs and stuff. But giving us custom songs will benefit both of us.

I’ve only had this game for a few days and I’ve leveled up from Easy to Normal. I’m excited to progress through the more difficult levels. The songs have a great beat and so it makes moving more fun. It feels like an intense workout! The only complaint I have is that we should be able to pair this with our own library of songs or at least a wider range of songs for us to purchase! I don’t mind purchasing songs within the app that I love, but the selection of songs are very, very limited! If you mod the game then I believe you lose a lot of the basic features. I didn’t want to risk that so now I’m stuck with a few really good songs.

I actually got my Q2 specifically for beat saber. It’s nice that there’s a few expansion packs but only a few new songs for OST4? When there’s so many custom songs for moded units. We need more songs !!

This is the most fun I have had moving in years. Focus on the dance beat and movement. Play against your own score and not others. You will see a rapid improvement in a short time.. You will find an increase in your cardio strength and agility. Great for anyone 12 or older.

Beat saber is everything it is cracked up to be. Liquid smooth graphics, fast-paced sick beats, and challenging levels. one_reviews_text: This game is a must have for any vr goggles. Fun to play, good for exercise and it's pretty friendly with someone who starts with vr. Unfortunately the original game fits about 30-40? songs which after you played all of them might get boring. Mods come for the rescue but installing them might not be easy for everyone. I wish the devs added option for custom songs in the future but it probably won't happen because instead they're releasing music packs with a few songs for over 10 $ per pack (profit!) and also adding custom songs is treated as "piracy" so probably they don't want to get sued.

If you think, "Eh, it's just slashing blocks with swords. What's the big deal," you are missing out. Beat saber is brilliant. I don't even know what what makes it so addictive, but it is. The difficulty system always gives you a sense of accomplishment, and keeps the game fresh. The campaign feels fantastic, fresh, and interesting. I never, ever wonder what I'm doing playing this game, I just play it.  I think that beat saber NEEDS custom levels to stay fresh and exciting. To do custom levels you have to install third party software that takes forever, and is a lot of effort. That being said, this game is beautiful and addictive, and just feels like the closest thing to the ultimate quest game out there...  A MUST HAVE!!!

I bought this Oculus Quest 2 for my entire family to use and the first game we bought (By my demand) was Beat Saber. We all needed some exercise and break from always sitting in one spot all day, thanks Covid 👍🏻👍🏻 

Anyways, we have all been enjoying this game and play daily, seriously recommend!

I always say nothing can be perfect. But when I first started this game, and played it, I tought I have found an exception to my quote. However later I discovered that this game, while at first looks perfect, it has some very small issues.
Let's start at the begining: This game only has about 30-ish songs built-in. Once you have played them all. It will get kind of boring. The PC version have custom songs, however without modding the Quest version, it's impossible to have any. And this leads me to my next point: Nope, Crossbuy is not possible with this game. That's why I have bought the PC version on Steam.
And there's my last problem: Collision issues. Many people say it's a thing, others say not. I literraly have Zero tracking issues with my Quest 2, however sometime the game registers a perfectly fine hit as a Miss or a Bad Cut. The funny thing about this is that the PC version is completely fine! I would be happy if Beat Games would investigate this issue a bit more, and they won't just say that it doesn't happen with them.

Overall, I'm going to give this game 5 stars. It feels amazing to play, it's very polished, and as I said, it's almost perfect. There are a lot of music packs that you can buy for the game, if you want to have more amazing songs. And Beat Games said that they are currently working on OST vol. 4. This game is also fantastic for Parties, with it's Party mode, and there's also an Online Multiplayer mode for playing with your friends, especialy in this pandemic. This game is incredible and should have gotten the '2018 Best VR Game' award.
review_title: Incredible Game, but has some flaws

review_title: Beat Saber is a fun game

one_reviews_text:
This game has arguably sold more than it's share of players on the platform! It's a lot of fun and it's biggest problem is that people want more!

That said, the game IS really lacking in content for new players. The music available is great, but is a limited selection and the modded community is both discouraged by the developers and caters to the high end players. The Devs should really release more content for beginners and intermediates - people in their first 10-50 hours of play are a big untouched demo that they seem to be struggling to understand.

I enjoyed this game a lot. It had me tapping my foot to the beat. I think a lot of the reason is the blocks had meaningful notes in the songs, and it had a different feel in this regard than something like Audiosurf where the beats are autogenerated by the song (at least this is my guess why I enjoyed the game more). 

I did find the mechanic where I have to pay attention to the direction of the blocks to not be related to the musicality of the game... it does add another element of technical difficulty but I found myself paying more attention to the direction of the blocks and less to the music and rhythm, which detracted from my enjoyment a bit. I would prefer an option to turn off the block directionality.

Overall I'm not sure playing this game will change my life, in part because it is not inherently a social game. I am not sure I would rather be playing this game than going kayaking with a friend, or playing Mario Party with a friend. But it definitely got me dancing, which is something I love to do and haven't done as much now that I'm older and don't want to stay out until 4am at the clubs. The game sort of forces you to dance to play.. and you get a lot of those same emotional highs you get when dancing.
So much fun .very addicting ..you will deff. Break a sweat ...love it best game ive played in a long time!!!!!
not as fun as I expected, the movement is very slight, not a good game to exercise in, its limited on modding capability, and really just popular because eof the hype and the add ons it has.

one_reviews_text: Being able to refund games shouldn’t take this long to figure out

Beat saber is a really fun and active game. I personally play it almost every day as it gives me something to do and exercise at the same time. But keep in mind that once you play and beat every game, it can get quite boring. I wish Beat Saber already added custom songs in the original game because some people do not have the right equipment to mod it; like myself. 

Overall it has some pretty good songs and I really enjoy it! 

TIPS:

Muscle memory! This game is all about muscle memory. I say this because you have to memorize the maps so you get more and more used to it, it helps beating the level faster

If you’re stuck on for example hard mode, go onto practice mode or play the next level over and over until you get a bit better, then go back hard mode. It’ll help, I personally use this tip all the time, and most professionals do to. 

The next tip will really help: when you have an arrow pointing up for example, the next note will most likely be a note pointing downwards. That’s why it’s very important to use your wrists and not you arms to break the block. Same with the arrows pointing to sides, just like with muscle memory, thisll help a lot. 


Grips for your controllers! : 

Search up some good grips that help YOU. My personal favorite for the oculus controllers is the claw grip, reverse claw grip, and the m. If you start feeling pain, stop immediately and take a break! Especially if your wrists are hurting, you could be using the wrong grip. 

I hope this helped as it personally helped me.

I used to LOVE BeatSaber and played it every day. What ever they have updated recently, has led to a total inability to slice the cubes consistently. Prior, I was up to Expert level for most songs, and now, even if you SEE the saber going through the cube, it registers as a miss. The absolute worst thing about this game now, is the inability to connect with cubes that switch sides, especially when each color switches sides: for example, when the blue cube comes at you from the left, and/or the red from the right, you have to have the wingspan of Gronkowski to hit them. The height level is fine, but the  wingspan of each player is not taken in to consideration. It's like it was only built for tall guys with a huge wingspan. I am so disappointed in this game now, and disgusted that the developers didn't take different body types into consideration. I hate this game.

I like BS as it is quite good, but not as good as reviews suggest. 

My key complaint is that getting music is EXPENSIVE - think $20 per pack. That is very annoying on top of an expensive base price. That is their business model and it's based on gouging customers.

To avoid this they should support custom songs but don't for obvious reasons. 

Custom songs are not only cheaper but bring much more choice. Every expensive pack offered is modern and most are electro pop. I prefer older rock standards. These are available via the broad BS community.

So my business model is lower reviews until they start offering better value through custom songs. I would encourage you to do the same.

Instead its $15 for 10 songs from one band. Thats a bunch of BS. No thanks. I would rather just stop playing and go find some other music beat game to play.  They really need to figure out the music licensing because its going to kill the game. Then they have the nerve to ban people who mod the game with custom songs. Well...you know if you offered a valuable product...there would be no need to mod the game. I just bought the game and I already have no desire to continue to play the game because of this bs. I am going to go try synth riders cuz i hear they have ez custom songs. I have a feeling games like synth are going to crush beat saber eventually and the bad music licensing is going to be the reason.

I was one of those people that didn't understand the hype behind this game.

Then I played it.

It just feels amazing to slice cubes to the beat of your favorite bangers.

Like everyone else I wish that there was official support for custom maps, but I also understand that the devs are supposed to play licensing fees for every song they play (hence paid songpacks).

That said, modding the game is not at all difficult, and reinstalling your old maps after an update is worth the inconvenience.

I used to think this game was overhyped, but now I play it every day!

I’ve played this game on a ton of headsets, and I love this game.
5. HTC Vive Pro (Arcade)
You can’t see anything, the headset is too blurry.
4. PSVR
Not too blurry. But with PlayStation move, tracking is awful. I’m pretty sure 360• levels don’t work.
3. Oculus Rift S
It’s PC based, and you can easily mod the game! The wire can get annoying though.
2. Oculus Quest

I love it it is a great game over-all but it would

I love this game so much. It’s a great exercise, and it’s super fun. Being able to play online with friends is really enjoyable. I just wish there were more songs. The expansion packs seem really expensive compared to the base cost of the game. It would be great if there was some kind of unlimited pass that was subscription based where you could unlock all the songs.
I have had this since I got my quest 2. Every song sounds great and the online community is the least toxic community I have ever seen.

I play this game almost every day. It’s a must-have for a VR library. A few things I haven’t seen in other reviews: (1) This is wonderful physical therapy for healing a broken wrist and for keeping flexibility in your wrists. (2) You can easily get into a “flow state” with alpha and theta brain waves, which makes this a nice moving meditation tool. (3) It’s anti-aging for the brain on many levels—right-left hand variance; quick response; responding to percussive rhythms; and cardio exercise delivering oxygen to cells.
review_title: One of the Best VR Games

one_reviews_text: Love the game but the song limits are killing me. I bought one add on but even the add on's are limited. I'm really losing interest in continuing to play. I'm not the first to say this in the reviews but I really hope the developers will start to pay attention. The game would be so much better with more popular music selection or even custom song ability. Think Guitar Hero and the like.

Everyone was recommending this game but i never expect is gonna be that good, played it for an hour and feeling pain for 2 days, great for lockdown

You may not have a large library of songs, but the ones you do have totally keep you captivated for a long time. Me and my family switch off on beat saber constantly, and online mode only keeps me going longer. This game is definitely one of, if not the first game you should get one your vr.

This game is great, but the choice of songs, even with the current track packs available for quest 2, are too minimal!

I don’t understand how I can have struggled all my life with anything that requires the coordinated motion of both sides of the body, from dancing to golf, yet endlessly enjoy this. I think the ability to tweak settings to smooth out the learning curve makes a big difference. They’ve also nailed the simplicity of gameplay. You don’t have to spend a lot of time to figure out the game mechanic, you just have to learn to perceive and move quickly. Like Pacman, but it gives you a workout.

I think this game is great, and you are able to put in a fair few hours. i’ve been playing for around 15 hours and i still have a lot of the game to play. 
I would like to suggest to the developers to try and make a Fall Out Boys music pack. i would appreciate it deeply, and i’m sure many other people will too. thanks and i hope this reaches you.

This is one of the best games ever made with its fun, and amazing soundtracks and getting better and better in the game. Lightsabers and music are an amazing combo with electronic music. I sometimes doesn’t register your hits when you actually hit a cube but you can’t focus and get mad about that when 100 red & blue blocks are flying at your face and the hype music in the background. This game is one of my favs and is surely going to be one of yours if you buy it.

Beat saber is such an immersive vr game

When I slash away at blocks I feel unstoppable it’s really a good experience. I have one complaint though the game does get boring after a while I think it’s time for us to get custom songs through the oculus it’s self. My pc won’t run side quest or bmbf so please add custom songss.
I totally understand that this game is 29.99 Dollar$ But its worth the purchase I LOVE this game its easy for a starter and it will give you alot of games free
I love this game I just want more songs to play that people like, an is example is like stone cold by rarin

Great for exercising and jamming out but the only issue I have is the “free songs” have not been updated in awhile and because of that most people usually pick around 3 to 10 songs to constantly pick because they’re more enjoyable than others to play, but with no new songs coming out and a good chunk of the songs you want being locked behind a paywall it makes wanting to come back every day hard when you only get new songs every 1 to 4 months and you have to pay 10-20$ for the new album that you most likely only will play 2-4 out of 8-11 of the songs, (i know type can pick individual songs but it cost more without the discount).

one_reviews_text: The game is fun and a blast to play but if you don’t have a strong computer you can’t play mods or other 3 parties songs, but if you do then have as much fun as you like. What I’m saying is that you will need to have a good computer if you want to play songs that are not already on beat saber and since they don’t update the game and add more songs your kinda forced into paying for the other songs you may not want just for a fresh new block slicing challenge

I heard reviews saying this game was like guitar hero so I was reluctant to buy it, thankfully there was a demo as this is the best game I have played in years. If you like playing racquet sports I think you will love this game. Also think this game is great for a good workout. The BTS pack is superb even made me like barriers, BTS is not particularly my kind of music but it works and the levels maps are first class, IMO avoid monster cat pack bought that one after BTS personally I think it's kind of boring the music is good though expert+ maps are really boring, Monster cat rocket league is a good fun pack though

This game is amazing. It’s insane how addicting slicing blocks with lightsabers can get; it’s also insane how quickly beat saber can make your arms feel like painful spaghetti noodles. This game is extraordinarily fun, I highly suggest buying it, but you need to prepare yourself for the most sore arms you will ever have.

I should note that taking breaks is CRUCIAL in this game. I stopped taking breaks at one point because I thought I was getting really close to finishing a song, and my body punished me with extreme exhaustion and mental deterioration.

5 stars. With how fun this game is, it’s worth it to destroy your arms.

Beat Saber compares to nothing! It’s like VR was intended for this game. For sure, Beat Saber doesn’t even use half the capabilities of VR, but without VR experiences like this weren’t possible.
When they first start with VR, a lot of people want to play games they are already familiar with from 2D gaming. But games like First Person Shooters or Adventures don’t work out nearly as good as completely new game concept native to the VR.
Beat Saber is the best example for great VR game design.
It will always be one of the best games out there.

I heard about this game and didn’t think I would like it, I downloaded so I could see if it would add some fasted cardio to my morning routine and man I am hooked! I downloaded almost all of the extra songs and still want
More, that would be my only issue that and maybe being able to continually play with a song shuffle added in!

I've had the Oculus Quest 2 for a month now and have played Beat Saber the most. I have bought most of the add on packs. I wish more came with it. Also wish they would add some more hit songs than they have. I don't care much for the songs that comes with the basic game. So I don't really play them.
I'm excited to say that I have been working hard at getting higher scores and can finally complete a few songs on expert. I do wish there were more 360° songs. Also wish there was a way to add more walls, specifically the ones that make you move more and squat. I use Beat Saber as a cardio workout. It really does help me burn some calories and get my heart pumping.

I absolutely love this game, but there are some things I would like to discuss... 
I would love to be able to have custom songs, because there isn’t much to play unless you want to spend extra on music packs. Which don’t get me wrong, are great but that gets into a little more money. It’s only because the game is 50$ already , which is a fare price for the game quality. But it’s still annoying to get them otherwise.

This is honestly just one of those games that you need to have on your VR headset, as it is one of those games that everyone can enjoy with or without the DLC's. Coming from a standpoint where I bought the game as a bundle with the Imagine Dragons DLC, my opinion may be different than others. This game is so much fun with friends and family as you try to beat each others scores, as well as improves a lot of you both physically and mentally. Beat Saber has heavily increased how quickly I can read things, my reaction speed, and so much more. Its a game that is challenging if you want to push yourself to the best, while also being accessible to people who want it chill and slow. Overall, if you're even reading reviews about the product, or even looking at it, you should get it! You'll enjoy it :)

I just want to come out and say that this is one of my favorite VR games. But, there’s still some issues I have with it. For example, there’s not many songs to constantly play except for the included “extras” songs, meaning that you’d have to buy music packs, or get custom songs. Other than that, this game is great for all ages, and a MUST HAVE for VR users.

The game is amazing one of my favorite vr game’s although it gets boring once u beat all the levels you could mod the game but it does take some time and after every update the mods break so developers if you could make an online mode with any song that’d be great
I’ve bought this game and over priced music packs for the PSVR and now here and they can’t turn on app sharing? C’mon beat saber step up and fix this!

I read a lot about this game before I made the purchase and I’m so glad I did! It helps me actually be active and not sit for long periods of the day and for that now I’m more productive and less lazy haha. Wonderful workout and it’s really addicting. Definitely recommend!
I love the multiplayer feature to join some buddies or join a random lobby! Best VR game!

One of the things I like about this game is that it loads quickly so I can play on a short break from work.  And frankly, it's addictive and a short break isn't enough time.

I like most of the music and it's fun to challenge myself to higher levels.  This is definitely my favorite "movement" game.

So beat saber was prolly the best VR game I’ve ever played until the new update. I like the multiplayer feature but the new environment is terrible. I hate everything about it. The cubes and swords are so glitchy. Like songs that where extremely easy for me before are now near to impossible. I have video proof of my sword passing through a cube (in the song rum n’ bass) and still telling me I got it wrong. The video shows in perfect view the sword passing through the cube and the game saying it was wrong. Beat saber, please fix the cubes, your game is practically unplayable.

EDIT: Now the sabers will barley even recognize that the blocks have been hit. On this one I’m not blaming the game but the headset in general. The new update plus the new lack of support in most games for the quest is just TERRIBLE.
The game is fun and addicting, the only thing I really recommend adding is custom level support so people on quest and other similar headsets can play custom levels made by other players.

Beat saber is a MUST HAVE for people new to Vr. It’s in incredible experience and never gets old. The only thing I would change are the prices for new music packs, as they are a bit pricey. Other than that though, it is a great game with amazing soundtracks.

I just recently started playing and I’m obsessed with trying to get perfects on hard on this one song but can’t find any other songs that I like. Other than that I love this game and it’s one of my favorites.
I absolutely love this game! Good first time VR users and a good workout too. However I do wish there was a way to access custom songs from online or something. Otherwise its a great fun game
Game is a great work out and beyond fun, just needs a song recommendation section where people can give feedback on what songs they'd like to hear or be included in the game.

This is one of the first vr games I played. It's like rock band on speed with light sabers. Pretty cool. It's definitely not easy so the challenge level is decent. I prefer games with a story and something more immersive but it's fun to play from time to time for sure.

So this game THIS GAME is great fun. I play it stock I’ve modded it, restarted all my scores over 5 times due to breaking because of mods and the updates but now I just play the stock game no more modding and still GREAT fun! My 7 and 8 yo sons love it! I played on the oculus quest when I got that and enjoyed it and equally enjoy it on the quest 2! You can’t go wrong just buy it! If you liked DDR even just a little you’ll love this game and feel like a saber BOSS! No regrets buying this game. Of course this game is 5 stars. It’s fun for everyone and no one goes unchallenged.

You played red dead redemption, watched all of Netflix, Disney+ and Prime, maybe played GTA5 a third time cause of covid and now you feel like a lazy little piece of trash? Well those times are over if you put on your Oculus and smash all those funny blocks. You are the master of the light sabers that you wanted to become since you watched Star Wars in elementary school, that your uncle lended your dad on a ripped dvd! Man, I just can’t get enough of this game. I played it on my Rift a few years ago on the rift of a friend, the same evening I bought a Rift, checked if it worked on my PC, had a little depression and ordered a new PC. I played it a lot and then forgot about it just to realize a year later, that there is a campaign mode. I then became addicted for a few days, played every level, became bored and the rift landed in the corner again. After I sold my Rift, I was a bit sad and then the Quest 2 came out, I smashed my hard earned money in the face of Facebook and bought this. Then I bought the Quest-Version of BS and realized that it now has an addictive online mode. Jackpot 😁 I play the game every second in the lunch break in homeoffice and burn about 1000 calories a day just by having fun, which is like hookers, but way cheaper 😁.
review_title: Best casual game that I have ever played

one_reviews_text: I got this game around a year and a half ago, and I’ve continued to have an interest in it for all of that time. With the multiplayer update a while ago, I found myself playing the game almost every chance I could. It is well worth your money.

one_reviews_text: This game is everything you need from VR, fun gameplay, nice graphics, great music(of course), and the most important of all replay value (especially if you get BMBF and download customs songs that brings the game from a 9/10 to a 1000/10 I definitely recommend getting it and side quest to sideload your favourite custom songs.

This game is amazing. I've bought it a total of 2 times, for PSVR and now for Quest. The base game is alright, but once you find out how to mod Beat Saber, it's way more fun. With mods you can play custom songs by yourself, or in multiplayer! You can even get custom sabers, custom bloqs (or blocks), and you can even get mods that allow you to throw your sabers into space! If you choose to get this game, you'll probably never stop playing it.

I'm an older guy and this game really didn't appeal to me at first, they had a demo so I tried it and now I'm hooked. Its a nice entertaining way to get or keep in shape. I was a drummer in my younger years which I think helps me out as I've put up some decent scores even on hard. I'm definitely using this to get me back in shape a loose a few pounds. Like others said I do think they should include more songs. Don't let a 50+ year old guy beat you online!

So this is a great game but I want them to add the online custom songs and custom sabers because not everyone including does not have a pc or laptop to connect my quest 2 to so I want them to add that feature so people who dont have pcs or laptops they can do custom online songs.

I assume I’m not the “typical” beat saber player if there is such a thing? 50 years young mom and love playing against my 17 year old son. He’s winning on most, but I certainly keep him on his toes (or he’s just being nice?). Regardless, it’s something fun we can do together and it’s a great workout! Only downside - wish there were more songs to choose from.

Beat saber is a greath game, with a great variety of difficulties so that not so good people can play it, it has a lot of rhythm and can be a good exercise in the greatest difficulties, it also comes with around 30 songs, customization of colors and others, but when the game more shines, is when you add custom songs and the mods like custom sabers.

 Some of these custom songs are simply amazing (like Mr. blue Sky) and the sabers give a whole different vibe to the game, although it may be complicated, I recommend you try to do it, just search a tutorial.

 Beat Saber by itself is a great game, but with the custom songs and the mods, you can bring out its true potential.
review_title: A great game and you can make it better.

I love this game it's got so much good songs and makes you feel like a expert swords men when done correctly. Making me feel so cool lmao
If you haven't bought this game yet, you certainly should! It's provided hours of entertainment at only £22.99!

This game is awesome, but if you think you are going to see songs by people you like without buying them then you will be disappointed. No hate towards this game at all I barely play anything else but the songs you get when buying are not songs you know and there are not many.

Played the demo for this game and instantly fell in love. I ended up buy the full version after playing the demo twice. I will play this game until I'm sweating and my arms are hurting. The only thing that I have found disappointing about this game is the small amount of content that you get initially. There is only about 20 songs in total that you get to play and about 1/3 of them sound the same. It would also be nice to see some saber and environmental customization options (or even unlockables). All in all though it is a great game for all ages. If it was possible I would have given this game 4.5 stars...

I bought this for my 8yo birthday. I thought she loved it up until I saw her 17 year old brother getting real hardcore down with it 😂. Apparently he loves it more. The girls in our house are stoked about the BTS music add on too

Dude this game is so fun. Got my Oculus on Jan 16th, and have already beaten most songs on Expert+ and tested out some mods. Dude. I love this game. It's so fun. If you like rhythm games and your wanting to get into play vr rhythm game then I highly suggest this game. It is very fun its easy to learn, there is a great selection of songs when you first purchase it and it is also a great party game.

This game should be every ones first purchase on VR. I know it seems like “$30 is pretty steep” but I’m telling you, it has that replay ability that most other VR games are lacking. Get it, I promise you won’t regret it.
