one_reviews_text:
I love this game: it has a lot of modes, challenges, a nice and gradual campaign and very nice music for swinging your blades. 
However, the only point that makes me give 4/5 stars is the quantity and variety of songs. I get that the number and quality of the songs is good and that Facebook need money (apparently) but there are just not so many VERY good songs or with a decent variety. 
Just to be clear, I know that there are a lot of sites that can give you custom Beat Saber songs for like everything and for free but, unlikely, I spent a lot of money for my Oculus and I don't have enough to upgrade to a PC with a compatible graphic card so I cannot install Beat Saber on my PC.

Ok it's good but it's expensive if you want songs you kinda know if it was a lower price or just pay the 22.99 that should be enough plus developer disabled live sharing which says alot doesn't want others seeing to try and get others to buy it I think you should open it up for people to see and lower price of songs or give them free more so when we pay 22.99 for it already part from that it's good enough to pass time on

Pain, surgury and more drastic health problem here! I was looking for something to help me move a bit everyday. This game is so fun, than even with pain, and the need to sleep 3 hrs after, it's  the best purchase! For peoples who have nothing to loose... But need to still move a bit!  Or.. Have a lot to loose... Because.. If you hate sports.. You'll find  your personnal happy trainer here!

1 star loose because you need to install 2 things in your pc, and more to have your personnal songs.
I tried this and it was great for my workout and I love the music in this game and the multiplayer is the BEST.         If you want some good exercise, this is the game for you
This game is so addicting and it’s very good for exercise as well! The only downside is that u have to buy more songs but that’s ok.
Needs more music
I want to buy add-on when i can add my music!
review_title: Cant add my music, ony English music

one_reviews_text: If you aren’t going to take the time to mod in custom songs, do not get this game. It is an absolutely amazing game and a great experience, but the default songs are the most horrible things I’ve ever seen in my entire life. Amazing game if u get it for the custom levels, just don’t get it if you don’t plan on getting the mod.

Back when I didn’t own a vr headset I had seen videos of people playing beat saber and it was like a wish for me to be able to play it. Now that I’ve playing it for over two months I can safely say this is my favorite vr game. It’s so much fun to play whether I play multiplayer or single player. The songs they have on it are good and fun to play. The only problem I have with it seems to be with the motion sometimes but it’s an amazing game nonetheless. It would be kinda cool to add some sort of custom songs to be able to play lots of songs but it’s probably hard to do that on quest so I’ll be fine without. For people who are looking at the reviews of this game to see what it’s like I say to get the game. It’s an awesome game whether you play it by yourself or with others through multiplayer and I bet you will have as much fun as I did. :)
I recommend this game if you like songs and it’s so fun with friends we have so much fun

Beat Saber is my most favorite game I have ever played.  The music is great, I think it is fun to play, and it is a good workout.  It just makes it even better with the fact you can add custom songs.  If you are going to add custom songs, make sure that you do it carefully, and look up a how to for it.  This is my favorite game and it never gets old.

Got this solely for exercise and it's still helping me move.  Struggled with easy, worked up to normal now finishing some tunes on expert.  Don't imagine I'll ever get to expert+ as the lockdown will end and I'll be able to use my bus pass again but, until then I'll keep trying to get better.  Wish they did some sixties / seventies song packs or even some Metallica or similar but otherwise I can't fault it.  Only one of two games I play every day.

Good game, but... App Sharing not working!!!
WTF?

I work in a mostly sedentary job,  so 2 or 3 times a day I will spend 10-15mins playing Beat Saber to get my heart rate up and metabolism going - what a fun way to do it,  particularly when you add music packs with songs you know and would dance to (if no one was watching).

Amazing game. After beating the campaign I decided to try some levels on expert+. Make sure you are careful...After halfway through the "Rum & Bass" song my right knee dislocated...Now a couple days later with a knee brace I'm attempting again...10/10 would dislocate knee again.

BEST GAME EVER!! I DEFINITELY RECOMMEND TO ALL AGES. Just add more songs.
21 Pilots?
I love this game all and all but, I this that a shuffle mode would be good. Something like you pick some songs and it makes a folder like thing that you can play in a 'shuffle' mode.

No other game has quite the reputation as Beat Saber. The experience is synonymous with owning a VR headset. You’ll spend hours and hours trying to perfect the way you play. Definitely worth the investment.
I recommend this game if your into beats like pistol whip.

I don't care what you say, this gsme is great and addictive. If I take a break from my Oculus, Beat Saber is always either the first or second game I play. My only criticism is the songs. In my opinion older songs should probably be in the game. Thats all. 10/10.
As stated, it's THE vr-game. It's a great game to let others play, and when they're done, you can pick up the grind. Great game!
review_title: Easy to pick up, hard to master!

one_reviews_text: Shame on you guys for being 1 of the very few that opted out of app sharing!  If I could refund I would, just because of this..
I’m Speechless this game is so good

I’ve seen this game mentioned for a while now and saw clips here and there but had never tried VR. I knew this would be the first game I bought when my quest came in, and it definitely didn’t disappoint.
review_title: It’s as good as they say

one_reviews_text: This is by far one of the most amazing games I own the only thing about it is it doesn’t have a lot of popular songs on there and the popular ones it does are expensive and I know you can mod it but idk if I want to but it’s definitely a 10/10 game

Okay by now everybody should know beat Saber is awesome. But why oh why are there no custom Sabers. I would like to see different style blades and handles available and who wouldn’t want to play beat Saber with cyber punk style katanas I mean come on how cool would that be. Also it’s about time we had some changes to the environment I’d like to see tunnel style levels which also swerved to the left and right and up and down. I know this game has been around for awhile so it is beginning to feel a little stale and these additions would be amazing￼. But yeah it’s Beat Saber, it’s awesome. Buy it. I used to have this on PlayStation and I had the 90° levels. I don’t seem to have that on the oculus quest 2 version, does anyone know if I need to buy a particular music pack for this.
This is one of the few games that I play on a regular basis. The varying difficulties make the set list of songs both entertaining in the long run and easy for a first-time player to jump on.
Brilliant game, BUT there should be more song choices as I paid a lot for the console! Most of the sings I've never heard of!!

I’m new to VR but must say Beat Saber will always be at the top of my list. It can be played casually on Easy or Normal, but if you really want to break a sweat it could actually become apart of a workout.

I switch from Hard to Expert+ depending on the song, and either way I’ll be sweating shortly after. It’s helped me work past the muscle stiffness and I feel really agile outside of VR again.
This game is so fun that I play it almost everyday & I use this game every morning for morning ￼exercise before school

BeatSaber gets five stars. For sure. Hands down. But as a marching band nerd and lover or classical orchestral pieces, can you imagine how amazing it would be to have a symphonic playlist? You’d conduct your symphony with SABERS! How cool is that?! We all love to air drum, air guitar, whatever. Don’t you feel yourself trying to “air conduct” when you listen to your favorite symphonic piece? PLEASE Oculus. Please give us the option to purchase a symphonic/orchestral add-on pack and conduct some amazing classical works with sabers!

Pros:
1. Graphic and resolution don't matter for this game
2. Very entertaining and addictive
3. It does everything required by the game theme
Things to improve:
1. I wish it allows unlock more songs rather than having to buy new songs.
2. Although graphics doesn't matter, but I wish the graphics were better.
3. The original music come with the game are great, the extra music pack purchased later are ok. I wish there more rhythm in the music.
review_title: Literally the ONLY VR game I play everyd

one_reviews_text:
This game is amazing! It comes with a lot of songs to play and fiddle with if you don't want to get "serious" about the game (my one friend thinks all the songs sound the same, but she clearly isn't familiar with Dubstep, trap, house music). There are quests, challenges, online battles, So MUCH to explore, AS IS! 

I'm super cheap, but even I'm willing to pay for bundles/add-ons for this game. They are worth it to me. And I love watching my kids jam out while they play too. When you purchase new music it doesn't appear on the main screen with the OST albums, like I thought that would. You have to go into "Music Packs" and select the music album then download each song, by selecting each song, then it will download, and you have to go into "Music Packs" to play those songs. Which is fine, once you know where they are.  

This game can be really simple if you want to be chill and lazy. But it's also a GREAT WORKOUT! Turn on the obstacles, bump up to HARD or EXPERT, and when I tell you, "You're gonna sweat!" I mean YOU'RE GONNA SWEAT BUCKETS!! (Unless you one of those lucky freaks that don't sweat) Either way, you will get a leg, arms, and core workout. 

I feel like a Samurai, Ninja, A**a**in, Boss A** BEECHE, Don't fudge with me, because I will CUT YOU, QUEEN.... When I play this game.

A good game for a mix of exercise and competitiveness against other people's scores. A real hard game that takes time and effort with plenty of practice that makes you never want to stop. It's a good way to get your daily exercise in with a little bit of gaming too and playing it with your friends makes it better than ever. A game that takes time to get good at but is very rewarding with exercise and the sweet victory of completion as you get your new high score put up on the board for others to compete against. It's a fun game that I personally think everyone should give a try.

This app is really cool. The wife and kids all bugged and bugged me until I bought it for them -- and then immediately went back to playing moonrider.xyz for hours

Looking at many of the Quest versions of the apps I've previously purchased for the Go, it appears most of them just got the updates my Gos aren't getting anymore -- but I still have to buy them again if I want to play them on my Quest

I'm not impressed. An experience I pay $30 for should certainly be at least as compelling as a free open-source alternative, right?

Maybe these apps should have prices more comparable to their Go counterparts -- or even to the free alternatives available.

This game is seriously a banger. Literally anyone can pick it up and play it. Don’t bother paying less money for a game you think you may like, this game is well worth the $30 price tag on it. You won’t put it down.
review_title: Maybe the best VR game out there

one_reviews_text: Love the game and really enjoy playing it. BUT it doesn't support App Sharing
review_title: Great Game - doesn't support App Sharing

one_reviews_text: so cool to make some sport and have fun with music :)
It’s so simple but so much fun. Except for my 6 year old brother he keeps walking in front of me
I play this game to get my heart pumping before I go for a run. It's motivated me to get better so I can work up more of a sweat

Honestly this is my favorite game on the Oculus quest 2 so far. It gets you up and moving (unless you prefer to sit), plus gets you some minor cardio. Graphics are amazing, so Is the quality of the game in general. Just an amazing experience in general. Have fun!

Don't get me wrong. It does what it does very well. It just doesn't do very much.

The environment customisations are all very samey; any colour you like, as long as it's bkack. And the music..

Well, I guess that's what really puts me off. The range if styles is very narrow. They've really gone fir quantity over quality. I just find pretty much all the tracks irritating. (And, yes, I'm including the premium content there.) I guess I could just play with no sound, but that kind of defeats the purpose.

I get why people love this, but to be honest, the lack of customisation available means that, after just a couple of weeks, I'm bored with it already.
Been playing since launch, game is by far my favorite rhythm game of all time

When I downloaded it, it was on a PS VR. It was pretty good. Then I got a quest 2 And downloaded it. When I played it for the first time. I was thinking "wow these graphics are good" they look amazing on quest 1 And quest 2. The starter songs are a good choice. I haven't bought any new songs Yet.

Great game and exercise!  By far our most played game.  I just wish there was greater song variety.  I would love to see a greatest hits album from each genre/decade. Like a rock mix, country mix, classic party/dance mix or even by 80s, 90s etc.

I have loved the beginner experience so far, the music is great and the game play is fun. I do have concerns for the difficulty though. On my first try with no tutorial I beat country rounds on hard. On my second try I beat it on expert. I feel like the game will become repetitive quickly. I know that there is a whole modding community which may fix this for me. But I don't feel that should be necessary. Since the game is already almost 50 dollars, I don't think the base content should be beatable in such a short amount of time. I also do not like the campaign very much. I don't think random increases in difficulty are the way to go, it would be like putting spike pits on the track in a running race. I would prefer more varied songs and harder speeds but not "move your hands 650m in this song". The gameplay itself still gives it a great rating but definitely room for improvement
We need to figure out how and when to miss? That's nonsense come on

The game is great, you can tell by other reviews, but there is a small problem here. The tracking of oculas is not really made for hardcore beat saber. Expert plus songs are the hardest due to tracking not being able to hold up as quickly as a human mind process which is kinda bummer but it is not a really big problem. I wish the tracking was better because the game is great.
review_title: Good game but Pne tiny problem

one_reviews_text: No excuse for the top selling app to skip this feature.

Been playing for about teo days whenever i get home from work its a great workout, i love the song selction for built in and add on. The online aspect is not bad wish there was a game chat for before the song starts, but overall great game. (still sore from playing)
This game is possibly the best of vr

I think beat saber is a great game but sometimes the levels get boring after a while but there is a soultoin to that all you need is some money and you can get song packs which gives you more levels to play in

I'm a 40s aged adult. Don't get all these new fangled games. However, this game is brilliant.  My son got me to play it once... soon, I'd got my own head set, and play this game every morning as a 'wake me up' exercize. 
I've bought the Linkin Park pack (oh, to be young again), and am having so much fun beating my scores!
I'm now keeping my fingers crossed for more rock themed packs. (Guns n Rose's, Aerosmith, U2, Depeche Mode, and an 80s pack would be perfect... hint hint to the developers)

I absolutely love this game I play it all the time. It is a great way to get moving and its replayability is amazing. This game doesn't get old. My only complaintnis that I thought when I bought it that it would come with songs I recognized (like what comes in the music packs) unfortunately it only comes with songs that are kind of techno and created for beatsaber. You can buy extra music packs of the other more recognizable songs though and these packs are frequently on sale so it works out in the end. I highly reccomend this game.

What a game, at first I can imagine it would get a bit pricey as the additional songs/packs are not cheap and soon add up.  But once I added custome songs it was awesome, fantastic game.  The kids love it.  And anyone who things games are bad for you.  2 hours on beatsaber and you are sweating like you have run a marathon.  😂🙌🙌

This game is probably one of my best vr experiences in vr, it is amazing, you can play multiplayer and i get very competetive on hard mode songs. Even if some of the songs cost money the gane is.still incredible with multiple free songs you can play. I highly suggest this game so I am giving it a 5 star.

I bought my quest to play this app and my feeling is great!! Great thanks to developers. I think Oculus and the other VR makers should give incentive to this app.
 The only thing I want to say is that I want more official tracks not just for young people but for senior generation like me. Michael Jackson, Boney M , Irene Cara ....
And I dont want to use inofficial way like sidekick.

I am extremely addicted to this game to the point where my eyesight is rapidly decreasing  multiplayer runs very smooth on both quest and quest 2 lots of free songs. And one of the packs camella  pack is really hard. The lighting and graphics are like when the ball drops at New York during New years,it's amazing.And it has 5 difficulty levels so you will be able to find one suitable for  you.

Expert + is very challenging and that makes the game interesting and fun. Not one of the cheaper games on the oculus but as the game I have spent the most time on, good value for money!! Some more music packs would be good now though! Eminem and Jimmy Eat World perhaps?

Although it’s hard to get custom songs, it’s still a fun game and the songs provided are decent, however after a while it does sometimes get boring, or may even frustrate you, campaign is a cool feature, music packs are nice aswell, multiplayers a bit laggy sometimes but not to bad, it’s kind of on the expensive side but still worth it! Hope they make it easier to get custom songs!
I would give it five stars but I hit my dog on accident while playing because I couldn’t see him

Love this game, it's the one I play the most. Amazing for single or multiplayer.  

Beatsaber can you bring out some more music packs? Michael Jackson pack would be amazing? Thank you.

Beat Saber is definately one of the best Vr Title you Can get. The Game is absolutely addicting and also a good Workout. The only Downside is that you have to Downlad Mods and Custom Songs because there are way too less Songs and Packs to buy .....
Yes

Put my headset down for weeks after burning through super hot and some other games, decided to invest a little time in best saber... now it’s 3 months later and I’ve been playing beat saber daily. This game is an absolute blast and it alone is a reason to pick up a quest. 5 stars. Get it.
All I need to say is that it’s so good and you can do so much in it and just go Cut blocks to your favourite songs and it’s just supper fun
I enjoy this so much, but I wish they had more music!

I love Beat Saber and I play it a lot. 
But .. sometimes the tracking is not working very well. You hit a block, but it doesn't slice it, and it registers as missed.

Doesn't happen that much, but it is really annoying if you go very well, the highscore is almost there .. and then .. missed!

It is a fun game but once you master all the songs it can lose its charm. Despite me saying this I think you should give it a try because it's alot of fun. The expert + difficulty is a tough but enjoyable time and there are many different songs although some are blocked behind a pay wall. Still, the simple yet addicting gameplay is in my opinion worth it. Its loads of fun and the music is awesome. 4.5/5
The game is boring with all of the good song locked behind a paywall as well as there being no cross buy. The game is overpriced and overhyped for the mediocre experience it gives you.

So I bought BS on steam for my vive and bought it again on oculus. Bought a quest 1 and a quest 2. Can't play multiplayer with my wife because of a 1 account per multiplayer policy. Have I not given enough of my money? 

So now I have to use another facebook account for this game and juggle accounts on one of my headsets???? Really????

Poor form facebook and BS devs.
No demo needed. It is a lot of fun and can even be a small workout. You ain’t gonna regret it, trust me!

I've never played a game with so little to offer that costs so much. Most free games on my phone offer more content and a better experience. I can't return it because my son played it for a little over two hours over a couple of days, now he's over it. I played for 10 minutes but I can't get I to any of the songs. The packs are expensive... stupid expensive. Much better content out there for less money.
it is very fun just get it alright?
Family members all love this app, sweating and compete with each other is fun.  From beginner to expert levels give us something to work on.

It's a great rhythm game, the only downfall is that it could use some more songs packed in, not big name stuff just some high energy chip tunes would do!

Also for god's sake Devs, put the purchased songs in the main song selection.  Don't make us dig through the packs.
review_title: It's what you bought this thing for...

one_reviews_text: Beat saber is a super awesome game! If you are considering getting this game but don’t have your choice made yet I’d say that it’s super worth it! I have had Thai game for a few months now and am working on beating ghost on expert+ and the journey to make it as far as I have is truly one I won’t forget. I’ve always liked very games and I have quite a few games as well but no game has made me more excited to play than beat saber does!
This game is amazing but it would be great for a level editor and add your own songs for other people to try for free or a way to unlock the other song packs via campaign. Still though 4.5 stars.

Bought as a family games activity and simply cannot stop playing Imagine Dragon, love the band so it makes this game even more fun. Please please bring out more song packs. I’m not fond of the free OST packs just because that’s not my taste, but music aside this game is fun, entertaining and on high and above is a very nice workout after several repeats. Highly recommend.!

I was nervous spending 30$ on a game that was just swing 2 swords. But wow, it really blew my mind. The game is so fun! There are so many songs to choose if you get and extension called beast saber. But it is kinda hard to install. That is my only complaint. Please, more free songs. Other than that it is good exercise and makes time fly so quick because it is so fun.

I’ve bought a couple,of the packs to add songs to it but this is probably one of the first games you should get for the quest 2. Start with the demo to get a feel for free.
I play this a bit but my youngster plays it a lot. Leaves me out of breath on some of the more intense levels so it’s got to be burning up some calories.

The game is amazing but I die a lot and I’m not bad I can do expert + on a lot of songs but I never got a full combo because the saber aren’t Alline with either the controls and is very annoying and frustrating and I think I will never get a full combo because of this although it is a outstanding game but that was the onley bug but is still my fav game and it’s hard to get used to         Where I first got the game I couldn’t play normal because of this bug

The BS is a must have game. Yes, original library is way too poor and official DLCs does not offer great varaiety of songs. Still game is super fun and immersive.
If you are planing to buy this for Q2, be aware of some tracking problems (sometimes it looses track in upper right/ left corners or somewhere down near hip area) which become really noticible in expert and up difficulties. I hope they will patch this up fast.
Its a good game dont get me wrong all I want is like some previous beta versions so if they broke something you can go back in versions
This game is so much fun! ONE request - bring on more campaigns to get through!
its good
I love the game but all I want is new sabers at least

Beatsaber is an amazing game, from its campaign, to solo, to party mode and even online! There are some things which would be great to have, like built in custom songs or savers, or even just mods in general. Kind of like steam workshop!
more of a variety would be nice . you guys have a REALLY wide range of customers . i don’t see any good hip hop, rap or r & b music on here . please add more songs .

Great workout-ish game. The game is on the high end price wise for a quest game but you get a lot in it. You get the 3 OST volumes and then a couple extra albums with songs like Crab Rave. Haven’t been able to do multiplayer yet cause the game just said “No.” but i’m sure its good. 10/10
OMG LIGSABER U CSN GO SHING SHING SHING AND SHING SHING SHING WITH LAZER OMG

review_title: No question, best overall VR game

one_reviews_text: Can we get an Allen Walker package please!!!!

I wasn't sure if I would like this game and held off buying it.   But Santa bought it for me, I loved it straight away and I am loving even more a month on.

I will say that I am in my 60s and not a gamer but neither of these points is an obstacle to enjoying Beat Saber.   It is just really great fun and a great workout - I normally play it for about an hour and the time flies by.  As you play more you gradually get better and now I can successfully tackle a few songs on Expert level which seemed impossible a month ago.

Not many of the standard songs are really to my taste but there are enough and I have topped up by purchasing a couple of add-on music packs to a give a bit of extra variety.

Will I still be playing this in a years time?  You can bet on it!

I absolutely love this game, but, the sad thing is, there isn't custom songs. Only DLC Packs of specific artists, and specific songs from those artists. I get the vibe that Oculus doesn't want to add the custom songs feature for virus protection or soothing like that. Understandable. So, to respect that, I'd love to reccomend a Fall Out Boy DLC! I'd love to play Centuries, Immortals, Phoenix, and more by Fall Out Boy on the Oculus Quest Beat Saber! I highly reccomend that to be a DLC!
This game gets me sweaty and I like that it’s actually difficult at some songs I like it

I hope they get more music like Imagine Dragons and Green Day. Some of these music I never heard of. It be nice to if we can use our own music, that is if it’s possible. But getting more music with well known artists like Meghan Trainer, Pink, Bruno Mars and other is what I’m wanting and looking for. Other than that, I love this as a workout. Thanks!

Literally the most fun game I’ve ever played. Trust me when I say it’s worth the $30. Its a very unique beat game, you get points based on form, not timing. This adds a new challenge when trying out songs because you slice blocks instead of left clicking the mouse button. Normal PC beat games are all similar because its based off when to hit but in Beat Saber it’s more about where.

After playing this every day for 5 weeks, it’s by far the best value. I’ve been playing this for around 40 hours, and I’ve gone from easy being hard, to playing on expert (where you also have expert+ which is ridiculous 😂).
The campaign set you on the right path, but is so hard when nearing the end! A lot of practice is needed :)

Online is fun too, not sees any chat, only nice people
waving👋🏻

I’ve played Beat Saber for a whole year now and when I got the quest 2 it was the first thing I bought. I’ve bought a lot of games since then and I’ve played them all for a decent amount of time but I just can’t get off this game. The only problem I would have with it is the starting songs that u get, all there is are 3 OSTs, Extras and camellia songs which are hard as hell for beginners. There are music packs that you can buy but the best ones are pricy my favourites are monstercat and rocket league. Thankfully if you have a PC you can download custom songs with relative ease. Overall this game is a 10/10 even for people who aren’t a big fan of rhythm games
review_title: Best VR Game of all time

one_reviews_text: I have bean having so much fun with it so far! It’s very satisfying to slice the blocks. I highly recommend this game!

I like this game but the best part of this game are the custom songs.
But they are not in this version.

I’ve had my Quest for about a year now. And I’ve loved playing games on it. One of my favorites is beat saber. However I’ve noticed that lately, as I play the game, my Sabers go through the blocks and don’t cut them. The controllers are also not vibrating when I do cut a block. It makes it really annoying and super difficult, if not impossible to get through a single level. Also I do not believe there is anything wrong with my quest since beat saber is the only game I have problems with. So if the developers do see this, PLEASE fix this bug!
This game gets you up and keeps you moving with endless options.  The songs are energizing and there are many to add when you run out.
It’s a bummer it doesn’t come with more songs, or even popular songs by default, but it’s still really fun especially if you can play with friends around the world in the “party” mode.
Best VR Games
This would suck without mods but great game
The game is great and is fun to play but the game is limited on songs and the extra music that is currently out is a bit expensive for the starting price of the game.
This game is my absolute favorite i just wish they would add mod support for quest
After a little the campaign get tricky but the other features you can do to make it 10 times more fun.
Fun game for the whole family. I love it. My husband loves it and our kids love it.  I highly recommend it. Honestly it's a great workout too!

Without custom song support it's kind of in a dead-end for Quest. I assume it's a bit too hot of a topic to try to tackle (or mention in a review perhaps). But it's hard to enjoy fully when you know about the "modability" for pc version and it being superior in almost every way. That said, probably everyone should have this in their library, unless you hate music. The core game is great, but I will look to other platforms to enjoy it. Unless custom songs are killed off there as well and the community with it. 

The Quest hardware also shows off its pros and cons; being able to have portable play is just fantastic, but at the same time the tracking will let you down eventually. There are blind spots the hardware cannot contend with, albeit the game must have some serious coding to make the magic happen as well as it does.

I love this game, it is one of my favourite games on VR but it bothers my soul how money grabbing it is.  The music that comes with the purchase of the game is not the greatest so if you want good music you have to buy a music pack which are not cheap by any means. The updates to the game don't include anything in terms of songs and I know that I and many others feel that this is where Beatsaber are missing a trick. Provide meaningful updates which give us news songs on a regular basis and I'll change my review to 5 stars.

Great game! It’s fun, addictive, and you burn some calories. 

The wish chat could be enabled within the game so I
Could talk with other players and friends. 

Biggest complaint would be the music. I wish they had more popular music, much like guitar hero and rock band did. Licensing costs for that may force the app price to go up, but it would be worth it for a better variety of music.
This game is just so fun and even when your not that good when you do it feels awesome though you should add more songs to the game

Just started using this.... love it already. I can see how this could be addicting. As a senior I like being able to have an easy level to start with.
Looking forward to playing daily and increasing my skill levels plus getting some exercise. Worth every penny!

While play a song on online mode. I was 90,000 points above second place and i missed 2 notes and he magically jumped to being 444,000 points ahead of me. It disgusted me at the site of someone who cant play the game fair. I will never be playing my vr again. Such ashamed of people for bringing cheats to vr.
Controls are simple but the game is not, once you get to harder levels. It’s a great introductory game for the oculus.
Cool update!! I would love to Beat Saber that song in the background!!

This game is amazing, I've probably got around 80 - 90 hours of play time at least. This game is completely different from regular rhythm games like OSU for example. I do have problems with it though. The base game has a very limited selection of songs and the DLC packs are much too expensive for what your getting out of them. This is were custom songs come in. A program called Sidequest can be used to allow for custom songs to be put of the game. It has given me endless hours of fun and is about 99% of what I've played in the game.

I love Beat Saber, it’s just amazing and everyone should try it, When I use Beat Saber I just feel relaxed when I listen to the music and cut blocks to the beat, there is a toll for tired arms but when they are rested up again, I assure you that you will want to play more. Any VR headset you buy, you should get Beat Saber with it, its like a pack.
review_title: One of best music games ever

one_reviews_text: I absolutely love this game! I have always wanted to play drums but never was allowed so my inner child kinda comes out playing this lol. I have seen u can add new music on it from somewhere else but it seems so complicated I cant figure it out ☹️ So I just play what songs r already there (& my add-on purchase ones as well) and play till I run outta time. I highly recommend it, Well worth the money!!

Look, there are things I wish they would implement, but, if you want to work out and the time fly by, nothing like jumping in a multiplayer lobby and swinging away.

Please DEVs, make it so when all players are ready, the timer goes away. 60 seconds is too big a rest when trying to maintain BPM

Not much of a gamer but thoroughly enjoyed this game to the extend that I bought the quest 2 headset. If you’re not used to exercise, then this is a wonderful game to get your body moving. The more you get into the game and familiar with all the options - let alone the extras that can be purchased - the greater your enjoyment of the game will become. It’s healthy and harmless good fun for one, but it’s more than that: when casting the gameplay, it’s fun for everyone in the room. Truly a magnificent game and one which I am glad I have.

I was really interested in this game, for few years, I wanted to play it, and when I got chance, and tried it, It was really, really, really amazing ! Beat Saber is my favourite VR game, and I think when you want VR this should be one of the first games you should buy, look, maybe there are'nt that much songs to play, but, it's big fun still, you trying to improve in this game, and want to have fun, so trust me, Beat Saber is really good game, without custom songs aswell.. I really recomend this game, its really Amazing.

Katana’s and other custom sabers should be unlocked threw campaign and if you have already gotten to that point then you unlock the saber so we don’t have to get mods for sabers. Other than that this really is a game I enjoy and play a lot I have so much fun coming home from school and playing 
.
You have vr. Just buy this game. It's a must have.
There is a lot of songs on this game! But I feel like we need more free songs on there and better songs! Having a different background would be nice, instead of a dark room!

Love the game, mods break with each update, bought another Oculus to play together at the house and they don't allow single account multi-system sign in. The solution is to delete the account from one unit and sign in and buy it on another account. I wouldn't mind that too much but ALL the games on the unit from the original account go away too with no way to play them. I have a big family and don't prefer kid sweat all over my Oculus, lol. This is more of an Oculus issue but the game developer choode to allow multi-unit sign in. Not Oculus.

BMBF works again, those devs are amazing. Beat Saber is a must own game again.

Old review: BMBF single handily made this one of the top games in the Quest store by allowing countless custom made songs for people to play for free. But the devs updated the game and made it not work anymore AND have not helped out the devs who created BMBF as well to make it compatible.
It’s really good you should get it. I don’t feel like typing so this is all I’m going to say.
This is fun but there’s is a lot of songs that are locked and online and campaign but is is a fun and amazing soundtracks.
Love the game and I love the new update definitely one of the best games on vr
great variety of music and a fun form of exercise. Definitely the best VR game
I love this game but all the songs on Apple Music should be in here so editors get on that stuff and I bet so many more players will play if you can get any song ever
review_title: Should get any song you want

one_reviews_text: One thing that I am satisfied with this game is how limited the amount of options for songs. It would be nice to allow people to upload some custom levels. Other than that, everything works beautifully

This is a great game with great gameplay, and is easily one of the best vr games there is. Fair warning, you do have to pay for most well known songs, and you have to mod for custom ones. Cross-buy with Rift would also be very much appreciated. But this is still a brilliant game concept, and is certainly worth a buy.

Great game love the mechanics of it the only complaint is once you play through all the base game songs and the dlc songs there's nothing more to do, there really need to either add a custom song section to the game or bring out some more songs and please enough with the super hard technology songs they are not enjoyable to play too and I prefer actual songs with lyrics over transformer porn music
Great fun that new players can jump into. Low chance of nausea and very intuitive even to non gamers. If you get tired of the base sounds, you can always buy track packs or sideload custom tracks.

The game does not show its true colors without mods (BMBF). 

Edit: Just to clarify, the game is still worth it, even without mods.
Its worth every penny

If we just want to get more games on the beach or just get custom games it’s a little confusing but I can help you out a long way you can get tons of games like Bang mr. blue sky and believer from Imagine Dragons all these games you can buy in game but you can get a free with custom songs
Get more top 100 songs!!!!!!!!!

The only thing I have to say is that the songs are not the best. Can u pleeeeeeas make a custom song mode or something. Other than that the game is really good. It is so smooth and clean. Stellar game.

I first played beat saver on playstation vr and it was pretty good. I got it on my quest 2 a month ago and the difference is HUGE. I found that on the quest I got much higher framerates and better performance. Beat saber has fantastic graphics and the songs are very good too.

I love music and used to Guitar Hero and Rock Band... Beat Saber is a newer better version of those games.  I got the BTS Tiny Tan pack and I love it!  I like the challenge of trying to outdo your own score and get to harder levels.  Highly recommend this game.  Would like more variety of music.

It is an amazing game, fun, it's really hard to even play any other game in the store, every time I start playing something else I'm thinking why I'm not playing beat saber. Everyone loves it and even a kid can play the easier songs. It only really sucks there are not a lot of songs, even after buying all the DLCs still needs more, and you can't install custom songs without breaking the multiplayer which is everything I play.

I tried the demo on a friends headset and was sort of disappointed when I bought it that they changed the graphics on the walls from the demo to be less intimidating in the real game. Over all though best game of all time must buy! I bought like a bunch of the extra songs because it’s so fun. Some of them I’m on expert + but mostly expert, besides the walls 0 complaints and that’s like a super small thing. Way way way way way fun way worth it.

I've been into vr ever since the original rift and vive came, out and beat saber was one of those games I've wanted that entire time, my first headset was the oculus go wich didn't have beat saber so I was ecstatic when they announced the quest 2, and beat saber was one of the first games I bought, i definitely rec you buy this game IMMEDIATELY!!!
review_title: THIS IS THE BEST GAME IN MY LIBRARY

one_reviews_text:
The quest, being cordless, is the best way to play this game.
The only annoying thing is that the Playstation move controllers make if feel like you're holding the swords more than the quest controllers. In any case, this game gets 5 stars!
review_title: I bought the quest so I could play this

one_reviews_text: I have had beat saber for a while. This game has multiplayer to play with friends and family, music packs to buy as add one for the game and Different modes. For those of you who don’t know what beat saber is, it’s a music based game where you slash blocks which are color coordinated to the beat of a song. Overall this is the perfect game for people who are looking for a fun VR game.

Beat Saber obviously has a lot of hype around it. But, unlike some other games, the hype is extremely deserved. I don’t think I can name a single bad thing about this game. It gives exercise, has a great concept, good graphics, and overall an excellent experience. It’s also not one of those games you just pick up and play for an hour, than just drop it forever.
review_title: this is a really nice game!

one_reviews_text: I’ve had my quest 2 since launch day and I bought beat saber on day 2. It’s the game I have the most hours in by a large margin, and I can’t recommend it enough. It’s a fun game to play with friends and get good at, and once you are good and you start grinding X+ levels, it’s also a fun workout. This game makes me sweat, but also improves my dexterity and muscle memory. No matter who you are, I think you need this game.
This is a must have for newcomers to vr, you don’t move so there’s no motion sickness a it really hones your skills.

This game is the best. I've played it for hours and only got off when it died. It is such A great game. They have my favorite songs too. 100% recommend. I have no problems other than you can't get other sabers.

I read some of the reviews and I am not sure why people are in a way hating on the game. It is a super fun game that I definitely recommend! I do wish there were a few more song but it isn’t that big of a deal. I love how challenging this game can be. I do however have one (maybe two)request. I wish you could creat a server, invite you friends, and then make it a public server. I also wish I could play with my friends on quick play . Just a few suggestions. Overall this game is the best. I am literally obsessed. Definitely recommend.

Honestly I got the game for quest 2 and I’m loving it you get a bunch of songs for and if you want you can get custom song from other people. Although there are some bugs and some things I don’t like about the game it’s still a good game. I really recommend this game to everyone it fun to play and dance along.

Beat saber is an absolute masterpiece of a game which should be one of the first games all Quest 2 owners purchase. A great game for new players and veterans alike, albeit with a relatively limited selection of songs. The base game only comes with a few songs (I'd say roughly 30) and the only way to get more is to pay for music packs or to modify the game which not everyone is comfortable doing. A great game, but could be improved by some more levels or more genres of music packs.
review_title: Great game, but small selection of songs

one_reviews_text: I thought Beat Saber is as just a bunch of hype about nothing. I watched other people play it and though “meh”. The first time I played it I couldn’t stop. Now I play about an hour a day. You are (virtually) literally dancing with light sabers, knocking blocks out of your way to great music beats in lots of different ways and difficulties. It’s exhilarating. Also, bonus: I’ve surpassed my step goal for 25 days in a row playing this game daily.
I would put 5 stars but i personally would like more costomization in the game
I love the game I just wish they let you do any song out there not just there’s they should let you pick ones from you iTunes or something so I don’t have to buy any packs

Tldr: good game but lack of custom songs means it get repetitive quickly. Get synth raiders instead.


Ok I actually I’ve beat saber, but..... the level get boring quickly the add on packs are expensive and not very good, and you cannot add custom songs.

Now while synth raiders doesn’t have the cool light saber concept and isn’t quite as calorie burning this is more than made up for with the ability to add custom songs.

Once you get good at the game, or maybe not, it gets soo much more fun. I love playing it! If I could ask for something in the next update it would be mutiplayer party chat in game and a custom song menu.

This is fun game to play with the family and great introduction to VR gaming! Be prepared to invest into some of the song packs though. Luckily these are in the discount at the moment, so Imagine Dragons and Linkin Park here we come!
review_title: Great game to get started with VR

one_reviews_text: So I got my Oculus quest 2 for Christmas 2020 the next day I bought beat saber because I lived the have when I tried it on my friends headset and I feel in love. Best Saber is great for me in quarantine because it helps me get my exercise in and I get to play with my friends.
While you playing sometimes it takes away your score because I played before I was out for 400K then it took me out to 200K

Let my wife try this game on the quest 2 now she wants her own headset and the game, she says it’s so we can play together but I think it’s really so she doesn’t have to share, so be careful you might just end up needing more headsets to play this game lol

Multiplayer is kind of toxic just a rhythm game classic vr Music packs for anybody from a boycotting BTS fan girl to a dubstep obsessed six-year-old pretty fun but the best thing is is that you need a very big space to play it and that’s it

This game is addictive, every time you play it you you try to go for a new high score and playing it with friends is even better. I play with my sibling a lot and we play and practice to be better then the other.
Anything less than 5 stars would be a sin.

More music is needed desperately however. What is available is great, but not nearly enough to keep people interested and playing once everything is mastered. Other than that it is possibly my favorite game.
Fantastic game. I can’t complain about it and it’s pretty fun. I beat ghost without any tracking losses

I love the game. My family and I are very competitive and use party mode to keep track on who has the high score for the different sounds and difficulties. My only complaint is the music library selection is pretty small by my standards. Please create more dlc! If more content is added then I’ll change to 5 stars.

This game is very good but it is only not boring when you have more than the OST songs so I would get some other music packs with it. Very good game recommend it to everyone with a VR headset. Check out my YT and see how the game is.😁👍
Beat saber is the best game I’ve ever played and I would recommend it for almost anyone who has a VR. The amount of songs that you can get astonishes me and I love playing everyone of them.

This game is one of the games that I play all the time its fun and you exercise its super fun playing online to and to play with your friends I recommend this game if you want to get faster reflex’s and have lots of fun
I bought it for 30 dollars and my sister wanted to play one of the bts songs but i had to pay i allready did

This game is completely bonkers. In the first few days I played 35+ hours. The base game content is okay, but custom songs provide unlimited fun. The intial setup of custom songs is a bit tricky but is actually just following like 10 steps. After getting custom songs you can go into further modding like mapping extensions or noodle maps. Also PinkUtils is a must for a PC-like experience. Go check it out now! Why are you still reading, just buy it already!
review_title: This game is insane and perfect

one_reviews_text: This game is why I got my quest 2. The only problem with it is that it needs more songs, but this isn't possible due to licensing and stuff like that. I went in and modded the game to where it's like running the pc version, and this game is the best thing ever created. I highly suggest watching a few videos on how to install the modded version and go that way. This game is awesome

Beat Saber is a classic VR game perfect for new and experienced players. I find myself daily picking up my headset and playing this game for quite awhile. It is also a wonderful game to get a workout in and stay active (especially during quarantine). However, the song choices are extremely limited and buying song packs is kind of ridiculous when you’ve already bought the full game. Though it’s a tedious and confusing process, I have installed many custom songs onto my game and absolutely love it! Beat Saber’s developers should definitely make adding custom songs an easier (and game-supported) process.

This game is insanely addictive and I love it but ... I have one thing I would like to ask to add now I know you have already gotten plenty of requests for this but here we go Custom Songs it would bring so much more excitement to the game and I can understand why it may not be added yet it takes time for you to be able to see what songs are allowed and not allowed just like stealing a song so would very much like that but otherwise game is awesome.
review_title: This Game Is Awesome DEVS PLEASE READ

one_reviews_text:
Perfect mesh between guitar hero and star wars. This game keeps you active and engaged while listening to some of your favorite songs. My wife started on this game and absolutely loves it. Great for beginners.

I think it would be great to see some upgrades however. Id recommend the developers improve the amount of sound tracks. For example, it would be great to see a radio station or mix up genres while you play with other people. Otherwise great game!

So I am over 50 and definitely not a gamer and  still have so much fun with this game. I think any age would love it and the music gets you moving.  If there was anything negative at all, would be the lack of music packs. I would love an AC/DC, Pink Floyd etc. Still, the Imagine Dragons is an amazing pack and worth the purchase. If you are looking for a must have first game this is it!

THIS GAME IS ABSOLUTELY AMAZING!!! Over since I’ve downloaded this and played my first level, my reaction time and coordination is better than ever!! There will be times when a bug comes up when im playing but they aren’t really anything big to me. But one of them that i notice the most is when my saber phases through a block and it not counting, or it would count it as a wrong swing which it clearly wasn’t. But overall i really recommend this game. 10/10 for me!!
review_title: A really amazing and fun game

one_reviews_text: This is a very good game, but it obviously has its downs. First of all I wish you could get more of a variety of custom songs, because there are those payed ones but I wish they had more. And more difficulty’s, but I mean its still a great game and would recommend this to anyone who wants some good sight reading.

Beat saber was one of my first introductions to VR several years ago, and now that i own a quest, one that i gladly can play to my hearts contents. Overall the music is good, although it would be nice to see a bit more variety in the "included" packs. Pop Stars is definitely one of my favorite tracks, especially since it has vocals, unlike many of the other included ones.
Happy to see the devs making improvements consistently, even if they pull a feature now and then to maybe reintroduce it later.

My only, ONLY complaint for this game is the limitations on the songs. Because before purchasing this I saw a plethora of videos of other people playing doing popular songs and I still don't know how that works yet. Overall super fun game and Ive really enjoyed playing it so far.
review_title: The greatest game I've ever played

one_reviews_text: I have bought this game twice firstly on PSVR but now on Quest 2.  If you haven’t played before I would recommend playing the campaign first as this introduces you to the different skills needed for variants in the solo game.   Although there are easy levels flexibility and stamina are needed for the harder levels.   You can have hours of fun dancing round and slicing through the blocks and if you are competitive and what those high scores it’s quite addictive.  If you enjoy rhythm games then you’ll love this game but if your serious gamer expect sweat and tears.

This game is very fun and great for showing people who are new to vr. Even after going through a lot of work to get custom songs because the normal songs suck it can still get very boring after a decent bit of play. Good game though a do recommend if you are new.
Ok, whyI wanted an Oculus Quest 2 is because beat saber and fun. But beat saber needs custom songs. Its just sooooo short of a catalog even with extension packs. Please consider. But it is fun!

By far, my favorite VR game so far. As many state, it would be great to have more songs. That stated, when you abs renin the zone the songs dont matter much anyways as you are focused on all the incoming stuff to slice.
I only have beat saber and rec room on my oculus so far but I live beat saber it is a nice exercise game and fun to play especially during quarenteen
We were playing like 24/7. We won many times and the songs are great!
i like this game a lot very fun with lots of updates!

Great fun. It’s part of why I bought the Quest. But there are so few songs in the base game and adding custom songs isn’t supported by Oculus like it is on other platforms. Add-ons maybe help but only if you like those set songs.
I bought my VR headset only for this game if that tells you something it’s worth buying very worth buying
review_title: I spent over 300 for my VR headset

one_reviews_text:
This is a fun and addictive game, guarantied to much time to spend on this game ;-) Nice game to get into VR and experience the possibilities of this technology. 
Cool for sure!

I love this game since at the start it might be hard but the more you play the more power you get I used to only be able to complete Normal and maybe Hard but now I can do Expert and expert plus! This is a necessity for the Oculus Quest I just wish I could get custom songs on it easier since I really want to see what songs the community created. to make it a 5 Star review add custom songs to it then it’ll be perfect game!!!
review_title: 100% all the way for this game except...

one_reviews_text: After some play time, playing the same songs over and over get very boring. Modding and getting custom songs is a MUST if you want to keep it fresh and entertaining.
review_title: One of the best games ONLY IF

one_reviews_text: I love this game. I put on my ❤ rate monitor and burned 461 calories in 45 mins of play. Definitely great work out  and a whole lot of fun.
review_title: Beat Saber is my new fav

one_reviews_text: I love beat saber it's the reason I got an oculus quest but the game needs more songs and free mods that you don't have to use third party software. Overall beat saber is an awesome game and you should buy it if your thinking of buying it.
review_title: It's good but It needs more

one_reviews_text: I love beat saber I just wish it was easier to add more songs like custom songs like I wish there was a community tab and you could download songs from there that would make the experience 10 times easier

Not my usual game at all. But I absolutely love it. Its so addictive. You start off thinking that there's no way you'll ever complete the game. You can't imagine how anyone can play the levels on hard. But day after day, week after week, month after month, you won't believe how good you get. This game is fully playable for months and years. Once you have 'completed' the game, it is by no means over...

I bought my oculus quest 2 last Tuesday and beetsaber was one of the first games I downloaded. I have nor been able to put it down except when I need to take a break or let the headset charge. It can definitely use more songs but ultimately the oculus quest doesn't have the greatest ammount of memory. its processing power can make it difficult to play harder levels while keeping track of hand movements but setting options such as static lights can help make for more processing dedicated to your playing rather than aesthetics. Wish I could play against my ghost thought.

So for all the people who are saying there are no good songs you can buy a USB A to USB C cable for like $15 and then you can have Sidequest, for tracking I don't know But I haven't had any issues. I LOVE this game I just bought the Imagine Dragons which Makes it even Better and the customizability is Great so I just love this game.
review_title: One of the best Quest games.

one_reviews_text: This is the most fun rhythm game I have ever played, it’s got a lot of songs to start you off with and there’s a campaign mode to train you in order to get you familiar with the games difficulty, and there are music packs you can buy from popular bands. My only complaint is that the only way to get custom songs is to side load them (which is pretty dang hard). I wish that in the future they add a creator mode where you can create your own songs and beat maps! Overall 5 stars
review_title: It is  G R E A T

one_reviews_text: I bought ghis gamr before christmas. I kinda liked it and promised myself i would take camelia-ghost hard. 4 days went by and i could finally did it fail free SS. This game is very good if you dont motivate much or train bc if you tryhard its probably gonna get hot. Might also want to invest in vr-covers but not necessary
I don’t think it’s possible to have bought a Quest without knowing about Beat Sabre in advance. It deserves every 5 star review to be honest. Hours of fun and highly addictive.

When I just got done setting up the Oculus Quest 2, I don't know what type of VR games to play. There were so many reviews and YouTube and many games had more cons than pros, but the ones that others enjoyed just wasn't my cup of tea. Then I happened to stumble upon Beat Saber. I was lost for words. Seeing a basic block game was surprisingly put so well together and I had a liking for the game so quickly. With sound tracks that are really catchy to songs that everyone know and love. It was a really fun game to play and I haven't put down the headset since. Beat Games has reached its peak in 2020 due to COVID-19. Even though we are still living with a tragic virus, we still can have fun with boxes on our faces slashing virtual blocks. Now that Beat Saber introduced multiplayer, I spent a whole 4 hours playing non-stop even if I had so much fatigue that I could barely move my arms. I really recommend this game. It has the best experience for newcomers of VR. I hope that everyone gets a piece of enjoyment that I had and still have to this day. I can't thank the Devs enough for this wonderful game that we call Beat Saber.
review_title: A Real Start to Virtual Reality.

one_reviews_text:
The game is amazing, gets you started in the morning to the beats!

Add 1kg wristbands and you may even build some muscle too :)

I play on hard only and instead focus on big swings and smashing as hard as possible. This together with the added 1kg on each arm gets the blood pumping good!

Can highly recommend!
review_title: Fun way to get excercise during lockdown

one_reviews_text: Not only is this game absolutely amazing to feel, and play! It also can really get you moving! Songs are high quality, and visuals are equally as good. Online is a blast too it really gets you into the song just to beat the competition! Only complaint is that if you get too into it making very large motions your controls may briefly freak out then come back resulting in missed notes. Must buy for the quest 2!

This game never seemed fun to me when watching videos but playing it is some of the most fun I’ve had. The soundtrack is one of the best and it is very fun to slice blocks as the formations change a lot every level and difficulty. The campaign has really cool challenges and there are some fun modifiers to mess around with. In practice mode you can change the speed of the song which can make for some extra fun gameplay. Overall it seems very surface level but the amount of little things you can do for each individual song is awesome.
review_title: One of the Best VR games

one_reviews_text: I like this game a lot, its my daily excersize and I stream it on discord, but I have two problems with it. 1: Camellia Songs and their notorious difficulty, I can beat every song on expert except a few + EVERY CAMELLIA SONG, anytime someone selects a camellia song in multiplayer I have to scramble to get a different song and if one is selected I DC because again they are HARD. Tone down the difficulty, please? | On To 2: the multiplayer. If I miss a single note I am immediately in 4th. Like excuse me wtf? Its a single note why do I get punished so hard. Also if you dont tone down camellia difficulty atleast make a setting for multiplayer that is “everything except camellia” or something like that. Other than those two things this is a great game and deserves 5*s

I honestly fell in love with this game before I ever had an Oculus. I caught a glimpse of a YouTuber playing the game and thought that it looked so fun! I finally got the Oculus Quest 2 last Christmas and this was the first app I purchased. Didn’t need the demo. I’m a HUGE fan of dance games and just music in general (I have the full catalog of Just Dance and the Michael Jackson experience on Switch/Wii just to give you an idea)... I’ve played this game everyday since.

This is a great game that I have been playing for a while but there isn’t that many songs that come with the game. I would seriously recommend getting custom songs because it’s a lot more fun to play. There is extra songs that you can buy in the normal game but I don’t recommend getting them since they are expensive and you can probably just find them in the custom songs list anyway. I’m giving it 5 stars because it’s a really fun game and custom songs makes it much better.

The complaint I have about this game is my score. If I could just stop dancing I'd score better. The game is fun and, if one dances through the songs, there's more exercise to be had. I guess it's a trade off. I am actually losing weight, 10 pounds in two and a half months. Even my husband likes it and he doesn't like dancing. Great focus game. I guess I'll have to spend more on new music packs. Maybe Oculus can discount them?

First game i bought and i realy dont regret it, replayabiliy is something realy important for a vr game because if you dont want to spend too much money for a game that last about 2/3 hours it might be hard to find a good game that value your money. Plus it make you move, which is realy good too. Only downsides is the fact you cant have custom songs and that if the standar music of the gsmes isn't your cup of tea you might want to buy a music pack too

I’ve played rhythm games for years (DDR, beatmania iidx, pop ‘n music), and the experience playing at home has never measured up. It’s always either come down to bad controllers, too much noise or both. Beat saber on OQ2 largely solves those problems, especially the noise. On top of that, it’s an incredibly fun and deep game. It’s basically the game I’ve been waiting for. Totally worth the price of an OQ2 just for this game. I highly recommend if you’re into rhythm games or have an interest in active games.

i personally like the game but i have a problem and i need help. so i wanna live stream my game but it says “the developer has disabled live streaming for this app” but i never disabled it now the question is how do i enable the live streaming settings because i dont now how to do it and if anyone dose know how to do that it would help.

The game is wonderful! The traffics are amazing there are so many awesome songs and difficulties. And it can be customized down the the color of the swords. Make sure to take breaks while playing because it’s really easy for you arms to become sore. Especially in expert and expert+ and ESPECIALLY in single sword mode. But this game is most definitely worth the money. You can play with friends, online, solo or play the campaign. You should be warned if you have epilepsy tho but they warn you about that in the game. They thrust cover all safety bases!

I’ve played this game since it originally was out on the Valve VR. It’s probably one of the most fun, comfortable and what feels like never ending game. You can play a wide variety of songs in different modes and difficulty’s which will give you hours of playtime even per song just practicing to get to the next difficulty.
review_title: Fun, hours of playtime, tons of songs

one_reviews_text: I loventhis game. It's the main reason I bought an oculus  BUT the music is very limited. Why not add more music both free and to buy. I also think you should make it where you can bring ur own music. Also might be fun to upgrade the avatars.  I love the game tho.
I do not like bts but still a good game
review_title: Good game but I hate Bts

one_reviews_text: I really love this game, it’s so fun and amazing to play but i would really like there to a be a custom songs option for beat saber to have replay vaule
I feel like you guys should make a public library where ppl can just make and put up their own custom songs

Fun but very dull after a short while, original songs are one of the worst included in any music game i have played, while the idea is briliant, there should be more elements added to the motion patterns and more backgrounds and effects, if i had to choose now, i wouldnt buy it again.

I have never liked rhythm games... But I'm playing this every day now as part of my exercise routine. I've historically had no sense of rhythm. Never played any difficulty over medium on any guitar hero game, never got hooked. But now I'm slashing expert and expert+ beats every day and I LOVE IT!
I’ve played this game for about 1-2 months and I’ve gotten really good at it. It’s really fun but I haven’t been able to do any mods yet bc I don’t have a cord yet. But I hope I can soon!

Fun game and great for the family or just want to show VR off to friend’s then highly recommend Beat sabre.
Also great for a work out. You will get sweaty.

I love this game, it has some similarities to DDR and guitar hero. Another thing is that when I saw Star Wars as a kid I thought I’d never experience what it would feel like to weild a light saber. Beatsaber has haptics that satisfy that long held desire! I will say that occasionally the sabers disappear if you hold them out of the field of view which causes you to “miss” the block which is a little frustrating but by en large it’s an incredible game.
Lots of great fun. It is a workout but it is fun to try to beat the score and levels! One day ill be an expert or expert plus! Ha! It would be nice to have more game options for songs though.
review_title: Great work out and you feel like a Jedi

one_reviews_text: Worth the money.
I was disappointed to learn that you can't share this app with family members.

Probably 90% of experience in this game, it can help to get needed daily activity. The best update was about online. I guess only online can help me play in this game almost every day about 1-2 hours. Hope 🙏 dev team add more activities in online mode.

Truly lives up to its reputation as VRs killer app. It's easy to learn hard to master fun for just about anyone and it's a great way to get active. Music packs are a bit pricey but I'm getting plenty of mileage out of the included songs. Getting into a flow state while playing is the best.
Cool game tis is fun

So this game has been up for a while and has changed a lot. Like A LOT. I love this and recommend it to people who have a strong hatred on boxes with arrows and whoever is energetic enough to beat something that is six minutes long. But the new latest update kind of broke something. 

So I’m playing a round of multiplayer ( servers just opened up for me ) and I lost. But , I could still play. I thought they did this so you could join in on the fun until I turned around. It was still going through and by the time it was finished I was still on the leaderboard. I unlocked immortality pretty much. I tried this out a couple of times and it happened again and again and again. Probably worth fixing as it could act as a cheap way to win a game. I’m not sure if other players saw that it happened, but yeah I’d say worth a look at. 

Over all, such a good game and I love it! Looking forward to more future updates ( if they every happen, which they might..probably ). 

:)
review_title: Who knew smashing boxes could be so fun?

one_reviews_text:
This game is stupidly addictive and so fun. All of the music is fantastic and thrilling. One of the best games I’ve ever played, and one you really should play yourself. I’m a pretty big guy and I’ve had this game for 4 weeks, I’ve lost 23lbs and I only play 1-2 hours a day. Trust me this game is worth the price and more. 

-Five Stars
review_title: Do yourself a favor, get this game.

one_reviews_text: I just got an oculus quest and I know i was going to get this game just to see what the hype about and I got it probably the best game ever I am on at 24 seven and I’m still not getting sick of it trust me it’s the best game ever you need to get this.it’s very easy to learn trust me just buy it you’ll thank me later Also GET IT NOW

Beat Saber has truly re-engaged me as a gamer and increased my Physical Activity and my  Love of Music! Remember it is called Beat Saber so stay on the beat😂.

I Absolutely recommend this game! If you don’t buy Your Favorite Music Pack you are missing out. 🧐

Online Play is competitive and Even More Fun! Again, Why are you still reading this Review....Buy it Now!😊

This game is as good as everyone says if not better the graphics are second to none I have never experienced any sort of lag and this is basically the only game I play now. Highly recommended the paid songs are good but I think they are a bit expensive for what they are other than that can’t complain you will not be dissatisfied

i used to enjoy playing beat saber all the time but now its just got boring and frustrating, i could be hitting blocks in the right way and it would say that it was the wrong way, ill hit notes on time but they count as a miss, its just frustrating now

This game is phenomenal to not only experienced Vr players but also to new people. I recommend this as the first game you download because boy is it fun. You can burn plenty and plenty of calories and find yourself lost playing a variety of songs. Get. This. Game.

First of all - the game is awesome, thanks a lot!)

I got this game as soon as I got VR. This game eases you into VR in a fantastic way and can be addicting. Way too addicting.

I've been wanting the game since it came out and I got it last Christmas and it's way better than I thought and it feels good to play because most games when you get better you dont really feel it but in this tou can feel your self getting better and better at harder and faster songs

At first I didn’t understand why people liked it so much, so I decided I would give it a try since I just got my VR headset.I have been playing for a couple days now, and it is definitely one of the best VR games I own.would 100% recommend for anyone getting into VR.

Beat saber is just over glorified. Never pay $30 for this game. synth riders has more songs, better mechanics, developers that are invested in the community, BUILT IN CUSTOM SONG SUPPORT, better online mode, mics in the multiplayer lobby, and doesn’t try to charge you for an overpriced game as well as $3 per INDIVIDUAL dlc song that should already be included. This game would maybe be worth $20 before they destroyed custom song support, but not any more. Just buy synth riders, you won’t regret it

one_reviews_text: I bought it as my first VR experience, and indeed it is a good entry game. You can spend hours playing it if... you can stand the soundtrack included.  The music is simply awful and makes the experience not enjoyable at all. Also the extra packs you can buy are targeted to a very young audience. But, the vr scene is increasingly populated by users who were born before year 2000, who do not like the music in the app. I wonder why nobody seem to care for these new users. I would give a higher score if it were not for the awful music included
I really enjoy this game! Honestly, I was a little hesitant to buy it since I figured all of the good songs were DLC but it had some good default toons!
Main reason why I bought the quest 🥳. Loved the concept! Everything is perfect!

So much fun and easy to learn. Although once you’ve done all the songs it can get a bit boring al you need to do is ramp up the difficulty and then if you can buy some of the add ons to play the music you like!

I got the oculus to get me moving. Beat Saber is an amazing way to trick yourself into doing exercise. It’s so much fun

I find myself looking for games with great replay value.  Beat saber is one of the games I've been looking for. Irs very fun and you can train and work onto harder levels. You can also challenge yourself with others online which is very fun. Overall it lasts very long and is super fun.

The songs were pretty good but if I could talk to the owner of the game privately it would be great. I thought for the money it costed it was going to be an amazing game. For me sadly I had a horrible experience.

After nearly 3 months of playing I am here to announce that it has effortlessly entered the list of the best games I have played in my life.

This game is amazing and keeps you immersed in the game for hours even if you are not the most into the exercise section it is also really good to let friends experiment and enjoy the world of virtual reality.

The only thing missing is official moding support for changing the lightsabers and adding more songs from the community.

Really recommended 999999/10

One thing you should add is a custom song because then you could play whatever you want. This wasn’t the longest review but I DEFINITELY RECOMMEND BEAT SABER!

I absolutely love beat saber there are no words i can say that actually describe how good this game is. I do wish that custom maps and mods were allowed tho would be kinda cool to have a scythe while playing Megalovania lol. Other than not having mod support the game is flawless.

Ok so right know there’s a glitch for the online game mode so when you die you keep playing  I’dont know if this is on purpose but you can’t die at all like I’m typing this during a game and I’m not losing so please fix but if it’s on purpose then keep it

one_reviews_text: The gameplay is fun no doubts, but this game lacks official modding support for maps, sabers, boxes. Also, there are a lot of good songs without copyrights (for example, on "NoCopyrightSounds" on youtube) which could be officially supported. Therefore I give 4* instead of 5.

I love it, it's fun but there's something I can't get out of my mind. Do I have to buy it on steam to download songs and stuff? If I do, then I'm not wasting money. At least put a few more songs for the people who don't really spend money on music bundles or what. But the thing is, is that I love this game. I play it almost every day. I recommend it!

It's a great game, there isn't much I could really think of improving. Only suggestion would be that they would add custom song support. You can do it with side quest and stuff but it would be nice if it was easier to do.
The range of songs is little disappointing for someone who isn’t really into electronic beats. But found a couple that are doable. It’s quite challenging and I am enjoying it.

Giving 1 star due to the poor music selection which puts off on playing

 the music with the full game is just electronic clubbing music unless u pay for better songs ( of which there is very very little - still mostly electronic clubbing)

The game is quite good, but the music is almost all awful, is almost all the same kind and if one wants to listen something better has to buy extra music packages that are quite expensive and maybe just to have 4-5 songs extra. Honestly lock down and exercise restrictions, this game has been invaluable to me. 

It’s a must buy for any human but then huge negative is song choice. Literally an excuse for printing money and they’re not.

This game is so fun. I love dancing and it’s similar. I’m also really competitive so it’s really fun trying to beat my high score and rank up on the leader board. Pretty much the only game I play! PLUS it’s a great workout, you’ll be sweating on the harder levels!
The face of VR games and can be played by almost anyone. Endless fun and a good exercise.
Really enjoy this game. Haven’t played it very long, but so far it’s the game that I go to when playing on the VR. Challenging and gives you a good workout while playing.

👍🏻
