one_reviews_text: I mean, there's a reason why it's popular. Just saying.

So, the Quest 2 was my first VR headset. The game set up relatively easy and was super quick to get into some some songs. The game is overall easy unless you start putting it on expert modes, but then again, it’s expert mode. One of my favorite games and I can see myself playing this for a long time. One thing I want is for them to allow you to stream it. If you want to you have to connect it to your pc and buy another camera and another audio output, other than that I’m in love with it.

I love this game so much- I can play it for hours. I especially like playing with other people online. The one thing I wish they would add is the ability to friend people. Sometimes I’ll spend an hour playing with someone but then my oculus will run out of battery and I never get to see them again :(

Ok so I finally figured out to switch off fail so putting an extra star. Two stars docked for not giving a few more instructions for newbies and the lack of feedback to customers. Guys, when you have been working all day, you don't  want to have to go through the overwhelming control panel. A few simple tutorial screens would be nice. Some don't bother with instructions but maybe they have more time to play with.

I wanted to review a couple of music packs I bought. The Timbaland music pack is absolutely fantastic if you are looking for moves that make you feel like you're dancing with the music. It doesn't try and trick you, it just makes you move with the music in a fun and dare I say it, musical way. The choreography is good and works well with Beat Saber. I fully recommend it and congrats to the devs who synced the music with the game.

Imagine Dragons, on the other hand, was disappointing. Here you aren't dancing, you are beating, beating a drum, and it is pretty mechanical and, for me at least, pretty boring at times. I lose concentration and miss. The levels are pretty badly designed too. I can barely hit an S in hard in most of the titles and Extra is impossible. In other packs, I hit S consistently and can cope with Extra hard.  It is not all bad. There are some nice moments. But if you are looking to buy a pack and not sure which one or ones, then avoid Imagine Dragons unless you dig beating a drum, and go for Timbaland for a more musical and dance experience.  Yet to try the other packs.
review_title: Yes, you can turn off fail and enjoy!

one_reviews_text: I enjoy this the most of the games tried so far. I can only play sitting down but this hasn’t affected my enjoyment.  I wouldn’t normally listen to this type of music but it’s ok for the purposes. There’s a few extra packs I like. Looking forward to more coming out.

It's a bit frustrating getting used to the moves and the speed but it feels great when you can finally get through a particularly hard level. The music is a little young and 'club' type for me but it's a great tempo for the game.

Beat saber is the best game to lost weight if you really want to . I have been playing for 2 years and I lost so much weight by playing it and the new maps just made more fun . It’s worth 10/10 and it’s worth your money for every game maps and songs. Why not give it a go yourself
review_title: Beat saber review is the best game

This is the perfect game to open your mind to virtual reality. I would highly recommend this game for any first timers or people that loved rock band or guitar hero growing up.

Yes
I only wish that with the $30 that you pay, you would be able to pick at least one album for free. Also why no cross play to pc?

The game would be perfect if they would just add the custom song search bar for extra songs. The songs that come in the game packs are not that good. I'm only giving it 4 stars because of the song selection. You have to keep modding it every update in order to play better custom songs.
There's not much to cause motion sickness and no walking about needed. Music is solid. Easy to learn and fun to master. Great pickup for your first outing to VR Environment

Great game ngl but, custom games need to be emplemented. This game has been out for a while and everyone has to go through a long process to get custom games which is what most people expect it to have. No hate just a massive suggestion.

Pros:
Decent amount of play time just in the Campaign 
Can mod for custom songs
Can be a decent work out

Cons:
Cant play multiplayer if you have modded the game
Stupid price for the add on songs when there is 2 good ones at max
Most modded songs are terribly made.

BUT most importantly, once you start getting onto the higher levels like expert the hand tracking will constantly mess up, i think due to how fast you have to move your hands, causing you to constantly mess up and go insane because you know you hit it but it wont register.

To sum it all up this is the first game that makes me want to die a slow painful death but if you can look past that minor detail then its a great game.

The game is fun and keeps you active, I whack on a sweat belt and it definitely gets you sweating! The only downside is that there aren’t enough music options, I’ve bought two music packs, imagine dragons and linkin park... I was hoping for a one republic pack but they don’t have it. More music options would be great!
很有节奏感，老少咸宜，不过场地还是要够了才方便玩啊，过程中手还你小心甩到墙壁，it really hurt

Difficulty in this game includes arrhythmic blocks, movement too fast and rapid to tell what direction an arrow is pointing in on the 4th + attempt despite it being the point of the run, and swapping of dominant hand without notice.
Yes, I can beat it. I promise. I've done darkeater midir over and over solo. 
This though, this is tedium, not difficulty. I had a lot of fun earlier in the game. It's not worth finishing though. I don't want to memorize the game's 7th recycling of a song so that I can spit out the random notes that don't fit the over-used song's rhythm with a sudden-death playstyle. I can't. There's too many other good games. I wish they'd finished it differently, but as it is, I would rather have my money back.

I absolutely love this game! At first I wasn’t sure about it, but I fell in love with it in the demo and I still love it after buying it. I also played the free trial of Supernatural, but I think this game is way more fun. I hope more songs are added, however I’m not bored of the ones on there yet. I highly recommend this game. Also, for those people who say you don’t get a workout from this game, I disagree. This game can give you a good workout. Some songs and/or difficulties and options give more of a work out than others.

For what I consider the rhythm game Big 3 (Beat Saber, Synth Riders, and Pistol Whip. Honorable mention to Thumper. Avoid Audica unless you are a super diehard rhythm fan; no developer support, community is lackluster, and overly complicated gameplay), this ranks number 3. Only because the developer support is spotty (new song pack regularly, but there are a number of features promised over a year ago that have not materialized) and there is no native custom song support. They should also increase the graphical fidelity on the Quest 2 to more closely match the PC counterpart. 

And frankly, I'm nitpicking. Beat Saber is otherwise a very, very good Rhythm game and, to a lesser extent, exercise game. Easily in the top 25 on the Quest!
review_title: Top 3 Rhythm Game on the Quest!

A wonderful VR rhythm game that is, was, and should be everybody's first VR purchase. This game really put VR on the map and the hype is real. With great motion tracking, some good tunes, and a good challenge, this game is nearly a perfect package. I only dock this one a star due to a lack of modes and music (however this is subjective because there is a campaign mode, solo mode, online mode and leaderboards). While at first it seems like there are plenty of songs with plenty of DLC, the library just does not reach the heights of other popular games in the genre. That being said, it is undebatable that this is a must buy for any VR owner!

one_reviews_text: I love this oculus app because it has great songs and I can play with my friends. I love doing this before dinner and on the weekends. This is my favorite app on oculus, mostly this is the only game I play!

If you have any sort of VR headset, this game needs to be in your library. Graphics are amazing, the gameplay is fantastic, and there is a steady stream of content flowing from the developers. Now if we could just get custom maps onto the Quest 2 somehow, this game would be PERFECT!

A guide so far on available music packs that I’ve played:

Monstercat Pack: highly recommend this pack. Basically a better version of all the original OST’s.

Rocket League: buy it if you have Rocket League or if you are looking for an intermediate challenge on Expert+. Glide is a good song for beginning Expert+ players.

Green Day: don’t buy it unless you’re a Green Day fan. Honestly, even then it’s pretty disappointing. Holiday was really the only song I had fun on, everything else feels tediously slow.

Timbaland: only buy if you’re learning Expert+ or a Timbaland fan. I beat every level except the last one on the first try, and I only lost because I hit my desk.

Linkin Park and Imagine Dragons: Highly recommend these packs, especially if you’re looking for songs that aren’t dubstep but still fun to play (unlike Green Day). The maps feel fresh, and they give a really good challenge.

I first saw this game on YouTube a few years back, and when I bought my quest 2 for my first VR headset, it was the first thing I bought. It lives up to all the hype, and offers both an immersive and unique experience. On top of all that, once you start to try harder difficulties your arms will get a wonderful workout. 

5 stars

Tracking issues are a pain! I have tried everything to combat this - covering mirrors/TV, different lighting, etc, but I am still getting lots of "misses" that 100% are not misses! I see the saber clearly go through blocks and still get misses, it sucks. The game makes me mad - I don't care if *I* suck and miss but I hate when I know I have done an FC and still have a bunch of misses.
The music choice is limited and poor. I bought the Imagine Dragons pack but what is badly needed is the ability of users to add their own songs/maps... without that, the lifespan of the game is low.
If the tracking issues were not there AND it had custom songs/maps then this would score an easy 5.
review_title: Issues spoil an otherwise perfect game.

I've had the game for almost 2 months now and must say it's one of the "must own" titles for any VR owner. It has a fun and engaging soundtrack with different modes and challenges to accomplice to really stretch the life of the game. But at some point you are going to want more and unfortunately like all things it will cost you. And even then the selection is limited. And the handling of custom songs is a grey area and also can be troublesome to impliment on the quest. At least some sort of system for user generated songs though their own track builder. But for again that's for people who feel they want more variety. But for casual players it should tie you over until your next new game purchase easily

This game is great, but the camellia levels are to hard for their difficulty. Hard mode feels like Expert, Expert feels like Expert+, Expert+ feels like Expert++. Can you please 1UP these difficulties. Or maybe make the levels easier.

The rhythm of your sword swings is detached from the music itself, which makes achieving any sort of immersion nearly impossible, the levels aren’t pick-up-and-play; instead there is a Geometry Dash level of practice grinding, which makes the whole experience infuriating, unless one is playing on a difficulty too easy to pose a challenge.
For God’s sake, I’m a guitarist of 13 years who’s been trained in the Japanese art of Bushido. This game should be nothing but a real blast for me, but it’s a just-plain-painful experience that I can’t even force myself to enjoy.

I dropped $29.99 on Christmas for this because my sister wouldn’t stop talking about it, and she and I both agreed to delete it within the first hour of play. I absolutely love this game, I've been playing for a year and I can't get enough of it, and the addition to multiplayer a few months back made it so much better, I do only have one tiny suggestion to the multiplayer, and that's when you are searching for a lobby. Currently there are only 2 "music type" options, "built in" and "all", I play on "all" only because I like to play the dlc songs as well, but I've noticed that a lot of people who play that type as well don't have all if any of the dlc's at all, which makes it hard to play those songs or get more than 2 or 3 people with a specific song, I have two ideas to fix this, either make it to where you must own all dlc packs to play the "all" category, or make a new category that requires you to do this and leave the other 2 categories as they are, I feel like this will help make the online mode in beat saber much more fun and enjoyable, as those with all the dlc songs can finally play those songs all the time, and those with no dlc songs or only 1 or 2 packs can be able to play without being skipped out because everyone voted a song they didn't have.

No matter what if I pick up my oculus to do anything i eventually play this game. Im not at expert plus yet but Im coming for the leader boards. See y'all in a couple years lol but for real best immersion I've felt in vr yet.

Well, Beatsaber is a game that certainly doesn't need much more description, so I'll go straight to the Quest version. While both the PC and PSVR versions are already wonderful games for me, the Quest version clearly falls short:

It lacks a lot of graphical liveliness: There are no reflections, no billowing walls. That's a great pity, because that should be very possible with the Quest 2. We are still playing the Quest 1 version, so to speak.

What I also sorely miss is the haptic feedback: due to the missing rumble, VERY much immersion is lost. It's a pity that so little work has been done on the Quest 2 version.

The basic game is fun but without add-ons it would be nothing. The OSTs are pretty bad. The Devs make awful maps. So a you need the community mods which are unofficial (I don't think they're frowned upon otherwise the Devs would have done something by now and the entire success of this game hinges on them).  The problem is the community appears to be 99% anime freaks (weebs) so if you're a "normal" you could end up with a lot of headaches searching for songs that aren't trying to sound like the singers are little Japanese girls screaming for daddy. Sometimes it seems like one big awful 80s computer game song... But there are good tracks and maps out there in between and plenty of less annoying more mainstream Asian music mixed in. Once you find them and get a good playlist at expert+ level this is a fantastic workout game. Probably the most fun calorie for calorie. It takes some work and computer knowledge to make it fun though. I suggest looking at guides on how to mod this game for quest before buying otherwise you're buying a lemon. Most of the official DLC is badly mapped too once you get past expert level. Also be warned: WARM UP. This game is addictive and physical and people can seriously injure themselves if they're not careful (rotator cuff injuries the worst of them). Treat it seriously in terms of injury prevention once you get good. The same as you would any sport especially if you're a little older.

I never got into rythm games back in the day of DDR and Guitar Hero, but this game converted me. VR is the ultimate way to play rythm games and this one is so simple and intuitive that just about anyone can play and get into it. Everyone that I have had try this game has enjoyed it, including my parents who are in their 60's and never play any video games. The songs are fun and catchy and they'll be adding more in 2021. This game would be an easy 5 out of 5 but for many, there aren't enough songs for long-term play and there isn't any official support for custom songs. Hopefully we will see some sort of legal compromise in the future so that we can have access to the large custom song community that exists for this game.

Let me start by saying that if you own a Quest or Quest 2 and somehow don't own this, stop hesitating and buy it... after you read the rest of my review. I've played beat saber since 2018 when the first music pack came out, and I was really curious how this game preforms on the Quest 2. At first, I thought that the graphics were very unimpressive with the original color scheme and environment. I did find a few things that MASSIVELY improved the graphical fidelity. (Tips soon) The game is very smooth on Quest 2, as well as having all the same songs and updates on PC. The multi-player is hit or miss, having a slight delay occasionally.For the colors, use a Hot pink for the left saber, and a bright greenish turquoise for the right saber, and the same pink and green for backround colors, as well as making the walls the same green. If you also override the default environment to the Linkin Park Environment, since it is newer it has better lighting and effects from the other environments from what I can tell. However, after seeing this game and seeing how AMAZING this game looks on PC by hooking up my quest, its not the prettiest looking game on the quest, but its understandable for the hardware its running on. Overall, definatly great, would give 4.5 stars if I could, but I would reccomend buying songs that you like because the built in songs do get tiresome after awhile.

one_reviews_text:
This game is amazing and extremely fun, and if youre playing it right, quite a work out.  This is easily one of my favorite games for the oculus, even for the play station VR. 
Why 3 stars?
This can't detect hight, you constantly have to turn auto adjust on and off, move your height in the setting and then it's still not totally correct, this doesn't always happen but there will be games you're swatting at the ground or the ceiling.
Second con which is huge!!!
ADD ONS ARE BARELY CHEAPER THEN THE GAME ITSELF. For the original game you get like 3 or 4 pages to flip through songs, some are lengthier then others, plus campaign, multuplayer online, party mode, and then to add about 7 more songs, most of them not good, 15.99
To me this seems crazy, now when you talk about bands like LP. Yes obviously I'm going to spend that, but you're not getting that class of music with every add on.

TL;DR
game is amazing, download it immediately!
Just watch yourself with the add ons, don't buy them until you know what you're getting. Also buy LP add on, that's a must 

After some updates could easily be a 4.5 star game

After trying Beatsaber on my brother's VR-headset in the holidays I went on and bought me my own Oculus Quest. I felt like I just couldn't live on without rythmically smashing boxes with lightsabers anymore.

New updates and multiplayer, so yeah it’s getting better but not holding out too much hope for cross play with friends who bought it for their pc years ago although they are looking into it. Can’t talk to people in multiplayer, which is good and bad.. No squeakers! But sometimes you want to congrats someone and the only option is arm movements since you can’t see your hands in the lobby. Currently 72 payable add ons to add music onto your headset, sure you can sideload songs to it, but there’s risk of getting in trouble for it and even if you bought the music, beat saber and Facebook scares you away from trying it so I’ve never tried it.. 

So yeah, 4/5 due to no dialogue between players and all the expensive add ons that don’t seem to be worth it in the end.

This game is almost perfect. It has perfect difficulty, gameplay, music, and much more. There are plenty beatmaps to play on without BMBF or DLCs, the latter i am too poor to get and the former i am too worried of my account getting banned to download. If you think you are as good as can be by beating songs on expert+, you can try one saber or no arrows. My only problem that is preventing the game from getting 5 stars is the graphics. Everything looks worse on the quest 2 version compared to pc, and even the demo on the quest looks way better so its not an issue with hardware. Don't believe me? Download the demo and see how much better it looks. The walls, sabers, saber handles, animations, and much more just look objectively worse on the full version. I can partially understand the walls since they wanted them to be transparent, but that doesn't excuse everything else. If Beat Games fixes this, I will change my 4 star to a 5 star. Thanks for reading.

The game itself is very much enjoyable, however updates are few and far between, with very little in terms of content improvements.

 The use of severs hosted by steam / oculus means there's no crossplay available between the 2 platforms, not a deal breaker but certainly inconvenient if you want to play with friends. 

The worst part comes when they expect you to pay twice for the game in order to have it on the quest 2 and on the desktop (given the desktop is the only one currently with custom songs, this is really inconvenient). They'll give their usual excuse that it's because they've had to build the game for the quest. 
 Which since the game uses unity, which specifically allows them to compile, with little updates, to the quest is a feeble excuse at best. Minus the whole development time based around assets as they're already available. They really should offer at least discount for people who have it already on one platform.

I've played Beat Saber at least twice a day since I got my OC2. It lets you get into wonderful flow states just moving to the music. I'm on expert difficulty currently and having tracking problems but it could be some level of finesse I haven't acquired yet. The only real complaint I have with this game is the selection of free songs. You don't get a really large selection at all. And there's the whole Camilla pack that to me just sucks... not into it at all. So that's like 1/4 of the paid game that I lose out on because it all has the same feel and it's bad. 
Please add more free packs to this game or make custom songs a norm. You're clearly not keeping up with the needs of daily players, even with your purchaseable packs.

The game itself is great, where it falls behind is more of its performance on the quest/quest2 platform. Mostly with controller vibration issues, controllers will start to buzz very lightly or even stop (though this is usually fixed with a restart) and it only seems to happen in this game. The level of vibration makes a bigger difference than you know, until it's almost gone. Other than that not too many problems. 

Over all I would still say its an essential quest game, fit for anyone's game library.

Update: having constant problems with controller vibration, and it's only on this game. Happens nearly every time I play and isn't always fixed by restarting

I just got my Oculus and this was the first game I got. It is exciting and challenging, but still a great first game for those new to VR. I’m somewhat susceptible to motion sickness and some games like Echo VR made me sick on first to, but this didn’t. Only downside for me is that there’s a limited music selection and the costs can pile up buying music packs.

This games has brought sooo much fun to our family game nights...  and also being able to play & chat with family who lives across the country.  One of the major pros is the INTENSE cardio workout we all get when we play.  (After almost a year of quarantine life, we all need the exercise.)  The only con is the music selection...  We all wish there was more of a variety!  Also, would be nice if people could play whatever song the host of the party picks!!!  It really blows having to quit songs because it doesn't inform us that so and so, doesn't have the music pack or song selected!  
... ...  Maybe have in game challenges that you have to complete to UNLOCK songs, & different saber styles?!
Other than that, the family loves it!  And we play daily! ;)

First off, I’m a mom, and I love this game. It’s fun, challenging, good replay value, and well developed—it’s all good, but…
It really feels like it was developed by guys and mainly marketed to guys—which maybe it was, and that’s OK. All of the environments in this game have the same feel—they’re dark and some have obvious “guy” aspects. I’d just like a little more variety to satisfy a broader audience. My 17 year old daughter says the same thing. She’ll opt for other beat games that have a more variety of environments and a lighter feel. Personally, I like how Beat Saber works, but often I go to Supernatural for lighter environments. Don’t get me wrong, I don’t want pink and purple fluffy backgrounds with kittens and rainbows. I just want something more neutral and inviting that can appeal to both men and women. I hope the developers see this and choose to make some changes, so me and my girls want to go to this world more often.

After nearly a year of playing Beat Saber I can tell you this is the best game on the Oculus. The new songs and maps over the last year have been incredible. Each music pack felt better and more difficult with each release. 

As a player, I didn’t realize this was a weight loss option until I weighed myself and had lost 20 pounds. A few months later I had lost 40 total. It doesn’t feel like a workout when you’re playing. Multiplayer is by far the best workout with 60 seconds in between matches. The only suggestion I would make is to be able to send a friend request to some players in the game without having to leave the game and search in Oculus.

The only issue I have is the leaderboards in Oculus not working anymore (which isn’t a Beat Saber issue, it’s an ongoing Oculus problem). I loved being able to see my progress and increase my ranking which made me feel like I was always improving. 

Other than that, thank you guys for all the hard work!!

Everything you've heard about this game is true: this is an amazing vr game. Each song feels great to play on, and feels completely different on other difficultys. The customisation is great, from changing colors, to backgrounds, it's very customisable. The different modes also add extra fun, such as one saber and 360° mode. And, they added extra song packs with great songs such as High Hopes, American Idiot, and Believer. With all this content (and more) it's no wonder how this game got so big. Please, buy this game

one_reviews_text: This is only day 3 of using it, but so far I'm loving it!

Yea you already know it's a fun, well designed game. But what about the multi-player? Pretty fun! But...custom songs are...SO much more fun! But the problem is when you add custom songs(not entirely streamlined but still simple enough), you can no longer join online matches. I like both these things and if the development team can figure out a way to make both things available, this game would be an easy 5 star from me.

So for a long time I really wanted this game and now I have vr I can experience it properly! Graphics, campaign and all that comes with the game is awesome! It's ticked majority of my boxes in expectations for it.

Now I know that making money is essential in a game especially when it's cheaper than your everyday Xbox, ps game who charge stupid money for decent games. Unless you can get it cheaper at places in uk like cex etc. But if I'm honest I was disappointed by the limited songs on beat saber.

I know 2 songs out of the 3 to 4 playlists I've got and majority of the songs sound exactly the same. Now, don't get wrong I've been playing these songs through.campaign and getting used to how best saber counts up points. But, I rely mainly on music to make me pumped about playing beat saber. It's the feel of the song, the moment I suppose.

So when exploring playlists of songs I do know and would love to play I've noticed the add ons are restricted to that one band, singer or song you like and if you want different music gotta add on extra. 

So add ons are a way to help the game make money I get, but I wish they'd mix and mash the music on playlists on that add on so your not restricted to buying multiple add ons for the sake of getting 3 songs you want to play you know?

That's the only issue I've had on this game. Otherwise I love it everything I expected bar the music ❤️

one_reviews_text:
I could have sworn i wrote a review already but what ever, ive had more time to play it at this point to get a good feel out of the game.

First off, its amazing. Its a must buy for any VR owner who wants a game they can keep coming back to or share with a friend.

There's a fairly nice list of songs you can pick from with different modes as well. Its customizable like stages, colors and mods to the game to help change things up and they are adding more and more songs to play. I personally enjoy the Rocket League playlist.

The only reason why i cant give this game a full five stars is custom songs. The PC version of Beat Saber is far more enjoyable due to being able to add custom songs, stages and even swords in the game. Its why i own two versions of this game now, one for the Oculus Quest when i need to leave home for whatever reason, and the PC version to fully enjoy what the community can make. It adds so much extra value to the game that it sucks to see the state of custom songs on the Oculus Quest.

You can add custom songs to Oculus Quest, but its so tedious and time consuming that by the time you get it done it wasnt worth the effort, mostly because you'll be forced to start all over again the moment you turn it off. 

If i had to guess, it's probably because of Facebook its self, which really sucks. If there is a way they can make it easier in the future to do it i would use this version of the fame as my main version for sure.

one_reviews_text:
When I got my Oculus Quest 2 the first game I bought was Beat Saber. I was so excited to play it! The graphics are great, it’s fun to play, but the song selection...

I thought there were more songs than what is on there. I saw they had some Green Day which was cool until I saw the songs they picked to put in the game, boulevard of broken dreams is a great song to listen to but to play a dancing rhythm VR game?? Not great. 

There was also Lincoln Park which I love but what a weird choice for a dancing game... 

The songs that are available to play are almost all by the same person. And they are fine, not good, not bad, they are just whatever. They don’t get me in the mood to dance or play.  

Better music needs to be added.
review_title: Umm... What is this song selection???

Boy was I wrong! I haven’t heard any of these songs before and they are all garbage, please include multiple genres of music in a free dlc because I think at $30 I deserve some decent tunes to play with. I wanted to jump off a bridge after hearing hundred dollar beels for the 20 th time. And what’s with the intentional mistake runs? Those aren’t fun, just annoying. it’s a shame that I played this game for longer than two hours, now I can’t get a refund. The reason I’m not rating one star is because I can download mods, thanks to them I can pair up the mechanics with some rock music and get the experience I was expecting.

The core game for Beat Saber is fantastic— and other reviews have covered this well. Truly enjoy it, and it’s a great experience. 

However, the Green Day add-on module is awful, and for one reason really: the songs are censored to bleep out curse words. This wasn’t evident when purchasing the add-on, and the game play is awful. The bleeps completely take you out of the game, and frankly... come on. Using edited versions of the songs is ridiculous. 

I like Beat Saber, but I’m wary of future add-ons, especially because you cannot get a refund for them. Truly hope the company will either offer a choice on edited/non-edited songs in the future, or will stop using edited versions altogether.

I've been playing Beat Saber for a long time now and it used to be, really, the only game I would play on the Oculus. In any other circumstance, I would give it 5 stars because it is a very enjoyable game and used to be one of my favourites. However since the recent update, the game is incredibly slow to/doesn't at all register my controllers movements, so whilst it would display the blades going through the boxes it would count them all as misses. This has rendered the game virtually unplayable as I end up losing within seconds of starting as I watch the blade pass through a box like there was nothing even there! I have never experienced these issues with similar Oculus games and it's really disappointing as it looks like I won't (more like can't) play Beat Saber anymore!

This is the game that everyone hypes. And it really IS a fun game!
BUT I don't think that the pricing is fair. I think there should be a connection between price and production value. 
- The reason for 3 stars: This is basically a really simple game AND there are a very limited number of songs included! 
Hence if it was priced at half the current price it would be the best buy ever. The ability to have/add extra (royalty-free/custom made) songs free of charge would also make it feel more worth the premium price. For now, you can buy extra song packs at about the same price that a full album cost back in the day when people bought a full album - and that is way too expensive...

I love this game, it has a neat concept and easy to get into, and I see why people like myself like this game so much. But the game has a few minor details that are easily glossed over. First, 60% of the levels are locked behind paywalls, so if you don't have cash to spare, your stuck playing the levels on the base games 5 soundtracks. After playing the game for a while, these songs get stale. This leads me to my second issue with this game, specifically on the Quest platforms. There is no custom song support other than modding the game with 3rd party programs (but thats against the privacy policy, and sometimes don't work), which keep the players stuck in the base game. Other than these issues, great game, but if you're going to buy it, setup Oculus Link and buy the game through Steam.
review_title: Great game, but missing a few things.

Simply put, this is my husband’s favorite game on the Oculus. His only complaint is that the people on multiplayer always pick the hardest/longest songs and then drop out after 30 seconds, leaving him to finish the song by himself. If they could make a “ranked” multiplayer, maybe with randomized songs, where people can really compete to go up in the rankings that would be great.

Ok

5/5 for the game mechanics and music.
3/5 for the interface. After you finish a solo music and return to the main screen it’s hard to find your score. It does not show if you did better or not than the last time you played that music and it does not show your progress to beat that music. 
3/5 game design. Campaign was badly designed. The difficulty progress too fast so you got stuck for a long time in a song. No option to select musics to play in sequence, if you want to exercise for one hour, for example. Practice mode should have a pause option so you can learn the complex sequences. 
1/5 help and instructions. No help. The game is easy to learn but if you need information about something, you need to figure it out trying. For example the points you make when you cut a box. Good luck trying to discover what gives a top score.

It’s a very fun game. I got an Oculus for Christmas and Beat Saber was one of the first games I got. There is a really cool feature where you can play with friends and that makes it a thousand times more enjoyable. Overall this is definitely a great game, the only downside is you have to have money if you want to continue the fun after some time.

one_reviews_text: I wish there were more songs, but that doesn’t bother me enough to take away stars from my rating.  This is a great game!

First off, this game is a blast. Truly intuitive and the best example of using VR that I have seen.

Now the downside that really got me: The songs are censored with a loud beep (not "hushed" like they do on the radio), there is no option to turn off the censoring, there is no refunds on DLC. This wouldn't bother me but I bought the Green day pack and well . . . Green day isn't exactly family friendly and the beep really kills the vibe. Poor artist selection for a family friendly game. That pack was a waste of money and I'm not even going to touch Lincoln park.

Beyond that the song selection is limited and the DLC is overpriced.
review_title: A ton of fun with a downside

one_reviews_text:
I have really enjoyed playing this game in my quest 2. The action is great the songs are great. The fact that there is a small campaign section is awesome. However, I would really like for there to be a random song selection option in solo play. That way I select random,a song pops up I select the difficulty level and then go. No downtime scrolling around for a song I haven't played today and thus losing the momentum of play.

Update: Jan 2021- I play on a quest 2 and I have friends that play on a Rift S. We can play each other in multi player mode, but we can't see each others high scores in the solo play section. This needs to be fixed.

It's also good for a nice workout; the higher tier songs will really push your upper and lower body to move and get those swings. I like to think this game also helps with hand and eye coordination over time. If I could give it 6 stars I would.

one_reviews_text:
I honestly don't have much to say: the title says it all.  The maps are amazing and quite beautiful with obvious skill and talent behind it.  I love the way that it is set up so that anyone can understand how to do any level with any difficulty AND modification AND mode they wish (for the most part).  That brings me to the next part of the review.  I know that y'all at Beat Saber HQ (or whatever it is) are kept relatively busy with other maps, but I would love it if you could do one handed, 360, 90, and no arrows on some of the maps that don't have it (for example, I would love for  "Cycle Hit" to be one handed as that is one of my favorite maps).

Other than that, I love your game, five stars regardless of my complaint.  If anyone reads this and has not purchased this game I have one thing to say: THIS IS A MUST BUY.  The campaign alone provided several DAYS worth of entertainment given the length and varying difficulties.  When you do Freeplay, I kid you not, there is almost limitless fun and entertainment with so many different ways to customize a single level it is insane.  BORED?! AHAHAHAHA not me, I have Beat Saber.

Excellent job to the producers.  10/10

I purchased beat saber about a month a go and play it frequently.  I must say though, if you have the quest 2, id highly recommend getting it on steam and playing it via the link cable. The reason being for this is steam has workshop that is free, and oculus charges you for each additional song.

I would say first, the game itself is great and if that was want this review was solely based on it would be a five. Unfortunately, this is based off the whole system, which is multi faceted. 

Gameplay: Like I said, I really enjoy this game. It’s something that I can do for as long as I have stamina to keep playing. Both my wife and I really enjoy the variety of songs and, honestly, breaking a sweat while playing. I’ll get frustrated sometimes when a slice should count but for whatever reason it didn’t, but it’s not like you have limited lives...just play again. 

Since getting an Quest 2: Like I’m sure many people over the based few months, I upgraded to the Quest 2 and my wife and I were excited to finally be able to play together with the new multiplayer mode. But wait you can’t play with each other if it’s the same account, so instead Beat Saber forces you to be in a different account instead of assigning localized user s for its multiplayer mode. In addition, like many other oculus games, don’t utilize cloud syncing for connecting saved game data. 

I understand this sounds petty but it feels like Beat games didn’t think through their roll out of multiplayer and people upgrading to the quest 2 while still keeping the Quest. When contacting support that were short and dismissive about that every changing.

So 2 stars

I absolutely love this game, I am totally addicted to it. I have only been playing for 4 months but already have around 100 hours in the game. It is a stable part of my workout, as it is great cardio (if you don't just stand still and flick your wrists of course) and my arms have gotten considerably more toned. I love the competitive part of it too, playing the crazier and crazier custom maps, climbing the ranks... There is an amazing community out there. I will probably play this game for a long, long time.

With that being said, here is some of the stuff I don't like:
- The new UI is awful imho. I liked the old one much better, so I actually switched back to the previous version.
- I don't know why Facebook is making it so hard for Quest users. The main selling point of the game is custom songs, since there is not that much content in the game itself. Without custom songs, this game would not be nearly as popular as it is. But now, I cannot play multiplayer and I cannot compete on OST leaderboards, because the game is modded.
- As for multiplayer, I did try it before going back to the previous version. It was fun, I enjoyed it, but after a week of playing, it kind of got boring to play the same songs over and over.
- OST Ex+ maps are kind of bad for the most part. They are all over the place, don't have a nice flow, etc. I wish they improved them.
- The music in the game is not that great, except for a couple songs.

I guess that's it. I love the game anyway so I have to give it 5 stars.
Oh and fair warning: once you start playing Ex and Ex+, make sure you warm up properly and stretch afterwards. I suffered a pretty bad back injury from playing which took a long time to heal. (And of course there is the constant arm, shoulder and wrist pain from playing too much...)

Don't get me wrong, I play this game everyday and love my experience, but I play the MODDED version, not vanilla. I will talk about the vanilla game in this review.  The game is fun for a few months, and the graphics are pretty good. After about 5 months and maybe a hundred hours of play time, it gets annoying. If you don't purchase any music packs, you start to realize after a while how little choices you have for songs.  I becomes absurd when your PAID $25 game has more DLC than the base game. What!?!? OST 1 has horrible and awkward mapping too so I never play any songs from that playlist. Also, if you are playing multiplayer and they pick a song you don't own, you just have to sit in silence. I'm sure there is a lot of legal stuff for why that happens, but it's just annoying. Another nit-pick is the sabers are just huge. It's never good when your game is improved by so much by modders and many have opted for that route.

Don't get me wrong the game is a blast. I love multiplayer and the levels are nice to play and build up your skills in between matches. 

Big issue is the lack of licensed music tracks. Yeah, yeah I can sidequest and load custom songs but I don't feel like that should be the way to expand the game or get, what iI feel, any kind of worth out of my money. 

To be honest I'd pay a subscription for some real tracks. Or how about do DLC with good music but Include a bunch of songs not just 5 or 6??  

I understand people have to make money but c'mon! I can't even get the songs that I paid for to get selected in multiplayer. Game seems to always pick a built in song over any DLC music.

The game looks FANTASTIC! The game FEELS fantastic, and it accommodates to all skill levels!

BUT WHY SO MUCH EXPENSIVE DLC?!

I don't understand, there is no support for custom community made songs unlike on other platforms & you are forced to pay more money for more songs. I already paid 30 dollars for the game, and pretty much over half of the game is sitting behind a $88 paywall to get all the content.

one_reviews_text:
I cant tell you anything different than the other 5 star reviews. Ive been playing beat saber for about a year now and I absolutely love this game.

Only ONE downside, which is more like a personal thing and not directly related to the game itself [thus why the rating isn't effected] I wish I could live stream this game to my Facebook like other games. I guess its a copywrite issue? If I bought the music, and credit is clearly given on screen, whats the issue?

I just want to play beat saber in the company of my friends and family so they can watch me play LIVE. Instead I record then share to Facebook.
I wish I could send my longer videos directly in messenger.

Apparently only recordings less than 2 minutes can be sent via messenger. I wish that limit would expand to at least 5 minutes so I could send some of my recordings just directly TO someone rather to my Facebook timeline.

Again this was entirely a personal thing and has no direct correlation to the game itself. The game itself is phenomenal, I utilize bmbf at times but only on original quest. My quest 2 is purely all oculus content and songs. I love it either way.

63/5 stars

I really do like beat saber, it's a great game to get into VR with, and it's very satisfying to slice virtual blocks the beat of a song. But if I'm going to be honest, it just got a bit boring, until now. The multiplayer online mode is amazing, and has rekindled my passion for beat saber. There is little to no lag when I play, and the added competition you get in multiplayer mode really brings beat saber up a notch. If you eere ever skeptical about getting beat saber before, I assure you this game is totally worth it.

Beat saber will always be my favorite vr game. I thought it looked like a lot of fun, but i started to think that maybe it wouldn't be as good as i thought. I was so wrong. It exceeded every expectation I had. Beat saber is so much fun, and with custom songs the variety will never end. Beat saber is the best vr game in my opinion, and it's one of my favorite games of all time.
This is definitely a must have

I got my oculus quest 2 and did not play beat saber because I did not want to pay for it. I read the reviews and I soon realized what a big mistake I had made neglecting to purchase the game. I bought it and I have never been the same since. I have a YouTube channel that has 3 beat saber videos and I gained 3 subs off of 1 of them. I would like for you to subscribe and you can see my skill that has improved sooooo much. Shout out to Beat Games for making my new workout routine and the best be game since 2018.

Of the three “beat” games I have (this, Synth Riders, Audio Trip), this is the simplest of the lot. It also has the worst music selection (and the music packs are limited in appeal), and is the most expensive. The thing that makes up for it is the light sabers: let’s face it, light sabers are cool. There’s something satisfying in slicing the blocks that is absent from the other games. If it wasn’t for that I’d say skip this and go with one of the other two that have better music and a wider variety of interactions. But if you love light sabers, this is the one.

Beat saber is a great game that gets you moving, it was the first game I got on the occulus and makes you feel like you are really holding a couple of light sabers, however. I was really disappointed at the lack of recognisable music, I know it seems good that the soundtrack is original, but when quite a few of the tracks are really boring to play over and over again it takes away from wanting to complete them. The chosen selection of music you can buy isn't much better. The main reason I give it 4 stars rather than 5 is the way that, every now and then, one or both of the sabers misses, not due to my ineptitude, it just seems to go through the block without registering. This pretty much ruins the game for me as I will never beat my friends high scores when I can't get a perfect run, but I keep playing because it's pretty much the only exercise I get. From the look of online forums this has been a problem for a long time.

This game is a fun rythem game where there are blocks flying at you and you have to cut them with light sabers in the right direction with the right color. one_reviews_text: That’s all I have to say. You need this. I have had this game for maybe 5-6 months and I have played it every single day I use my VR. It’s an amazing game because of the endless game time, and now multiplayer mode. This is literally the best game on VR as of right now. When do you ever get to slice blocks left and right up and down perfectly to the beat of a pumping sound track? Also the various modes from easy, normal, hard, expert, expert+. The campaign is great, solo is even better, and the fact that there is different colors, environments, and modes such as “no arrows” or “ghost notes” is just perfect. If your contemplating on getting this game, I’ll make the decision for you. Your buying it.

This game is amazing no matter what oculus device you are on. The songs are great and it really gets your heart pumping. This game is addictive. I have been playing this game for a long time, while every song is unique along with the rhythm you can cut in. My favorite songs are crystallized bye Camellia, Light it up by Camellia, and The greatest show by Panic At the Disco, but the gold medal of my favorite is Light it up. I have constantly been trying to figure out the pattern on expert + as this song is rushing, quick, and it makes you feel good about yourself and your progress at the beginning. It’s one of those songs that make it look like you are inside of the blocks as it looks like it is impossible to beat it. Although to be honest, it looks more satisfying watching others doing it on multiplayer as the almost never miss a block. Overall, I know I focused on one song, but this game is great, and I really hope many can try it.

I first played Beat Saber on the PS VR. I fell in love, and knew I had to get it for my Oculus. I knew that the controller tracking would be different, and that it would take me a bit to get used to, but I've been noticing that there are just some blocks I can't hit in certain songs. It annoys me a bit, but that's also because I'm super competitive and it brings my scores down, haha. I will also voice the same opinion that many other players have and say that there needs to be more music variety available, preferably for free. Beat Saber's baseline price is expensive, and a lot of people can't afford to get music packs with music they like on top of that. If there was a wider variety of music available for free, I feel like a lot more players would be more satisfied with the game, myself included. Overall though, I still think the purchase is worth it :) It's a fun game for sure.

This game is outdated with terrible hit detection and the music sucks. 

I made it through the campaign mode and I can play all the songs in expert but where the game falls apart is expert +

This is where all of it’s mechanical flaws show painfully bad. 

If you still doubt me I’ll save you some money. 

If you buy the game go to Angel Voices under extras, go to practice, go to the one minute mark, see if you can get past the drop before your refund time is up. 

That’s not even the hardest drop in the song. 

If you do manage to get past it, congratulations, your autism level is high enough to enjoy this game. 

For the rest of us you could finish 10 other games in the time it takes to learn how to play one song and all the songs range from mildly listenable to outright trash.

If you're only going to play 1 vr game, make it Best Saber. It's easy to pick up, but difficult to master, with TONS of replayability. It's fun and also great exercise. It's perfect for vr novices, as there's no motion sickness (though lots of flashing lights, if you're sensitive to that - there is a setting to disable that though). The game is clean and free of bugs. There's lots of music and an active modding community for limitless songs. It's simple, yet a perfect game. If you just got a vr headset, start here. You won't be disappointed.

I absolutely love this game, and I play it all the time.
Even so, having logged 150+ hours, I’m still struggling to get past the built in levels* on Expert+. This game requires immense practice and patience, and also good stamina. 

*You can mod your game to allow fan made levels, which can be nigh impossible except for a handful of players

This happened to me btw: If you ever try playing and have huge trouble on songs you used to be able to do, here’s some advice. Wait it out. Play songs slowed down or a difficulty below what you are used to, so as to not lose interest/skill. Do this for about a week, or until you feel ready to get back on the hard levels. It’s similar to writers block, but Beat Saber version.

You may be wondering "is this game something I will enjoy?" why yes, yes it is. No matter what type of vr player you are, Beat Saber is just for you. It has engaging gameplay that will get you emersed. It even has songs you may already know and like (although they are dlc). Also I do not recommend modding it. The reason being is nodding it will remove that feature. Take it from me who modded it before hand, multiplayer is what shines in this game.

Also if you are looking for a challenge look nowhere but to the campaign! Campaign mode give you the songs you know from beatsaber and makes you wish they was harder! What campaign mode does is it starts out easy but gets harder and harder as it goes. It even has levels where your goal is to move your hand a lot, then slam your face with levels that are the complete opposite and you can't move that much! Its really fun and I wish they would add more challenges. -REVIEW OVER-

When I first got my Oculus quest 2 about a month ago, I saw how many free games and short experiences there are, and spent days just messing around in them and getting used to the Quest and being in a virtual world. Once I had exhausted all the free options that seemed interesting to me at the time, I decided to go ahead and purchase my very first oculus quest game. Having seen many videos and many YouTubers playing this game I decided to give Beat Saber a try. In my opinion, it is a must-have for any VR owner who enjoys music/rhythm games. The gameplay is very simple to learn, but incredibly hard to master. The visuals are stunning and completely immersive. I am very happy that I made this my first Oculus quest purchase, and anyone who has not yet bought or tried this game should absolutely do so. It is a must have!

one_reviews_text: I have had beat saber for a long time and it is my most played game. The core gameplay is so much fun but once you start modding (which is really easy) it becomes 10 times better. 100% would recommend nothing wrong with the game

Let me put it like this. Beat Saber is the Mario Cart of Nintendo, it’s the Sonic of Sega Genesis, its the Doom of windows 95, it’s the Pac Man of Atari, it’s the Grand Turismo of PlayStation, its the Fortnite of Xbox. 
It’s a fun, challenging, affordable game that you can play alone or in groups. 
Fundamentally this is best game you can buy for Oculus Quest/ Quest 2 it can be played at any ability level. You can put someone who has never experienced VR in the demo mode on easy and they will be able to understand enjoy it on from the first attempt. ￼
I have literally tried it with both my parents (who are in their 60’s and they couldn’t get enough). 
At the same time I can play every level at Expert + and it’s remains as enjoyable as when I first started. I love it and without exaggeration I play it every time I play VR. I use it as a warm up to get my dexterity and coordination going before I play other games. 

Trust me you need to own this game!
review_title: Make Sure You Have This Game

one_reviews_text:
When men and women find out wearing a refrigerator on their face while playing games dramatically  replaces botox for raising eyebrows with no lumps, fluff or 
 bulges... many of them are going to want to buy music that reminds them of when they were young.  Motown, old pop and rock, slashin to the oldies, that sort of thing... Until then... this isn't the full five stars it ought to be.  Still, I cannot believe we're this close to Christmas and no one is pitching the way Beat Saber beats Botox at raising our brows beautifully.  It's not a cost of $299... it's a SAVINGS on botox for the rest of our lives.  Let me talk to the marketing people.  Give them each a glove... I'll have them slap themselves silly till they think about the market they're so comfortably ignoring.  No more Botox Babe is... OUT.  :)

Hi all,  Thank you for a great game.  Beat Saber is my favorite so far.  I am new to VR.  I know the music industry has an iron fist with music rights and all which is fine.  I am older and have a huge music library I purchased over the years.  I see there is an AI program that map the songs to the music for Beat Saber on the web.  If you could incorporate that into your game so players can listen to their own purchased music without having to go through the Developers only stuff, your game would be infinitely better.  Thank you again for a great experience.  I would pay extra for the feature but it needs to be seamless if it  is an add on.
John

I picked up Best Saber maybe 10 months ago and was in two minds given that it's expensive compared to a lot of other games. Afterwards, I didn't play it too much, although my wife really got into it.
Then I gave it another go recently and somehow got completely hooked. I think the Camellia songs in the solo game pushed me over the edge, as well as the "extras" set including the Crab Rave and Fitbeat. Since then I've been playing it for over an hour every day and absolutely loving it.

The only slight downside is that uploading custom songs and maps requires the use of Sidequest, when ideally this would be integrated into the game like on other music-based games such as Audio Trip. I've done it successfully with Beat Saber and it really unlocks the game's true potential.

I love Beat Saber, but I kinda love it in spite of itself. I have several friends who play it several times a week, and they’ve all stopped since the new update.

I have a Rift and a Quest. My partner uses my Rift (hates the Quest) and my other partner bought her own Quest. So I have two people to play with, right??

No. Rift and Quest can’t play together, although the game never tells you, so enjoy getting an error message for 20 mins before you figure it out. Only same headsets can play together. WTF?

Well at least I can play with my partner with her own Quest right? NOPE! Because the only reason she (or any of us) like the game is because of custom tracks. I don’t need them on my Quest because I have it on Rift and that’s enough for me. But my partner doesn’t have that option, so she either can play a game with me during a pandemic without any songs she likes, or play alone with all the tracks she loves. It’s the worst situation.

So I decided to rate Beat Saber on its own terms, as it’s decided to present itself to us. If cross play (even between headsets from the same company) isn’t an option, and custom songs take away our ability to play together, then this game has taken away the additions it promised and what little made us like it in the first place. 

When you have 4 headsets between you (5 if you count my old Vive) and none of them can play together, your multiplayer update ISN’T MULTIPLAYER.
I play daily as a form of fitness and can't fault it. Especially since bringing out the multi player mode, its pushed me to improve my skills and enjoy it even more. #1 Quest game for sure

Ok, so, don't get me wrong. I absolutely adore this game. I first started playing Beat Saber on my HTC Vive when it first came out. Like, when there were only a handful of songs you could play. I love this game, and I've loved seeing it grow into what it is today.

However, Expert is almost unplayable on the Oculus Quest 2. I'm constantly losing my sabers, or they get stuck to my side. I've tried reaching out to both Oculus and Beat Saber about the issue, and I've been ignored. It's a shame, really. This issue renders the game pretty much unplayable

one_reviews_text:
Update: the new online mode is excellent and suddenly brings a whole new challenge and fun to the game. It would be nice to be able to enter a lobby with people who agree on which sets of songs to choose from as there are a few tracks i loath and yet seem to always get selected by other players (I’m looking at you “where’s the cat” and others in that same vein) - but I can always quit a match so it’s not that big a deal.

Previous review:

I bought this originally for the PSVR and enjoyed it. With the Oculus Quest offering more accurate tracking etc, I bought it again and it plays so much better.

The newer 360 and 90 degree modes add a great new aspect that I hadn’t experienced before too.

I have found you need a lot of space to play the 360 degree tracks ‘safely’ - but well worth it. The patterns used in those feel especially rewarding when you get them going fluidly.

For anyone struggling with missing blocks etc - I found the controllers don’t like rechargeable batteries, and you might have to learn to reach out in front of you a bit more than is initially natural so the headset can see the controllers better, and also check the lighting/reflections in the room you are in as bright sunlight can overwhelm the sensors in the headset and lead to areas it can’t see to track the handsets accurately, watch out for any updates downloading in the background as those can cause brief inconsistencies in the tracking, and if nothing else, reboot the headset. I’m working my way through finishing all the songs on at least Expert with faster song and ghost blocks and concentrating on getting accurate hits and no misses of course, and these tips mean I very rarely have misses when I know I hit the blocks and so I know any errors are mine and not the tracking. I still get the odd back tracking and you can tell the difference when you miss or it incorrectly thinks you missed, but I can usually fix the issues with one of the tips above and get back to accurate tracking.

I am new to VR and just bought a Quest 2 to dip my toes in the water. I am now obsessed with this game. Even during my first attempts on easy mode I already felt like a beautiful dancer - or maybe assassin. A couple of weeks down the line and I'm mostly playing all the levels on Expert and even as a fifty year old woman I feel cool as a cucumber. The satisfaction of beautifully chopping the cubes has to be experienced to be believed. This is truly worth every penny. As a musician, learning the patterns is like practising an instrument. At the start you feel like the higher levels will always be impossible, but then your hands start to learn on their own and your brain gets out of the way and your entire body starts to feel the joy.

Are there any downsides? Only the limited number of songs from a narrow set of genes in the base game. But there's a mod to fix all that for you if you're into going the sidequest route.

Hmm... you wonder what this game is and why people enjoy it so much. I wondered the same thing after I spent most of my allowance on it. The idea in my head did not seem as exciting as it was, played the demo and immediately found out why people love it so much. The graphics are just outstanding, not to mention, I’m in the demo, there’s better graphics in the full game! The feel of the game and the interaction with the beat of the song gives you this nice feeling that never fails to put a smile on your face. It’s such a wonderful game to play and share with friends! The feeling of rush as these boxes with arrows on them come at you, with your brain telling you how you need to hit them and which way to swing, and when you need to hit them, knowing that if you beat that level you can try the next difficulty... it’s amazing. The game is so well made with such a simple idea, this provides endless fun. It never gets boring, it’s amazing for the Oculus Rift, Oculus Quest, and even the Oculus Quest 2 where the graphics get even better. This is a must buy and will overall make your VR experience much more fun and exciting. You need to try this...

I don't feel like making an in depth review so I made a pros and cons list. I wasn't going to leave a review but I need to get the word out there that this game is not worth it.

Pros: 

Cons: 

Screen flashes too much

No Volume/ Audio settings (so it's consistently loud all the time)

Terrible Tracking

Poor Customization Options

Overpriced song packs

Poor and unbalanced Multiplayer lobbies

The song selection isn't good

Some songs are harder than others with no rhyme or reason. Expert + on "Reason for Living" looks like easy compared to "What the Cat" on hard. They aren't anywhere close to similar skill levels.

Here's a list of SIGNIFICANTLY better games you can vet for the same price

Espire 1 (really cool gameplay and long story)

Phantom Covert Ops (Feels like classic CoD Campaign and has incredible mechanics)

Onward (Community is toxic, but realistic weapon mechanics an is still better than 
Beat Saber)

Virtual Virtual Reality (Half the price if this game and has an in depth complex storyline with collectables making the replayability high)

Rec Room (Free and yet the character customization is better than Beat Saber)

Do NOT buy this game. There are better song games out there like "Pistol Whip" for example. Don't waste your money like I did. Beat Saber does not improve their game. They only add songs in order to have a payday.

BTW: This game is definitely not worth the hype.

one_reviews_text:
This was the first game I bought after getting my Quest and it's the one game I play the most with friends and family. Especially now that multiplayer (i.e. "Online") has been added. 

Highly entertaining and easy to use. A cross between Guitar Hero and Fruit Ninja. 

The strength of this game is also it's weakness: the Content. The levels are hand-crafted to go with the music so both need to be in-sync for the level to work. Sometimes the level design is great but the music is so-so. Sometimes it's the opposite. When they are both excellent the game is highly satisfying and very enjoyable. 

The downside is: you quickly get tired of the playing the same music if you play this game a lot. At launch you will probably like about 60% of the music available. There are several IAP music packs available currently but they target superfans so if you like that specific band....great...if not, you're SOL.

I realize IAP Music Packs are licensed from the bands so they are costly and take time to develop. It would be great to add more original music or to license smaller bands so there is more variety. 

Overall...this is an excellent product and my favorite game for playing in social settings. Definitely worth the money!
review_title: Still one of my favorite games

Ok, before I had this game which was when it was released, it looked awesome but underwhelming of how little songs there are... but on November 2019, when I got this game, I ADORED it! 3 OST’s, 5 extra songs including Freakin’ CRAB RAVE, and a camellia pack which might I just say, EXTREMELY CHALLENGING, and DLC songs! I was SURPRISED and shocked how much fun this game is! If you just got this game and have no experience with rhythm/music based games, I recommend normal. But if you’re looking for a challenge, try hard mode. I’m an expert level person, not to brag, and it’s AMAZING how much care they put into this game! But the problem is this game is dark and I have nyctophobia (fear of the dark) and I kinda get iffy with every update because, they make the darkness more darker and realistic... But it’s still fun! So fun, that I ignore the darkness and have fun! And do NOT get me started with the multiplayer... THE. FUNNEST. THING. EVER. It’s literally everything I’ve dreamed of! What everyone’s been dreaming of! It’s so fun and challenging, multiplayer encourages you to get better at the game and get first place EVERY TIME. Honestly this game has so much to offer! Even without mods! The one suggestion I have is please add a Joji album! That’s all I request! Other than that, 10/10, would play FOREVER if I could! While yes, it is technically illegal for players to mod their game and use custom songs, the developers at beat saber know that a large community of their players do this. A lot of these players modify their game so that they can play a much wider variety of songs at much more difficulties. Many mods that you can get make the game a lot more fun, too! Also, these players that mod their game compete in tournaments and also regularly make videos which helps beat saber through advertising by more people viewing their gaming. However, with this new update, the developers at beat saber have made it much, much, much, harder to create mods and to play with them, which is making them lose a lot of their dedicated players. And, for those who have modded their beat saber, MULTIPLAYER DOESN’T WORK. Yup, if you have any unofficial modifications or any custom songs, multiplayer will be unable to work. This multiplayer update is huge for the game and it has been highly anticipated but it is now devastating many players who are now unable to play with their friends. Lots of people who are deciding to un-mod their game in order to play multiplayer are very upset that they are only limited to specific songs at lower difficulties, with most songs having to be paid for. While is may only be a minor upset for many players, it has greatly affected the dedicated beat saber community who spend much of their time playing custom songs with many mods. If anyone from the beat saber team is viewing this, and if it is possible, LET MULTIPLAYER WORK. It would make so many players happy and the community of dedicated players would grow very rapidly. On another note, I’d like to say that beat saber is truly a great game and it has created such an amazing level of entertainment for all players at all levels. We all hope that this game continues to get better for we really enjoy it.

This game is the killer app for the Oculus system, but there have been so many missed opportunities or poorly executed features. The single player game is fun, but the campaign is a quick play through. The amount of content released since the Oculus hit the market is pathetic. The developer had the opportunity to release all sorts of content during the spring lockdown and failed to deliver more than one music pack. The multiplayer is a cool concept but poorly executed. Half of my multiplayer matches are people voting to play Crystallize who can’t even get through the whole song. And if the majority of the players vote on a DLC song that one player doesn’t have, then the game defaults to an OST song. If you try to host a game, then you better have friends to invite because it won’t match players from quick play to your game. This has so much potential to be a great game, but the dev isn’t putting enough effort into it.

Just do it already!

This is the reason I bought my Quest. After seeing videos of it online and having some experience of playing console games like Guitar Hero and Rock Band, I was excited to step into a new rhythm based VR game. 

I was not disappointed. This game is fantastic and is my go-to game when picking up the headset. I would recommend it to anyone. 

The visuals are fantastic. I particularly enjoy the Green Day setting. 

The sound is amazing. So many new artists I've never heard of. The soundtrack is now on my Spotify playlist. However, I would LOVE an ability to add custom songs or even just some more DLC of hip hop and deep house hits. 

I get a decent workout from this game. My arms can ache afterwards and I'm covered in sweat, (yuk) it is exercise without the feeling of exercising. 

I found the Easy level too easy. The Normal level is fun and challenging but anything above Hard I can't do very well. I still enjoy it very much though and I'm still very much a beginner, so will aim to reach a better level as I progress. 

The only negatives are the lack of custom songs. A wider choice of environments would be great too. Still a 5 star game regardless.

I have had this for 2 hours and I am already addicted, but if you want more songs you have to Buy them for like $20. That’s a lot of money but if you think about it it’s a nice way to exercise listen to your favorite songs and play with friends it is so addictive I love this game so much. I think everybody should get it. PS, you can also get a PC and download songs I don’t know how yet but I know you can. 
Everybody needs this game.￼￼

To be honest I thought I was going to hate the music as the last time I really listened to club (disco when I had hair) was during the 80-90's.
That said I'm finding it really addictive and seem to be shedding pounds already. Even like the music though you won't find me playing it while driving around. 🤫
The sabers feel great and love the vibration on contact. Makes me feel like a Sith lord on a day off.
To the developers; knock us old rockers up a few rock packs to download please. Metallica, Judas Priest, Saxon,etc. Anything heavy or rock ballads would be outstanding. 
Worth every penny. 👍🏻
This game is honestly amazing. Overtime you can get bored with the song they have so you might want to get bmbf or pc vr for song you enjoy 👍

I’m writing this review coming from the psvr version of the game! And this games is so cool! But oculus and beat saber should make it easier to side load custom songs on. The game gets a bit too repetitive with the free songs. What are you doing reading this still? JUST BUY THE GAME!
review_title: Honestly the best title on here!

This is the first game I played on my oculus and love it so far! Haven’t had a problem or anything with it. Mainly got it for BTS songs but might start buying the other packs, can’t get enough of the game! Plus does a bit workout xD so that’s a bonus
