This game slaps like an angry gorilla it is fun as he I I  but when you beat all the levels￼ it could get kind of boring. also you have to buy song packs like what the fukc did I spend 30$ fore. If your ok with spending an extra five or 10 bucks then you’ll be entertained forever
Cool game, but ask 30$ for 10 songs ....

I have bought this game and some music packs on Steam (over 2 years ago). Then on Quest (last year) and paid again for the same music packs, plus a couple of the new ones. So many other Developers enable cross buy on the Oculus store and now this game has multiplayer I refuse to buy it again on the Rift store. Isn't it about time Beat Games and Oculus stop using this game as a cash cow?

Beat saber is the game that keeps me putting on my headset every day. The drive to improve, to get a better score, to beat that stupid hard challenge map that you’ve been grinding at for days, all those bring the biggest dopamine rush I have ever felt. The base game is fine enough, lasts a good 10-15 hours, but once you go ahead and install custom songs with BMBF a whole world opens up. The sheer amount of custom songs, and the insane difficulty that can be reached, absolutely improves the game. Once you go down the rabbit hole of ranked with ScoreSaber the game just becomes a drug with how much you play every day to get a few more performance points and go up the global leaderboards.

tl;dr 8/10 without mods, 11/10 with mods, please buy and mod this game
is a very good game I have spent meany hours playing it I would to have rap god on it
Beat saber is a classic everyone can love,the multiplayer is nice and the built in songs are cool but I would really like the ability to play player created maps like how you can on other VR sets

Mine and my families first experience with the Quest, we have had so much fun with this game.

Whether me and my obsession with wielding light-sabers, my kids and their lightning fast reactions or my wife who had never used VR before my while family get great fun from this game.

The variety of music and game modes gives you hours of challenging content for all skill levels, we added the Imagine Dragons content pack for some recognisable tunes to play too. 

Really good title! 5*

I've never been a fan of rhythm games. Rpgs and strategy on consoles and pc was my thing. However, what this offers in VR is just incredible. I bought it for my kids to play, but then I wanted to have a go and now I'm addicted. Try to explain how this game plays to people just doesnt make sense, but you feel like a rockstar ninja when you get through a song with out failing It and you just want more! I think If you own an occy quest, then you need to own this, its the go to, quickfire game.

This is probably the only game that you will feel like playing every single day, I bought it for exercise and since then I’ve closed the rings on my Apple Watch consistently, not to mention that playing with sabers to the sound of great music is a blast, this for me is the best VR game and totally worth its cost as it’s going to provide you tons of hours of entertainment.

This game is amazing and I recommend to anyone looking for a fun time and a good exercise. But thats all it is, unless you fork over 15-20 dollars for songs your just gonna run out of stuff to do in a week. I would rate this 3 stars but the addition of multiplayer added another 1.5 stars

This music pack has some great tracks, but freaking annoying floating characters... I play mainly Expert and Expert+, but who on the design team thought it was a good idea to make floating avatars appear in the middle of the screen, that essentially, you have to try and completely ignore! 

These avatars appear, float around in the middle of the action, wave to you, and who knows what else.... At least give an option to turn that off.

This is a great game that almost anyone play I honestly think it's one of the better game to be released on the quest highly recommended especially for first time vr users but their is one thing I don't like mods you can't get mods on beatsaber without going through a lot of hassle I would recommend adding a workshop if you see this makers of beatsaber I ask for this

This is the one car game I haven’t gotten bored of in the 4 years I have had vr. I first got it on the vive and that was good but the wands were heavy and cumbersome but with the quest it feels great. Can’t recommend it more.
There is no reason other than financial shortage that shoudn't buy this materpiece of a game. This is THE VR game.
有意思，而且老少偕宜。很耐玩的一款游戏。经典必须收藏！！
review_title: 值得拥有的一款经典OQ2游戏

one_reviews_text:
I never write reviews so let me start by saying that this game is so good it has made me enjoy video games again. As a larger man who has always found it necessary to stay active in order to stay fit I found modern video games rather lacking in that they promoted more of a sedentary lifestyle. Now that works for many people who don't love to eat as much as I do but with beat Saber you get an extremely immersive and fun gaming experience that if played properly can be one heck of a workout. The Oculus quest and games like this have really excited me for virtual reality and what can be coming in the gaming industry for the future. I Absolutely love love love this game!!! My girlfriend loves to chuckle at me while I'm dancing all around the living room floor playing the 360 degree levels that they added. This game really gets you moving and it's fun and there's continually new challenges and ways to one up yourself. The customization allowing you to change the rules in the environment and the colors of your sabers and many other aspects of the game make the game have so much replay value it's ridiculous. Also all they have to do is release another music pack and they've got another $15 from me that I happily give them. the ability to take videos of me playing and uploading them has actually given me opportunities to show other people what playing on one of these sets is like and in turn three of my coworkers have already purchased occulus quests as well. I'm definitely giving it 5 stars for this reason but with that said here's some things that I truly feel would make a great thing even better.
1: Include a multiplayer mode where you can play with friends online. 
2: More music, I mean let’s be candid, I know you've got to make money and that's what selling these headsets and software is about so pump 'em out and charge away, I’m buying.
3: Add a custom track creator
It's fun but when I was buying the game I thought it would never end but you only get like 25 songs and the game costs 30 and you spend more on the music then the game so I want more games.

I have a problem with the game/oculus, on some of the levels It says I hit the blocks but fails randomly, this is really confusing, either its the game or its the controllers, but overall the game is very good, wide selection of songs and very fun.
Fun = 5 star

I love this game and I play at the expert level. I have a Quest 2 and my Internet downloads at over 400mbps. I still miss some of the blocks due to system lag. I haven't been able to fix this yet. This is a fun game and provides a great cardio workout. The new multi player online play is awesome. A must have for Oculus Quest, they just need to figure out the system lag.
review_title: Great game but lags a little

one_reviews_text:
Looks like a dumb game. 
But for me it gets my blood flowing. 
A true therapy device.
Helps to regain your balance in real life. 

Try the demo for a taste.

To preface, I have such a poor sense of rhythm (and tone deafness or something) that I was incapable of passing the tutorial for the Rhythm Heaven games. I don't play rhythm games at all, I can't stand them. In fact, I bought this game for my wife and in-laws to try.

And now I'm addicted. I love it. The natural feeling of the swords, the amazing music, the actual feel as you cut the blocks. I've mostly been back and forth between Normal and Hard so far, but I'm pushing this so I can hit the higher difficulties to make it my exercise game. I need a new face padding because I start to seriously sweat. I love this game. Don't hesitate, buy it.
review_title: I am TERRIBLE at Rhythm Games

one_reviews_text: Let me just start off by saying this game is amazing. A lot of newbies always overlook this game because they don't see the hype in it but the only way you can really see it is by playing it. Custom songs and mods are one of the biggest apps for this game. Those are what bring the game to life.
review_title: One of the most OVERLOOKED title

one_reviews_text: It might have its ups and downs but over all it’s a great game. Just try not to play it all the time. Because when you stand up for so long it really starts to hurt so don’t get to attached. Oh and if any one who made this game is reading this please make a sitting down mode! I really want to continue playing but it would start to hurt SOooo much.😁☺️Thx
review_title: THIS IS THE BEST GAME EVER

one_reviews_text: Forget going outside to work up a sweat. This game is a mix of eye coordination and a workout. 100% would recommend I have hade it for like 3 days and I am moving up the ranks. This game is easy to learn and gives a challenge as the notes move faster as well as multiply the amount of notes that appear.

I have a few VR games but this one, is probably the easiest to enjoy and have direct fun with. So satisfying, and a very great exemple of a game that takes you to « the flow », that state when you don’t think and are just the witness of your body doing the perfect actions. Now when I listen to some music, I find myself thinking what it would be like playing them on beat saber (like blackpink ahah)

I got my quest 2 on launch day, and was excited to set it up and try it out. This was my first vr headset, and i didn't know what games to get. 
I then saw beat saber on the store, and got it since every reviewer reccomends it  for a first game.
I tried it, and it is GREAT. If you're on the fence about this game, just get it already! It's gameplay is fun and addicting, and it gets BRUTALLY difficult when you step up the difficulties.
However, there aren't too many songs, so I reccomend you get BMBF, even though it's a bit of a hassle.

Truly has an amazing experience with songs/musics. It's also a good fitness activity if you up for the hard modes or Expert / Expert+. Downloading BMBF into this game makes it 10X better with the variety of custom songs I'm able to play, its a great extension for the game. In my opinion if you are bored and just want to have some great fun then Beat Saber is your go to game! Beating to songs has never felt better with this VR experience.
review_title: Best Beat to Song Game Of All Time

one_reviews_text:
This game is the most enjoyable gaming experience I’ve had in years. I love the varied play styles in the different soundtracks included within the game: swordplay choreography, drumming, etc. My favorite addition to the game is the BTS sound pack, because the play style seems to incorporate some of the dance moves similar to the boy band’s choreography- really fun!

I’d love to see more additions to the game, both free and pay, which use more varied dance moves (groove, funk, disco, country dances, etc.). Also it would be fun to see more swordplay style arrangements, it is beat SABER after all.
review_title: Not just a “hit the beat” game.

one_reviews_text: I don’t play it much because I’m more into the shooters and stuff but it’s a really fun game that brought me back to my guitar hero 3 days. Super cool concept and a great workout as well.

There’s a reason this is one of the most downloaded games on every VR platform. Can also be used as an exercise regimen. I personally lost 25lbs playing 1 hour everyday for 3 months and loved every minute of it. Go check out some official videos from the dev, there’s really nothing else to say.
It’s straight up a good game, not gunna cap🤙

If you've seen videos of this game online you know exactly what the gameplay is like. To be honest, this is one of those games that look great but are even better when you pick it up. 

You just gotta trust me on this one.
This game has plenty of reviews so just adding my 5 stars and moving on.
It's a really fun game, but it needs more song variety most of the songs on here are techno or pop, it would be cool to have some more rock songs for this game.
Slicing through blocks in VR and only feeling some vibration as feedback while a song is playing in the background is odly one of the most satisfying things I've ever done
review_title: Most satisfying game I've ever played

one_reviews_text: As a title states, I thought I'd actually hate this game. I thought this game had no real appeal. I thought this game would do nothing for me. I was wrong, I play this game more than anything else. There is a minor learning curve but after a couple of times practicing and getting some music you really like (I bought the linkin park album) this game becomes amazing and fun in ways that don't make you ever want to drop your controllers.
review_title: <3 love this game & thought I'd hate it

one_reviews_text:
Beat saber is one of those games you buy that you can't stop playing, even after months. Beat Saber is one of the first games I bought in VR, and I am so glad I bought it.

I have had the game for over a year, and I am still loving as much as I did back then. With the amount of music packs available, and the abilities such as mods, colours of the sabers/blocks and multiple environments to choose from makes the game even better with the amount of customization options available.

The multiplayer mode has also recently came out, in which you play amongst four other players to complete the song chosen. The atmosphere is great with this mode, and makes the games 10x more enjoyable.

The game is also incredibly addicting and brings you back to it!

Overall I am really enjoying this game, and I would totally recommend!

This game is super fun! You can work out while hitting the beats with your sabers. It’s like Star Wars meets guitar hero. It’s really fun with custom songs. I’ve recently downloaded some. Go follow my twitch it’s xLiezx100
I absolutely love this game it's a must have really gets the adrenaline pumping but I wish it came with more songs without buying additional ones

It was fun to slash blocks and all that stuff. I liked watching videos of beat saber then I stopped. I wanted to have the actual experience of slashing those blocks. My adrenaline boosted and made me realize that I was in another world. 

(Edit) haven’t stopped playing now around Expert+

This game is the reason I bought a vr headset, and I love it. I played it on my friend's headset before I could buy my own, and now that I own it I get to feel satisfied and hit blocks with sticks anytime I want to! My one qualm is that Quest users don't have access to custom songs except through third party programs. I don't use any of these programs, but I do think that allowing users to access custom beatmaps through the oculus system would be a great improvement.

Beat saber alone is a great game easily worth the money but it really starts to get good once you add mods custom songs custom sabers suddenly this already long game becomes infinite and is personalized I wouldn’t keep coming back if I didn’t know something new would be there each time (Modding will remove the online function which is just playing beat saber next to another person)
Must have for the quest or any vr headset.

one_reviews_text: Beat saber is an incredible game and when you hit all the notes perfectly it’s really satisfying but the game isn’t quite as I expected. I thought that when I bought the game, I would be able to play custom songs made by the community, songs that I listen to everyday but that’s not the case. In order to play custom songs, you have to download a beat saber song library from online and because I don’t have a PC, this is just not possible. Something that should definitely be added is an official custom song library where people can use whatever music/audio they want to make beat saber songs for the community. This should have been a feature from day 1 and it would EASILY get 5 stars from me and many others if this was implemented. I really hope the Devs do something like this, I can imagine that many people would love it.

I've stayed fit during COVID, and leveled up to Expert(+) which Is CRAZY FUN. As a guy who grew up on DDR, I never thought I'd find a suitable replacement - a rhythm game that could get your heart pumping and your body grooving to that sweet beat. 

My miracle came in the form of Beat Saber. This app has monumentally changed my life and is the one game I keep coming back to every day. Stop reading, and buy it. BUY IT RIGHT NOW.
review_title: The one I keep coming back to

one_reviews_text: I loved this game ever since I purchased it.  The songs are great the beat keeps your moving and multiplayer mode is excellent.  I love challenging myself to get the high score.  As another reviewer mentioned it is best to relax yourself and go with the flow getting to excited can make you miss a beat.  Overall I give this game a 10/10
review_title: Best Game out for the Quest and Quest 2

one_reviews_text:
Ok I must admit, Beat Saber was the main reason I bought my Quest. It looked like a lot of fun, and I figured it might be entertaining enough to keep my interest and keep me exercising.

Many months later, here I am, still using at least 5 times a week while working from home, because I love it. And after 6 months of COVID lockdown, I’ve lost 45lb/21kg. How many people can say that? Admittedly I’m eating better too, but that regular bit of exercise is a huge help. My Fitbit even recognises it as an aerobic workout automatically.

Pretty comfortably settled on normal difficulty with ‘faster song’ selected for now, but starting to try the next step up and getting through them ok.

Just get it. You won’t regret it.
Amazing game. I would just love a custom song option instead of songs I've never heard of.

Awesome game, and I mean awesome. It’s extremely addictive and glitch free. The only issue I have (baring in mind even with this niggle I still give it 5 stars) is that there aren’t enough songs. You can go through them all in an hour or so. The packs to buy more are almost half as much as the game itself in some cases. Still, you should 100% buy this game, you will not be disappointed !

cannot praise it enough. Perfect for people new to VR and people who have been in VR for quite some time. Perfection.

And yeah I know that side loading more music is an option but I’d rather pay for more official music packs instead of treading the murky waters of piracy and DRM.

Can you see the next note? I couldn't. I had it on normal and set the speed to 175 and was still getting A's but i just couldn't figure out why i couldn't make it through hard mode. Then i figured it out in multiplayer mode. In the settings to the left of you while in the lobby count down if you set the note distance to FAR and then also disable the debris effect it works so much better for me. I think its cool that those settings are there and you can still get the same quality workout all around on hard. I just need to find these settings in solo mode now and also figure out how to adjust my height. The height of the avatar float is there to adjust but i cant move it any higher than its default setting. Im guessing at just a little higher you can maybe see what's behind the notes a little better as well. Im glad i found this out because on default settings i was ready to get a refund and just eat the green day tracks i purchased. Solid work.

I would like to see 90 & 360 with Hard mode for every song.

I am new to the VR world and it has been so much fun playing this game. I was nervous that the game wasn’t going to live up to my expectations due to all the talk about it. I was wrong! I have even gotten no gamers involved loving the game which says something. Campaign mode is solid and I enjoyed how they advance you to the next levels. All in all great game and I love all the add ons too!
You already know beat saber is good. Why are you even reading the reviews. Just get the game already
Loved it on PC, the quest version will get 5 stars from me once bluetooth headphones can used with causing huge amounts of lag.

All I can say is this is by far the best vr game to get you into vr.
The graphics are the music awesome and it gets you fit.
This title is a must for anyone buying into vr.
true story 👍
So much fun. It's not as good a workout as FitFx of thrill of the fight, but it's a lot more fun.
I absolutely love this game. I love that I can connect to my friends in other households and it feels like we are in the same room having a dance off! Definitely keeping us all fit! Brilliant game.
Get it now!
I love this games its absolutely amazing for my first game on vr will definitely purchase the song packs for it

I didn’t think this game could get better, but I am amazed at how fun it is as a multiplayer game. The beginning of each song feels like you are in the movie Tron which is just awesome, and competing with others makes you continually strive to improve. I don’t know, I just seem to be better at this game when playing multiplayer, and this is a game that the better you get at it multiplies your enjoyment. Also the multiplayer pushes me to try maps I hadn’t really thought to spend much time in previously and find a new appreciation for them. Great work guys.

I can’t actually believe I’m about to say this but... the multiplayer mode that’s been added to beatsaber recently has ABSOLUTELY transformed the entire game for me and I’m actually starting to like it a lot!!! 😲 I’ve been playing VR games for around 3 years or so now and I was never ever a huge fan of beatsaber in that entire time and always found it hard to wonder what the appeal was. Don’t get me wrong I thought it was ok as one of those games to go into for around 10-15 mins (even with custom songs) but I ended up getting bored super quickly even on the higher difficulty modes. But this.. this beautiful creation where you can compete against others live on all the songs, all the various difficulties, seeing whos ahead during a song or even spectating others. its an absolute GAME CHANGER and it’s EXACTLY what this title needed to pull people like me in. Never ever thought I’d say I love beatsaber and I never ever thought I’d write a review on this but I now do and I now have! 

My summary: A 3-4 star game at best without the multiplayer aspect as it can get old quickly but now with multiplayer at your disposal this is a 5 star title all day long! Really well done to the devs!!!

Beat Saber is a game that everybody should play at least play once in your lifetime. This is one of the games I show people just getting into VR especially if they like music. 

With the fantastic multiplayer added and all the different music added including music from one of my favorite games of all time Rocket League I can't not buy this game. 

You can have fun on the easy or normal difficulties and all you have to do is swing so, it just makes it easy for new people to pick it up and get use to playing. On expert+ it's the hardest game I've played in my life but still beatable. 

Though Audica is my favorite rhythm game Beat Saber is a must own game in your library.

I adore this game, it’s fun, addictive but not too bad, it challenges you and makes you want to improve your skills. But, it’s $35 CAD, and you have to pay to unlock more songs. Which is  absolutely ridiculous, also I see the “custom level” request a lot in the reviews and I agree, we need the versatility that the other platforms have, because as it stands the music can feel samey and after a while you are left wanting more, but to get more there is a $10 CAD price tag. Please fix this issue devs, please don’t make us pay more ontop of the already pretty high price tag. 

EDIT: So I forgot I thought of something, maybe instead of an entire custom level editor you guys could take ~5 most played custom levels from the pc version and then from there add the next most played song from pc a week. Just an idea but could make the game a bit more worth the price tag.

TL;DR: Lacks variety and has expensive micro transactions even though it’s an expensive game already

Another Edit
Alright like 3-4 months later, I still play this game fairly often, but only for the BMBF community, the new multiplayer update is cool but doesn’t work with mods installed, it’s a fair trade off at first glance. But when PC users are both encouraged to mod the game and still get to enjoy the full game it just makes it really hard to enjoy the game to its fullest. One of the huge reasons BMBF is so cool is because the base game mapping gets really dull at around expert-expert+, a lot of the notes just seem to be repetitive up and downs, BMBF modding fixes this because there are so many different people mapping the songs so there’s always variety.

I just hope we can see a bit more mod support in the future, but for now it seems like it’s going to be the opposite because when starting up a modded version of the game you get a warning.

People fixed your game for you, at least give us the courtesy to enjoy it.

This game is so much fun when you really get into it and are just nailing the notes, It's hard not to have a big stupid smile on your face.  I wish they had put more effort into the campaign mode though. Usually the campaign mode in a rhythm game introduces you to all the content at increasing levels of difficulty so you have a natural progression from easy to expert or whatever. 

Some of the modifiers you encounter are great, others are hard to believe the made it off of paper and into the game. I don't mind failing for missing too many notes or making too many bad cuts. But failing because my combo got too high? Or I didn't miss enough notes? Because I didn't cover 800m while playing the song? Those mechanics just aren't fun. Everything else is absolutely amazing.
review_title: Songs are great, campaign is horrible

Between every song you have to stop and pick a new song and start that song. I wish they would have an option for continuous play.￼

The game is great but multiplayer is lacking allot of important Things. 

1. Chat in lobby or in game when playing with friends. Chat works perfect in game in fx population one. 

2. Theme packs are great. But in multiplayer the design of the stage is different. Thats a shame.

3. I love 360 mode. A great workout. But I cant compete in multiplayer in 360 mode. 

4. You sound be able to send a friend invite to a game instead of have to text them a code. 

Y. In the same songs. The same places its like one of the controllers loose tracking and it is impossible to hit all boxes. Some times a restart fixes the problem.

If the above is fixed. The game is near a masterpiece.
Really makes you feel bad&ss, I got from playing beginner to hard in 5 days! I wish there were more songs to choose from without buying packs though.
Love the options of the game.  Pack upgrade are reasonable.

Ok, at first it is exciting, and seems like a good workout. However, I soon discovered that I only have to move my head to avoid obstacles. Even true for the fitness soundtrack (left right, etc.). Hardly do I have to bend down to avoid obstacles (developers please add them!). Mainly good for hand eye coordination training. Workout level equivalent to walking once you understand the tricks!! And yes, I do expert levels too! The 90 and 360 mode tries to improve this, but there are very few songs that have this option and with limited difficulty levels!
They could have made more use of room space. Just allowing one meter to move left or right and many more low flying obstacles would make it much better. Or are they afraid that players may get hurt by moving around? I want to train my leg muscles also! Why not introduce obstacles to avoid by going down with your face on the ground? So far only up to hip level and very few cases! Increasing difficulty level mainly limited to an increase in blocks per second leading to faster wrist movenents mainly.

Music? Well all the same stuff (not something I would normally listen to). They could have added more variation, or do they expect you to buy music packs?

The demo level was great because I could compete with friend who used my Quest and their names would appear on the score list, not possible with the paid version (everyone needs to have their own Quest+game). So we use pen and paper for that...

If developers would address these points it would easily be a five point score.
review_title: Not enough options for a good workout

LONG STORY SHORT:
Post update
Missing sounds, inconsistent blocks height, super low menu, cut block's halfs fly right into your eyes, bad auto height measurement, inactive manual height measurement (DOESN'T WORK ANYMORE), safety net always pop up unlike pre update.
People who use Oculus Quest ONE talk about the same thing on Reddit . 

Long story:
It all was fun and smooth until I decided to update. 
Is it meant for giant midgets? 
All of the Menu became SUPER low. Meanwhile regular maps give me higher blocks. Maps, I got used to, feel super uncomfortable now. Fixing height doesn't help, because IT DOESN'T WORK ANYMORE. FIX IT. Auto height makes blocks too high for me. And then again, I cannot manually put my height anymore. Almost every time the sound for the very first cut blocks Does NOT appear. (Angel Voices keeps constantly missing the sound in the beginning). Very Unpleasant. Blocks being inconsistent. Too low or too high blocks in maps/songs that used to be very comfortable to play. The warning net is always there. I KNOW I HAVE A SMALL ROOM, LET ME PLAY. It was not popping up so much before, now it's constantly there, I had to make a way bigger play area, where I have a furniture just so I would not have to deal with that net right in from of my eyes. Also, I used to cut blocks and the particles were falling aside, now they always fall into my eyes. WHY?? ? WHY YOU HAD TO RUIN THE ONLY GAME I GOT OCULUS FOR. I got it just for this game. And now it's HANDICAPPED.

Offline is brilliant. This will be one of the only games you will come back to. It has some brilliant songs and really satisfying maps. I'd generally only tried the songs I was familiar with until I went online though.

The online is a great new addition and a good opportunity to try some of the maps you aren't used to. They are excellent and a lot are more challenging than you'd think. My only issue with the online and the reason this is four stars and not five is that the game joining tool should be fixed. There should be more options than just all mappings or standard mappings so that you can tick the packs you actually have. There also needs to be some sort of fix on game state that you join, otherwise the first ten minutes of trying to play is spent either trying to find a lobby that hasn't already started or trying to find one with a map you can actually play. Genuinely have searched for a game on putting on my headset and for the first 15 searches its either been midway through or a map I don't have, these arent great odds. When you do find a game its brilliant though!!

Beat Saber was one of the few games on my list of games to get when I bought the Quest 2. Superhot VR, Onward, and Tetris Effect are also on that list. As a then-PSVR player of Beat Saber, I'm actually impressed with Beat Games for making such an addictingly good game.

As others mentioned, I highly recommend getting BMBF to make the experience better. As it gives you more songs to choose from, and it allows you to get more for your money, but even without BMBF, I'm saying this right now, this game is probably a must-have for Quest owners.

The only real complaint I have with Beat Saber, is the updated menu. I personally don't the main menu. Every other thing about the UI is fine when talking about modes.

Apart from that, however, even with the updated main menu, I personally recommend Beat Saber.
It is sooo fun it’s like no game I’ve ever played before and it gets even better by modding but you can still enjoy it without mods. 10/10 would recommend buying.

I have played for 80+ hours now. Beat Saber is an amazing game, but if you don't mod the game, you most likely will run out of content after a few weeks. Once you mod the game, it lets you into a massive community of wonderful people. Also it lets you rank and play custom songs (there are thousands of them). The game is a must have if you buy a vr, otherwise you are just missing out.

Got this game on the Oculus store on PC as I had a Rift but wanted to get a Quest 2 when out so wanted to have it on Oculus Store for having it out and about.  Well more fall me as every game I bought on the PC Oculus Store was there on my Quest 2 but Beat Sabre that wanted me to pay for it again, and to ad salt to the wound every game I buy on Quest 2 unlocks on PC too but this game.  Still was able to play my PC Oculus vision with my friend on Oculus Quest 1 so with no where to go just waited till game came on sale and now I have and can review.  While waiting had a friend with a Rift join us, only he did not.  He had bought game on Steam and despite me running same game on PC just though Oculus store he could not join my game, as he bought on same platform but different device.  One day I might get on Steam too as they have crazy sales so can play with friends their too, but making you pay three times just seems needlessly greedie.  I say needless as I would rate this game 5 star, love it and buy all the packs which at their price would be way more than three copies of this game when bough on sales.  But when I know there is no chance in hell they will unlock packs you bought on the many copy’s they make you buy if you want to play with friends no way.  Also why have 8 player mode.  I might have 8 friends who I will play this with for sure, chance they all have bought on the same store on PC I would rate as zero.

So in short buy this game it’s amazing, but be careful where you buy it as it’s the most restricted for no good reason out there.

Let me start by saying that I think Beat Saber is a great game. Lots of fun, good exercise, endlessly playable. I’ve enjoyed it immensely as a Quest 1 owner. That’s why I was really disappointed to discover that when I got my new Quest 2 and transferred over the game, all my scores and settings were lost. Evidently they are saved on the device and there’s no automatic way to back up. There are Sideloading instructions for back up that may or may not work but it’s a complicated and uncertain way to do something that ought to be automatic and easy. I mean, come on, I can back up my phone with a swipe of my finger!  It’s not just Beat Saber, btw, it’s many if not most games.  A serious enough problem that I’m considering returning my Quest 2 despite it being a lot better visually. If Facebook and game developers want to develop a VR community beyond the early adopters, they need to FIX THIS.
I’ve probably got over 700 hours clocked in this game. It provides a fun to exercise in addition to having the most satisfying mechanics even despite its simplicity!  The first masterpiece in VR.

I've had beat saber on both PC and quest for a long time now. It's a good game. Is it perfect? no. 

The list of songs it has without DLC is definitely lacking a bit. that's probably because most of the songs are actually made by one (or more) of the developers, and it takes a bit to make a good music. 
It also requires money to license music to be in your game. I don't know how much but I'm assuming a lot. 

As someone who is somewhat knowledgeable in the game development space, I have nothing but respect for the devs. 
Does that make me biased? I don't know.
What I do know is that I've been having fun with the game for about 2 years now, with some mods on PC, and no mods on quest. ( I haven't played PC beat saber for several months now, so Take that as you will) 

It's good, and multiplayer made it better.

Don't expect mods to work well.

Yes i know VR is capable of so much more, but beat sabers is what i used to justify buying a VR headset to my wife. It’s more than waving make believe glowy stick to break make believe boxes. 
It’s a great cardio workout for people like me who live sedentary lives. I’m no dancer, by any stretch, but i’ve found myself swaying, grooving and moving to the rhythm of the music and gradually improving my hand, eye and feet coordination.

Or for pointers on how to slash younglings (if that’s what you’re in to)

When I first got my Oculus Quest, I knew I was going to get Beat Saber. Seeing how fun the game was on a flat screen is so low compared to actually experiencing the game in VR. Even side loading BMBF onto my Quest literally opened a new door to the rest of the Beat Saber world. I was able to download custom songs and sabers, which if you didn’t know are by far the best this game has to offer. Still, whether you choose just to use the game as is, or side load custom stuff onto Beat Saber, you will surely enjoy what VR has to offer in Beat Saber.
So this is really a review for the multiplayer mode, its great but I would like to have voice chat, if you can please work on that, but it’s great thanks for making it!

Now when I first saw the trailer, I thought it looked pretty cool, but it also looked like just one of those “tap on the beat” games that kids get on their phones. 
So one day, a friend brings his Oculus to our, and my family played on it, and when I played, I loved it!! I can’t put it into words on how epic it makes you feel!
A few weeks later, I got my own VR headset literally just to play this game because it was so amazing!
Of course, I have more than just Beat Saber, but this game will always be my favorite on the VR!

Skimming through YouTube one day, I came across a video for a game that had light sabre’s, floating cubes and great music. Jump forward to actually getting my Quest and this was the first game I bought and wasn’t disappointed! The concept couldn’t be simpler - slice the flying boxes, with the matching coloured light Saber in the direction of the arrow, how hard can it be, asks every friend that’s had a go - easy to pick up, hard to master, fun to play and watch! And I’m pretty sure a certain Sith Lord had a hand in some of the campaign levels 😂.

In a nutshell, buy it, you won’t regret it!

I know this is long but trust me it’s all worth reading especially if you’re new.

I spent some time looking at the different reviews on here and the majority of complaints were about not having a variety of songs, if you’re thinking about getting this game then I can help you out with that all you need to do is download BMBF if you google it you’ll find dozens of videos on how to install it on your headset but a forewarning you will need a computer to download the software just once as well as a USB-C cable not your headset charger (any Mac or apple laptop charger will suffice as well) once you have these download side quest where you can find hundreds of side loadable games and apps and use that Dow download BMBF which will let you get custom songs without needing to plug your headset in again.

I would also recommend not immediately purchasing all the DLC maybe one or two packs but a surprisingly high amount of the songs can be found on BMBF.

If you’re looking to play the game for fitness purposes then also download YUR: fitness tracker from Sidequest on your computer, I did recently and it’s quite fun to fill up your daily progress meter while hacking and slashing at various colorful blocks.

Finally, (yeah I’m surprised I wrote this much too) if you’re still on the edge about this game in my opinion it is worth every cent I have had tons of fun with my cousins competing for the highest score or racing to get a full combo first and even by yourself it’s a fun physical challenge you can enjoy while rocking out to your favorite songs if you aren’t a fan of high speed games or have difficulty moving the lower levels are fairly easy and simple but still provide fun for those who can’t quite finish the Expert/Expert+ levels. I’ve had hours of fun with what is probably the premiere game of VR right now and never before have I enjoyed a rhythm game as much as this, Beatsaber lets me challenge myself physically and mentally and gauge my own personal growth while allowing me to enjoy one of the best experience of VR; I hope you enjoy it as well.

It feels a little mean of me to rate one of my favorite apps down a star because of this, but I thought the developers would be more likely to read my review if I rated 4 stars. The glitch is that, after playing the game for a long time (more than 30 min), the left saber begins to flicker and glitch and no longer follows my hand movement. There’s not a problem with the left hand controller in other games or in beat saber when I play for a short time only.

I like the song library and the graphics. My favorite thing about it is the vibrating feeling you get when you put the two sabers together :). I get the feeling that this is a game Jedi would play in their free time in the Star Wars universe, which is pretty cool. 

Oh there’s one other thing I don’t like: the best songs don’t come with the base game and have to be purchased separately. Also, the difficulty of the add-on song packs is much higher than the difficulty of the base game songs, which could be good or bad depending on how good you are (:

Look! I'll say it now and I'll only say it once, I was really skeptical and thought I'd never get this game. I'd watched videos, read articles, and skimmed over HUNDREDS of reviews. But words and videos will bot and can not describe how amazing this game is. Even on the demo alone, after one play through the level, I was immediately sucked in and wanted more. Every time you hit a block the controllers vibrate a bit, sending a pulse of chemical happiness through my brain. Hitting every single block is like a little dopamine button. I have not ONCE got tired of this game! And heck, if you get tired of the OST levels there are always DLC! If you're lucky enough to have a computer, too, you can also install custom beatmaps with only a few clicks! The game hardly crashes, has amazing graphics, NO glitches, and for a concept so simple has granted me many hours of gameplay and many hours to come. This was the second game I ever got on my quest and lemme tell ya, it was WORTH IT! If you haven't played beatsaber, you are NOT using your headset to its full potential. Oh, and did I mention the workout it gives you? Since I started playing, I've lost 5 pounds and been able to curl 25lbs in each hand. Before I started playing I could hardly muster 10.

one_reviews_text:
It's a simple concept really, but highly enjoyable to play and addictive #musclememmory. It has good game mechanics, builds up your reflexes, memory and cardio and has some truly gamer oriented higher difficulty settings - the trick is to rewire your visual cortex straight into your motor cortex: 0 ping, no lag.
It's even a perfect VR experience if you are willing to buy the beter music packs.

'Cause my only complaint is the music that's with the base game, that's not a part I look forward to when I load into beat saber. It's probably the reason I don't play the game more, to be frank.
I know music tastes vary, but still, it's pretty poor borderline annoying at times.

This way, beat saber does rack up a high pick up price, with vanilla + some real songs. 

But the truth is, it's probably still worth it. 
There are days BeatSaber simply puts a smile on my face. (Yes, let's!)

Hopefully, future generation beat saberers will get some of the current DLC as FLC, as more DLC comes out. Now then... it will be a no brainer, must buy.

Now it's just highly recommended, for the energetic gamers amongst you - it's not just Zoom that needs your speed...

one_reviews_text:
Everybody knows this is the "killer app" for VR. Everyone can play it, everybody will love it. Best "casual" (though there are competitive leaderboards) rhythm game of all time, period.

Quest needs official support for custom songs, which in my opinion will not harm revenue from music packs (I have bought 3 and they are all *exceptional* and worth buying). Conversely, without a map community, players can and absolutely *will* burn out on the included songs.

Not docking a star-- there exists nothing better, and even with built-in songs only, months off replayability. But custom songs/map support would escalate this to a level it still hasn't reached.

This game is so much fun. Its like guitar hero but way better. The music packs are a must buy too. I have Green Day, Imagin Dragons, Panic at the Disco, and just purchased Linkin Park (love the Panic and LP songs, so much fun). This has endless hours of fun. You can master different levels of difficulty as well as play 360 mode on most songs. Blocks coming from all angles. You'll build some muscle and endurance playing too!

This game saved my shoulder after I was in a car accident. At one point I wasn't able to move it at all and I already didn't like the workouts they kept giving me at Physical Therapy. So I kept up with flailing my arms around in between PT sessions and I was back to normal playing expert levels all over again.  I love this game. I dance like an idiot when I play and if you haven't tried that yet....you're not living yet.

If you've played VR for more than 10 minutes, you've probably heard of beat saber, and if you haven't, you're missing out. I'd say beat saber is like the Mario Brothers of VR, an instant classic that everyone loves! If you're on the fence for buying this game, look no further, as soon as you buy this, you won't be able to stop! Here's why: The game mechanics are simple, slice the cubes with the correct lightsaber color and direction in time with the music, but it's a nice challenge to master, figuring out how notes flow, and what tricks work best. The music in my opinion sounds great, i couldn't imagine any other type of music for this game, but if you don't like it, please don't let your opinion ruin this game's reviews because of your opinion. (There's ways to mod it anyway if you don't like the music but still respect the developers' time and effort into this wonderful game) The only problem I'd ever have with this game is that it can be tiring after a few hours of playing, but it's a good workout and it's so fun while doing it! i would rate this in my top games of all time, even off of VR. I hope this eating helps you make the choice of buying this game (seriously, you won't regret it), and have a good day.
review_title: An absolute must of VR titles

one_reviews_text: After playing this game on my brother's oculus, I ran out and bought myself my own....if that tells you anything. I love this game. It's fun. Most of the songs are catchy and make you want to dance. Yes, it can be glitchy at times, which I noticed happens more when the battery is low with the headset or one of the remotes. It doesn't happen enough to make me want to quit. It is enjoyable to play, and the next thing you know, it has turned into an awesome workout you've been doing for 45 minutes. I also love that there's an option to change colors of the light sabers (mine are purple and blue now 🙃) and all the other game playing options. [As a suggestion, it would be cool if you could create a playlist and then have a "play all" option without stopping between songs.]
My wife loves this game. She plays it at least 2 hours every day.  Went from beginner level to expert in a few months and can’t get enough

This is my first time ever owning a VR headset and if you were to buy any game for your own headset, it should without a doubt be this one! Great exercise, good song choices and lots of fun. I have an Oculus Quest and have not yet found a better game that allows you to do what this one does. If you have an Oculus Rift, Quest, Rift S or HTC Vive that are compatible, I strongly recommend this game!

The game has about 30 songs which you can play on different difficulties. You can change a lot of modifiers to play your way. There is a campaign mode which brings you up to speed, solo mode which you can play any song in, and then an online mode. The online mode consists of you and some other players playing the same song and you can see each from across the room, no talking though. Graphics are incredible on the quest 2 and this is an essential vr game. Master the beat saber!

I'm mostly going to go over the pros and cons

Pros
Great selection of songs
Graphics are Oh So Good
Good selection of difficulties
The game really fits all ages :)
C O L O U R S ! ! !
Great workout Game!
Good starting game if your just now getting into VR!

Cons :(
Can glitch out a little bit (especially if your playing on PSVR but this is oculus, sooo)
Could cause minor headachs, but it goes away pretty quickly
Lotta strobe lights, sooo, seazures are a tiny risk.

Overall Score, I'd say 9.6/10, Good Job!

one_reviews_text:
Beat Saber is a must have game for any VR setup. This is the game you show friends and family to show them why VR is fun. It's not yje best VR demo but it's fun, it's exercise and it's terribly addictive.

You work through the songs fast though and here comes the big "but". The music packs are essential for the longevity of the game and their quality vary a lot. Another gripe I have which I think buyers should be aware of is that getting the game on the headset store DOES NOT entitle you to the game on the PC. Choose wisely or you will need to buy a game you already own.

Hi! I could write this for potential buyers, but seriously, what can I say that hasn't already been said? Anyway, what I want to say to the developers is that you really need to give a big fat giant wallop of a raise to whoever made the maps for the new Linkin Park pack!!!!! Also, please give that person the ability to build all future maps. I say this because, while beat saber rules the quest, for the most part the maps become pretty predictable once you've played a lot of songs. These new Linkin Park maps are STUPID FUN!!!! They're even fun in normal mode and usually I don't play normal mode because it's boring to me. So, yeah, more of this arm waving, dancing, creative awesomeness that has me playing for so long that I have trouble lifting my arms because I wouldn't stop because it's just too fun. Please and thank you!!! Seriously, please tell the creator of the Linkin Park maps thank you for me. 😁

So far this game is great!  I enjoy the play style, and the music. Then last night I took turns playing it with my son competition style and it totally changed how I view this game.  We had a blast going back and forth to see who could get the high score or the fewest misses.  Unfortunately once we move to a new song there’s no way to know who had the high score unless you write it down or just remember them all.  I think Beat Saber may be missing an opportunity to have an arcade style setup where you can enter your initials for your score.  Otherwise an awesome game that provides some working out, def recommend!

I just got the Oculus Quest and I got it due to Beat Saber Linkin Park! Of course I had always wanted a VR set! Haven't even purchased Linkin Park Pack yet and am loving the game and the beats!!! 2nd day and I'm in pain, but the good pain: sore from such a workout!!! Get ready to sweat!!!  I give it 100 stars!!! Like others say: you need this!!! :)

I want to preface this by saying that this game is phenomenal and I recommend this to anyone who has a quest. But it could be better. For one, there’s this really annoying glitch where your saber goes through the block and you miss because of a glitch. But the bigger problem is the fact that you can not have custom songs. It is possible, we know this because of BMBF, but they chose not to include it because... why? It makes no sense at all, but I think it’s because they want to sell more DLC music packs. If you’re really in it for the money, then make custom songs DLC. It would be better if you just make custom songs a free update, but that’s not gonna happen. At least not with Facebook controlling this thing.

At the moment of me typing this, Beat Saber is the best vr rhythm game I've ever played. I started playing on PSVR and bought my Quest solely to be able to play Beat Saber with no wires. 
The gameplay is easy to learn and a bit difficult to master, but nothing is more satisfying than slicing block after block in rhythmic bliss. 
I have bought every music pack available and will continue to buy them as they release. 
Buy it. Buy it right now.

So straight off the bat this game is phenomenal you have one simple task and that is to complete the level and not fail and you do the by slicing blocks in the correct ￼ Direction with the right color and if you miss a white bar on the bottom of the hud will go down if that is completely empty you fail and as you practice you can rise through the difficulties from easy to expert plus there are DLC packs if you want any extra songs however there’s something that I think some of us want we want another monster cat X rocket league pack vol 2 or a paid or free Camila pack vol 2￼. 
There is a glitch if you logon and all of your data is gone don’t worry it will automatically  recover itself, this has happened to me twice￼

one_reviews_text: the fitness gram pacer test is a multistage aerobic capacity test that progressively get more difficult as it continues. The 20 meter pacer test will begin in 30 seconds. Line up at the start. The running speed starts slowly, but gets faster each minute after you hear this signal. [beep] A single lab should be completed each time you hear this sound. [ding] remember to run in a straight line, and run as long as possible . The second time you fail to complete a lap before the sound, your test is over. The test will begin on the word start. On your mark, get ready, start.

There's a demo for Beat Saber so try it before buying to make sure you'll enjoy it. The track in the demo is probably the best in the base game though. I didnt expect to like it but was suprised how fun playing the track 'Pop stars' was in the demo.

Modding the game to allow custom tracks is a bit of a pain but it opens up a world of quality content and brings the game up to 5 stars. I'd probably rate the unmodded game 3 stars due to its limited track selection, most of which is just electro music.

With custom tracks the game is easily 5 stars. I play it daily and find it an enjoyable light workout.

I love this game. The moment I got it, I used BMBF to add custom songs. Despite the fact that this game has inspired the creator in me (mapping songs), it is less than desirable that since I have the quest, I’d have to buy this game again on the rift store in order to use the game editor that is part of the game when I hook my quest up to my computer, even though I have already purchased the game. So now, I have to do this whole complicated process in order to create music.

Don’t get me wrong, the game is super fun! I have played it before on the PlayStation VR and I loved it! When, I got my Quest I got this game on it, too (obviously). On PSVR, it was so fun and amazing! But not on the Quest. It’s also much harder on the Quest. I remember beating an Expert level but on the Quest, I can hardly complete Normal. I dunno! I got some music packs and this game and enjoy. My family enjoys. So, is it worth it. Yes, if you’re new. If you’ve played it before, then you now!

Absolutely fantastic game and totally addicted to it. Party mode is my go to work out and it’s a phenomenal rush when you get that full combo.

I have only two gripes:

Firstly campaign. I can’t play it...

My wife started the campaign, it’s her progress in the campaign and there’s no way for me to have my own.

Granted this should be Oculus/Facebooks responsibility to enable multi user profiles on the console. However, as it doesn’t seem as though this is coming any time soon it falls to the developers to allow save slots for multiple users. 5 stars if this appears in a future update.

Secondly (a tiny one admittedly):

The playlist section is one playlist. Again a couple of playlist saves would be great. Personally, I’d like to create a casual chill playlist, a workout playlist (or 2/3) and a party playlist.

If these gripes seem picky it’s because otherwise this is a fantastic game that I have poured many hours in to with no regrets.

Looking forward to future updates (the addition of Fit Beat as a new song was perfectly timed and has kept me fit these last couple of months stuck inside)

Before Beat Saber, I was decidedly skeptical of VR as all the games I tried seemed boring, and exercise was always a total chore.  After trying it, I was shocked to find that I found both the VR and the aerobics enjoyable and even so addictive that I had to purchase my own headset just to play.  Beat Saber on the Quest also has the benefit of no wires to get in the way on 360 levels.

Tip to newbies, play the campaign, it actually acts as a pretty good tutorial for leveling up in your saber skills, although some of the requirements are a little silly.  I’ve never had much hand-eye coordination in video games or sports but with consistent practice have been able to clear some expert plus levels.

The game can get a little tedious after you’ve played every song dozens of times and are stuck on the same level forever, but that’s when getting custom songs through Sidequest comes in handy to clear the boredom and make it a brand new game.  The additional DLC song packs seem well mapped (more natural motions compared to OST songs) and a nice way to support the developers as well.

Small issue with the pricing of the DLC songs though, if you buy a single song from a pack, the full cost of the song is not deducted in full if you want to complete the pack later. A pack that costs $6.99, after you buy a song for $1.99, the remaining pack is $5.24 rather than $5.00.

I have somewhere around 25-26 hours on this game and I absolutely love it. There’s always something new to learn and do based on the difficulties for the songs. You can slow down songs to learn them at your own pace or just go in and put on the No Fail feature and learn it from just playing the level. The other modes like 360 degrees, 90 degrees, and one handed are some of the most fun one can have in a VR and you don’t need too much space for this game. I’d recommend this to just about anybody and would even say if you’re looking to lose weight or have a fun exercise routine to purchase this game. I sometimes have issues with height placement in the game where it will think I’m taller or shorter, but backing out and going back in tends to fix that issue. Other than that, I’d say this game offers a lot of different ways to play it and is worth your money!
I bought this game as soon as I got my quest and it was great! The rhythm combined with the intensity sure make a genius combo. If my parents enjoyed it, so can everyone!

Love it.  Great game, gets you moving and sweating.      I feel like Luc Skywalker.   I’m mildly addicted to it and spend a lot of time swinging my arms around the living room.  I’ve had to move furniture permanently from my tiny apartment, but it’s worth it.  The game is not perfect, for sure, but, for what it is, a fun time swinging light sabres at flying cubes, it’s great.  I’d like to see more/better house music; it wouldn’t be hard for them to find a DJ willing to give up their music to this game for next to nothing.  I feel like the 360 aspect is a little under-explored; it has great potential, but, so far, it hasn’t blown me away; how about stuff falling from the direction of the sky, from the floor, bouncing, etc; it’s very one dimensional; maybe I need to hit higher levels, but most of the stuff I’m doing now is high level.  It seems the flying objects, blocks and bombs are underutilizes was well; most of the time they just float by without being any sort of a threat.  I could be dodging and ducking more; again, perhaps I’m not at a high enough level.  Updated levels and music should be free, or only a few bucks.  I’m seeing stuff from one artist for $9+; that’s too much.  I feel like there can be more of a fitness emphasis on some levels.  So far, only one level was really geared toward being a workout.  And upgrade solely for the purpose of working out; I’d pay money for that upgrade.  Overall, a fantastic game.  Looking forward to seeing what they do with it in the future, especially the free updates. It really has endless potential for new music and levels.  My feet have blisters.

review_title: One of the first must haves

one_reviews_text: Beware, highly addicting. When I first played it it was fun, sure. But after a while I really got caught in it, it grew more and more on me. After completing the campaign I side loaded more custom songs and now there is no limit on how much I can play this. You really get better and better as you play. I struggled a lot with hard songs, but now expert is what I play for fun and expert+ when I want a challenge. My kids love it as well and is getting pretty good at it :)

I won our occulous, and was stoked because in the middle of a pandemic who has funds for VR headsets?!?!

Beat Saber was the FIRST game we purchased. And let me tell you. It's the MOST visited game in our library!

We LOVE the sword play, the music, the immersion! It's "undercover" exercise and everyone in out house enjoys it from 13-50 years old.

NO motion sickness. Controls are user friendly. Beats are worthy.

We LOVE this game!

I like this game because me and my family can play this on game nights. And it has the feature that slowed you to change the difficulty of the level from easy to expert plus. So it’s a hit with the family the only catch is that you need a pc to download songs. But otherwise one of the most addictive games I have ever played.

I’m a big guitar hero guy, so I thought I would like this game, and was super hype to play it, but the game is way too easy. I beat my first hard mode song in my first hour of playing, my first expert on my second day, and my first expert plus probably on my 4th or 5th day. it was pretty fun, but I didn’t fee like I earned my progression as I did in guitar hero, since guitar hero takes much, much longer to get good at.  This game has a stupid campaign that only takes you up to early expert mode, and most of it is stupid rule sets where If you fc it you will lose.  On top of that pretty much no one has heard of any of the songs on here and the dlc are a bit over priced. But the main problem is it costs 30 bucks to hit some cubes. Overall an ok game and I would recommend tbh
it’s a very good game, espacialy if you like music and being active. it’s also great for quarentine, and i recomend onward as well for your next game if you like guns like me.
Good very good
I thought it would have been boring after a while but i was so wrong as its still my most played game and i have had it for 3 months.
Hands down my favorite game on the quest, I keep coming back to this one after months of play

If you havent expirienced VR yet, beatsaber is the Perfect Game to Start. Its easy to geht into but hard to master. You dont have to move a lot, but sliceing notes is fun and the music is awesome. The DLC is very expensive though.

There’s a slight problem with the blade where I hit a block and it just fazes right through it and it says miss, so yeah devs please fix that. Other than that this game is amazing and I have so much fun playing.

Great

I have owned my oculus quest for about 6 months now ,and nothing has me coming back like beat saber.
The second i got my quest out of the box and on my head i downloaded the beatsaber demo,despite the song being on easy it was a very enjoyable experience i found myself returning to the demo just to beat my high score

a week Later I bought the full game and played through the campaign, which was a very enjoyable experience  the challenge slowly ramps up from easy to expert and it goes from beating a song just for highscores to hardly beating it the song at all 

AND GETING A FULL CARDIO WORK OUT

however after finishing the campaign and all the songs (which took around 1 month) i found myself re playing songs and looking for some variety 

Now we get to the funest part,mods
Moding the game to be able to add our own songs opens up the game to infinite replay ability the sheer amount of songs downloadable on the internet is amazing and music makes you want to exersize even more

in a nutshell;
campaign is a blast
in game Music is good 
Good replayability 
custom songs only add to the personal enjoyment factor
A masterpiece of rythm games

When I look for a good rhythm game(and believe me, I know all about them), I expect the game to have 3 main things: nice gameplay, great graphics, and most importantly, good beat maps. I have to say, this game did not disappoint! The game had amazing graphics, great music, and probably the best gameplay I have ever seen in a rhythm game. No bugs or glitches so far. 5 stars.

ive wanted beat saber for the longest time and i finally got a headset to play it on! ive seen people say that there’s no choice of music but their really is! search up on youtube “how to get all songs in beat saber” or something like that and your find an easy way to download your favorite songs. 11/10 i totally recommend the game!

I haven’t actually played a game which does everything so well, maybe with a slight exception of GORN as that does better in other elements, nevertheless beat saber focuses and achieves on the key aspects of the game it needs to do. A masterfully made game, 100% recommend

If the Oculus store has nothing but Beat Saber, my purchase would still have been worth it!  This gave take advantage of all the best of the medium.  You become part of the game in many ways.  It’s also a hell of a workout especially if you lean into the body movements, beats, and sounds.  Go to town! Nobody is watching.  Practice for that next wedding.

This game also teaches you how your body learns things.  Practice, practice and mistakes and practice.  But the difference is that is NEVER boring to practice,  it sneaks up on you how good you become. You will hit songs that you will swear you are incapable of doing, before you know it you will surprise yourself what you can do. 

This does everything right, BUT...Just one note to the developer.  I play this on Vive/Steam as well as Quest, as I want to take it with me.  The haptics and feel of slicing the blocks aren’t quite right in Quest yet.  Still great, but it’s a combo if the vibration amount and the way the blocks sound/slice viscerally connects better with Steam VR and Vive.  give us the ability to up the vibration too please.  If you fine tune this then even more magic!

 Also, please more songs!  🙏🏼

review_title: It doesn’t let me install it!!!!

one_reviews_text: This is the best game on quest the feeling of hitting the blocks to the beat is so good in im addicted to this game 5 stars

i have the PC version of this and thought ok lets get the quest version for on the go it'll be just as good

oh how wrong i was 

the quest version is not enjoyable at all

i can understand the graphical downgrades but the following things is whats pushing me so far away from this version of the game

1. the life bar is completely broken. when you miss a block it goes down so fast but hardly goes back up at all leaving me with having to keep no fail on at all times to beat an easy song i can easily do on the PC version without no fail on

2. theres TONS OF SOUND LAG. for a rhythm game you want everything to be in sync but this version doesn't do that even with the audio override it doesn't sync like how can you mess that up

3. the rumble is too weak to the point where i had to mod the game to make it better.

4. the sound effects are too quiet compared to the pc version where again i had to mod the game to fix this myself

fix all the issues above and maybe then i'll enjoy the quest version more but until then if you're looking to play beat saber on the quest play the PC version with oculus link its a way better experience over all

i'm very disappointed in this version of the game come on beat games you can do better then this!

(use normal sized windows laptop) most custom levels don’t have easy mode so i recommend this for most people who play on hard and up. overall this is a great game that i recommend for most music lovers or anyone that has a quest!

I was a little skeptical of the hype but bought in anyway as it's so highly recommended - and I'm so glad I did! From initial struggling flailing through to challenging expert mode on some of the longer songs this game has had me moving, laughing and enjoying myself greatly.

Fantastic game to take the edge off quarantine lockdown, with a wide range of modes and modifiers to allow you to keep challenging yourself even when you are familiar with a song. It's great to discover a new fun track and realise that there's even more game than you thought, over and over! Just as I was getting comfortable with trying every track for the first time on Hard + Fast Song modifier I thought to check out some of the new tracks and BOY was that another level!

In short, Beatsaber may have been one of the early VR titles but it really nailed the experience and holds up fantastically even today.

Strong recommend.

one_reviews_text:
So I'm not gonna state the obvious reasons about how this game is gods gift to quest, but something else this game did that completely caught me by suprise...

So I first get my quest and set it up with vr chat and beat Saber, the two must-have quest titles, and I start playing beat saber. Now I'm a pretty scrawny guy, a total nerd who hates getting out of the house. But after a few weeks of beat saber, through some events I go to my friends house, and he has this pull-up bar in his hallway... attempt to use it, and I did like 5 pull-ups. This may sound stupid, but a few weeks ago I wasn't even able to do a push-up, much less a pull-up. And thats when I realized, I'm developing actual muscles playing a VIDEO GAME. A video game SO fun, that I didn't stop to think about how I'm actually doing a workout.


So yeah we can officially live our entire lives in vr now.

I bought this game for its high ratings and the promise of a fun work out. I got much more than I expected.  Not only did my cardio improve (I'm 60 and  I can notice the improvements  quickly because they leave me just as quickly if I don't use them). So here is my list of very noticeable improvements playing this game after only a few weeks. Increased range of motion - I swing wide to improve this,   better concentration - I zoned in half a song now I can do about 5 in row before my mind wanders, better focus - I am hitting with more accuracy and seeing the cube orientation faster,  better reflexes,  weight loss, more flexibility, more speed.  It's not often as single product can give you all that in one package.
review_title: More than Just a Work Out

one_reviews_text: What can I say, this is like a must have game. What are you waiting for, purchase it!
review_title: My favorite a must have for VR games

one_reviews_text: I got the game 4 months ago and I am in top 600 on expert +

It’s Soooooooo Good! The Levels Are Fun And Sometimes Challenging! The Campaign Is Another Small Part That Adds So Much! You Pay This, And It Lasts You A Very Long Time... So Take My Word For It, Buy It Now.
THIS GAME IS SO AMAZING THAT I CANT STOP PLAYING IT!!!
I had this game for about 2 months now I can say it’s really good game but I have hit my controllers on a lot of things so just have a good play space
This game was so fun and I loved to do this in my free time and I have no complaints THANK YOU!!!

Well this game let's be honest is a five star game. It is simplistic but yet so extremely addictive as you won't find any other game in VR that's that good.

But the pay wall is pretty bad and that's what costs the stars.
This game has so much potential. You could get any song in this game and play for hundreds and hundreds of hours, but instead there are 50% of the songs you can play free and these are the mostly boring ones, and the other stuff costs you either money per song or per collection. I know licenses are expensive, but the most songs here are not really close to popular. Even the new Timbaland songs are a collection of let's say not the most popular ones.

All in all anyways the best game and still better than all the copycat games of it.

This is a great game!  I would love to see more songs added with more 360 variations. Expert+ is possible with practice!

Side Note: by design fault, when you whip the controllers around hard enough, the AA battery inside the controller will dislodge which will cause a controller tracking issue. It's a controller design flaw. The spring on the negative end of the battery isn't strong enough to hold the battery in place.  Hopefully, Oculus will redesign a controller with a permanent rechargeable battery
review_title: Awesome game please add more songs!

Beat Saber is an incredible game. I have put over 300 hours into this game over 2 years. I have played almost every single day, and have never gotten bored of it. This is a MUST-HAVE title, and is irresponsible not to own if you have a headset. Period.

It's a great game and I definitely recommend it. It's now part of my morning workout routine. One thing I would wish for is more rock/metal tracks. The Green Day pack made me realize it's much more enjoyable when playing with music you actually like.

The reason I think Beat Saber is so popular and well loved is the craftsmanship of the game. Everything feels incredibly smooth and considered. I rarely encounter anything immersion-breaking. The UI is clear and obvious. It’s just a good experience. So glad it exists. And so glad I get to work out playing a video game.

one_reviews_text:
This game is, in my opinion, the best VR game ever released.
Rhythm games are already really fun, but this paved the way for games like Pistol Whip and others.

This game does really well with the lack of resistance with the controllers, which in most games is a problem. The feeling of the sabers slashing through cubes like warm knives through butter is satisfying as hell.

A lot of the beatmaps made by the game devs have a really good flow and are satisfying to move throughout.

The multiplayer seems nice, but I don’t have friends in VR.

Overall, a purely amazing game.

5/5 stars.

one_reviews_text: This game is hours on hours of fun and is really addictive it has the campaign and just play songs on your own if your thinking about it go for it trust me

If your hesitant about getting this game with fear of either getting bored or getting tired of it in general (like most games I've played). Get this game, the only time you'll want to stop playing it is due to being sore from the exercise. The campaign is a tad short but you don't play a game like this cause it tells a story.... Campaign really shouldn't be the word for it to be honest, more like tutorial build up to play on expert+, but campaign is easier to fit on the menu I guess. There is plenty of songs to start with on the game to keep you busy for a while specially if this your first time experiencing a game such as Rock Band or Guitar hero... For those familiar with them games though it will still keep you busy for some time then there's dlc that you can get that's fair on price as well... I'd recommend Imagine Dragons for both first timers and pros alike. If this argument won't get you to change your mind then your loss friend because this is a great game. I'd recommend it to everyone even my nephew, age 10, loved this game... Almost lost my occulus quest cause he was addicted to the game.

Anyway buy buy buy this game you won't regret it!

one_reviews_text:
I’ve seen the videos. I’ve heard the music. Love the light sabers. Looked like so much fun until I actually tried it. So hooked now! 

This game takes me back to my late 90’s rave days when I danced all night and played with glow sticks. The maps are perfectly synced to the music and once you get them, the feeling of smashing the blocks to the beat is amazing. You just feel like you’re part of the music in this virtual wonderland giving yourself a light show. Yeah, just like those late 90’s raves. Wonderful flashbacks and wonderful fun. This is the one game I play during every oculus session.

This game is SUPER fun and It’s been both the best and worst thing that has happened to me. I’ve gotten so addicted to it and spent over 50 bucks on music packs in just this week alone. I got it on Wednesday and on Thursday I could already do expert+ with ease because the only breaks I took were to charge my quest.

Beat Saber is fun solo and in groups.  If you're playing in a group setting I would recommend casting to a tv.  The game gets very difficult past hard mode.   There is a small glitch that causes some hits to be registered in the wrong direction, but overall, it's a decent game.

There's just not enough variety in terms of music style for my taste. The only thing I can stomach is the Green Day song pack. (And the community songs are mostly just as non-varied as the included ones.)

The 90 degree and up modes cause motion sickness for me.

And the mechanics are alright but personally, I don't like the fact that I have to pay attention to which direction to slice from.

The visual are top-notch though and for one of the first VR experiences, it's fun for an hour or two.
I don’t know what to say I just love beat saber
This game is so much fun. I play this game almost 4 hours a day. Only thing they need to add is a way to get songs from your phone to connect to the game.
review_title: One of The Best Games On Oculus

Would highly recommend all Quest owners.

This game really deserves 5 stars. The gameplay is amazing, my friends and family love it, and all of the song are extremely catchy! My personal favorite is Till It’s Over. I can’t stop playing this game! There’s basically no downside to it. I hope there’s new songs sometime! The money was so worth it!

People, have fun playing this game!

Not only does it provide you with hundreds of hours of gameplay from the standard songs that comes with it, but its really enjoyable, the campaign mode is great, slowly raising the difficulty for unexperienced players to be able to enjoy, and the overall experience of hitting boxes and the controllers vibrating is very immersive.
The game can get really challenging but its really satisfying beating a level you failed countless times before

The only thing that's missing currently is a custum songs menu, sure there are the packs of songs you can buy and you can sideload the custom songs using a computer app but it'd be great to have it as an official function

Overall it's a really fun, challenging game and quite a workout. 10/10
